干涉

Intervention

运动员和训练师的路线修正

Dan John









前言

Thomas Plummer







On Target Publications

圣克鲁斯，加利福尼亚州

Course Corrections for the Athlete and Trainer

Dan John









Foreword

Thomas Plummer







On Target Publications

Santa Cruz, California

致谢

Acknowledgements

几年前，在波士顿迈克·博伊尔的冬季研讨会上，一位戴眼镜的黑发男子走过来对我说：“你住在旧金山。我住在旧金山。”从此我开始了与史蒂夫·莱德贝特（Steve Ledbetter）的关系，他也被称为史蒂夫教练。 Stevo 对这项工作的贡献不容忽视；他是旅途中的朋友、知己和同伴。

A FEW YEARS AGO, at Mike Boyle’s Winter Seminar in Boston, a dark-haired man in glasses came up to me and said, “You live in San Francisco. I live in San Francisco.” With that began my relationship with Steve Ledbetter, also known as Coach Stevo. Stevo’s contributions to this work can’t be ignored; he is a friend, confidant and companion on the journey.

斯特沃全力支持最早形式的干预概念。他继续提出问题并促使大家对所有要点进行更深入的了解。他对本书中扩展的协议和原则的采用提供了有关更清晰和更集中的需求的反馈。

Stevo went all in with the concept of Intervention in its earliest form. He continued to ask the questions and prod for more depth about all the points. His adoption of the protocols and principles expanded in this book gave feedback about the needs for more clarity and more focus.

Stevo 是干预的早期采用者，并带领许多客户完成了这个过程。他的经历和挫折可以在全书的四个侧边故事中找到。他还承担了展示我们的基本人类运动如何扩展到举重室之外的投掷领域的任务，事后看来，这对我来说应该更加明显。斯蒂沃对健身领域的贡献不断增长，我希望我因“发现他”而获得部分荣誉。

Stevo is an early adopter of Intervention and has walked many clients through this process. His experiences—and frustrations—are found in the four sidebar stories spread throughout the book. He also took on the task of showing how our basic human movements expand far beyond the weightroom into the areas of throwing, which, in hindsight, should have been much more obvious to me. Stevo’s contributions to the field of fitness continue to grow, and I hope I get partial credit for “discovering him.”

在某种程度上，我很荣幸能与像史蒂夫教练和我的另一位贡献者蒂姆·安德森这样优秀的年轻人一起工作。蒂姆在重置身体方面的工作改变了生活，而我也许是他这种方法的最好例子。想到我将继续拉尔夫·莫恩（Ralph Maughan）教练和迪克·诺特梅尔（Dick Notmeyer）教练的遗产，通过帮助这些优秀的年轻人来影响健身的未来，我感到很高兴。在新一代教练的带领下，健身行业的未来似乎更加光明。

In a way, I am honored to work with such fine young men like Coach Stevo and my other contributor, Tim Anderson. Tim’s work on resetting the body is life-changing, and I am perhaps his best example of this approach. It makes me happy to think I continue the legacy of Coach Ralph Maughan and Dick Notmeyer in impacting the future of fitness by giving a hand up to such fine young men. The future of the fitness industry seems solid with this new generation of coaches.

一如既往，我感谢蒂菲尼、凯利、林赛和安德鲁的持续支持和耐心，因为我继续为大量的房客、饥饿的晚餐同伴和发臭的身体提供精彩的生活。

As always, I thank Tiffini, Kelly, Lindsay and Andrew for their ongoing support and patience as I continue to funnel enormous houseguests, hungry dinner companions and smelly bodies through their amazing lives.

最后，如果我没有强调和强调 Laree Draper 对这个项目的影响和影响，那就是我的失职。 On Target Publications 让我的生活变得更好，我认为世界因 OTP 而变得更美好。

Finally, I would be remiss if I didn’t highlight and underline the impact and influence of Laree Draper on this project. On Target Publications has changed my life for the better and I think the world is a better place because of OTP.

内容

5 第二个问题：这是健康目标还是健身目标？

5   Second Question: Is this a Health or a Fitness Goal?

6 第三个问题：这个目标会让你螺旋式上升——扩大你的生活吗？

6   Third Question: Will this Goal Allow You to Spiral Out—to Enlarge Your Life?

7 如果旋转失去平衡怎么办？

前言





Foreword





人们寄给我审阅的一摞书籍、DVD 和文章已成为一堆从未完成的堆，被战略性地放置在我办公室的角落里。几年前，我干脆放弃了对这些通常是随机的作品的任何及时审查，这些作品代表了健身领域的一切，从罕见的真正天才到更常见的毫无价值的材料，这些材料永远不会见光，也不应该找到适合任何健身的方式专业人士的书架。

THE STACK OF BOOKS, DVDs and articles people send me to review has become a never-finished pile strategically placed in the corner of my office. Years ago I simply gave up any timely review of most of these often-random works that represent everything in fitness from the rare and truly genius to the much more common worthless material that should never see the light of day or find its way to any fitness professional’s bookshelf.

我第一次认识丹·约翰就是在这堆东西上。我正准备搭乘越野航班，从拉里·德雷珀 (Laree Draper) 那里拿起一个未开封的包裹，里面装着丹当时的最新书《永不放手》(Never Let Go)，我把它扔进背包里，然后就忘记了。在飞机上我发现自己完全清醒了，正在寻找一些可以读的东西，我决定尝试一下这位新作家。

I first met Dan John through this pile. I was leaving for a cross-country flight and picked up an unopened package from Laree Draper that contained Dan’s latest book at the time, Never Let Go, threw it in my backpack and forgot about it. Finding myself wide awake on the plane and searching for something to read, I decided to give this new author a try.

几个小时后，我完成了这本书，这对我周围的人来说显然是一种解脱，他们发现我在五个小时的飞行中无休无止的笑声和过分的记笔记有点麻烦。丹让我担任封面，我非常着迷，以至于在回程的航班上又读了一遍整本书。

Several hours later I finished the book, which was an apparent relief to those around me who found my endless laughter and obsessive note-taking somewhat of a nuisance during the five-hour flight. Dan had me at the cover, and I became so enthralled that I read the entire thing again on the return flight.

虽然丹一直是教练界的摇滚明星，但直到最近他才进入更主流的健身领域，并且是目前现代训练中最受讨论和最受尊敬的大师之一。他的追随者不断增长，现在他在受过教育的教练和主流健身界的工作人员中拥有庞大的粉丝群。

While Dan has always been sort of a rumpled rock star in the coaching world, only recently has he found his way into more mainstream fitness and is currently one of the most discussed and respected gurus in modern training. His following is ever-growing and he now enjoys a huge fan base amongst educated trainers and those working in the mainstream fitness world.

人气的上升很大程度上是基于丹的完美时机。多年来，训练界已经厌倦了快速解决、一招一式的大师们宣扬和尖叫的新福音，但最终失败了，留下了一个疲惫不堪、更加愤世嫉俗的健身专业人士。 “我的方式或高速公路”领导力的时代很累人，但在快速发展的培训世界中仍然需要领导力和清晰的思维。

Much of this rising popularity is based upon Dan’s perfect timing. The training world has grown weary over the years of quick-fix, one-trick masters who preach and scream the new gospel that ultimately fails, leaving a jaded and more cynical fitness professional. The era of “my way or the highway” leadership is tiring, yet there is still a need for leadership and clear thinking in the fast growing world of training.

丹通过他之前的写作和研讨会以及现在他的最新著作《干预》提供了这种领导力。这本书将他置于我们领域教学和思想的顶尖梯队，与其他思想改变者一起，如格雷·库克、阿尔文·科斯格罗夫、马克·维斯特根、格雷格·罗斯、雷切尔·科斯格罗夫、托德·德金和迈克·博伊尔——所有这些男人和女人都帮助我们理清了无穷无尽的废话，找到什么是有效的、什么是安全的，以及什么是训练任何只想过上更健康、更健康的生活的运动员或普通客户所必需的。

Dan has provided that leadership through his previous writing and workshops and now with his newest book, Intervention. This book places him at the top echelon of teaching and thought in our field, along with other mind-changers such as Gray Cook, Alwyn Cosgrove, Mark Verstegen, Greg Rose, Rachel Cosgrove, Todd Durkin and Mike Boyle—all men and women who have helped us sort through the endless stream of nonsense to find what works, what is safe and what is necessary to train any athlete or regular client who simply wants to live a healthier and more fit life.

当前的健身界正处于巨大的动荡之中。主流的盒子健身公司正在衰落，而下一代以训练为中心的企业正在崛起。这种失败很大程度上可以追溯到一个简单的想法：大多数被设备公司和销售其产品和解决方案的虚假大师所流行的现代健身公认原则并没有为我们的客户和运动员带来可持续的结果。再加上受教育程度提高的消费者，迫使任何从事健身或教练工作的人重新评估什么有效、什么无效以及我们应该走向何方。

The current fitness world is in great turmoil. The mainstream box fitness players are failing and the next generation of training-centric businesses is rising. Much of this failing can be traced to one simple thought: Most of the accepted principles of modern fitness that were made popular by equipment companies and the false gurus selling their products and solutions just does not get sustainable results for our clients and athletes. This, coupled with a more educated consumer, has forced anyone working in fitness or coaching to reassess what works, what doesn’t and where we should be going.

丹的工作帮助我们回归训练的基础，让我们思考回归数百年来一直有效的原则，同时介绍他目前的想法，即他通过数十年的辅导、教学和参与所学到的东西世界级运动员。他的书有力地让我们重新思考我们认为我们所知道的有关培训的一切，并用大量“离不开”的东西取代了许多“不需要的东西”。

Dan’s work helps us return to foundations of training by getting us to think about a return to the principles that have worked for literally hundreds of years, while introducing his current thought as to what he has learned through his decades of coaching, teaching and participating as a world-class athlete. His books forcefully get us to rethink everything we think we know about training and replace much of the “not needed” with plenty of the “can’t live without.”

尽管我很喜欢他的作品，但丹·约翰在我们行业中的重要性并不在于他的书。为什么我认为他是所有培训师的强大榜样，不是因为他写的东西，我觉得他写的东西很有趣，而且常常很精彩，而是因为他是谁，以及他对我们所有在这个领域工作的人所代表的东西。

As much as I like his work, his books are not what make Dan John important in our industry. Why I think he is a powerful role model for all trainers is not what he writes, which I find funny and often brilliant, but who he is and what he represents to all of us who work in this field.

对于大多数培训师来说，正常的专业课程是从一个危险的人开始，几乎没有实践知识，但对于如何培训一个人有大量的理论和想法。大多数新教练都为完美的锻炼而苦恼，几乎每个人都过度训练，而且是疯狂的纯粹主义白痴，他们在餐馆里让自己难堪，试图让每个人都吃得干净。

The normal professional course for most trainers is to start out as a dangerous human with little practical knowledge, but with an enormous amount of theory and ideas as to how a person should be trained. Most new trainers agonize over the perfect workout, over-train virtually everyone and are the crazy purist idiots who embarrass themselves at restaurants trying to impress everyone with how clean they eat.

这也是为什么你永远不应该与教练共进晚餐的原因。订餐需要一个小时，因为培训师必须讨论油的种类、肉的来源、蔬菜的新鲜度，然后当他自己制作小吃和有机芥末时，羞辱了整桌人。我们明白，你生活纯洁；现在点一大块屠体，喝一杯好啤酒，明天再努力一点。您将在 90% 的纯度下生存并在外出晚餐时存活下来。

This is also why you should never eat dinner with trainers. It takes an hour to order the meal, as the trainer has to discuss types of oil, origin of meat, freshness of vegetables, and then humiliates the entire table as he whips out his own snack and organic mustard. We get it, you live pure; now order a big hunk of carcass, drink a good beer and just work out a little harder tomorrow. You will live and you will survive dinner out at 90% pure.

幸运的是，白痴阶段只持续一年左右，然后培训师进入饥饿阶段，跟随大师环游世界，并花几个小时与其他培训师朋友讨论最新的 Cosgrove 帖子或 Todd Durkin 视频。他吸收了每一个字，复制了每一个细微差别，读了每一本书，他从不错过“表现更好”峰会或任何其他培训议程，在那里他可以跟踪他的英雄并获得难得的机会提出问题并与健身之神一起闲逛哲学。

Luckily, the idiot stage only lasts a year or so and then the trainer moves into the hunger stage where he travels the world following the gurus, and spends hours with his other trainer friends discussing the latest Cosgrove post or Todd Durkin video. Every word is absorbed, every nuance copied, every book read, and he never misses a Perform Better Summit, or any other training agenda, where he can stalk his heroes and get the rare chance to ask questions and hang out with the Gods of fitness philosophy.

此后，少数人继续寻求终身教育，而大多数人则停滞不前，被自己的成功所困。发展成功的事业，让你的生活充满客户和家人，再也不用学习任何新东西。随着时间的推移，你所知道的就是你所知道的，一个新想法通过那个密集的头脑的机会就像夹心蛋糕被一年级的纯粹主义者吃掉一样多。

After that point, a few continue the quest for lifelong education, while most stagnate, trapped by their own successes. Develop a successful business, fill your life with clients and family and never again learn anything new. Over time, what you know is what you know and a new idea has as about as much of chance of getting through that dense head as a Twinkie getting eaten by the first-year purist.

这让我们回到丹。

Which brings us back to Dan.

丹代表了我们所有人应该成为的人，即寻求有效的方法，不仅在训练中，而且在生活中也是如此。他的职业生涯和他的生活代表了对事物如何运作以及如何不仅成为经典意义上的好人，而且如何将这种特质展现给他人的永无休止的探索，仅此一项就足以成为一生的事业。

Dan represents what we all should be, which is a seeker of what works, not only in training, but in life as well. His career and his life represent a never-ending search for how things work and how to not only be a good man in the classic sense, but also how to bring that trait out in others, which alone is something to make a life’s work.

他还代表了一个人应有的最佳品质，他公平、谦虚，愿意帮助任何需要或想要他帮助的人，通过一生的职业生涯寻求更高的权力，教导学生如何思考宗教和更高的权力，并且不害怕说他尝试过一些事情，相信了一段时间，然后认为他错了并继续前进。

He also represents the best of what a man should be in that he is fair, humble, willing to help anyone who needs or wants his help, seeks a higher power through a lifelong career teaching students how to think about religion and higher power, and is not afraid to say he tried something, believed it for awhile, and then decided he was wrong and moves on.

也许他最具有的特质，这可能是年轻教练应该向他学习的最重要的事情，就是随着时间的推移，我们必须发展自己的训练哲学和生活哲学。跟随大师可以帮助我们开始这条道路，特别是如果我们跟随训练界中如上所述的诚实的男人和女人。他们愿意为我们思考，他们毫不傲慢地分享最好、最聪明的信息，通常带着耐心和帮助他人成功的动力。

Perhaps the trait he wears best, and this is probably the most important thing a young trainer should learn from him, is that over time we have to develop our own philosophies on training, and on life as well. Following gurus can help get us started on that trail, especially if we follow the honest men and women in the training world like those mentioned above. They’re willing to do our thinking for us and they share the best and brightest information without arrogance and usually with patience and a drive to help others succeed.

我看过丹的教学，对他的耐心分享感到惊讶，而不需要永远是对的，这是这位年轻教练的另一个残酷特征，他只知道自己的路或不知道。丹花了一生的时间才终于得到了他应得的认可，但他却接受了所有新的关注和成功，就好像他在舞台边等待轮到他上场一样。

I have watched Dan teach and am surprised at his patience to share without the need to always be right, another brutal trait of the young trainer who only knows his way or no way. Dan has spent a lifetime to finally get the recognition he deserves, yet he takes all the new attention and success as if he was on the side of the stage waiting for his turn to be called.

当我被问及健身行业的未来时，我通常会回答说，大盒子会员制时代正处于危险的境地，过去几十年来我们向公众展示的大部分健身产品都在失败。然而，希望是存在的，我们行业的未来以及我们所做的事情改变了许多人的生活的共同信念的持久性是安全的，因为变革是从培训师开始的。这一变革是由这一代最优秀、最聪明的人领导的。

When I am asked about the future of the fitness business, I usually respond by stating that the big box membership era is on dangerous ground and that most of what we have presented to the public as fitness during the last several decades is failing. There is hope, however, and the future of our industry and the endurance of the common belief that what we do makes a difference in so many lives is safe, because change is coming from the trainer up. This change is being led by the best and brightest of this generation.

当然，谁在培养新一代领导人？新英雄丹·约翰和所有其他愿意分享他们所知道并塑造他人思想的大师。当然，丹是一位伟大的读者，但更重要的是，他将成为我父亲所说的伟人，他的定义是愿意领导，愿意犯错，更重要的是，愿意在大事上保持正确。

And of course, who is nurturing this new generation of leaders? It’s the new hero, Dan John, and all the other gurus who are willing to share what they know and shape others’ thoughts. Dan is, of course, a great read, but more importantly he would be what my father called a great man, defined by one who is willing to lead, to be wrong, and more importantly, to be right about the big things.

我希望您喜欢这本书，并花大量时间了解丹的工作并了解他作为下一代的领导者。

I hope you embrace this book and that you spend a lot of time getting to know Dan’s work and getting to know him as a leader of this next generation.

托马斯·普拉默

Thomas Plummer

《在健身行业赚钱》一书的作者

Author of Making Money in the Fitness Business

ThomasPlummer.com

ThomasPlummer.com

     

     

第1章

Chapter 1

A点到B点

Point A to Point B

事实证明，在健身界，我就是问题所在。是的，这是真的：我有很棒的想法、出色的编程和一些对每个人都有效的技术花絮。对于深蹲，我的进步我谦虚地认为永远改变了举重世界。

IT TURNS OUT in the fitness world, I was the problem. Yes, this is true: I had great ideas, excellent programming and some nice technical tidbits that worked for everyone. For the squat, I had progressions I humbly think changed the world of lifting forever.

好吧，至少我认为他们在工作。我发现了一种脱节：我在说“这个”，而人们听到的是“那个”。我以为我在表达一个观点，但人们听到的是另一个观点。

Well, at least I thought they were working. What I discovered was a disconnect: I was saying “this” and people were hearing “that.” I thought I was making one point, but people were hearing another.

这让我想起了数学课，迄今为止我最薄弱的科目。

This reminds me of math class, by far my weakest subject.

“两点之间最短的距离是直线。”

“The shortest distance between two points is a straight line.”

来自欧几里得……或者，至少是我从几何学中所记得的。

From Euclid…or, at least, what I can remember from geometry.

如果你让我几年前总结一下这一切，今天我称之为干预的整个系统，我会不知所措。说真的，我在很多年前就已经把整件事锁定了，但我认为自己所说的和人们听到的之间存在脱节，也许更像是鸿沟或海洋。

If you asked me to summarize all of this a few years ago, this entire system of what today I call Intervention, I would have been at a loss. Seriously, I had the whole thing locked down years and years ago, but there was disconnect, perhaps more of a gulf or an ocean, between what I thought I was saying and what people were hearing.

老实说，我最近才得到答案，即干预DVD 和《Mass Made Simple》一书出版一年后，在向精英运动员、顶级教练和令人惊叹的人们展示这个系统之后，他们以某种方式“知道”这是力量、体能和健身世界的未来。

Honestly, the answer came to me just recently, a year after the Intervention DVD and the book Mass Made Simple came out, and after presenting this system to elite athletes, the top tier of coaches and amazing people who somehow “know” this is the future of the strength, conditioning and fitness world.

你看，这个系统就是为了让人们实现他们的目标。现在，正如俗话所说，“如果你不知道你要去哪里，任何一条路都会带你到达那里！”

You see, this system is all about getting people to their goals. Now, as the cliché goes, “If you don’t know where you’re going, any road will get you there!”

这就是脱节。我希望人们知道他们要去哪里，因为在很大程度上，我的职业生涯一直在帮助那些非常认真的人，他们确切地知道他们想去哪里：奥运会、超级碗、10% 的体脂。

This was the disconnect. I was expecting people to know where they were going because, for the most part, my career has been helping very serious people who knew exactly where they wanted to go: Olympics, Super Bowl, 10% body fat.

这些人清楚地知道他们想去哪里。我对自己充满了自信，并确信这是常态。但我一直在与 0.001% 的人口一起工作。我很快了解到，另外 99.999% 的人不知道自己要去哪里，所以我的好建议只是他们迷失的另一条路。

These people knew exactly where they wanted to go. And I got full of myself and became convinced this was the norm. But I had been working with 0.001% of the population. The other 99.999%, as I soon learned, had no concept of where they were heading, so my good advice was just another road for them to get lost on.

对于那些确切知道自己前进方向的团队来说，我仍然认为成功是一条直线。我相信你明白这一点：从你所在的 A 点到你想去的 B 点，最快的方法是走直线。我的精英运动员似乎总是知道他们想去哪里——B点！

With the group who knew exactly where they were headed, I still think success is a straight line. I am sure you understand this: The fastest way from Point A, where you are, to Point B, where you want to go, is a straight line. My elite athletes always seem to know where they want to go—Point B!!

问题是：他们知道 B 点。A 点，他们现在所在的位置，是一个深深的谜团。

Here’s the issue: They know about Point B. Point A, where they are right now, is a deep mystery.

欢迎采用我的方法来指导那些有明确目标的人。我的简单愿景是确定他们现在的处境。

Welcome to my approach to coaching those with clear goals. My simple vision is to identify where they are right now.

想到这一点几乎是可笑的，因为大多数人会说：“嗯，这不是很明显吗？我在这儿！”

It’s almost laughable to think about this, as most people would say, “Um, isn’t that obvious? I’m right here!”

然后我也笑了。真的吗？我添加了一个古老的爱尔兰笑话：“我需要去都柏林。你能给我指路吗？”

Then I laugh back. Really? And I add the old Irish joke, “I need to get to Dublin. Can you show me the way?”

“好吧，我不会从这里开始！”

“Well, I wouldn’t start from here!”

在与美国最精英的军人之一坐在一起并引导他了解这个系统后，他靠在椅背上微笑着问道：“我在想什么？我正处于红灯状态（他需要从背部和腿部取出弹片，我认为这比参加没有明显规则的健身比赛更重要），而且我毫无理由地增加了更多疯狂的压力！ ”

After sitting with one of America’s most elite service members and walking him through this system, he leaned back and smiled and asked, “What was I thinking? I am in a red light situation (he needed shrapnel pulled out of his back and leg, something I consider more important than competing in a fitness contest with no apparent rules), and I’m adding more crazy stress FOR NO REASON AT ALL!”

是的，他对我大喊大叫，好像这是我的错！我让人们意识到他们的短期目标需要如此多的新技能，他们只是一天中没有足够的时间来学习所有的东西。

Yes, he shouted at me as if it were my fault! I have had people realize their short-term goals needed so many new skills, they just didn’t have enough time in the day to learn all of the stuff.

第一个问题是：人们寻求我的建议——我的建议很昂贵——但不知道他们想从谈话中得到什么。所以，这仍然是事实，我无法真正帮助他们。

The first problem is this: People were asking for my advice—my expensive advice—with no idea what they wanted to get from the conversation. So, and this is still true, I couldn’t really help them.

抱歉，如果你要倾听风中的每一个声音，我想我不能成为其中之一。人们可以轻松地在一周中的每一天找到一种新的饮食和减肥想法。正如我经常指出的那样，我在新的饮食中没有获得足够的食物，所以现在我有两种饮食。如果您不知道自己的目标，那么同时遵循两种饮食可能与我鼓励您尝试的任何方法一样好。

I’m sorry, but if you’re going to listen to every voice in the wind, I don’t think I can be one of them. One can easily find a new diet and weight-loss idea every day of the week. As I often note, I didn’t get enough food on that new diet, so now I am on two diets. If you don’t know your goal, following two diets at once is probably just as good as anything I can encourage you to try.

这个干预系统还不适合那个人。哦，会的，会的（尤达在哪里？）。一旦您知道自己要去哪里（您的目标、B 点），我就可以引导您完成这个系统。

This Intervention system is not for that person…yet. Oh, it will be, it will be (where is Yoda?). Once you know where you’re going—your goal, your Point B—I can walk you through this system.

我的朋友们，这种方法就是要发现你在哪里。现在，由于这也是上帝在《创世记》中问亚当的第一个问题，所以我必须小心谨慎，避免侵犯版权。但这是成功的关键。

The approach, my friends, is all about discovering where you are. Now, since this is also the first question God asks Adam in Genesis, I have to be a little careful about treading on copyright violations. This, though, is the key to success.

是的，有一个目标很重要，这样你就可以向它画一条直线，但在画线之前，我们需要首先决定把铅笔放在哪里。

Yes, it’s important to have a goal so you can draw that straight line to it, but before we draw the line, we need to decide where to put the pencil in the first place.

对于我的精英运动员和受训者，我们花了大部分时间来发现他们在哪里——他们是否拥有实现目标所需的工具？他们有扎实的深蹲之类的技能吗？他们是否制定了纠正措施，并知道需要纠正什么？一旦我们绘制出 A 点，我们就会发现一条直线。这似乎比最初目标分配的时间更长，但现在我们可以诚实地开始走上成功之路。

With my elite athletes and trainees, we spend the bulk of our time discovering where they are—do they have the tools necessary for the goal? Do they have the skills, like a solid squat? Do they have the corrective movements mapped out, and know what needs to be corrected? Once we map out Point A, we discover a straight line. It might seem to be longer than the time allotted for the original goal, but now we can honestly begin walking down the path to success.

当我九年级第一次学习铁饼时，我读到一位美国精英投掷运动员的上斜卧推重量为 385 磅。当我读到它时，我正在用 85 磅的重量做同样的动作。我知道 A。我知道 B。我清楚地知道我前面的路，这将需要在举重房里花很多时间。

When I was in the ninth grade and first learning the discus, I read that an elite American thrower incline benchpressed 385 pounds. As I read it, I was doing the same move with 85 pounds. I knew A. I knew B. I knew exactly the road ahead of me and that was going to involve a lot of time in the weightroom.

一切都很好。精英不是问题；问题是。老实说，这是其他人。

And that’s all fine. Elites aren’t the problem; honestly, it’s everyone else.

我曾与一些出色的女性一起工作过，她们也有相反的问题，坦率的态度让她们流下了眼泪。

I have worked with some wonderful women who have the opposite issue, and the frankness brings them to tears.

“我只是太重了……胖了。”

“I am just so heavy…fat.”

“我无法控制这个东西……而且，（摇动上臂）这是什么？”

“I can’t control this thing…and, (shaking an upper arm) what is this?”

“我丈夫不会碰我。”

“My husband won’t touch me.”

说实话，很难听。但是，这种关于他们在 A 点位置的清晰性令人震惊，就像优秀的铁饼运动员告诉我她要去参加奥运会一样真实。

It is hard to hear, to be honest. But, this clarity about where they are, Point A, is stunning and just as real as the elite discus thrower who tells me she’s going to the Olympics.

欢迎来到脱节：大多数人都知道 A 点（我很胖；我需要锻炼和吃得更好），但 B 点才是问题所在。这些优秀的女性在健身杂志上看到经过修图的照片，并认为这就是 B 点。你可能看到了一位年轻歌手最近发布的一组前后照片——她的腿变长了，她的腰部收紧了，她的胸部变大了……全部都在艺术家的工作室。

Welcome to the disconnect: Most people know Point A (I’m fat; I need to exercise and eat better), but Point B is the issue. These fine women see photoshopped images in fitness magazines and think that’s Point B. You probably saw that recent set of before-and-after photos a young singer released—her legs got longer, her waist came in and her boobs got bigger…all in the artist’s studio.

各位，B点是我们大多数人面临的问题。我们生活在这个奇怪的时代，健身照片主要由超级健康的女性主导，她们既有遗传天赋，又对缺失的空白进行了严重的增强，坦率地说，这对大多数人来说不是B点。是Z点！

Folks, Point B is the issue for most of us. We’re living in this odd time where fitness photos are dominated by hyperfit women with both genetic gifts and serious augmentation for the missing blanks and, frankly, this is not Point B for most people. It’s Point Z!

可悲的是，健身和时尚行业用Photoshop、呕吐和手术来实现健康和健身的假象。我们需要放慢脚步，表现出一些理性。我们需要帮助人们找到他们的 B 点。

Sadly, the fitness and fashion industries use Photoshop, vomiting and surgery to achieve the illusion of health and fitness. We need to slow down and show some reasonableness. We need to help people find their Point Bs.

所以，这是我们必须解决的三刃剑。



So, here’s our triple-edged sword that must be addressed.



   无论出于何种原因，有些人（通常是运动员）清楚地看到目标。

   For whatever reason, some people, often athletes, see the goal clearly.

   有些人确切地知道自己的实际位置，但需要帮助才能看到现实的目标。

   Some people know exactly where they are physically, but need help seeing a realistic goal.

   当然，还有其他人在 A 点或 B 点上与现实相距甚远，我们需要与他们一起努力。

   There are others, of course, who are far from reality on either Point A or Point B, and we need to work both ends with them.

我的整个职业生涯都因为忽略了这一点而变得混乱。这就是为什么我们需要尽早并经常进行评估，例如功能性运动屏幕（FMS）、“之前”图片（以便您可以“之后”）、基本力量测试等。这就是为什么我们需要有食品日记和某种积极主动的日历工作，让我们的客户知道即将发生的事情会阻碍进展或培训，而当我们可以加速实现目标时，其他一些事情就会得到缓解。

My whole career has been muddled by missing this point. This is why we need to do assessments early and often, like the Functional Movement Screen (FMS), “before” pictures (so you can “after”), basic strength tests and a few others. This is why we need to have food journals and some kind of proactive calendar efforts to let our clients know things are coming up that will impede progress or training, and some other things are easing up when we can accelerate to the goals.

我们使用这些工具来回答“你在哪里？”的问题。

We use these tools to answer the question, “Where are you?”

当 Pavel Tsatsouline 第一次向我介绍 Easy Strength 的概念时，该计划释放了大量的时间、精力和强度，让我能够致力于提高作为投掷运动员所需的其他素质。我的举重室被锁定，但需要更多的纠正（我是公开组新手级的不对称先生）并解决一些投掷技术问题。

When Pavel Tsatsouline first introduced me to the concept of Easy Strength, the program freed up a lot of time, energy and intensity to allow me to work on the other qualities demanded of me as a thrower. I had the weightroom locked down, but needed more correctives (I’m Mr. Asymmetrical, Novice Class, Open Division) and to address some technical throwing issues.

当我和几乎每个人一起工作时，纠正糟糕的深蹲技术和完全缺乏负重运载会对他们的身体和他们几乎在一夜之间训练更长时间的能力产生影响。对于像我这样的人来说，简单力量（或简单力量）回答了如何通过变得更强来更轻松地到达 B 点的问题。

When I work with almost everyone, fixing poor squat technique and the total lack of loaded carries makes a difference in their bodies and in their ability to train longer almost overnight. For some people like me, Easy Strength—or simple strength—answers the question of how to get to Point B more easily by just getting stronger.

但我们需要评估才能找到A点！有些人需要在健身房里集中时间重新装备和重新训练问题，这样我们就可以回到技术、战术和所有其他工具的问题。

But we need to assess to find Point A! Some will need focused time in the weightroom literally retooling and reschooling the issues so we can get back to the issues of technique, tactics and all the other tools.

对于我们的朋友来说，除了那些挤进杂货店收银台的名人饮食之外，我们不知道该去哪里，我们需要定义一条合理的成功之路。可能是食物准备、购物技巧、行动问题或其他问题。它还包括现实的后续步骤，更重要的是，现实的目标。让你的人踏上前往 B 点的道路，直到他们有信心让 Z 点消失！

With our friends who have no vision of where to go besides those celebrity diets that invade the grocery checkout line, we need to define a reasonable path to success. It might be food preparation, shopping skills, movement issues or whatever. It also includes realistic next steps and, even more importantly, realistic goals. Get your people on the road to some Point B until they have the confidence to let Point Z fade away!

开始了。

Here we go.

当人们知道目标后，评估他们所处的位置并将各个点联系起来。

When people know the goal, assess where they are and connect the dots.

如果人们知道他们现在在哪里，但要么祈求奇迹出现，要么对下一步一无所知，请向他们展示下一步并将各个点联系起来。

If people know where they are now, but either are begging for a miracle or are clueless about the next step, show them the next step and connect the dots.

最后，与你辅导或指导的每个人一起，不断关注过程和成功的关键。

And, finally, with everyone you coach or mentor, focus constantly on the process and on the keys to success.

我会努力不再成为问题。让我们进入干预。

I’m going to try not to be the problem anymore. Let’s get into Intervention.

第2章

Chapter 2

对我的大脑进行逆向工程：

Reverse Engineering My Brain:

进行干预

Getting to Intervention

当有人问“你是怎么做到的？”时，整个项目就开始了。

THIS WHOLE PROJECT BEGAN when someone asked, “How do you do it?”

我的一位实习生每周都在与运动员通电话时听我讲话。

One of my interns had been listening to me, week in and week out, on the phone with athletes.

“做什么？”

“Do what?”

“嗯，你似乎每次打电话都给出了可靠的建议，我认识到我们所做的基础知识，但是，然后……”

“Well, you seem to give solid advice every call and I recognize the basics we do, but, then…”

“什么？”

“What?”

“你似乎有一些个人建议只是从你嘴里说出来的，一些我从未听你说过的事情，而且就像每次电话都会发生这种情况。”

“You seem to have some individual advice that just comes up out of your mouth, things that I’ve never heard you say, and it’s like every call this happens.”

哦。嗯，好问题。

Oh. Well, good question.

我花了四年的时间才回答这个问题。

And it has taken me the better part of four years to answer it.

简而言之，这实际上回答了力量和体能领域的几乎所有问题，“这取决于情况。”

The short answer is, and really, this answers just about every question in the world of strength and conditioning, “It depends.”

这实际上也是一个很好的答案。我可以发自内心地告诉你：如果有人规定了一种“一刀切”的培训方法，我可以保证一件事：这是错误的。我们中的许多人可能会爱上一个新玩具、一种新时尚或一个看起来奇怪地像是从别人那里偷来的新想法，但迟早我们会发现我们再次拿着一袋虚假的承诺。 （我曾经说过一袋甜甜圈洞，但后来他们推出了该产品；我应该得到回扣。）

That’s actually a pretty good answer, too. From my heart of hearts, I can tell you this: If someone prescribes a “one size fits all” approach to training, I can guarantee one thing: It’s wrong. Many of us may fall in love with a new toy, a new fad, or a new idea that looks strangely like it was stolen from someone else, but sooner or later we find we’re holding a bag of false promises…again. (I used to say a bag of doughnut holes, but then they came out with that product; I should get a kick-back.)

通过介绍，让我们看看我可以提供什么。您有一个健身目标，并询问是否有力量训练方法或支持计划来帮助实现该目标。我想我有能力帮助你。当您读完本文时，您也将拥有帮助自己和他人的技能。

By way of an introduction, let’s look at what I can offer. You have a fitness goal and ask if there’s a strength training method or support program to assist in that goal. I think I have the skill-set to help you. By the time you finish reading this, you too will have the skill-set to help yourself and others.

干预是包含 10 个问题和 5 项原则的工具箱。就是这样。

Intervention is tool box of 10 questions and five principles. That’s it.

混合到这个问题和原则系统中，我将向您介绍我使用的一些评估，我认为是基本的人类运动，以及我将所有这些整合到一个终生计划中的方式。但这些问题的答案几乎并不重要。哦，我非常喜欢他们！ 35 年的举重、比赛和训练让我找到了这些答案。但只要你提出这10个问题并遵循这五个原则，你就会找到A点，并以最直接的路线到达B点。如果你跳过几个问题并忽略一两个原则，你可能仍然会到达那里，但我的一位运动员可能会站在那里问你为什么花了这么长时间。

Mixed into this system of questions and principles, I’ll introduce you to some assessments I use, what I believe are the fundamental human movements, and the way I put all this together into a lifelong program. But the answers to these questions almost don’t matter. Oh, I’m very fond of them! And it was 35 years of lifting, competing and coaching that lead me to these answers. But as long as you are asking the 10 questions and following these five principles, you will find Point A and you will get to Point B in the most direct route. If you skip a few questions and ignore a principle or two, you may still get there, but one of my athletes might be standing there asking what took you so long.

我认真对待这些问题，因为在我职业生涯的大部分时间里，我一直在与非常严肃的运动员打交道。问“你想要什么”是一个很容易开始的地方，0.001% 拥有真正精英目标的运动员在告诉我“我想参加奥运会”时通常非常认真。 “我想要世界纪录。” “我想在 NFL 打三年球。”

I take these questions seriously because for most of my career I have dealt with very serious athletes. Asking “what do you want” was an easy place to start and the 0.001% of athletes with truly elite goals were usually pretty serious when they told me, “I want to go to the Olympics.” “I want the world record.” “I want to play three more years in the NFL.”

但还有其他 99.999%。问题就在这里。当你进行干预时，你会假设你已经知道了问题的答案，但我挑战你是否有勇气诚实地回答。

But then there’s the other 99.999%. And therein lies the problem. As you go through Intervention, you are going to assume you have answers to the questions, but I challenge you have the courage to answer with honesty.

先开始我的第一次吐槽吧。没有什么比人们发牢骚、抱怨、抱怨、操纵和扭曲世界以获得他们想要的东西更让我发疯的了。他们明白了。那么，看来这终究不是他们想要的。

Let’s start with my first rant. Nothing drives me crazier than when people whine, complain, bitch, manipulate and twist the world around to get what they want. And they get it. Then, it seems that wasn’t what they wanted after all.

我在爱情婚姻、马车、当然还有健身行业中都看到了这一点。有人会要求失去或得到一些东西；我们召集了该领域最伟大的人才来解决这个问题，我们发现同一个人一天后在一场即兴的啤酒篮球比赛中宿醉并受伤。

I have seen it in love and marriage, horse and carriage, and, of course, the fitness industry. Someone will ask to lose or gain something; we put together the greatest minds in the field to solve the issue, and we find that same someone a day later hung over and injured from an impromptu beer basketball game.

在本书的后面，我将问你第一个问题：“你想要什么？”

Later in this book I’m going to ask you the first question, “What do you want?”

事情是这样的：当你告诉我时，我就会相信你！

Here’s the thing: I’ll believe you when you tell me!

这就是我的问题。很多时候，我花费了大量的时间和精力来辅导、写作、教导和协助某人做一些实际上充其量只是一时兴起的事情。我喜欢女人，讨厌冲动。

And that’s my problem. All too often, I’ve spent a great amount of time and energy coaching, writing, teaching and assisting someone to do something that really, at best, was a whim. I like women, I hate whims.

作为“你想要什么？”的答案。空气中传来重击声，我也在倾听非常重要的线索，看看我是否可以帮助实现这个目标。我会问干预工具包中的许多问题，以了解您是否在与正确的人交谈。这是健康问题还是健身问题？如果是健康问题，我几乎会立即道歉，因为正如菲尔·马菲托解释的那样，健康是器官的最佳相互作用。如果你选择不戴头盔并打赌乘坐某种高速交通工具从山坡上跳下来，我只能做这么多。我是力量教练，不是你妈妈。

As the answer to “what do you want?” thuds around the air, I am also listening to very important clues to find out if this a goal I can help with. I ask many of the questions in the Intervention toolkit as a way to discover if you’re talking to the right guy. Is it a health or a fitness question? If it’s health, I apologize almost right away, because health, as Phil Maffetone explained, is the optimal interplay of the organs. If you choose not to wear a helmet and on a bet leap down a mountainside on some kind of high speed conveyance, I can only do so much. I’m a strength coach, not your mother.

然而，如果你有一个健身目标，我就会振作起来。如果您真的知道自己想要什么，并且有健身目标，那么力量教练几乎可以为您提供帮助。但当我们进行干预时，我也在倾听我能为你提供多少帮助。我不是你的医生，也不是你的物理治疗师。我们工具包中的许多问题都致力于回答人们最常问的问题：教练，你能帮助我吗？

However, if you have a fitness goal, I perk right up. If you really know what you want, and you have a fitness goal, a strength coach can almost universally help. But as we go through Intervention, I am also listening for how much I can help you. I am not your doctor and I am not your physical therapist. Many of the questions in our toolkit are dedicated to answering the question people ask the most: Can you help me, coach?

嗯，当然，但是，你应该能够和我一起说：这取决于情况。

Well, of course, but, and you should be able to say this along with me: It depends.

或者说我多年来一直这么认为。现在，我认为力量教练可以在帮助您实现健身目标方面发挥非常重要的作用。在某些情况下，这个角色会非常热衷。但当我带你经历干预时，我能提供多少帮助将完全取决于你是否有勇气诚实地回答这 10 个问题，并诚实地遵循五项原则。

Or so I thought for years. Now, I think the strength coach can have a very important role in helping you get your fitness goals. In some cases, the role will be very keen. But as I take you through Intervention, how much I can help will depend entirely on the courage you have in answering the 10 questions with honesty, and following the five principles with integrity.

我将与您分享的这五个原则是我所拥有的最重要的教练课程。每当我偏离这些教训时，我都会经历惨痛的教训。让我的失速、溅射、死胡同和手术成为你的教训。这对你来说更便宜、更容易，因为我已经盲目地前进了！哦，我知道你们中的大多数人都会尝试将公园长椅变成公交车长椅，我很快就会对此进行解释。而且你们都会吃掉比自己能咀嚼的更多的食物。你对这条道路的信心会消退，但如果你不断问自己这 10 个问题并坚持遵循五个原则，你就会找到回来的路。

These five principles I’m about to share with you are the most important coaching lessons I possess. I have learned these lessons the hard way every time I deviated from them. Let my stalls, sputters, dead-ends and surgeries be your lessons. It’s cheaper and easier for you because I’ve gone ahead so blindly! Oh, I know most of you will try to turn a park bench into a bus bench, which I’ll be sure to explain shortly. And that you’ll all bite off more diet than you can chew. Your faith in the path will ebb and wane, but if you keep asking yourself the 10 questions and keep following the five principles, you’ll find your way back.

我称这个系统为“干预”，因为多年来我一直用它来教人们在去 B 点的路上迷路时如何找到 A 点。老实说，它也可以帮助很多人找到 B 点。干预是我赚钱的方式，但我希望人们不必使用它。哦，我知道。如果人们永远不会迷路，而是以 Godspeed 的方式实现他们所有的健身目标，我就会破产！但我从经验中知道，没有人会坚持走这条路。每个人都会迷路。我正在教你干预，因为你和你的客户会迷路，而且打电话给我的费用非常昂贵。

I call this system Intervention because I’ve used it for years to teach people how to find Point A when they have gotten lost on the way to Point B. And honestly, it helps a lot of people figure out Point B, too. Intervention is how I make my money, but I wish people didn’t have to use it. Oh, I know. If people never got lost and instead moved with Godspeed to their all their fitness goals, I would be broke! But I know from experience that no one stays on the path. Everyone gets lost. I’m teaching you Intervention because you and your clients will get lost and calling me is very expensive.

虽然我希望您能用它来完成您的健身之旅，但我也知道还有更好的方法。

And while I hope you’ll use it to complete your fitness journey, I also know there’s a better way.

在我们干预之前：有更好的方法来做到这一点

Before We Intervene: There’s a better way to do this

有比我给一位 26 岁的 NFL 防守截锋打电话告诉他要这样做或那样做更好的方法。理想情况下，我们应该有一个系统，让每个人从小就学习基本动作和模式训练。小时候，我接受过体育教育，我很幸运：九年级体育课的老师教了我举重和训练的基础知识。这对我的高中在体育方面如此成功产生了重大影响。

There’s a better way to do this than me being on the phone with a 26-year-old NFL defensive tackle telling him to do this or that. Ideally, we’d have a system where everyone would learn the basic movements and pattern training at an early age. As a child, I had physical education, and I was lucky: The instructor of my ninth-grade PE class taught me the basics of lifting and training. This had a major impact on why my high school was so successful in sports.

如果我们仍然接受这种教育，我们会教授什么样的东西？在我的小世界里，我们会教这些基本动作——



What kinds of things would we be teaching if we still had this education? In my little part of the world, we would teach these primary movements—



   摇摆、高脚杯深蹲、起立——壶铃基础

   Swing, Goblet Squat, Getup—the kettlebell foundation

   军事推举、前深蹲、高翻、卧推——杠铃

   Military Press, Front Squat, Power Clean, Bench Press—barbell

   跨栏跨栏、农夫行走、侧手翻、前滚翻、翻滚、肩滚

   Hurdle Walkovers, Farmer Walks, Cartwheels, Forward Rolls, Tumbling, Shoulder Rolls

   一般运动和流动性工作

   General Movement and Mobility Work

   后来……硬拉、后深蹲、雪橇训练、徘徊者和推车

   Later…Deadlift, Back Squat, Sled Work, Prowlers and Car Pushes

这就是所谓的系统教育。系统教育需要每次学习新技能时都从基础开始的勇气。这显然并不适合所有人，因为互联网上充斥着那些跳过前面的人的例子，而那些追随这一领先者的人则有祸了。学习基础知识、循序渐进和精通之路至关重要。如果不这样做，就会导致以后出现问题，从受伤到更严重。如果你不相信我，请随意观看一些愚蠢的网络视频。

This is called systematic education. Systematic education takes the courage to start at the basic level each and every time when learning a new skill. It’s obviously not for everyone, as the internet is filled with examples of people who have skipped ahead and woe to those who follow that lead. There’s a crucial need to learn the basics, the step-by-step progression and the road to mastery. Failure to do so leads to issues later, from injury to worse. If you don’t believe me, feel free to watch some internet videos of idiocy.

可悲的是，很少有人带着这样的背景来找我。干预从几个问题开始。然后我会给出一个或两个建议，然后等待几周电话响起。我拿起它，听到：“就这么简单；我自己就应该想到这一点！”

Sadly, few come to me with this background. Intervention begins with a few questions. Then I give a single recommendation or perhaps two, and wait a few weeks for the phone to ring. I pick it up and hear, “It was so simple; I should have thought of this myself!”

我感谢电话里那位优秀的人的见解，然后回到我今天剩下的时间。

And I thank the fine person on the telephone for the insight and move back to the rest of my day.

对我来说，这个系统很简单。它基于的工具使我能够摆脱健身行业的混乱和垃圾，让运动员或非运动员重新专注于目标。这些工具清除了机器、带子、包裹物、按扣、链条、球和各种巫术的所有这些和那些，这些使训练比火星之旅更加复杂。确实，其中大部分都是垃圾，但我们想要做的是专注于提供飞跃改进的工具。

To me, the system is simple. It’s based on tools that allow me to get past the clutter and junk of the fitness industry and focus the athlete or non-athlete back on the goals. The tools clear away all of the this and thats of machines, straps, wraps, snaps, chains, balls and assorted voodoo that make training more complex than a trip to Mars. Most of it’s junk, true, but what we want to do is focus on the tools that provide a leap of improvement.

问题是：当我们读到这里时，你会耸耸肩，说这一切是多么简单和明显。我知道。但是，简单而明显就是天才的全部意义。

Here’s the problem: When we get to the end here, you’ll shrug your shoulders and say how simple and obvious this all is. I know that. But, simple and obvious is what genius is all about.

第3章

Chapter 3

10 个问题

The 10 Questions

1.你的目标是什么？意思是……你的B点在哪里！

1.   What is your goal? Meaning…where’s your point B!

2. 这是健康目标还是健身目标？

2.   Is this a health or a fitness goal?

3. 这个目标会让你螺旋上升，扩大你的生活吗？

3.   Will this goal allow you to spiral out, to enlarge your life?

4. 你的目标在哪个象限？

4.   What quadrant is your goal in?

5. 你几岁了？

5.   How old are you?

6. 你在举重室举什么？

6.   What do you lift in the weightroom?

7. 你的差距是什么？你愿意回到基础吗？

7.   What are your gaps and are you willing to go back to the basics?

8. 让我们仔细检查一些事情......评估，重新评估，重新评估。

8.   Let’s just double-check a few things…assess, reassess, re-reassess.

9. 问题——你愿意解决你的问题吗？

9.   The issues—Are you willing to correct your problems?

10. 如果一切从开始到结束都是无缝的，你介意吗？

10. Would you mind if everything was seamless from start to finish?

所以，这是 10 个问题。我将称它们为工具，因为它们提供了答案，让我可以帮助您找出道路。有些就像 GPS，有些则更像为 GPS 供电的电池。前五个问题对于任何人来说都很容易回答，但需要勇气提供诚实、有用的答案。后五个需要更多的思考和工作，但需要更少的勇气。

So, these are the 10 questions. I’m going to call them tools, as these hold the answers that allow me to help you figure out the path. Some are like a GPS and others are more like the batteries that power the GPS. The first five are simple for anyone to answer, but require courage to deliver honest, useful answers. The second five take a bit more thought and work, but less courage.

我们拥有一个包含 10 个问题的工具箱，然后是您的答案。然后，当我给你答案时，奇迹就发生了！

What we have is a 10-question toolbox, followed by your answers. Then, the magic happens as I give you the answers to the answers!

答案就是这五个原则。



The answers to the answers are these five principles.



1. 瘦体重和关节活动能力的力量训练比其他一切都重要。

1.   Strength training for lean body mass and joint mobility work trump everything else.

2. 人体的基本运动是根本。

2.   Fundamental human movements are fundamental.

3. 必须不断评估标准和差距。

3.   Standards and gaps must be constantly assessed.

4. 公园长椅和公交车长椅锻炼的概念必须在整个训练生涯中一起应用。

4.   The notion of park bench and bus bench workouts must be applied together throughout the training lifetime.

5. 不断追求精通和优雅。

5.   Constantly strive for mastery and grace.

但是，我们不要太过超前。就像爱丽丝梦游仙境中的国王告诉我们的那样……

But, let’s not get too far ahead of ourselves. Like the King in Alice in Wonderland tells us…

“从头开始，”国王严肃地说，

“继续下去，直到结束。那就停下来吧。”

“Begin at the beginning,” the King said gravely,

“and go on till you come to the end. Then stop.”

史蒂夫·莱德贝特教练是一位出色的年轻教练，他采用了干预系统并与之运行。他为我们概述了他的四位客户，他的故事将提供有关对大多数人应用干预的见解。

Coach Steve Ledbetter is an outstanding young coach who has taken the Intervention System and run with it. He outlined four of his clients for us, and his stories will give insights about applying Intervention to most people.

史蒂夫教练的案例一

Coach Stevo’s Case One

这个客户是大多数培训师的梦想。她充满动力并准备好工作。但她也迷失了。她不知道自己想去哪里，甚至不知道自己在哪里。她不知道A点或B点。大多数私人培训客户都从这个地方寻求帮助——迷失且不知情。

This client is the dream of most trainers. She’s motivated and ready to work. But she’s also lost. She doesn’t know where she wants to go or even where she is. She’s doesn’t know Point A or Point B. Most personal training clients seek help from this place—lost and unaware.

事情发生得很慢。当然，一开始不会。前10磅显然是大学时发生的啤酒重量。但她所有的朋友都增加了同样的 10 磅，所以看起来并没有那么糟糕。不管怎样，她需要新的工作服。这个借口有效了近五年，但体重又增加了五磅后，它就和她大腿间的牛仔裤一样薄了。她下班后加入了街边的一家健身房，并告诉自己她每天都会去，因为很方便。健身房还方便地每年一月更新她的会员资格，所以签证账单上的打击奇怪地提醒她，自去年一月以来，她又穿着牛仔裤骑自行车、椭圆机和嘻哈舞。已经成年十年了，距离新生入学准备还有 20 磅。她到处尝试节食。她参加了一些举重课程。她做了正确的事，但年复一年，她的肥牛仔裤却变成了她的牛仔裤。

It happened slowly. Not at first, of course; the first 10 pounds were obviously beer weight that happened at college. But all of her friends put on the same 10 pounds, so it didn’t seem so bad. Anyway, she needed new work clothes. That excuse worked for almost five years, but after five more pounds, it was wearing as thin as the denim between her thighs. She joined a gym down the street from work and told herself she’d go every day because it was convenient. The gym also conveniently renewed her membership every January, so the hit to her Visa bill was an odd reminder that she had pedaled, ellipticaled and hip-hop danced yet another pound into her jeans since the previous January. Ten years as an adult, and she was 20 pounds from freshman orientation. She tried a diet here and there. She took some weightlifting classes. She did the right things, but year after year her fat jeans kept becoming just her jeans.

直到地铁上那个男孩对她说：“移动吧，胖子。”

Until that boy on the subway said to her, “Move it, tubby.”

然后慢慢就不是一个选择了。

Then slowly wasn’t an option.

动力来自海豹突击队和马拉松运动员。乘坐地铁后，她没有了动力；她没有动力。她是一种激光聚焦的愤怒。她在垃圾桶里装满了冰淇淋、椒盐卷饼和其他所有含有碳水化合物的东西。她购买了耐克燃料带、跑鞋、浴室无线秤和厨房营养秤。

Motivation is for Navy SEALs and marathoners. She wasn’t motivated after that subway ride; she was a fury of laser-focused rage. She filled the garbage can with ice cream, pretzels, and everything else with a carb in it. She bought a Nike Fuel Band, running shoes, a wireless scale for her bathroom and a nutritional scale for her kitchen.

即使在训练营一个小时之后，她仍然让椭圆机上的红色小数字比她见过的更高。她不在乎上班迟到了30分钟；她不在乎。这就是她现在的生活。汗水和饥饿意味着她正在进步。

And even after an hour of boot camp, she made the little red number on the elliptical go higher than she ever had seen it go. She didn’t care that she was 30 minutes late for work; this would be her life now. Sweat and hunger meant she was making progress.

一周后，她的新体重秤有了新的数字。它较低，但并不像汗水和饥饿所暗示的那么低。每块肌肉都酸痛，她想吃面包。人们如何做到这一点？人们如何保持愤怒足够长的时间来减肥？没有冰淇淋和夜晚外出，人们如何生活？她需要帮助，但她甚至不知道该请求什么。

A week later, her new scale had a new number. It was lower, but not as low as the sweat and hunger suggested it would be. Every muscle ached and she wanted toast. How do people do this? How do people stay angry long enough lose the weight? How do people live without ice cream and nights out? She needed help, but she didn’t even know what to ask for.

“只要告诉我该怎么做就可以了。我不知道我要去哪里，但我知道我不想待在这里。”

“Just tell me what to do. I don’t know where I’m going, but I know I don’t want to be here.”

第4章

Chapter 4

第一个问题：

First Question:

你的目标是什么？

What’s your goal?

您需要回答这个问题。我不能为你做这件事。想一想就会明白。那里有很多更好的作者——我想到了厄尔·南丁格尔——他们在这方面比我做得更好。

YOU NEED TO ANSWER THIS. I can’t do this for you. Think about it and find clarity. There are plenty of better authors out there—Earl Nightingale comes to mind—who do a better job on this than me.

这将是你的 B 点。老实说，我的工作是打开你的 A 点，但请帮助我：了解你想去哪里！我不想把你抛弃在这里，因为我知道人们为了找到 B 点付出了多少努力，所以这里有一些关于这个想法的事情。

This is going to be your Point B. My job, honestly, is to unpack your Point A, but help me out: Have an idea about where you want to go! I don’t want to abandon you here because I know how much people struggle to find Point B, so here are a few things about this idea.

首先，几年前，“我需要为任何事情做好准备”的大男子主义立场开始在互联网上占据主导地位。我最近读到一篇有趣的文章，说有多少大学生确切地知道如果僵尸启示录发生他们会做什么，但不知道毕业后该做什么。如果你正在为任何事情做准备，那将会很难做到。就像斯蒂芬赖特所说的拥有一切：你会把它放在哪里？

First, a few years ago, this whole “I need to be prepared for anything” macho stance started to dominate the internet. I recently read a funny line about how many college students know exactly what they are going to do if a Zombie Apocalypse happens, but have no idea about what to do after graduation. If you are preparing for anything, it’s going to be hard to do. It’s like what Stephen Wright said about having everything: Where would you put it?

在“做好一切准备”之前，那些自称为 HIT Jedi 的高强度训练者统治着互联网，所以我认为我们已经取得了很大的进步。互联网在很短的时间内从宣扬“一劳永逸”到“为一切做好准备”。

Before “prepared for anything,” the high intensity training guys who referred to themselves as HIT Jedi ruled the internet, so I like to think we’ve come a long way. The internet went from preaching “one set to failure” to “prepare for anything” in a very short period of time.

而且，对于我们大多数人来说，这两种方法都充满了问题。

And, for most of us, both approaches are fraught with issues.

我的问题，直到最近才澄清，是这种为任何事情做好准备的思维方式，将 B 点变成了一个圆圈。好吧，当然，A 点的问题仍然存在，但你会注意到，即使你从圆圈的正中间开始，任何方向上的任何进展都会使你偏离目标。

My issue, only recently clarified, is that this way of thinking, this prepare for anything, turns Point B into a circle. Well, the question of Point A still comes up, of course, but you’ll notice even if you start right smack in the middle of a circle, any progress in any direction takes you in a direction away from your goal.

即使你的目标是“为任何事情做好准备”，请相信我：如果你变得更强，几乎普遍地，你会发现实现目标的道路更容易。所以，先变强吧。当你变得强壮后，你可以准备用火花塞或其他厨房用具与大白鲨搏斗。做出明智的选择！

Even if your goal is “prepare for anything,” trust me on this: If you get stronger, almost universally, you’ll find the path to your goals is easier. So, get stronger first. After you’re strong, you can prepare to fight a Great White shark with a spark plug or another kitchen utensil. Choose wisely!

请记住，这些人说要为任何事情做好准备。这将是“任何事情”。我想，你也应该准备好用牙线制作一艘太空飞船。

Remember, these guys say to prepare for anything. This would be “anything.” You should also be prepared to make a space ship out of dental floss too, I would imagine.

这让我想到了最短但最重要的一点。

Which brings me to the shortest, but most important point ever.

为什么要进行力量训练？

Why strength training?

好问题。

Good question.

答案——布雷特·琼斯曾经告诉过我——

The answer—Brett Jones once told me this—

“绝对的强度是玻璃。其他一切都是玻璃杯内的液体。玻璃越大，你能做的事情就越多。”

“Absolute strength is the glass. Everything else is the liquid inside the glass. The bigger the glass, the more of everything else you can do.”

举重是增强力量的最快方法。当你的实力提升了，其他的一切也都可以扩展。

Lifting weights is the quickest way to build strength. As your strength goes up, everything else can be expanded, too.

这很简单，所以不要错过！

It’s a simple point, so don’t miss it!

许多精英健身竞赛教练认为，基本力量水平使他们在时间和明显的能量消耗方面不必那么辛苦地训练，并且仍然比那些忽视力量的人用更少的工作量保持苗条。

Many elite fitness competition trainers believe that basic strength levels allow them to not train as hard in terms of time and apparent use of energy and still remain lean with less work than those who ignore strength.

我教授这一点越多，听取的优秀反馈越多，我听到的现实世界的例子就越多。

The more I teach this point and listen to the excellent feedback, the more I hear real world examples about this.

最近，一位女士告诉我她的朋友不能犯错误。

Recently, a woman told me her friends can’t make a mistake.

什么？嗯，她告诉我的是：由于他们通过有氧运动和严格节食来减肥，所以他们没有任何回旋余地。这位女士几乎全年都将自己的体脂保持在令人印象深刻的 19%，她告诉我她喜欢甜点、鸡尾酒、烧烤和美食。但是，这是一个很大的但是，她还可以做 10 个引体向上。她在举重室里非常强壮。换句话说，她的杯子太大了，她可以到处作弊。

What? Well, what she told me was this: Since they were attacking fat loss with aerobic work and strict dieting, they didn’t have any wiggle room. The woman, who holds herself nearly year-round at a very impressive 19% bodyfat, told me she enjoys desserts, cocktails, BBQs and fine food. But, and this is a big but, she can also do 10 pullups. She is very strong in the weightroom. In other words, her glass is so big, she can afford to cheat a little here and there.

这对我来说毫无意义。然后我看着她训练，想着和我一起工作的其他一些女性。当她将一个令人印象深刻的壶铃举过头顶（用一只手压下她体重的一半！）时，她的整个系统必须收集资源，然后适应并从努力中恢复。当我健身房里的小埃德娜认为五磅重的哑铃很重时，她不会对自己的身体造成很大的负担。

That made no sense to me. Then I watched her train and thought about some other women I work with. When she presses an impressive kettlebell overhead (half her bodyweight with one hand!), her entire system has to gather up resources, and then adapt and recover from the effort. When little Edna at my gym thinks the five-pound dumbbell is heavy, she isn’t going to tax her body very hard.

埃德娜不能吃蛋糕。

Edna can’t eat cake.

现在这几乎是陈词滥调，但这让我们想到了另一个问题。我一直看着妈妈们拿起、放下、举起、摆动、装载和搬运相当大的负载。我们将这些负载称为“子负载”。然而，当我们去健身房时，我们似乎认为女性需要使用非常轻的负荷。就像米洛和他的小牛一样，也许我们应该让女性从八磅的体重开始，随着孩子的成长而逐渐增加。

It is almost a cliché now, but this leads us to another issue. I watch moms pick up, put down, lift, swing, load and carry fairly large loads all the time. We call these loads ‘children.’ Yet, when we get to the gym, we seem to think a woman needs to use very light loads. Like Milo and his calf, perhaps we should start women off with an eight-pound weight and progress upwards as the child grows.

最后一点。有一个电视广告讲述了一位女士摔倒后无法站起来的故事。她说了一句著名的话，我确信这是受版权保护的，但是看，把自己从地上爬起来或滚到一个可以站起来的位置可能会挽救你的生命。为了你自己和你所爱的人，你应该尽可能长时间地保持力量。

One final point. There’s a television commercial about a woman who falls and can’t get up. She makes a famous statement I’m sure is copyrighted, but look, picking yourself off the ground or rolling yourself to a position so you can get up might save your life. You owe it to yourself and your loved ones to keep your strength up for as long as you can.

对于很多人来说，他们读过的最令人震惊的事情可能是这样的——

For many people, the most shocking thing they may ever read is this—

强起来才能瘦！

Get strong to get lean!

因此，当您考虑目标时，请记住玻璃杯。不要只是为了强而强！但您可能会发现，问问自己，如果您使用小桶而不是小酒杯，您的目标中有多少会更容易，这一点很有价值。也许穿着比 schmedium T 恤大一点的衣服会更容易容纳“为任何事情做好准备”所需的所有品质。

So as you are contemplating your goal, remember the glass. Do not just get strong for strong’s sake! But you might find it valuable to ask yourself how many of your goals would be easier if you were working with a keg instead of a shot glass. And maybe it’ll be a little easier to hold all the qualities you need to “prepare for anything” in something a little bigger than that schmedium t-shirt.

最后，在此过程中出现的另一个未被重视的见解是，干预也可以帮助人们实现 A 点。如果您只听到我宣扬的关于教练的一件事，请听听：这不仅仅是评估，而是持续评估。大多数人因为忘记评估而忘记了自己所处的位置。洗衣服不会让你的裤子缩水，衣服的尺码也不会缩水，而且你也不能太频繁地“再多一件”。

Finally, another unappreciated insight that comes up in this process is that Intervention also helps people with Point A. If you only hear one thing I preach about coaching, listen to this: It’s not just assessing, but constant assessment. Most people lose track of where they are because they forget to assess. The laundry isn’t shrinking your pants, the sizes of clothes aren’t shrinking, and you can’t get too comfortable with “having one more just this time” too often.

您如何评估自己的处境？继续阅读。但时不时地花点时间重新评估你的 B 点可能是个好主意。当你沿着这条路走得更远时，环顾四周看看你是否喜欢你要去的地方可能是明智之举。

How do you assess where you are? Keep reading. But taking the time every now and then to reassess your Point B could be a good idea. As you get a little further down the path, it might be smart to look around and see if you like where you’re headed.

第5章

Chapter 5

第二个问题：

Second Question:

这是健康目标还是健身目标？

Is this a health or a fitness goal?

首先，大多数读过以下内容的人都会像大风天里的一缕头发一样把它拂掉。这样做后果自负。

AT FIRST, MOST PEOPLE who read the following brush it off like a wisp of hair on a windy day. Do that at your peril.

在你走得太远之前，请确保你知道你的目标是偏向

健康方面还是健身方面。

Be sure you know whether your goal tilts

towards the health side or the fitness side

before you get too far along the path.

不久前，一位女士问我减掉五磅体重的事。我友善而有礼貌地告诉她，她可能想减掉五磅的身体脂肪，因为减掉五磅的体重很容易：砍掉一部分肢体。

Not long ago, a woman asked me about losing five pounds of bodyweight. I was kind and courteous and told her she probably wanted to lose five pounds of body fat, as losing five pounds of bodyweight is easy: Chop off part of a limb.

我的建议是安全且理智的。我告诉每个人的基本原则都是一样的：降低碳水化合物，添加一些鱼油，多喝水并举重。它不性感，当然也不是任何让人热血沸腾的东西。我承认——我很无聊。

My advice was safe and sane. It was the same basics I tell everyone: Lower your carbs, add some fish oil, drink more water and lift a few weights. It’s not sexy, and it certainly isn’t anything that gets the blood pumping. I admit it—I’m boring.

她以大约一千美元的价格与一位拥有一日认证的私人教练签约，并承诺为她提供“精英”培训，并使用“硬核”和“糟糕的屁股”等术语。几个月之内，她离开了家人，开始与教练约会，并失去了房子。后来，他甩了她，转向另一个健身房女孩。好消息？她减掉了五磅。

She signed up with a personal trainer who had one of those one-day certifications for about a thousand dollars and promised her “elite” training and used terms like “hard core” and “bad ass.” Within a few months, she left her family, started dating the trainer and lost her house. Later, he dumped her and moved on to another gym girl. The good news? She lost the five pounds.

了解健康和健身目标之间的差异可能看起来微不足道，但混淆两者会产生一些相当可笑的决定。在力量、体能和健身领域，人们会用在公园里追逐曾孙的未来来换取暂时修复身体部位的这种疯狂，我继续看到的这种疯狂是什么？我只能帮助部分疯狂的人，但我愿意挺身而出。真的，我的大部分咆哮，不仅是在现场，而且是在网上和文章中，都围绕着这个疯狂的想法，即以某种方式将自己置于死亡之门旁边对你有好处。哦，我知道 T 恤——

Knowing the difference between health and fitness goals may seem trivial, but confusing the two yields some pretty ludicrous decisions. What is this insanity I continue to see in the strength, conditioning and fitness world where people will trade their futures of chasing great-grandchildren around a park for a temporary fix on a bodypart? I can only help with part of the madness, but I am willing to step up here. Really, the bulk of my rantings, not only live, but online and in articles, centers around this lunatic idea that somehow putting yourself next to death’s door is good for you. Oh, I know the T-shirts—

疼痛是身体虚弱的表现。

凡是杀不死我的，都会让我变得坚强。

Pain is weakness leaving the body.

That which doesn’t kill me makes me strong.

什么时候出现过简单的问题，比如“我想要感觉好一点；我想感觉更好”。你能帮助我吗？”或“我想减掉几磅；我应该怎么办？”变成战场战术？我从来没有见过一件 T 恤上写着“我想在死的那天走到邮箱”，但我很确定更多的人会认同这个目标，而不是为了完成第 20 次引体向上而进行全面战争。健康、健身和长寿问题会影响每个健身目标，在将所有可用资源投入到下一个引体向上之前，了解这些目标之间的差异非常重要。我要告诉你——这需要一段时间，但现在让我们解决第一个问题，即健康和健身是相同的。它们不是，当你混淆它们时，你就真的走上了错误的道路。

When did simple questions like, “I want to feel better; can you help me?” or “I would like to lose a few pounds; what should I do?” turn into battlefield tactics? I’ve never seen a T-shirt that said, “I want to walk to the mailbox on the day I die,” but I am pretty sure more people would identify with that goal than an all-out war to get that 20th pullup. The issues of health, fitness and longevity impact every fitness goal and it’s important to know the differences between these before you commit every available resource you have to that next pullup. I’m going to tell you—it’s going to take a while, but let’s get through the first issue now, the idea that health and fitness are the same. They’re not and when you confuse them, you really start down the wrong road.

我长期以来一直使用 Phil Maffetone 对健康的定义——

I’ve been using Phil Maffetone’s definition of health for a long time—

健康是器官的最佳相互作用。

Health is the optimal interplay of the organs.

健康总是可以变得更好一点。健康是通过血液检查、寿命和健康状况是否不佳来衡量的。健康不是疾病。肿瘤、高血压和晕厥并不是健康状况良好的迹象。健康是我们大多数人认为理所当然的东西，直到我们没有它为止。

Health is something that can always get a little better. Health is something measured by blood tests, longevity and the lack of bad health. Health is not illness. Tumors and high blood pressure and fainting are not signs of good health. Health is something we mostly take for granted until we don’t have it.

事实上，我经常提醒自己深呼吸，微笑，享受健康的时刻。这是一份礼物。

In fact, I remind myself often to breathe deeply, smile and enjoy a moment of good health. It’s a gift.

这不是健身吗？不。

That isn’t fitness? No.

健身只是完成任务的能力。

Fitness is simply the ability to do a task.

投掷运动员适合完成投掷任务。跳跃运动员适合跳跃任务，短跑运动员适合短跑任务。几年前，我认识的一个人醉酒后跳进游泳池的浅水区，摔断了脖子。他行动不便，但他生了两个儿子。尽管他不能走路，但他适合生育。如果你将铁饼扔出 244 英尺，然后需要小睡一小时，并且无法慢跑赶回奥运村的巴士，那么你就是新的世界纪录保持者，没有人会记得关于这个故事的任何其他事情。

Throwers are fit for the task of throwing. Jumpers are fit for the task of jumping and sprinters are fit for the task of sprinting. Years ago, a guy I know jumped into the shallow end of a swimming pool, drunk, and broke his neck. He can’t move well, but he fathered two sons. He is fit for the task of procreation, although he can’t walk. If you throw the discus 244 feet then need a nap for an hour and can’t jog to catch the bus back the Olympic Village, you’re the new world record-holder and no one is going to remember anything else about this story.

如果您可以做 100 次引体向上或跑马拉松，但体内潜伏着一种严重癌症，那么您适合执行任务，但不健康。这些问题是独立的，但通常会相互影响。

If you can do 100 pullups or run a marathon, but you have a major cancer lurking inside your body, you’re fit for a task, but are not healthy. The issues are separate, but often impact each other down the line.

人们经常评论我训练运动员的方式——我的投掷运动员投掷。根据记录，我的跳投运动员是跳跃的，我的短跑运动员是冲刺运动员。我在生活的许多方面都使用这个简单的公式。

People often comment on the way I train athletes—my throwers throw. For the record, my jumpers jump and my sprinters sprint. I use this simple formula for many aspects of life.

事情是这样的：我的投掷者不跑。我的投掷者不做敏捷或跳跃，或者说，除了投掷和举重之外，几乎不做任何事情。为什么？我希望他们能够投掷。

Here’s the thing: My throwers don’t run. My throwers don’t do agility or jumping or, really, just about anything besides throw and lift. Why? I want them to be fit to throw.

我们的口号有两个——



Our mantra is two-fold—



   顺利走远。

   Smooth goes far.

   适合走得很远。

   Fit goes far.

“适合什么？”是正确的后续问题。投掷者投掷的次数越多，技术就越流畅，投掷的距离也就越远。投掷者投掷的次数越多，则投掷者的身体状况越好。当然，你的运动员可能比我的运动员慢跑得更多，但规则手册中没有任何内容奖励投掷运动员慢跑。

“Fit for what?” is the correct follow-up question. The more a thrower throws, the smoother the technique and the farther the implement goes. The more a thrower throws, the fitter the thrower. Sure, your athlete might jog more than mine, but there’s nothing in the rulebook that rewards jogging for throwers.

为了健康，我让我的投掷者每天使用两次牙线，我坚持要求他们在自行车或摩托车上系好安全带和头盔，并鼓励大量使用鱼油。此外，我鼓励我的投掷者找到一个愿意保持身体活跃、优化休息和恢复并发现精神生活的生活伴侣。但是慢跑呢？疯狂的有氧运动？不，这是一个健康问题，或者对于投掷者来说，是缺乏健康的问题。

For health, I have my throwers floss their teeth twice day, I insist they wear seatbelts and helmets on bikes or motorcycles and encourage a generous use of fish oil. Moreover, I encourage my throwers to find a life partner willing to remain physically active, to optimize rest and recovery and discover a spiritual life. But jogging? Insane cardio workouts? Nope, that’s an issue of fitness or for throwers, a lack thereof.

以下是我给大家的健康或健身的10条规则。前八项与健康相关，后两项对于任何健身目标都普遍适用。



The following are the 10 rules I give everyone for health or fitness. The first eight are health-related, and the last two are universally true for any fitness goal.



1.不要吸烟。

1.   Don’t smoke.

2. 系好安全带，并在适当的时候使用头盔。

2.   Wear your seat belt, and use a helmet when appropriate, too.

3. 学会跌倒……然后恢复！

3.   Learn to fall…and recover!

4、多吃蛋白质。

4.   Eat more protein.

5.多吃纤维。

5.   Eat more fiber.

6、多喝水。

6.   Drink more water.

7.服用鱼油胶囊。

7.   Take fish oil capsules.

8. 用牙线清洁牙齿。这对您的心脏健康至关重要……查一下！

8.   Floss your teeth. This is key for your heart health…look it up!

9.保持关节健康。

9.   Keep your joints healthy.

10.锻炼肌肉。

10. Build some muscle.

明确健康和健身的作用是我教练生涯中最大的障碍。很多时候，我和这个领域的几乎所有其他人一样，试图为自己和我的运动员做这、那、这、那，却发现我们不仅离目标越来越远，而且还生病和受伤。 。当你不断地将健康和健身混为一谈时，你会发现两者经常会在路上相遇。你只能为了健身而牺牲健康这么长时间，反之亦然。关键是要知道你正在做出的妥协以及原因。

Achieving clarity on the role of health and fitness was the single biggest hurdle in my coaching career. All too often, I, like almost everyone else in the field, tried to do this and that and this and that for myself and my athletes and found that we got ourselves not only farther and farther from our goals, but sick and injured, too. When you keep mixing up health and fitness, you’ll find the two often run into each other down the road. You can only sacrifice health for fitness for so long and vice versa. The point is to know the compromises you are making and why.

连续 40 年，每年用右手扔东西 10,000 次，健康吗？不！但我对掷铁饼任务的适应使我余下的职业生涯成为可能，并让我的孩子们能够上大学，也让我能够在星期三与我的妻子蒂菲尼一起喝香槟。我并不是说你的目标应该是健康而不是健身，甚至相反。但看看你对问题一的回答，认真思考一下你的目标是什么样的。是健康还是健身？

Is it healthy to throw something with your right hand 10,000 times a year for 40 years? NO! But my fitness for the task of throwing the discus is what has made the rest of my career possible and allowed my children to go to college and for me to have Champagne Wednesday with my wife Tiffini. I am not saying your goal should be health over fitness, or even the other way around. But look at the answer you gave to question one, and give some serious thought to what kind of a goal you have. Is it health or fitness?

此外，罗布·沃尔夫指出，我们还应该关注长寿，因为如果他们颁发了一个奖项，那么为了赢得世界上最瘦女性奖这样的目标而牺牲可能是不值得的。当我的左臀部开始遭受一些相当严重的（令人目眩的、痛苦的、可怕的）疼痛之后，我知道我需要认真考虑长寿问题。我并没有很快意识到这一点，并用燕麦片制成的股骨参加了几场高地运动会，但过了一段时间，我开始重新思考我想要投掷多久与我想要保持健康多久有关。

In addition, Robb Wolf noted we should also keep an eye on longevity, because it’s probably not worth dying over a goal like winning the World’s Thinnest Woman Prize, if they give one. After I started to suffer some pretty serious (blinding, agonizing, terrifying) pain in my left hip, I knew I needed to give a lot of thought to longevity. I didn’t know that soon enough, and competed in a few Highland Games with a femur made of oatmeal, but after a while I started to rethink how long I wanted to be fit to throw versus how long I wanted to be healthy.

请记住，健康和长寿与失去腹部“这个”或在筹款活动中跑五英里不同。当人们混淆这两者时，真正的问题就出现了。

Keep in mind that health and longevity are different than losing “this” around your midsection or running five miles at a fundraiser. It’s when people mix up these two that the real issues appear.

第6章

Chapter 6

第三个问题：

Third Question:

这个目标会让你螺旋上升——扩大你的生活吗？

Will this goal allow you to spiral out—to enlarge your life?

我认为我第一次接触终身健身的艺术是在二年级（我一生中最美好的三年）。事实上，我还记得 20 世纪 60 年代初、几十年前的一次演讲，这足以感谢玛丽亚·阿桑普塔修女和她在黑板前几分钟的记忆。姐姐走到黑板上，用粉笔画了一个基本的罗盘形状。她用“工作”、“休息”、“玩耍”和“祈祷”代替了“北”、“南”、“东”和“西”。很简单，她告诉我们，你的生活应该始终与生活的这四个关键方面保持平衡。

I THINK MY FIRST GLIMPSE into the art of lifelong fitness happened in the second grade (the best three years of my life). The fact that I remember a talk from the early 1960s, decades and miles ago, is enough to thank the memory of Sister Maria Assumpta and her few minutes at the chalkboard. Sister walked up to the board and chalked a basic compass shape. Rather than North, South, East and West, she replaced the sections with Work, Rest, Play and Pray. Very simple, she told us, your lives should always live in a balance with these four key aspects of life.

如果你工作太多，你就会忽略重要的事情，尽管这句话是在多年后的不同经济时期说出的，但你还是会精疲力尽。

If you work too much, you ignore important things and, although the phrase was to be uttered years later in a different economic time, you burn out.

如果你休息太多，你就会变得懒惰，忽视真正的生活。

If you rest too much, you become slothful and ignore real living.

如果你玩得太多，你就会像伊索故事中的蚱蜢一样，冬天会很严酷。修女从来没有过多地祈祷，因为她确实有宗教使命。

If you play too much, you’ll be like the grasshopper from Aesop’s tale and winter will be harsh. Sister never went into praying too much as she did have a religious vocation.

祈祷可以很容易地独处时间或欣赏善或美。我知道有几位妈妈在研讨会结束后来找我，告诉我他们的孩子的生命是通过有人把他们带走让妈妈安静几个小时而得救的。晚上观看瀑布或飞机降落也会让人感到平静。

Pray can easily be alone time or an appreciation of goodness or beauty. I know of several moms who have come up to me after workshops to tell me their kids’ lives were saved by having someone take them away to give Mom a few hours of quiet. There’s something restful about just watching a waterfall or a plane land at night, too.

吸气，呼气，享受它。

Breathe in and breathe out and enjoy it.

就像自然的分形一样，那些从远处或近距离观察时似乎表现出自我重复结构的物体——比如雪花、山脉、河流、西兰花和血液系统——可以通过以下方式观察一个人从出生到死亡的一生。这个平衡指南针。

Like natural fractals, those objects that seem to display a self-repeating structure when looked at from a great distance or up close—think snowflakes, mountains, rivers, broccoli and the blood system—one’s life from birth to death can be looked at by this balance compass.

第一步，回顾一下你的生活，找到你看起来完整、生活充实的时刻。通常你会意识到你在平衡工作、休息、娱乐和祈祷。你一边忙着公事，一边还脱掉鞋子去玩沙子。你可能有名副其实的好朋友，并且有一些独处的时间来照顾你的个人和精神需求。

As a first step, look back over your life and find times where you seemed whole and your life was full. Usually you’ll realize you were holding work, rest, play and pray in balance. You took care of business, but also took your shoes off and played in the sand. You probably had good friends, worthy of the name, and some time alone to take care of your personal and spiritual needs.

从分形模型缩小范围——如果你不记得在哪里学过分形，想想侏罗纪公园——可以让你了解这四个罗盘点如何照亮一个成功的企业。一个人的一天、一个人的锻炼，甚至一个人早上喝的咖啡都可以用同样的方式来看待。

Narrowing this down from the fractals model—and if you don’t remember where you learned fractals, think about Jurassic Park—can give you some insights about how these four compass points can illuminate a successful venture. One’s day, one’s workout and perhaps even one’s morning coffee could be seen this same way.

让我们利用训练日。

Let’s use a training day.

过度锻炼会导致酸痛、受伤和疲劳。更糟糕的是，锻炼身体（字面意思）的锻炼往往只是短期的，但长期（生活！）却会让你精疲力竭。

Too much working out can lead to soreness, injuries and fatigue. What’s worse is that the workouts that work you out (literally) tend to only be short-term, yet burn one out for the long haul (life!).

锻炼中休息过多可能会造成相当大的影响。有人向我寻求各种帮助，然后在回应时，我发现这个人从未真正训练过。或者我看到一个人可能需要再次热身以应对过多的休息时间。老实说，很少有人在训练中存在缺乏休息的问题。他们经常休息、坐着、睡觉和看电视，因此他们的休息储备掌握得很好。

Too much rest in a workout can be fairly broad. I’ve had people ask for all kinds of help, and then in responding, I discover the person never actually trains. Or I see a person who may have to warm up again to deal with the excessive rest time. Few people honestly have a lack-of-rest issue in training. They tend to rest, sit, sleep and watch TV so much that their rest reserve is well in hand.

我们也不再看到太多的游戏了。我相信，如果我们只是下班后在野外见面并玩一些游戏，我们大多数人就永远不需要健身 DVD 或私人教练。标签游戏是一种尚未被充分认识的锻炼方式。现在，锻炼期间可能会进行过多的社交活动。很多健身迷，我和其他人一样糟糕，宁愿谈论伟大的锻炼，也不愿进行锻炼！

Too much play is something we don’t see much anymore either. I’m convinced most of us would never need workout DVDs or personal trainers if we just met in the field after work and played some games. The game of tag is an under-realized workout. Now it’s possible to have too much socializing during a workout. A lot of gym rats, and I am as bad as anyone, would rather talk about great workouts than to have one!

太多的独处时间是我在训练中必须取消的。我在车库里训练了很多年，但发现缺少了很多东西。经常邀请朋友过来或去健身房确实比单独训练更能帮助我更加努力。这是一件小事，但它的强度却产生了真正的差异。

Too much alone time is something I’ve had to undo in my training. I trained in my garage for years, but found a lot was missing. Inviting friends over or popping by a gym every so often really helps me push myself harder than training alone. It’s a small thing, but it makes a real difference in intensity.

所以，所有这些问题的答案就是坚持让你花一些时间和精力来思考如何平衡锻炼。

So, the answer to all of this is to insist that you take some time and energy to think about how to balance a workout.

我最近又吸取了这个教训。我去了一个研讨会，接触到了一些关于风车和弯举等传统动作的非常有见地的新技术理念。每个人似乎都愿意提供帮助，以至于有了一点建议和一点帮助，我就被关起来了。我的大脑超速运转。

I recently learned this lesson again. I went to a workshop and was exposed to some very insightful new technical ideas on traditional movements like the windmill and the bent press. Everyone seemed willing to help, so much so that with this bit of advice and that bit of help, I became locked up. My brain was on overdrive.

后来，当我回到家时，我的脑海里只有一个声音（笑话留到以后再说），我可以使用我得到的所有建议，但一次只能使用一条。我需要团队的友情和工作的强度来学习动作，但我需要一些安静的独处时间来掌握它们。这是一个值得考虑的点。我发现了关于我学习方式的一个小见解，许多人告诉我，他们也是如此：我需要社区和孤独来掌握一项运动或一个概念。

Later, when I went home and only had one voice in my head (hold the jokes for later), I could use all the advice I was given, but one piece at a time. I needed both the camaraderie of the group and the intensity of the work to learn the movements, but I needed some quiet time alone to master them. It’s a point worthy of consideration. I discovered this small insight about the way I learn, and many people have told me the same is true for them: I need both community and solitude to master a movement or a concept.

这或许就是学生作业的高明之处。诚实地尝试提出几何证明可以让稍后在课堂复习期间获得顿悟。这就是为什么许多人在淋浴或开车或骑自行车时会产生好主意。一旦内部噪音稍微减弱，答案或清晰度似乎就会上升。

This might be the brilliance of homework for students. An honest attempt at working out a geometry proof can allow the flash of insight later in the classroom during a review. This is why many people get good ideas in the shower or driving around in a car or bicycle. Once that interior noise abates a bit, the answer or the clarity seems to rise.

几年前，我决定有意识地在生活中收获这项技能。

I decided years ago to consciously harvest this skill in my life.

值得您花时间填写下表。

It is worth your time to make to fill in the following chart.

罗柏·沃尔夫提到我应该在生命平衡指南针上加上长寿。在生命中尽早地思考如何尽可能地生活、尽可能地生活是值得的。当考虑一些可能不安全、不健康或危险的事情时，至少花点时间把它抛到长寿方程上。当然，抚摸大白鲨可能是你心目中的史诗时刻，但考虑一下鲨鱼笼。

Robb Wolf mentioned that I should add longevity to the life balance compass. As early as you can in life, it’s worth thinking about living as well as you can, as long as you can. When considering something that may be unsafe, unhealthy or dangerous, at least take a second to toss it through the longevity equation. Sure, petting a Great White might be your idea of an epic moment, but consider a shark cage.

请注意，我在工作表中包含了绩效。无论出于何种原因，无论我多少次定义健身，大多数人仍然没有听到“完成任务的能力”。我在表中添加了表演，现在很多人似乎听到这就像完成马拉松或再次跳舞。

Note that I include performance in the worksheet. For whatever reason, no matter how many times I define fitness, most people still don’t hear “the ability to do a task.” I added performance to the table, and now many people seem to hear that as completing a marathon or going dancing again.

尽管任何时间单位都可以使用——一生、十年、年、月、周、日或小时——但第一次思考时，请在图表上进行全局思考。让我们用明年来进行第一次尝试。在每个区域中，添加一个简短的注释，说明明年您将如何充分利用您的思想、身体和精神来参与所有四点和所有三个支柱（罗布的术语），以平衡自己。



Although any unit of time will work—lifetime, decade, year, month, week, day or hour—think a bit globally on the chart the first time you ponder it. Let’s use the next year on your first attempt. In each area, add a short note about how you’ll use your full mind, body and spirit to engage all four points and all three pillars (Robb’s term) to balance yourself this next year.



例如-

For example—

工作



Work



健康

Health

我会在工作时准备好牙线、鱼油胶囊和水。我还会每周举重两次。

I will keep a supply of dental floss, fish oil capsules and water at work. I’ll also lift weights twice a week.

健身/表现

Fitness/Performance

我会完成 5K 终身步行。

I’ll finish the 5K Walk for Life.

长寿

Longevity

我每周至少有五天步行、骑自行车或游泳。由于商店只有一英里，我会步行购买所有单品。

I will walk or bike or swim at least five days a week. Since the store is only a mile, I’ll do all single-item shopping on foot.

休息

Rest

健康

Health

每天晚上九点我都会关掉电视，除非有我必须看的节目。不然的话，我每天晚上九点到十点的时间都会用来准备睡觉。

I will turn off the television at nine every evening unless there’s a show I must see. Otherwise, I’ll spend the time from nine to ten every night preparing for sleep.

健身/表现

Fitness/Performance

我会每半小时从办公桌前站起来，走动几分钟来放松和充电。

I will stand up from my desk every half an hour, and walk around for a few minutes to relax and recharge.

长寿

Longevity

无论是通过录音带、DVD还是课程，我都会学会让自己处于放松、冥想的状态，并且每周都会这样做几天。

Either through audiotapes, DVDs or lessons, I will learn to put myself into a relaxed, meditative state, and will do this several days a week.

玩

Play

健康

Health

我会在工作中学会多笑。我将根据出现的情况发布呆伯特、卡尔文和霍布斯连环漫画。我每天都会笑。我会把喜剧 CD 放在车里供上下班时使用。

I’ll learn to laugh more at work. I will post Dilbert and Calvin and Hobbes comic strips as appropriate to situations that arise. I’ll laugh every day. I’m going to put comedy CDs in the car for the commute.

健身/表现

Fitness/Performance

我会对每一次参加比赛的机会说“是”，无论比赛是什么。

I’m going to say ‘yes’ to every chance to play in a game, no matter what the game.

长寿

Longevity

我会每月至少在我的日程中添加一次聚会，以便与朋友一起闲逛和吃草。

I will add at least one gathering a month to my schedule to just hang and graze with friends.

祈祷

Pray

健康

Health

我每天都会花一些时间独处几分钟。

I’ll take some time each day to be alone for a few minutes.

健身/表现

Fitness/Performance

我要掌握[填写一项艰巨的任务：劈叉、手枪、另一次举重、瑜伽动作]。精通是一条道路，不是目标，但要走上这条道路。

I am going to master [fill in a difficult task: the splits, a pistol, another lift, a yoga move]. Mastery is a path, not a goal, but get on the path.

长寿

Longevity

去教堂的人寿命更长。我应该考虑一下我在这件事上的处境。

People who go to church live longer. I should consider where I am with this.

这里的关键是下一步——查看所有这些“我愿意”并查看其中的联系。

The key here is the next step—looking at all these ‘I wills’ and looking at the connections.

对于这个例子，这只是一个例子，工作场所的压力显然是一个因素，时间也是如此。像减少看电视和将通勤方式改变为许多人所说的“移动大学”这样的小事情可能会产生巨大的影响。每个人在一天、一周和一年中拥有的时间都是相同的，但我们每个人如何度过这些时间却是不同的。

For this example, and it’s just an example, the stress of the workplace is obviously a factor, as is time. Little things like less television and changing the commute into what many call ‘the mobile university’ might make a huge difference. Everybody has the same amount of time in a day, a week and a year, but how each of us spends it is a different thing.

一般来说，在你生活的某个方面做出一些小小的改变，让生活变得更好，就像在你的车和桌子上放一根牙线棒这样简单的事情（是的，我一直在重复），似乎会延续到其他领域。一旦你开始使用牙线，你看起来会更适应放入嘴里的其他东西，也许你会在办公室聚会上跳过生日蛋糕。不吃蛋糕通常会让你有勇气回家锻炼一下。锻炼可以让你精力充沛，让你不再窝在沙发上看电视。

Generally, making a small change for the better in one area of your life, something as simple as having floss sticks in your car and desk (yes, I keep repeating it), seems to carry over into the other areas. Once you start flossing, you seem more in tune with other things you put in your mouth and maybe you’ll skip that birthday cake at the office party. Skipping the cake often gives you the courage to get home and get a little workout. Working out invigorates you enough to not slump into the couch and click on the TV.

是的，就是这么简单，而且效果很好。当您拨通电话后，您可能会嘲笑我们的小图表的简单性。当你陷入困境时，你需要醒来并重新评估这种集中的尝试，以保持生活的平衡。

Yes, it’s that simple and yes, it works that well. When you have things dialed in, you’ll probably laugh at the simplicity of our little chart. It’s when you struggle that you need to wake up and reassess this focused attempt to have balance in your life.

第7章

Chapter 7

如果你旋转失去平衡怎么办？

What if You’re Spinning Out of Balance?

最近，在 Paul Hammer 博士的研讨会上，我看到了一种有趣的方式来传播健康和健身的概念。我喜欢连续体，而且，坦白地说……习惯就好。

RECENTLY AT A WORKSHOP by Dr. Paul Hammer, I saw an interesting way to spread the concept of health and fitness across a continuum. I love continuums and, well, in total candor…just get used to it.

如果您愿意的话，健康和健身连续体从最左边的绿灯开始。想象一下标准的交通信号灯来理解这里的要点。绿色表示前进，黄色表示谨慎，红色表示停止。当我们穿过这个连续体时，我们从绿色变为黄色，再变为红色。

The health and fitness continuum, if you will, starts on the far left with a green light. Imagine the standard traffic light to understand the point here. Green is go, yellow suggests caution and red means stop. As we move across this continuum, we move from green to yellow to red.

如果你处于连续体的绿色一侧，那么恭喜你，你已经拨通了一切。我的目标是在我生活的每个领域都处于绿色区域。



If you’re on the green side of the continuum, congratulations, you have things dialed in. My goal is to be in the green area for every area of my life.



   我和家人的关系很好。

   My relationships with my family are fine.

   我们的金融领域并不存在真正的疯狂。

   There is no real insanity in our financial areas.

   我有时间在社区提供帮助。

   I have time to help out in the community.

   我很享受生活，保持良好的体形，睡得很好。

   I’m enjoying life, keeping in decent shape and sleeping well.

对我来说，绿色生活就是要有一些储备。我的银行存款足够支付生活中的小悲剧，比如坏了的热水器，而且我有足够的时间帮助朋友搬沙发。我有足够的精力去训练，训练后也有足够的精力与家人一起享受一些娱乐。换句话说，穿着绿色衣服时，没有人会用手臂搂住你说：“嘿，我有点担心这个或那个。”

For me, life in the green side is all about having some reserves. I have enough in the bank to cover a minor tragedy of life, like a broken water heater, and I have enough time to help a buddy move a couch. I have enough energy to train and enough energy after I train to still enjoy some entertainment with my family. In other words, in green nobody puts an arm around you and says, “Hey, I’m a little worried about this or that.”

顺便说一句，如果你的生活中没有人警告你不要过度，那就表明你没有处于绿色状态。

And by the way, if there’s nobody in your life to warn you about excess, it’s a sign you aren’t in green.

黄色（当然要注意）并不像您想象的那么糟糕，但记住驾驶员教育课程中的注意事项很重要。现在还不是加速的时候！

Yellow—caution of course—is not as bad as you may think, but it’s important to remember caution from driver’s education class. This is not time to speed up!

在我一生中最富有成效的一些时期，我也感到自己失去了平衡。这些时候，我常常只看日历。如果看到缓解，我就不会太担心。

In some of the most productive times of my life, I’ve also felt myself spinning out of balance. At these times, I often just look at the calendar. If there’s relief in sight, I don’t worry too much.

不久前，我这周——

A while back, I had this week—

周五和周六：州田径运动会，我担任主教练，我女儿赢得了铅球州冠军

Friday and Saturday: State track meet, where I was the head coach and my daughter won the state championship in the shot put

周日：为我们跨越几个州的搬家收拾行李

Sunday: Packing a household for our move across several states

周一：全天工作并完成在线课程的期末考试

Monday: Full day of work and finishing finals for my online courses

星期二：全天工作并为我女儿攻读学士学位——我是一名老师，所以我必须早点到那里

Tuesday: Full day of work and Baccalaureate for my daughter—I’m a teacher so I had to be there early

星期三：田径晚宴——作为主教练，我必须组织和管理它

Wednesday: Track and Field Banquet—as head coach I had to organize and run it

周四和周五：打包

Thursday and Friday: Packing

周六：毕业典礼和毕业派对

Saturday: Graduation and graduation parties

周日：我女儿的毕业派对

Sunday: Graduation party for my daughter

周一：搬家工人来接我们——蒂芙和我开车去加利福尼亚，留下我们的女儿们

Monday: Movers show up to move us—Tiff and I drive to California, leaving our daughters behind

基本上，一周的时间我的工作、劳作、压力和情绪就足以填满好几年了。这是黄灯时间，但我知道在打开行李后我至少有两周安静的时间，然后才出现其他事情。知道压力会减轻就减轻了压力。我很幸运，因为我有朋友、家人、社区和一个可以支持这段紧张时期的时间表。

Basically, in one week I had enough work and labor and pressure and emotions to fill several years. This was a yellow light time, but I knew I had at least two quiet weeks after unpacking before anything else came up. Knowing the pressure would ease eased the pressure. I was lucky in that I had friends, family, community and a schedule that supported this stressful time.

我真的必须努力工作才能如此幸运。

I really had to work hard to be so lucky.

红灯意味着命运此刻对你有其他计划。这包括酒后驾车、被捕、严重受伤或其他创伤性问题。这不是友好援助的领域。这是寻求专业帮助的时候。

Red lights mean fate has other plans for you at the moment. That’s something like a DUI, an arrest, a serious injury or other traumatic issues. This is not the area of friendly assistance. This is a time for professional help.

就像一个老笑话说，当你在候诊室看到《60 分钟》的工作人员时，你就知道你将在办公室度过糟糕的一天，红灯舞台也是糟糕的一天。讨论这些问题远远超出了本书的范围，但如果您发现自己处于黄灯状态足够长的时间，请立即解决它！不要等红灯。

Like the old joke about knowing you’re going to have a bad day at the office when you see the 60 Minutes crew in the waiting room, a red light stage is a bad day. It’s far beyond the scope of this book to discuss these issues, but if you find yourself in the yellow light situation long enough, address it now! Don’t wait for the red light.

但不要关注这里的负面因素。我在 20 世纪 90 年代中期对生活平衡罗盘的深刻见解是，工作、休息、娱乐和祈祷这四大真理往往会螺旋式上升。如果我决定更加努力地工作，我发现现在增加我的比赛时间是很自然的。当我更加努力地工作时，我会更加努力地玩耍。我的假期更长，也许反映了更加努力工作带来的钱的增加。我发现当我在承担一项任务时有意识地增加我的其他指南针时，会产生巨大的协同作用。

But don’t focus on the negative here. The great insight I came across in the mid-1990s about the life balance compass is that these four great truths of work, rest, play and pray tend to spiral out. If I decide to work harder, I find it natural now to increase my play. I play harder when I work harder. My vacations, perhaps reflecting the increase in money from working harder, are bigger.
