I find there’s a tremendous synergy when I look at consciously increasing my other compass points when I take on a task.

帕金森定律中有一个精彩的章节是关于要求一个忙碌的人写一封信的。一分钟内就会完成。作者 C. Northcote Parkinson 将其与几乎无事可做的人进行了对比，而这个人则为使用哪种信封而苦恼。忙碌的人往往会完成更多的事情。如果你寻找在所有四个方向上扩展自己的方法，你将会完成更多的事情。你做得越多，你做的就越多。

There is a wonderful chapter in Parkinson’s Law about asking a busy man to write a letter. It will be done in a minute. The author, C. Northcote Parkinson, contrasts this with someone who has almost nothing to do, and this person sweats over what kind of envelope to use. Busy people tend to get more things done. If you look for ways to expand yourself in all four directions, you’ll get more things accomplished. The more you do, the more you do.

变得更加平衡也开始影响您实现目标的方式。我因在河边后院举办艰苦的训练而闻名。我们已经有超过两打人来参加，但一般人数约为 10 人左右。我们有各种各样的设备和装备，我们轮流拉、拉、冲刺、跑步、搬运各种零碎的东西。

Becoming more balanced also begins to affect how you go about attaining your goals. I became famous for hosting very hard workouts in my backyard along the river. We’ve had over two dozen people show up, but around 10 or so is the typical number. We have all kinds of equipment and gear and we take turns pulling and tugging and sprinting and running and carrying various odds and ends.

这是一项有趣、好玩的锻炼，我们一直让烤架保持运转。经过刻苦训练后，我们挂在甲板上吃草几个小时，笑着享受生活。当然，我会通过简单的锻炼来平衡这一点，在这些锻炼中，我独自训练，并尝试找到击败我的朋友的方法，并在他们回来时想出更狡猾的方法来让他们筋疲力尽。

It’s a fun, playful workout and we keep the grill going the whole time. After training hard, we hang on the deck and graze for hours, laughing and enjoying life. Of course, I balance this with easy workouts where I train alone and try to figure ways of besting my friends and thinking of even more devious ways to exhaust them when they come back.

为了清楚起见，让我添加这一点。这里有两个工具合二为一。首先，你需要看看螺旋。如果您要做更多的工作，您需要积极关注您的游戏、祈祷和休息区域。如果你不扩展这些，这也很好地以协同方式扩展了工作，那么你就是在计划失败。

Let me add this for clarity. There are two tools stuck into one here. First, you need to look at the spiral. If you’re going to do more work, you need to actively look at your play, pray and rest areas. If you don’t expand those, which wonderfully also expand work in a synergistic way, you’re planning failure.

红、黄、绿灯系统提供了一个基本工具来决定“也许不是现在！”

The red, yellow and green light system provides a basic tool to decide “maybe not now!”

对训练的影响是显而易见的。当你处于绿色状态时，你可以增加你的工作量。红色和黄色的情况并不意味着放弃你的训练、锻炼或补充方案。事实上，此时锻炼可能有助于解决您的其他问题。然而，现在还不是增加训练量、强度或负荷的时候。

The impact on training is obvious. You can increase your work when you’re in green. Red and yellow situations do not mean toss out your training, exercise or supplement regime. In fact, this is probably the time when a workout might be supportive of your other issues. It’s not, however, the time to ratchet up the volume, intensity or load.

我正在努力教导人们在这方面更加积极主动，这样他们就可以在一年中的某些时段关注生活的现实。例如，税务会计师可能会将三月和四月列为明显的黄灯月份。老师可以在五月、六月、八月和九月做同样的事情。当然，对于年幼孩子的父母来说，在 12 月的所有音乐会、选美、戏剧等活动中打上“X”并不是一个坏主意。

I’m working on teaching people to be more proactive about this so they can focus certain periods of the year on the reality of life. For example, a tax accountant would perhaps calendar out March and April as obvious yellow-light months. A teacher could do the same May and June and August and September. Certainly, it wouldn’t be a bad idea for parents of younger children to put an “X” through December with all the concerts, pageants, plays and stuff.

在这些时间里，你当然应该继续训练。但你需要更多地关注另一种训练，我称之为巴士长凳和公园长凳锻炼。我将详细介绍这意味着什么，但简单地说——

During these times, certainly you should still train. But you need to focus more on another kind of training I call bus bench and park bench workouts. I’ll go into great detail about what this means, but simply—

巴士长凳锻炼

当您期待准时结果时，就像您希望巴士准时到达一样

Bus Bench Workouts

When expecting results on time—like you’re hoping the bus will be

公园长椅锻炼

一个探索和享受训练地点的机会

Park Bench Workouts

An opportunity to explore and enjoy where you are in training

我意识到这与我们在大多数电视广告、互联网新闻和月刊中看到的内容背道而驰。但是，我没有厨师、搬运工、司机和全职摄影师。我只有我自己，这让我有点分散。我无法像那些花钱训练或花钱让自己看起来更好的人那样训练。

I realize this goes against the grain we see in most TV ads, internet chest pounding and monthly magazines. But, I don’t have a chef, handlers, driver and full-time photoshopper. I just have me and that spreads me out a bit. I can’t train like someone either paid to train or paid to look good.

哦，是的，这与大多数人的想法相反。有一种观点认为，持续、彻底的训练是实现目标的唯一途径。这不是真的，它正在摧毁许多人实现目标的旅程。

Oh, and yes, this is contrary to what most people think. There’s this idea that constant, exhaustive training is the only path to a goal. It’s not true and it’s destroying many people’s journey toward their goals.

第8章

Chapter 8

第四个问题：

Fourth Question:

您的目标在哪个象限？

Which quadrant is your goal in?

象限的概念首先出现在我的干预DVD 中，这是本书的介绍性姊妹篇，不久之后，出现在我与帕维尔合着的《Easy Strength》中。我为自己对健身和力量世界的贡献感到自豪。

THE CONCEPT OF QUADRANTS first appeared in my Intervention DVD, an introductory companion piece to this book, and shortly thereafter, in my book with Pavel, Easy Strength. I am proud of this contribution to the world of fitness and strength.

和大多数教练一样，自从我第一次吹响我的第一声哨子以来，我一直在与我的运动员一起应对不断扩大的力量训练世界。早在 20 世纪 70 年代，每个月都会推出新一波的杂志，其中包含新的工具、程序和动作，所有这些都保证会改变运动员的生活。我们可以测试一些，嘲笑一些，并且通常从所有纸浆中保留一两个想法。今天，通过互联网，我们几乎可以在一分钟内获得一个新想法。随着 DVD 节目和声称是海豹突击队发明的或 NFL 球员使用的家庭训练设备的激增，我们大多数人都被成堆的杂物淹没了。

Like most coaches, I have been juggling the ever-expanding world of strength training with my sports athletes since I first blew my first whistle. Back in the 1970s, every month brought a new wave of magazines with new tools, programs and movements all guaranteed to change the lives of athletes. We could test a few, laugh at couple and generally keep one or two ideas from all the pulp. Today, through the internet we can literally get a new idea a minute. With the explosion of DVD programs and home training equipment that were claimed to be invented by a Navy SEAL or used by NFL players, most of us are swamped with piles of clutter.

几年前，有人提出这样的问题：“力量教练的角色是什么？”嗯，就像英语老师的角色；答案就在形容词中。

A few years ago, the question came up, “What is the role of the strength coach?” Well, it is like the role of an English teacher; the answer is in the adjective.

教英语。

Teach English.

教练实力。

Coach strength.

然后帕维尔提出了后续问题：是的，但是 力量教练的影响是什么？

Then Pavel asked the follow-up question: Yes, but what is the impact of the strength coach?

这就开始了为期两年的试图回答这个问题的过程。我担心我能想到的最佳答案是“这要看情况”。

This began a two-year process of trying to answer this question. I was worried the best answer I’d come up with would be, “It depends.”

最后，我制定了一个简单的四部分象限网格。这些象限基于两个连续体——



Finally, I worked out a simple four-part quadrant grid. These quadrants are based on two continuums—



   运动员在一项运动中表现出色必须具备的素质

   The number of qualities an athlete must have to excel at a sport

   运动员需要在这些品质中达到多好，相对于任何运动员在该品质上可以达到的好程度

   How good the athlete needs to be at each of the those qualities relative to how good any athlete can be at that quality

根据这些线的相交位置，我们将力量教练的影响分为四个象限。能够将一个人分类到第三象限而不是第四象限，使我们能够辨别哪些内容需要添加到培训计划中，更重要的是，哪些内容需要忽略。

Based on where these lines intersect, we split the impact of the strength coach into four quadrants. Having the ability to categorize a person in Quadrant Three instead of Quadrant Four allows us to discern what to add to a training program and, more importantly, what to ignore.

第一象限

Quadrant One

这个象限中的人正在低水平学习很多品质，就像高中体育课一样。大多数人一生中只有一次机会进入这个象限。这就是为什么高质量体育项目的重要性怎么强调都不过分。在这里我们学习游戏、体育和运动的规则、技能和欣赏。

The person in this quadrant is learning a lot of qualities at a low level, like a high school physical education class. Most people only get one shot in life for this quadrant. This is why the importance of a quality PE program can’t be overemphasized. Here we learn the rules, the skills and the appreciation of games, sports and movement.

第二象限

Quadrant Two

该象限包含碰撞运动和职业。需要很多品质，而且这些品质的水平相当高……高得惊人。这是足球、橄榄球和特种部队的工作。可悲的是，大多数人计划在这个象限中进行训练，但实际上很少有人应该以这种方式进行训练。

This quadrant houses the collision sports and occupations. A lot of qualities are needed, and the level of these qualities is quite high…amazingly high. This is football, rugby and Special Forces work. Sadly, most people plan to train in this quadrant, yet few actually should train in this manner.

第三象限

Quadrant Three

这听起来很奇怪，但这里需要一些低水平的品质。大多数人都属于第三象限，但精英运动员也最常见于此。优秀的田径运动员需要技术和力量。力量水平令人惊叹，但与仅像奥运会精英举重运动员一样举重的人相比并不高。在这个象限中，一个人可能需要绝对力量来硬拉 600 磅。这是一个相当大的数字，但我们要记住，世界纪录正在接近这个数字的两倍。在第三象限，一切都是相对的。

This will sound odd, but here there’s a need for few qualities at a low level. Most people fit in quadrant three, but elite athletes are most often found here, too. An elite track athlete needs technique and strength. The strength levels are amazing, but not high when compared to someone who just lifts like an elite Olympic lifter. In this quadrant a person may need the absolute strength to deadlift 600 pounds. That’s a pretty big number, but let’s remember the world record is approaching twice that. In Quadrant Three, it’s all relative.

第四象限

Quadrant Four

在第四象限，我们发现了最稀有的运动员。这些人需要的品质很少，但却具有人类最高水平的表现。想想 100 米短跑运动员和奥林匹克举重运动员。除非您想举起 1,000 磅的硬拉或短跑 9.8 米的 100 米，否则您可能不适合这里。

Here in quadrant four, we find the rarest of athletes. These are people who need very few qualities, but at the highest levels of human performance. Think 100-meter sprinters and Olympic lifters. Unless you are thinking of deadlifting 1,000 pounds or sprinting a 9.8 100-meter, you might not be here.

象限中的生活和生活

Life and Living in the Quadrants

几乎普遍地，当我帮助人们完成干预计划时，我告诉他们他们处于第三象限。这不是懒惰，而是现实。当然，NFL 球员位于第二象限，但随着职业生涯的发展，训练会变得简单。

Almost universally, when I help people through the Intervention program, I tell them they’re in Quadrant Three. It’s not laziness, it’s reality. Sure, an NFL player was in Quadrant Two, but as a career moves on, training simplifies.

事实上，对于我参加这个干预计划的几乎每个人来说，我的“悲伤但真实”的一部分是：你不再是高中或大学了！

In fact, part of my “sad, but true” for nearly everyone I walk through this Intervention program is this: You are not in high school or college anymore!

而且，这可能是一件好事。是时候解决这两件大事了：肥大（去脂体重增加、脂肪减少和肌肉增加）和关节灵活性。

And, that’s probably a good thing. It’s time to work on the two big things: hypertrophy—lean body mass increases, less fat and more muscle—and joint mobility.

听我说：除非你用打破 100 米世界纪录或解雇 NFL 四分卫赚来的钱买这本书，否则你就处于第三象限。而且，这意味着力量训练的作用将与你的目标（例如，为了减肥而节食，为了整体健康而步行，或者为了铁饼运动员而进行投掷）呈阴阳关系。作为一名力量教练，我可以影响的品质与你需要发展的一两个其他品质是平衡的。你需要学会管理你的选择。

Listen to me: Unless you bought this book with money you earned from breaking the world record in the 100 meters or for sacking an NFL quarterback, you are in quadrant three. And, that means the role of strength training will be in a yin and yang relationship with the meat of your goal (diet, for example, for fat loss or walking for general health, or throwing for a discus thrower). The qualities I can impact as a strength coach are balanced with the one or two other qualities you need to develop. You need to learn to manage your options.

有时，当我读到一篇新文章或走进研讨会或诊所时，我会感到担心。我开始对这个新玩具或新想法感到兴奋。我的脑海里闪过这样的念头——

Sometimes I worry when I read a new article or pop into a workshop or clinic. I start to get excited about this new toy or idea. This goes through my mind—

“我可以。”

“Yes, I can.”

我有资源。我去上课了。我坐在诊所里。我读了这本书。我能做到。是的，只需一点点信息，我就可以为训练计划和运动系统添加一些新的、漂亮的东西。我的运动员问：“嗯，教练，我们一直在做的其他事情怎么样？我们还要做吗？”

I have the resources. I went to the class. I sat through the clinic. I read the book. I can do it. That’s right, with just a little information, I can add something new and pretty to a training program and sports system. My athletes ask, “Um, Coach, what about this other stuff we’ve been doing? Are we still going to do it?”

我不知道。我有一个闪亮的新玩具！

I don’t know. I have a shiny new toy!

确实，这就是问题所在。在第二象限，一切可能都有效。我在我的职业生涯中坚持“一切正常”，突然间我变成了“一个担心一切正常的人”。

And, really, this is the problem. In Quadrant Two, everything probably works. I have made my career insisting that “everything works” and suddenly I become “the guy who worries that everything works.”

现在，在你因为我缺乏承诺而抛弃我之前，让我为自己辩护。

Now, before you abandon me due to my lack of commitment, let me defend myself.

这就是第二象限活动（例如碰撞运动和碰撞职业）的问题：一切都只是“可能”有效。例如，足球比赛是一个非常复杂的系统，试图评估什么是正确的、什么是错误的，充其量只是猜测。第二象限的本质是，具有大量的品质以及这些品质的高水平，这些品质只是为了表现出来所必需的，这使得很难看出一个新的想法、计划、补充、计划或概念是否真正产生了影响。 。

This is the problem with Quadrant Two activities like the collision sports and collision occupations: Everything only “probably” works. A football game, for example, is such a complex system that trying to assess what goes right and what goes wrong is, at best, guesswork. The very nature of Quadrant Two, with the sheer volume of qualities and the high level of these qualities necessary just to show up, makes it tough to see whether or not a new idea, plan, supplement, program or concept is really making a difference.

问题是：你的竞争对手可能已经开始做你关注的新事物，所以你需要问一些棘手的问题。如果我的对手要添加这个或那个，我是否需要添加这个或那个？还是说我的情况不同，愿景不同，所以这个时候不需要补充什么？或者也许——情况经常如此——这个新想法很愚蠢，我可以节省大量时间和精力来忽略它。

Here is the rub: Your competition may have started doing this new thing you have your eye on, so you need to ask some tough questions. If my opponents are adding this and that, do I need to add this or that? Or do I have a different situation and a different vision, so I don’t need to add anything at this time? Or maybe—and this is often the case—this new idea is idiotic and I can save a lot of time and energy ignoring it.

当人们参观一级联赛或专业运动队训练设施时，首先令人惊讶的是他们看到了一切！机器、壶铃、健身球、绳索、登山机、划船机、越野滑雪机……我可以一直说下去。为了招收高中生，一位大学教练告诉我，他们投资了一台 25,000 美元的机器，但从未使用过；它看起来只是让你变得更好的东西。

The first thing that amazes people when they visit a Division One or professional sports team training facility is that they see, well, everything! Machines, kettlebells, med balls, ropes, climbers, rowing machines, cross-country ski machines…and I can go on and on. To recruit high school kids, one university coach told me they invested in a $25,000 machine they never use; it simply looked like something that would make you better.

为什么？为什么这些项目在大力士装备和奥林匹克杠上投入如此多的资金，但在第一周后就不再使用它们？

Why? Why do these programs invest so much into strongman gear and Olympic bars, then never use them after the first week?

答案通常是“其他人都在这样做”。为了跟上，我们需要添加这个、那个和这个。有效吗？好吧，谁知道呢，因为两个月后我们订购了商店里下一个最新、最亮的玩具！

The answer is usually “everybody else is doing it.” To keep up, we need to add this and that and this. Does it work? Well, who would ever know, because two months later we order the next newest, brightest toy in the store!

那么，第二象限需要一种特殊的思维方式——管理妥协。

Quadrant Two, then, demands a special kind of thinking—managing compromises.

管理妥协与管理选项

管理妥协

Managing Compromises Versus Managing Options

Managing Compromises

我们可以做任何事，但可能有效，也可能无效。或者我们可以削减任何东西，但它可能有效也可能无效。但是，听听这个：如果我们花了很多时间在这个伟大的新想法上，我们如何继续做我们现在的事情呢？如果这个想法确实是自切片面包以来最好的东西呢？欢迎妥协。

We can do anything, and it may or may not work. Or we can cut anything and it may or may not work. But, listen to this: If we spend a lot of time on this great new idea, how do we keep doing what got us here? And what if that idea really is the best thing since sliced bread? Welcome to compromises.

我们来谈谈吧。

Let’s talk.

当超级碗比赛开始时，总会有人告诉我，X 队需要做的就是“类似这样的事情”或“我们以前做过的这个动作”。当然，这很可笑，因为 NFL 球队有太多事情要做，我可以向 Old 97 保证，赢得 1926 年玫瑰碗比赛的那场比赛将会出现在比赛手册中的某个地方。主教练、助理教练和进攻协调员自高中打比赛以来所拥有或听说过的每一个想法都可能在该战术手册中。

It never fails that when the Super Bowl is on, someone will tell me that all Team X needs to do is “something like this” or “this play we used to do.” It’s laughable, of course, as the NFL teams run so many things that I can guarantee Old 97, the play that won the 1926 Rose Bowl is going to be in the playbook somewhere. Every idea the head coach, assistant coach, and offensive coordinator has had or heard of since they played the game in high school is probably in that playbook.

大多数球迷没有意识到的是，足球队无法很快从这个有趣的事情转向那个新想法。将剧本打印在书中很便宜。实际上，向一个对战术和系统记忆有限的团队教授这些战术的风险更大。一名体重 320 磅的进攻前锋，全年都被告知向前迈出三步，但现在却被告知向后退三步，可能最终会回到他开始的地方！

What most fans don’t realize is that football teams can’t go from this fun thing to that new idea very quickly. Printing plays in a book is cheap. Actually teaching those plays to a team with a finite memory for plays and systems is riskier. A 320-pound offensive lineman who all year was told to take three powerful steps forward, but now is told to go three steps back could end up in the place he started!

在处理碰撞运动和职业时，我们听到的对这种僵局的反驳是，“我们必须回到（填补空白）。”当你经历这个或那个新想法时，很快你就会感觉自己正在做所有这些事情，但你回头一看，发现你已经忘记了最初带来成功的基础知识。足球里有句话是“你和那个给你带来麻烦的女孩跳舞”。

A counter to this stalemate we hear when working with collision sports and occupations is, “we gotta get back to (fill in the blank).” What happens as you flow through this or that new idea is pretty soon you feel like you’re doing all these things, but you gaze back and see you’ve forgotten the basics that brought the success in the first place. The phrase in football is “you dance with the girl who brung ya.”

但你必须警惕管理妥协的另一个极端。当你决定（源自拉丁语词根dēcidere，意思是“切割或杀死”）强行改变方向时，你可能会把婴儿和洗澡水一起倒掉。

But then you have to be wary of the other extreme of managing compromises. It’s possible to throw the baby out with the bathwater when you decide (from the Latin root dēcidere, meaning “to cut or to kill”) to forcefully shift directions.

几年前，我所在的足球队进行了一项名为“跑动投篮”的伟大进攻。我爱它。团队争先恐后地试图阻止一切。我们发现，每次上半场快结束时，我们都能轻松达阵。我认为这有效的原因是我们的进攻让时间停止了很多。我们队习惯了比对手多上场20分钟左右。我有证据，因为当球队与我们比赛时，比赛次数明显更高。

Years ago, the football staff I was on ran a great offense called the Run and Shoot. I loved it. It had teams scrambling around trying to stop everything. We found that towards the end of each first half, we scored a fairly easy touchdown. The reason I thought this worked is that our offense stopped the clock a lot. Our team was used to being on the field about 20 minutes longer than the opposition was accustomed to. And I had evidence, because the number of plays were clearly higher when teams played us.

接下来的赛季，经过对教学和清晰度的长时间讨论，我们决定简化并只进行跑动和投篮。作为一名教练，这很棒：我只用了我们以前教的一半就可以更快、更流畅地完成整个进攻​​。

The following season, after long discussions about teaching and clarity, we decided to simplify and only do the Run and Shoot. As a coach, it was great: I had the whole offense in quicker and smoother with just one half of what we used to teach.

问题是，我们也开始失去……很多。当我们简化进攻时，我们削减了这种基于“打你嘴”的较旧、更简单的进攻，称为“I 阵型的爆炸和力量”。上赛季中场休息时，对方教练正在重新规划和设计他们的跑投防守，所以我们以I阵型出场，在混乱的防守下快速得分。当我们削减I阵型时，我们也放弃了很多胜利，因为这样更容易防守和挑战我们进攻的一面。更简单的进攻的妥协就是失败，这是一个可怕的妥协！

The catch was, we also started losing…a lot. When we simplified our offense, we cut this older, simpler offense based on “punch you in the mouth” plays called Blasts and Powers from the I Formation. During halftime in the previous season, the opposing coaches were remapping and redesigning their defenses for the Run and Shoot, so we came out in the I Formation and scored quickly against a confused defense. When we cut the I Formation, we also gave up a lot of winning because it was easier to defend and challenge the one face of our offense. The compromise for that simpler offense was losing, and that’s a terrible compromise!

欢迎接受管理妥协的挑战。你可能会变得太可爱，然后又回到了最基本的东西，以至于你简化了自己的工作。第二象限并不容易！但是，这就是 NFL 教练薪水如此高的原因。这还不是一天八小时的水平。

Welcome to the challenge of managing compromises. You can get too cute and get so back to the basics that you simplify yourself out of a job. Quadrant Two is not easy! But, this is why NFL coaches are paid so well. It’s not an eight-hour day at that level.

你是怎么做到的？您如何忠实于基础知识、给定条件、核心或使命，并在等待实施时仍然尝试竞争对手正在掌握的新事物？您如何管理妥协？

So, how do you do it? How do you hold faithful to the basics, the givens, the core or the mission, and still try new things your competition is mastering while you wait to implement it? How do you manage the compromises?

首先，作为一名力量教练，我们始终致力于建立我们所能达到的最高水平的绝对力量。一支由力量水平相对稳定的运动员组成的团队胜过举重房里有超级明星和无法将自己的袜子抬离地面的人混合在一起的项目。我们高中男生的 Big Blue 俱乐部和女生的 Big Silver 俱乐部就是基于这种见解。

First, as a strength coach this will always be about establishing the highest level of absolute strength we can. A team of athletes who are all at a relatively solid strength level trumps a program with super stars in the weightroom mixed with people who can’t lift their own socks off the ground. The Big Blue Club for our high school boys and Big Silver Club for the girls were based on this insight.

蓝色巨人俱乐部

Big Blue Club

力量翻举 205

硬拉 315

后深蹲 255

前蹲 205

站立推举 115

单臂卧推 32 公斤，右 5 次，左手 5 次

力量挺举 165

Power Clean 205

Deadlift 315

Back Squat 255

Front Squat 205

Standing Press 115

One-Arm Bench 32kg, 5 right, 5 left

Power Clean & Jerk 165

大银俱乐部

Big Silver Club

力量翻举 95

硬拉 205

后蹲 135

前蹲 95

站立推举 70

单臂凳 12 公斤，右侧 10 次，左侧 10 次

力量翻和挺举 75

Power Clean 95

Deadlift 205

Back Squat 135

Front Squat 95

Standing Press 70

One-Arm Bench 12kg, 10 right, 10 left

Power Clean & Jerk 75

其次，体能方面需要与整体计划的愿景保持一致。我经常告诉高中教练，休赛期的训练绝对取决于主教练的愿景。如果您的计划以高速和大量跑步为基础，那么您的休赛期训练就是田径练习。你的员工应该短跑和跨栏。如果你对足球的看法是基于粉碎嘴、顽固的接触、雪橇和徘徊者需要成为休赛期的重要组成部分。将团队理念和您的健身房愿景结合起来。

Second, the strength and conditioning side needs to align with the overall program’s vision. I often tell high school coaches that off-season training absolutely depends on the vision of the head coach. If your program is based on high speed and lots of running, your off-season training is track practice. Your people should be sprinting and hurdling. If your vision of football is based on smash mouth, hard-nosed contact, sleds and prowlers need to be a huge part of the off-season. Marry the ideas of the team philosophy and your weightroom vision.

第三，评估和评价你的系统。我知道我们都这样做，但这里必须有一个真正的愿景。如果没有对关键问题的真正认识，就无法赢得时间的胜利。约翰·伍登的书和其他一些人的作品值得你花时间和投资。

Third, evaluate and assess your system. I know we all do this, but there has to be a real vision here. One can’t win over time without a real vision of what is crucial. John Wooden’s books and the work of a few others would be worth your time and investment.

第四，由于第二象限的存在如此罕见，这些运动员需要受到全面卓越挑战的指导和支持。我是比尔·沃尔什所有作品的狂热读者，我发现胜利是卓越标准的副产品。你不可能在比赛队服保养不善、厕所设施肮脏的情况下还称自己是一流的组织。第二象限的成功将来自于我们所做的每一件事的卓越。

Fourth, because Quadrant Two exists at such a rare air, these athletes need to be guided and supported by an overall challenge of excellence. I am an avid reader of all of Bill Walsh’s work and I discovered that winning is a byproduct of standards of excellence. You can’t have lousy care of game uniforms and obscene toilet facilities and call yourself a first-class organization. Success in Quadrant Two is going to come from excellence at every single thing we do.

最后，也是最根本的，管理妥协的艺术要求有能力不断审视使命和目标，同时筛选实现使命和目标的各种新方法。当然，关键是记住生命的两个咒语。

Finally, and fundamentally, the art of managing compromises demands an ability to keep looking at the mission and goal while sifting through various new ways of achieving the mission and the goal. The key is, of course, remembering the two mantras of life.

使命就是坚守使命、使命不渝。

目标就是保持目标、目标。

The mission is to keep the mission, the mission.

The goal is to keep the goal, the goal.

第9章

Chapter 9

第三象限——我们大多数人居住的地方

Quadrant Three—Where Most of Us Live

管理选项

Managing Options

象限网格的问题是一个有趣的事实，几乎每个人都认为自己是精英，碰撞生活的象限二人组。我怎么知道这个？到目前为止，我回答的最常见的问题是“我处于第二象限吗？”

The problem with the quadrants grid is the interesting fact that nearly everyone thinks they are elite, collision-living quadrant twos. How do I know this? By far, the most common question I answer is, “Am I in Quadrant Two?”

这些问题来自那些想要学习奥林匹克举重但每两周才做一次的人，而其他 13 天则充满了有氧运动、健美和循环训练。相信我，将杠铃举过头顶 400 次与举起 95 磅重 50 次完全不同。我知道，如果你计算一下（!!!），你会发现 400 只相当于 400 磅的总工作量，而 95 只相当于 50 磅，嗯，更多，但不知何故，400 仍然感觉更重。

These are questions from people who want to learn the Olympic lifts, but only do them once every two weeks and the other 13 days are filled with cardio-busting workouts, bodybuilding and circuit training. Trust me, putting the bar overhead with 400 is nothing like doing 95 pounds for 50reps. I know, if you do the math (!!!), you will find that 400 for one is only 400 pounds of total work and 95 for 50 is like, well, a lot more, but, somehow, 400 still feels heavier.

我收到一些人发来的电子邮件，他们想要减掉一些脂肪，但又花时间跳到箱子上。我就是不明白。

I get email messages from people who want to lose some fat but spend time doing leaps onto boxes. I just don’t get that.

但随后，我也会收到一些人发来的消息，他们在Youtube上观看了我的 DVD 中的一分钟剪辑，并询问我是否可以将其余部分发送给他们。我总是想知道他们是否也希望我为他们做饭和打扫卫生，因为他们认为我是他们的母亲。

But then, I also get messages from people who watch a one-minute clip from my DVDs on Youtube and ask if I can just send the rest to them. I always wonder if they want me to cook and clean for them, too, because they think I am their mother.

然而，这是一个无法回避的事实——

Here, however, is the inescapable truth—

我们大多数人从第一象限移动

到第三象限并留在那里。

Most of us move from Quadrant One

to Quadrant Three and stay there.

当然，像我一样，您可能已经在第二象限踢了几年足球，但人生的大部分时间都是在第三象限度过的。

Sure, like me, you may have played a few years of football, Quadrant Two, but the bulk of life is spent here in Quadrant Three.

这是我的错，第三象限被认为是软弱的。我经常开玩笑说，在第三象限“我们做得不多，也做得不好。”

It’s my fault Quadrant Three is thought to be feeble. I often joke that in Quadrant Three “we don’t do much and we don’t do it very well.”

但我喜欢第三象限！我拥抱它。真的，我喜欢它。几年前，我人生中最清晰的时刻出现了，当时我有两份全职工作——高中老师和大学讲师——家里有两个小女孩，凯莉和林赛，还有一个总是在路上的妻子。当我发现我每天最多只能挤出一个小时的训练时，我的举重生涯爆发了。奇怪的是，这与我给我的运动员的建议是一样的，但我不可能听到我自己的合理建议。

But I love Quadrant Three! I embrace it. Really, I love it. The greatest moment of clarity in my life came a few years ago when I had two full-time jobs—high school teacher and college instructor—two little girls at home, Kelly and Lindsay, and a wife always on the road. When I discovered at best all I could squeeze in was an hour of training each day, my lifting career exploded. Oddly, it is the same advice I gave my athletes, but there is no way I can possibly hear my own sound advice.

当你只有一个小时的训练时间时，你就有机会剔除多余的部分并决定（记住，来自拉丁语词根“削减”）什么对你来说是重要的。这改变了我的生活，对我来说，这是一个照亮生活的时刻。当我完成这个练习时，我发现第三象限的生活并不是要进行妥协。我并没有在第二象限中试图决定我应该偏爱数百种运动品质中的哪一种以获得竞争优势。

When you only have an hour to train, you have an opportunity to scrape away the excess and decide (remember, from the Latin root “to cut”) what is important to you. This is life-changing, and in my case was a life-illuminating moment. When I went through this exercise, I discovered that life in Quadrant Three is not about managing compromises. I was not in Quadrant Two trying to decide which of the hundreds of athletic qualities I should favor in order to gain a competitive advantage.

我的生活并没有那么复杂。我只需要一些品质就能在我的运动中脱颖而出。我的生活很简单，我需要平衡。

My life was not that complex. I only needed a handful of qualities to excel in my sport. My life was simple and I needed balance.

第三象限是一个美妙的地方，平衡比任何其他象限都更重要。这就是混乱的地方。我用阴阳符号来解释绝对力量的作用和技术掌握之间的动态关系，但这个符号并不完美，因为它忽略了这种关系的动态本质。

Quadrant Three is a wonderful place where balance means more than in any other quadrant. And this is where the confusion comes in. I use the yin and yang symbol to explain the dynamic relationship between the role of absolute strength and technical mastery, but this symbol is not perfect because it misses the dynamic nature of this relationship.

有实力，有技术。但这不是 50/50，而且这种关系也不是静态的。就像婴儿一样，你无法将 DNA 与父亲或母亲分开。基因是如此不可或缺，以至于孩子确实是父母双方100/100%的血统。

There is strength and technique. But it’s not 50/50 and the relationship is not static. Like a baby, you can’t unlink the DNA from the father or the mother. The genes are so integral that the child is truly 100/100 percent of each parent.

对于第三象限的运动员来说，你必须明白这一点：技术工作是力量工作；实力是技术。这两种品质相辅相成、相辅相成。举重房中的精通会延续到赛场，这将知识带回举重房，然后带回赛场。你教的一个强壮的人来投掷铁饼，或者你让一个优秀的投掷者变得强壮，他永远不会像那些试图掌握这两个方面作为补充的投掷者那样投掷得那么远。

With Quadrant Three athletes, you must understand this: Technical work is strength work; strength is technical. The two qualities flow into and build on each other. Mastery in the weightroom carries over to the ring, which brings knowledge that carries back into the weightroom and then back out to the ring. A strong person you teach to throw the discus or a good thrower you make strong will never throw as far as the thrower who seeks to master both aspects as complements to the other.

这种动态平衡就是我喜欢第三象限的原因。

This dynamic balance is why I love Quadrant Three.

对于减脂客户来说，同样如此：饮食或食物计划必须与锻炼计划紧密结合。 （当然，我在这里主张力量。）同样，力量计划应该指导饮食。

For a fat loss client, the same holds true: The diet or food program must be linked tightly to the exercise program. (I argue strength here, of course.) In the same way, the strength program should inform the diet.

一名优秀的私人教练应该花尽可能多的时间审查食品日记，让客户了解到食品日记是成功的关键。如果没有食物日记和对未来一周现实的了解，培训只是一个半途而废的措施。食品杂志为培训提供信息；培训将影响食品杂志，掌握两者将带来终生轻松的体重管理。

A good personal trainer should spend as much time reviewing the food journal as it takes for the client to learn that the food journal is the essential key to success. Without the food journal and the peek into the reality of the week ahead, training is a half-way measure. The food journal informs the training; the training will impact the food journal, and mastery of the two will lead to a lifetime of easy weight management.

我玩这个游戏的时间越长，我就越意识到第三象限不是一个“非此即彼”的命题。哦，当然，我们知道有人从流行饮食转向流行饮食并得到了一些改善。但这些改进很少能持续下去。而且，我们都知道现代的陈词滥调，你无法超越百吉饼/甜甜圈/小蛋糕/任何东西。

The longer I spend in this game, the more I realize that Quadrant Three is not an “either…or” proposition. Oh, certainly, we know people who move from fad diet to fad diet and get some improvements. But the improvements rarely stick. And, we all know the modern cliché, you can’t outrun a bagel/doughnut/twinkie/whatever.

它必须是“两者……并且”。

It has to be “both…and.”

今天力量、体能和健身界的问题是，我们都爱上了 NFL 球员或终极战士在准备某件事时做这做那的视频。我理解这种吸引力。第二象限的运动员确实是精湛技艺和优雅的令人惊叹的奇观。有时连我也想成为那样的人。

The problem with the strength, conditioning and fitness community today is that we have all fallen in love with the videos of NFL guys or ultimate fighters doing this and that and this in prepping for something. And I understand the appeal. Quadrant Two athletes are truly amazing spectacles of mastery and grace. Sometimes even I want to be that guy.

对于我们大多数人来说，如果想要减掉腰带上的几磅脂肪，或者参加一项只有少数素质的运动，我们可能会陷入所有这些奇妙的事情中。这就是问题所在。正如我不断指出的：“一切正常......大约六周！”

For most of us who are trying to scrub a few pounds of fat that has frowned over the belt or compete in a sport with a just a few qualities, we can get caught up in all of this fantastic stuff. And that’s the problem. As I have noted endlessly: “Everything works…for about six weeks!”

然后呢？

Then what?

我最喜欢的一篇文章揭示了我们如何快速从简单到复杂——

One of my favorite articles sheds a light on how we can quickly go from simple to complex—

布莱恩·奥德菲尔德、阿尔·费尔巴哈、布鲁斯·威廉和萨姆·沃克喜欢快速举重，而乔治·伍兹和兰迪·马森则倾向于力量举重。 ......如果铅球冠军之间有任何真正的共识，那就是快速举重和力量举重的结合是有效的。” ~Dave Davis，《田径技术》， 1974 年 3 月和 6 月

“Brian Oldfield, Al Feuerbach, Bruce Wilhelm and Sam Walker favored the quick lifts, while George Woods and Randy Matson leaned toward the strength lifts. … If there was any real consensus among the champion shot-putters, it was that a mixture of quick and strength lifts is effective.” ~Dave Davis, Track Technique, March and June 1974

这些铅球运动员的成功秘诀相当简单，但今天你很少看到这个秘诀。这是任何运动员都会遇到的问题，稍后我会将其扩展到大多数人：一个人可以通过多种路线在投掷、冲刺或其他运动中达到最高水平的力量。

The formula for success with these shot-putters is fairly simple, but you rarely see this recipe today. Here is the issue for any athlete, and in a moment I will expand this out to most people: One can achieve the highest levels of strength for throwing or sprinting or whatever through several routes.

这些包括-

These include—

奥林匹克举重 举重

大力士

训练

高地运动会

力量健美

Olympic lifting

Powerlifting

Strongman Training

Highland Games

Power Bodybuilding

坦率地说，它们都有效。我确信以某种方式混合这些计划会比只做一个更好，但这将是一项艰难的实验，并且可能会涉及像我正在研究的那样的时间机器。

Frankly, they all work. I’m sure blending these plans somehow would work better than just doing one, but that would be a tough experiment and probably would involve a time machine like the one I’m working on.

我们都同意，铅球运动员需要的品质是绝对的力量。现在你看，戴维斯提到的这些力量训练学校只是一些选择。如果有理解第三象限的关键，那就是这两个词：一切正常。

We can all agree that the quality the shot-putter needs is absolute strength. And now you see, these schools of strength training Davis was referring to are simply options. If there’s a key to understanding Quadrant Three, it is these two words: Everything works.

第10章

Chapter 10

一切正常

Everything Works

一切正常。投掷运动员体能教练的目标只是让投掷运动员变得更强。正如我在无数场合说过的那样，没有什么比力量更容易提高的品质了：你只需举重即可。

IT ALL WORKS. The goal of a thrower’s strength and conditioning coach is to simply get the thrower stronger. As I have offered on countless occasions, there is no simpler quality to improve than strength: You just lift weights.

技术、战术和灵活性问题，如果需要表现，可能需要几年的时间才能发展，但我可以让你在你的运动中变得更强，并可能在三到六周内影响表现。这就是体育界的闪电，这就是为什么每项运动都将举重作为基础训练的重要组成部分。当然，你可以找到十年前没有的人，但今天这种情况已经很少见了。

Technical, tactical and flexibility issues, if needed for performance, may take a few years to develop, but I can make you stronger for your sport and probably impact performance in three to six weeks. That is lightning in the sports world, and this is why every single sport has lifting weights as an essential part of basic training. Sure, you can find someone who didn’t a decade ago, but that is rare air today.

这都是关于管理选项的。一切正常。记住这一点，拥抱这一点，珍惜这一点，并将“一切正常”写在健身房、举重室或道场的墙上。还要记住，它只能有效大约六周。

It’s all about managing options. Everything works. Remember that, embrace that, cherish that and keep “Everything Works” written on the wall of your gym, weightroom or dojo. Just remember, too, that it only works for about six weeks.

阅读汤米·科诺（Tommy Kono）的杰出书籍，我一次又一次地想起他如何拥抱健美和奥林匹克举重。汤米决定进行为期八周的举重训练，然后回到健身房锻炼身体并恢复活力。我认为，如果它适用于历史上最伟大的举重运动员和宇宙先生（汤米赢得了奥运会金牌和宇宙先生），那么它可能值得考虑。汤米·科诺过去是、现在仍然是期权管理大师。

Reading Tommy Kono’s outstanding books, I was reminded time and again about how he embraces both bodybuilding and Olympic lifting. Tommy settled on an eight-week build up to a lifting meet, then back in the gym to bodybuild and refresh himself. I think if it works for the greatest lifter in history and Mr. Universe—Tommy won Olympic gold medals as well as Mr. Universe—it might be worth considering. Tommy Kono was and is the master of managing options.

减脂也是第三象限的目标。同样，这归结为管理选项。什么饮食有效？他们都工作！这是关于坚持一个。我在“肉、叶和浆果”、阿特金斯饮食法、速度饮食法、慢碳水化合物饮食法和伊兹饮食法（三种蛋白质奶昔和一日一餐计划）方面做得很好。我做过的最好的饮食是 F 计划饮食，每天摄入大量纤维。哦，我浮肿了，关节酸痛了，但我还是冲刺去厕所做了很多运动。

Fat loss, too, is a Quadrant Three goal. Again, it comes down to managing options. What diet works? They all work! It’s about sticking to one. I have done well on Meat, Leaves and Berries, Atkins, the Velocity Diet, the Slow Carb Diet and the Eades’ diet of three protein shakes and one-meal-a-day plan. The best diet I ever did was the F-Plan Diet when I consumed massive amounts of fiber each day. Oh, I got bloated and my joints ached, but I got plenty of exercise sprinting to the toilet.

人们、饮食和饮食方式都与选择有关。实际的饮食方法并不重要。真的，谁在乎你要吃什么？你吃的东西让你发胖！

Folks, diets and ways of eating are all about options. The actual dietary approach doesn’t matter. Really, who cares what you are going to eat; what got you fat is what you ate!

在饮食纪律中，坚持胜过教条。我们也知道，从强度方面来看也是如此：持续执行的糟糕计划胜过缺乏活力的完美计划（如果有的话）。顺便说一句，我确信这是每个​​程序能运行大约六周的秘密的一部分：一个人早期的奉献会让最疯狂的想法发挥作用。

Adherence trumps dogma in dietary disciplines. We also know this is true on the strength side: A bad program consistently administered trumps a perfect program (if one ever existed) done with lack of vigor. I’m convinced, by the way, that this is part of the secret that every program works for about six weeks: One’s early dedication makes the craziest of ideas work.

就像我告诉那些不听我理智建议的人一样：好吧。明年我也会来这里，我们可以在你的手术后跟进此事。

Like I tell people who don’t listen to my sane advice: Fine. I will be here next year, too, and we can follow up on this after your surgeries.

从减肥硬币的另一面来看，真的，一切都有效，而且一直如此。无论您写下什么，无论是非洲迪斯科舞、步操氨纶还是壶铃摇摆，它都会起作用。问题有点奇怪：当你变得越来越高效时，你获得的好处却越来越少。现代舞课几乎要了我的命，因为每次课上进行步球变换时，我都会多做 20 个动作。哦，这对我来说会减掉脂肪，但是我右边的小宝贝 Twinkle Toes 最好有一个完美的饮食，因为她刚刚经历了阶段。

On the other side of the fat loss coin, really, again—everything works and it always has. Whatever you write down, whether it is African Disco Dance or Step Marching Spandex or Kettlebell Swings, it will work. The problem is a little odd: As you become more and more efficient, you get less and less benefit. A modern dance class will just about kill me as every time the class does Step-Ball-Change, I will have done 20 extra moves. Oh, it will be fat loss for me, but our little darling Twinkle Toes to my right had better have a perfect diet, because she is just going through the paces.

减脂运动需要尽可能低效。这就是我喜欢秋千的原因：你会消耗大量的能量却一事无成！但是，许多人不同意我的观点，当你在挥杆方面做得越来越好时，这些也会变得太高效。如果您每次锻炼从 75 次挥杆到 2,000 次，但脂肪不再减少，您可能需要寻找替代方案、补充方案或其他措施。

Exercise for fat loss needs to be as inefficient as possible. That is why I like the swing: You expend tons of energy and go nowhere! But, and many disagree with me here, as you get better and better at swings, these too can become too efficient. If you go from 75 to 2,000 swings a workout and stop losing fat, you may need to look for alternatives, additions or another bell.

减肥就是管理选择。选择一种饮食并遵循它。找到一个健身计划并遵循它。记笔记，写食物日记，并对前后照片、测量结果和皮褶测试进行尽职调查。是的，周刊封面上的饮食比你正在做的要好，你在电视上看到的新 DVD 也是如此。这可能不是真的，但这不是我们的想法吗？

Fat loss is about managing options. Pick a diet and follow it. Find a fitness program and follow it. Take notes, keep a food journal and do your due diligence on your before-and-after photos, your measurements and your skin-fold tests. Yes, the diet on the cover of the weekly magazine is better than what you’re doing, and so too is the new DVD you saw on TV. It might not be true, but isn’t this how we think?

我所要求的只是你坚持你的计划足够长的时间来诚实地评估它。这可能需要几周的时间，但从长远来看，你在掌握食物和锻炼的基础知识上所付出的努力将会带来回报。

All I am asking is that you stick with your plan long enough to evaluate it honestly. That might take a few weeks, but the effort you expend on mastering the basics of food and exercise will pay dividends in the long run.

如果您是第三象限运动员，是的，是的，是的，您有选择。在技​​术方面，你可以用多种方法进行跳跃和投掷。我刚刚读了英国跳远运动员克里斯·汤姆林森（Chris Tomlinson）的一篇引人入胜的文章，他说他使用“悬挂”法，这是最基本、最原始的跳远方法，因为它简单且能承受竞争压力。他可以专注于攻击棋盘，而不是他的飞行（根据物理学，他有这个权利）：“我更喜欢使用一种在跳跃中尽可能少出错的风格。”

If you are a Quadrant Three athlete, yes, a resounding yes, you have options. On the technical side, you can jump and throw with a variety of methods. I just read a fascinating piece by a British long jumper, Chris Tomlinson, who said he uses the “hang” method, the most basic and primitive method of long jumping, because it’s simple and holds up under the stress of competition. He can focus on attacking the board, not his flight (and, according to physics, he has this right): “I prefer to use a style where as little can go wrong as possible in the jump.”

也许你会选择这个方法而不是那个方法，这对我来说没问题。现在，掌握它。变得坚强一点，提高你的技术，你应该会做得更好。但坚持你选择的选项足够长的时间来掌握它们！

Maybe you pick this method over that, and that’s fine with me. Now, master it. Get a little strong, improve your technique and you should do better. But stick with the options you choose for long enough to master them!

第三象限最难的部分是不要陷入这个美妙的饮食和训练计划自助餐的所有选择中。鼓起勇气选择一个，看看它会带你去哪里。完成你开始的事情。正如古人教导我们的那样——



The hardest part of Quadrant Three is not getting caught up in all the options of this wonderful buffet of diets and training programs. Have the courage to pick one and see where it takes you. Finish what you start. As the ancients taught us—



   计划狩猎。

   Plan the Hunt.

   狩猎狩猎。

   Hunt the Hunt.

   讨论狩猎。 （详情请参阅 J. Stanton 的《豺狼人信条》）

   Discuss the Hunt. (See J. Stanton’s The Gnolls Credo for details)

保持这个顺序。当你节食或训练时，你就在狩猎。你需要把所有的思考和谈话留到下次再谈。但是，由于自助餐上有各种各样的选择，而且各种不同的人和刺激因素都在争夺你的注意力，难怪我们中的许多人无法管理选择，也无法保持目标。

Keep it in that order. When you diet or train, you are in the hunt. You need to save all the thinking and talking for another time. But with all the options available at the buffet and all the different people and stimuli vying for your focus, it’s no wonder so many of us fail at managing options and fail at keeping the goal the goal.

在我的整个职业生涯中，我依赖于每位教练和培训师以及家长和老师都可以针对每种情况和环境使用的三种工具。

Throughout my career, I have fallen back on three tools every coach and trainer—and parent and teacher—could use for every situation and setting.

他们是-

They are—

清单

仪式

刻意练习

Checklists

Rituals

Deliberate practice

清单

Checklists

如果我可以告诉你一个成功的秘诀，那就是制作清单。我不确定我是如何第一次遇到它们的，但我知道我是在 20 世纪 90 年代中期开发它们的。保罗·诺斯威 (Paul Northway) 是法官纪念天主教高中伟大的铁饼运动员，他有一份叠好的比赛清单。我记得，他写道——



If I could tell you one secret to success, it would be making checklists. I’m not sure how I first came across them, but I know I was developing them in the mid-1990s. Paul Northway, the great Judge Memorial Catholic High School discus thrower, had a laminated checklist for meets. As I recall, he wrote—



   铁饼

   Discus

   鞋

   Shoes

   毛巾

   Towel

   夹克

   Jacket

   水

   Water

   防晒霜

   Sunscreen

   零食

   Snack Food

   钱

   Money

   太阳镜

   Sunglasses

随着时间的推移，我们添加了更多物品，包括卷尺，因为犹他州的许多高中田径运动会都很糟糕，并不总是有卷尺用于铁饼。

Over time, we added more items, including a measuring tape as many high school track meets in Utah are so bad there wasn’t always a tape for the discus.

最终，这份清单几乎囊括了所有我们可能忘记的事情。关键是：当我们越来越频繁地做同样的事情时，我们就会忽视基础知识。

Eventually, the list included practically everything we could forget. Here is the key: When we do the same thing more and more often, we’re going to slip on the basics.

当我举办研讨会时，我会向主持人发送一份清单，其中包括一些小事情。名牌几乎是最容易被忽视的物品，因为我们担心航班、膳食和酒店，这些可以在未来几个月处理的事情，而错过了那一小包名牌，它可以简化我整个研讨会的生活。

When I run a workshop, I send the host a checklist that includes the little things. Nametags are almost universally the most overlooked item, because we worry about flights, meals and hotels, things that can be taken care of months ahead, and miss the tiny packet of nametags that will simplify my life for the entire workshop.

检查清单可以让你的大脑不再专注于一堆事情，而是让你思考什么是重要的，就像 Lou Holtz 著名的 WIN 公式：现在重要的是什么。当您记住清单时，清单上的任何内容都不会那么重要，但是忘记任何一项都可能使我们陷入困境。现在重要的可能是“我的短裤在哪里？”与“让我们参加这场比赛”相比。

Checklists keep your brain from focusing on a bunch of stuff and make you think about what’s important, like Lou Holtz’ famous WIN formula: What’s Important Now. Nothing on the checklist will be that important when you remember it, but forgetting any one item might put us in a difficult position. What’s Important Now could be “where are my shorts?” versus “let’s run this race.”

制作清单的行为本身就要求您——



The very act of making a checklist demands that you—



   告诉我你需要的一切。

   Tell me everything you need.

   告诉我什么是真正重要的。

   Tell me what’s really important.

你从事任何游戏或工作的时间越长，这些清单项目就会越多。第一次做煎饼时，您会阅读食谱。第20次，你没有读食谱，但忘记了鸡蛋（或其他什么）。第 100 次，你轻松地浏览了食谱，将各个步骤集中在一起，但你仍然检查了食谱！

The longer you are in any game or job, the more and more you will clump these checklist items. The first time you make pancakes, you read the recipe. The 20th time, you don’t read the recipe, but forget the egg (or whatever). The 100th time, you breeze over the recipe clumping together the various steps, but you still check the recipe!

这一切都归结为我所说的蚀刻。蚀刻是在玻璃上绘画的术语，我喜欢用于训练……和生活的图像。蚀刻就是一遍又一遍地做一些事情，使所有多余的绒毛变得不重要。当最好的运动员看似毫不费力地移动时，您可以看到正确的蚀刻。

It all comes down to something I call etching. Etching is the term used for drawing on glass and I love the image for training…and life, too. Etching is doing something over and over, making all the excess fluff unimportant. You can see proper etching when the best athletes move seemingly without effort.

检查表可以让你蚀刻。你是在说“这很重要”。

Checklists allow you to etch. You are saying “This is important.”

这就是为什么我经常谈论家庭菜单和社区中每个人的家务清单。我和我的妻子蒂菲尼几年前就采用了这些技术。我制作了一些小卡片，并将它们放在墙上和工作时的小隔间里。例如-

That’s why I often talk about menus for a family and chore lists for everyone in the community. My wife Tiffini and I adopted these techniques years ago. I made little cards and put them on the wall and in my cubby at work. For example—

周一

晚餐：牛排、沙拉

家务：白色洗衣和步行（每个人在共用起居区周围走动并收起书籍、鞋子、夹克和垃圾）

Monday

Dinner: steak, salad

Chore: white laundry and walk-through (everyone walks around the shared living areas and puts away books, shoes, jackets and junk)

周二

晚餐：维京辣酱玉米饼馅

家务：深色洗衣和步行

Tuesday

Dinner: Viking enchiladas

Chore: dark laundry and walk-through

周三

晚餐：什锦

饭 杂务：清洁浴室和步行

Wednesday

Dinner: jambalaya

Chore: clean bathrooms and walk-through

我过去曾讨论过这个问题，但人们错过了真正的关键。我们的房子里到处都有洗衣篮，我每周有六天可以在白色洗衣箱旁走过，而且从来没有想过，“负载越来越高了”。直到周一我才打开告诉我洗涤、烘干、折叠和收起白色衣服的装置。

I have discussed this in the past, but people miss the real key. We had laundry baskets throughout the house and I could walk by the white laundry bin six days a week and never, not once, think, “the load is getting high.” Only on Monday did I switch on the gear that told me to wash, dry, fold and put away the white laundry.

该系统简化了购物过程。老实说，我们知道我们需要购买什么，并准备了一张纸供任何人填写详细信息。通过清理我们不需要担心的所有家务和不需要购买的所有食物，我们已经管理了我们的选择。

Shopping is simplified on this system. Honestly, we knew what we needed to buy, and kept a piece of paper handy for anyone to fill in the details. By decluttering our minds of all the chores we didn’t need to worry about and all the food we didn’t need to buy, we had managed our options.

反映菜单的购物清单可以让您将宝贵的时间和精力花在选择牛排上，而不是站在过道上思考“那是什么？我忘记了什么？”该清单释放了心理空间。

A shopping list that reflects a menu allows you to spend your precious time and mental energy on making steak selections rather than standing in the aisle thinking “What was that? What am I forgetting?” The list frees up mental space.

几年前，林赛说她厌倦了周一吃牛排。对我来说，如果你还记得的话，所有这些都是管理选择，而不是管理妥协。所以，我说：“好吧，你想要什么？”她说：“不是牛排。”

Years ago, Lindsay said she was sick of eating steak on Mondays. For me, if you recall, all of this is managing options, not managing compromises. So, I said “Fine, what would you like instead?” She said, “Not steak.”

你看，我被引导去妥协。我告诉她任何她想出的办法都可以，只要让我确切地知道它是什么就可以了。此后的几年里，我们每周一都吃牛排。我们决定吃什么并不重要，只要确保我们购买了它，准备好了所需的物品，并按时上菜即可。

You see, I was being channeled into a compromise. I told her anything she came up with would be fine, just let me know exactly what it is. We ate steak on Mondays for a few more years after that. It still doesn’t matter what we decide to eat for any meal, let’s just make sure we shopped for it, have the items for it, and serve it on time.

蚀刻是管理选项的主要技术工具。当教练和运动员都可以查看清单以确保所有内容都被涵盖时，这种感觉就会得到加强。听着，归根结底是这样的：卓越就是每年完成 10,000 次重复或 10,000 个小时的练习（阅读几年前一起出版的三本书，它们都说了同样的事情）。我认为简单性会让你比复杂性快一万倍。我可能是错的，但我想我已经用我的运动员证明了这一点。

Etching is the primary technical tool for managing options. It’s reinforced when the coach and athlete can both look at a checklist to insure that everything is being covered. Listen, it comes down to this: Excellence is the race to 10,000 reps a year or 10,000 hours of practice (read the three books that all came out together a few years ago that all said the same thing). I argue that simplicity will get you to that magic 10,000 faster than complexity. I could be wrong, but I think I have proved it with my athletes.

一旦你选择了一种方法，你就可以使用清单——菜单、购物清单、行动手册、食谱、指导要点——来实施这个想法。我们希望生活中重要的事情可以重复。我希望我的投掷者取得成功，并将他们的见解传递给下一代投掷者。我希望我的家人每天晚上能吃到大约六点的食物，这样我们就可以一起享受几个安静的时光。

Once you pick an approach, you can then use the checklist—menu, shopping list, playbook, recipe, coaching points—to implement the idea. We want important things in life to be repeatable. I want my throwers to succeed and pass down their insights to the next generation of throwers. I want my family fed by about six every night so we can enjoy a few quiet hours together.

清单向我们展示了蚀刻之路！

The checklist shows us the path to etching!

仪式

Rituals

仪式是“活的”清单。我是他们的忠实信徒。作为一名老师，我每堂课都以简短的祈祷开始——

Rituals are checklists “alive.” I am a huge believer in them. As a teacher, I began each class with a short prayer—

主啊，大海那么大，我们的船那么小。

Lord, the sea is so large and our boats are so small.

阿门！

Amen!

然后我会拍拍手，然后我们就走。学生们对我进行了惊人的模仿，他们总是基于我用来开始上课的这个小仪式。

Then I would clap my hands and we would go. Students have done amazing imitations of me and they are always based on this little ritual I used to kick off class.

从某种意义上说，仪式就是行动中的清单，所以我的一些清单想法和仪式想法是相互关联的。想象一下一场婚礼，以及必须考虑的数十个（如果不是数百个）细节。明智的牧师会在祈祷本上放一张便利贴，提醒他们新娘和新郎的名字，因为在压力下，忘记一生所认识的人的名字并不罕见。所以，在仪式中……检查清单。

The ritual is, in a sense, the checklist in action, so some of my checklist thoughts and ritual thoughts interconnect. Think about a wedding and the dozens, if not hundreds, of details that must be taken into consideration. Wise ministers will put a little PostIt note in the prayer book reminding them of the names of the bride and groom, as under pressure it’s not unusual to forget the names of people you’ve known all their lives. So, in the middle of a ritual…checklists.

仪式也会通知您该出发了。一位教练曾经问我什么时候开始准备田径运动会的。我从投掷开始向后思考，意识到那是我在任何比赛前几天服用无糖橙味 Metamucil 的时候。对我来说，品尝那浓郁的橙色粉末开始了我为比赛做准备的过程。就像你开始吃饭时祈祷，不仅是为了感谢上帝，也是为了让每个人都知道该吃饭了！

Rituals also inform you it’s time to get going. A coach once asked me when I started preparing for a track meet. I thought backwards from the throw and realized that it was when I took Sugar-Free Orange-Flavored Metamucil in the few days leading up to any competition. For me, tasting that tangy orange powder begins the process of preparing me for competition. Much like you start a meal with prayer not only to thank God, but also to let everyone know it is time to eat!

我有很多小仪式——比如在扔东西之前微笑——我想我可能会被这些小仪式淹没。除了他们工作！为什么不把一切都写在仪式中呢？因为信息量太大，您可能会迷失在细节中，从而失去使命或目标。我在投球前微笑，但这不在我的清单上。有时，仪式就是我们在做的时候所做的事情。

I have so many small rituals—like smiling before I throw—that I think I might overwhelm myself with all of them. Except they work! Why not write everything in a ritual? Because it can be so much information that you get lost in the details and lose the mission or the goal. I smile before I throw, but that’s not on my checklist. Sometimes, a ritual is just that—something we do when we do it.

几年前，我凭借一首关于在母亲的坟墓上撒一把泥土的诗赢得了一场诗歌比赛。我在那里站了一会儿，然后伸手扔了一把泥土。丹尼尔·德里神父和我的表弟比尔·斯皮兰都告诉我，“我们不知道你有多爱尔兰人。”我不知道我为什么这么做，这完全是自发的，直到今天我所能想到的只是我看到其他人做的事情。当仪式做得最好时，这就是仪式存在的地方：它们深深地扎在你的内心深处，当你需要平静和控制时，它们就会从那个地方涌出来。

I won a poetry contest years ago with a poem about tossing a handful of dirt on my mother’s grave. I just stood there for a moment, then reached over and tossed a handful of dirt. Father Daniel Derry and my cousin, Bill Spillane, both told me, “We didn’t know how Irish you were.” I had no idea why I did it, it was totally spontaneous and all I can think, still to this day, is it was something I saw others do. That’s where rituals live when done best: They sit deep inside you and well up from that place when you need calming and control.

确实，最好的仪式都根深蒂固，你常常不知道它们是如何形成的。

Really, the best rituals are etched so deep, you often don’t know how they got there.

刻意练习

Deliberate Practice

对于根深蒂固的蚀刻和仪式，我相信最好的描述是刻意练习。我不太喜欢这个词，但我还没有想到更好的词。我第一次从苏联人那里听到这个想法。他们对足球运动员进行了实验，发现有些人是混战英雄。这个小组掌握了所有技能测试，但在游戏中经常失败。另一组在测试中没有达到标准，但在比赛中占据了主导地位。

To ingrain etching and ritual, I believe in something best described as deliberate practice. I don’t like the term so much, but I haven’t thought of a better one yet. I first heard this idea from the Soviets. They did experiments with soccer players and discovered some guys were scrimmage heroes. This group mastered every skills test, but often failed in games. Another group wasn’t up to par in the tests, but dominated the games.

因此，添加了一个小改动：心率监测器。他们发现有些运动员在心率达到 90 左右时就能主宰某些事情。而且，这非常好，非常感谢。不过，这项运动的节奏是 150 次。每分钟额外的 60 次心跳彻底改变了技能组合。

So, a small change was added, a heart rate monitor. They found there are athletes who can dominate something when the heart rate is 90 or so. And, that’s very good, thank you very much. The sport, though, was played at, say, 150 beats. Those extra 60 beats a minute completely changed the skill set.

几年前，一位著名篮球教练告诉我同样的事情，赢得篮球比赛的三个关键之一就是在疲劳时罚球。要想掌握一项游戏技巧，练得累是有帮助的！

I was told this same thing years ago by a famous basketball coach that one of the three keys to winning basketball games is making free throws when tired. To master a game skill, it helps to be tired when you practice it!

我曾经和我的橄榄球队一起训练第三档和 15 码，这是我的助理教练讨厌的。如果进攻方没有获得码数，我就派出弃踢队，然后我们踢球。然后我们重复第三次和第十五次。我们一遍又一遍地这样做。我们年轻的助理讨厌这一点，但我的观点是：当我们在比赛中弃踢时，场上通常只有九到十个人。我们必须在现实环境中练习让弃踢队上场。

I used to a drill with my football team to practice third down and 15 yards that my assistant coaches hated. If the offense didn’t get the yardage, I sent on the punt team and we kicked. Then we repeated third and 15. We did this over and over. Our young assistants hated this, but my point was this: When we punt in a game, we often only have nine or 10 guys on the field. We have to practice getting the punt team on in realistic settings.

根据记录，本次演习后我们不再遇到此问题。

For the record, we no longer had the issue after this drill.

犹他州高中州锦标赛将于周五上午 8:00 开始，这两天的比赛极其无聊。我一看到赛程表，就开始带那些被叫去比赛的运动员早点到学校，这样他们就能习惯早起投掷、跳跃或跨栏。一天中的这个时候，排便、热身、早餐和起床都是问题。我相信，只要教孩子们早上 8:00 需要大约一个小时的热身时间，而下午 2:00 需要五分钟的热身时间，我就已经偷偷获得了一两个州冠军。

The Utah high school state championships, as deadly boring a two days one can spend, begins at 8:00am on Friday. As soon as I see the schedule, I start bringing those athletes who are called to compete to school early so they’ll get used to throwing, jumping or hurdling at an early hour. At this time of the day, bowel movements, warm-ups, breakfast and literally just waking up are all issues. I am convinced I’ve snuck in a state champ or two simply by teaching the kids they need about an hour to warm up at 8:00am versus five minutes at 2:00pm.

这就是刻意练习，是在运动、生活……以及一切事物中生存的关键。

That’s deliberate practice, and it is the key to survival in sports, life…and everything.

把东西压下来。列出清单并找出真正重要的事情。拥抱仪式并利用它们来专注于重要的事情。刻意练习。选择一些东西并掌握它。忽略不重要的事情。

Squeeze things down. Make checklists and figure out what truly matters. Embrace rituals and use them to stay focused on what’s important. Practice deliberately. Pick something and master it. Ignore what doesn’t matter.

管理您的选择。

Manage your options.

快速复审

Quick Review

前四个工具——



The first four tools—



1.你的目标是什么？ （你的B点在哪里！！！）

1.   What is your goal? (Where’s your Point B!!!)

2. 这是健康目标还是健身目标？

2.   Is this a health or a fitness goal?

3. 这个目标会让你螺旋上升，扩大你的生活吗？

3.   Will this goal allow you to spiral out, to enlarge your life?

4. 你的目标在哪个象限？

4.   What quadrant is your goal in?

工具一到四是找出您想去的地方以及那个地方是什么样子的方法。前四个工具帮助我们定义 B 点。通往 B 点（目标）的道路将再次涉及对我们现在所处位置（A 点）的诚实评估。前四个问题都是为了为今后的成功奠定基础。接下来我们将开始了解该计划的实质内容。接下来的六个工具是关于找出 A 点在哪里。

Tools one through four are ways to find out where you want to go and what that place looks like. The first four tools help us define Point B. The path to our Point B—The Goal—is once again going to be about an honest assessment of where we are right now (Point A). The first four questions are all about setting the groundwork for the success down the road. Next we will begin the process of getting to the nitty-gritty of the plan. The next six tools are about finding out where Point A is.

斯蒂沃教练

Coach Stevo

场景二中的运动员迷路了，与第一个例子相同，但他确切地知道自己想去哪里。他甚至认为自己知道自己在哪里，尽管所有明显的线索都表明他的评估有误。运动员对他花钱购买的专业建议和最亲近的人的恳求视而不见。这是 Dan 面临的典型干预客户——他知道 B 点，但没有 A 点。

The athlete in Scene Two is lost, the same as in the first example, but he knows exactly where he wants to be. He even thinks he knows where he is despite all the obvious clues that his assessments are off. The athlete is oblivious to the professional advice he is paying for and the pleads of the person closest to him. This is the classic Intervention client Dan faces—he knows Point B, but there’s no Point A.

我本来打算跑三小时以内的马拉松。这些数字都在 12 月份的拉斯维加斯马拉松赛上。作为训练的一部分，我跑了 38 分钟的 10 公里，甚至还跑了 86 分钟的半程马拉松。每周五十英里是我生活的一部分，我毫不犹豫地起床进行那些漫长而缓慢的晨跑。

I was going to run a sub-three-hour marathon. The numbers were all lining up for the Las Vegas Marathon in December. As part of my training, I had run a 38-minute 10k and even an 86-minute half-marathon. Fifty-mile weeks were a part of my life and I didn’t think twice about waking up for those long, slow morning distance runs.

下午的跑步是我挣扎的时候。起初是胫骨疼痛，没什么新鲜事，但仍然很烦人。 10千米后我将步态调整为中足着地。 POSE方法减轻了我小腿前部的压力，但很快我的小腿后部就开始唠叨，然后对我尖叫。

The afternoon runs were when I struggled. At first, it was shin pain, nothing new, but still very annoying. I adjusted my gait to a mid-foot strike after the 10k. POSE method took the pressure off the front of my calves, but soon it was the back of my calves that were starting to nag, then scream at me.

但我本来打算跑三小时以内的马拉松。

But I was going to run a sub-three-hour marathon.

“不，你不是。”

“No you aren’t.”

我的医生拿着一张我小腿的照片，是一些机器吐出来的。

My doctor was holding a picture of my lower legs that some machine spit out.

“你得了肌腱病。”

“You’ve got tendinosis.”

“我不能服用莫林吗？”

“Can’t I take Motrin for that?”

“我说‘肌腱病’。”这意味着您的跟腱中积聚了少量眼泪。每次你跑步，情况都会变得更糟。如果你继续跑，它们就会破裂。”

“I said ‘tendinosis.’ It means you have little tears accumulating in your Achilles tendons. Every time you run, it gets worse. If you keep running, they are going to rupture.”

“我还能跑多少？”

“How much more can I run?”

“破裂意味着我得去你的膝盖后面寻找它们。”

“Rupture means I get to go looking for them up in the back of your knees.”

“哦。”

“Oh.”

我的医生是一名跑步者。她知道告诉跑步者不要跑步并不容易。对于跑步者来说更难听到它。第二天的晨跑非常艰难。

My doctor’s a runner. She got that it wasn’t easy to tell a runner not to run. And that it’s harder yet for a runner to hear it. The next morning run was pretty hard.

“三级以下会比我想象的更难。”

“Sub-three is going to be harder than I thought.”

“你怎么还跑？”

“Why are you still running?”

我的妻子不是跑步者。

My wife is not a runner.

“因为下个月我要跑三分线。我正在完成我所有的数字。”

“Because I’m going to run sub-three next month. I’m making all my numbers.”

“你不能走路。是什么让你觉得你能跑？”

“You can’t walk. What makes you think you’ll be able to run?”

“我每周跑 50 英里。我跑了半场 86 分钟。”

“I’m running 50 miles a week. I ran an 86-minute half.”

“你的医生没告诉你不要这么做吗？”

“Didn’t your doctor tell you not to?”

“她没告诉我不要这么做。” （是的，她做到了）。

“She didn’t tell me not to.” (Yes, she did).

“但是你不能走路。而且你看起来像个废物。我不喜欢这个。”

“But you can’t walk. And you look like crap. I don’t like this.”

“你在说什么？我正处于一生中最好的状态。”

“What are you talking about? I’m in the best shape of my life.”

“你不能走路。而且你现在总是生病。”

“You can’t walk. And you get sick all the time now.”

“就上个月那两次。”

“Just those two times last month.”

“而且你永远不想胡闹。我不记得我们上次做爱是什么时候了。”

“And you never want to fool around. I can’t remember the last time we had sex.”

我的训练日志里没有这样写。

My training log didn’t have that written in it.

“我认为你不应该再逃跑了。”

“I don’t think you should run anymore.”

“但我要跑三小时以内的马拉松。”

“But I’m going to run a sub-three-hour marathon.”

“不是这样的，你不是。”

“Not like this, you’re not.”

第11章

Chapter 11

第五个问题：

Fifth Question:

你今年多大？

How old are you?

发现你在训练中所处位置的最重要工具之一就是找出你在时间和空间上的位置。这一点非常简单，当我引导其他人完成干预计划时，我经常忘记这一点。

ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT tools for discovering where you are in your training is finding out where you are in time and space. This point is so simple, I often forget it when I walk others through the Intervention program.

让我们立即回答年龄问题。

Let’s get to the age answer right away.

如果您未满 18 岁并且在上学，那么您位于第一象限。尽可能多地了解每一项运动、比赛和动作，并全身心投入到你能做的一切事情中。也许你生来就是为了成为世界上最伟大的皮划艇运动员或击剑运动员，但你需要尝试一切才能找到答案。哦，如果你还没有学过骑自行车、游泳和翻滚的话，就在这个年纪吧。这些技能将永远伴随着你，但遗憾的是，它们有时也是生活中必需的。

If you are under 18 and in school, you are in Quadrant One. Learn as much as you can about every sport, game and movement, and immerse yourself in everything you possibly can do. Perhaps you were put on this earth to be the greatest kayaker or fencer the world has ever seen, but you need to try out everything to figure that out. Oh, and learn to ride a bike, swim and tumble at this age if you haven’t already. These are skills that stay with you forever and, sadly, are occasionally musts in life.

如果您年满 18 岁并且从事一项以您为生的运动，请掌握您的技术并投入每一分精力来维持您在该运动中的存在。恭喜你，你成功了——现在就保留它吧！我将奖学金运动员纳入了这一小段时间。

If you are over 18 and in a sport where you earn a living, master your techniques and engage every ounce of energy in maintaining your presence in that sport. Congratulations, you made it—now keep it! I include scholarship athletes in this little window of time.

从某种意义上说，我们必须解决与大多数人之间的一些差距，因为他们的年龄比他们实际意识到的要大。我和公公经常开玩笑说“镜子里的老家伙是谁？”我的大脑认为我是青少年，但我的身体却有不同的想法。这听起来很有趣，但除非您在一级大学注册或者是美国海军或海岸警卫队的成员，否则像大学橄榄球运动员或海军特种作战人员一样训练意味着您会跳过一些明显的步骤。

In a sense, some of the gap we have to address with most people is they’re older than they actually realize. My father-in-law and I often joke about “who is the old guy in the mirror?” My brain thinks I’m a teenager, but my body has a different idea. This sounds funny, but unless you are registered at a Division One university or are a member of United States Navy or Coast Guard, training like a college football player or a Navy Special Operator means you’re skipping over some obvious steps.

如果您年满 18 岁并且不以体育为生，那么，欢迎来到这个简单的现实：您正处于一场拯救生命的战争中，对抗瘦体重和行动能力的丧失。你必须为保留这些而打好仗。生活、猪油和懒惰都在密谋反对你，在你让自己尽可能年轻、尽可能长久的崇高战斗中。正如伟大的棒球运动员萨切尔·佩奇所说：“如果你不知道自己多大了，你会多大？”

If you are over 18 and not making a living in sport, well, welcome to this simple reality: You are in a lifesaving war against the loss of lean body mass and mobility. You must fight the good fight in keeping these. Life, lard and laziness are all conspiring against you in your noble battle to keep yourself as young as you can be, as long as you can. As the great baseball player, Satchell Paige, said, “How old would you be if you didn’t know how old you are?”

顺便说一句，这是《干预》中我最喜欢的部分。

This is my favorite part of Intervention, by the way.

我接到一些中年男子的电话，他们想要像一级大学橄榄球运动员一样接受训练，但没有时间、身体和支持人员。不要表现出你的年龄，而是训练你的年龄。尽一切努力保持甚至增加去脂体重并保持适当的活动能力。

I get phone calls from middle-aged men who want to be training like Division One college football players without the time, body and support staff. Don’t act your age, but train your age. Do everything you can to keep or even increase lean body mass and maintain the right amount of mobility.

所以，如果你错过了这一点，事实证明，几乎所有阅读本书的人都处于第三象限，并且迫切需要灵活性和力量训练！

So, in case you missed this, it turns out nearly everyone reading this book is in Quadrant Three and is in desperate need for mobility and strength work!

第12章

Chapter 12

第六个问题：

Sixth Question:

你在举重室举什么？

What do you lift in the weightroom?

现在我们知道您的目标是什么以及您在生活中所处的位置，我们需要了解您在达到 B 点所需的品质发展方面走了多远。如果 Point 中的“A” A代表任何事物，它是评估。我们需要评估每个人，正如我们今天所说的那样——如果你不评估，你就是在猜测。

NOW THAT WE KNOW what your goals are and where you are in your life, we need to find out how far along you are in the development of the qualities you need to get to your Point B. And if the “A” in Point A stands for anything, it’s assessment. We need to assess everybody and as we all say today—If you ain’t assessing, you’re guessing.

评估一：灵活性和力量运动

Assessment Number One: Mobility and Strength Movements

我的评估工具非常简单。对于基本的移动性、稳定性和灵活性，我非常喜欢功能性运动屏幕 (FMS)，这是 Gray Cook 和 Lee Burton 创建的程序。最近，我与 Gray 和 Brett Jones 一起在 CK-FMS 研讨会上在寒冷、黑暗的礼堂里坐了四天，这是经过认证的壶铃教练功能运动屏幕。尽管我的 FMS 技能充其量只是初级的，但我坚持为与我一起工作的每个人提供两项 FMS 基础知识，即主动直腿抬高 (ASLR) 和肩部灵活性 (SM) 屏幕。

My tools of assessment are pretty simple. For basic mobility, stability and flexibility, I am a huge fan of the Functional Movement Screen (FMS), the program Gray Cook and Lee Burton created. I recently sat in a cold, dark auditorium for four days with Gray and Brett Jones at a CK-FMS workshop, which is the Certified Kettlebell Instructor Functional Movement Screen. Although my skill set with the FMS is, at best, rudimentary, I insist on two of the FMS basics for everyone I work with, the Active Straight Leg Raise (ASLR) and the Shoulder Mobility (SM) screens.

确实，您可以使用所有七个 FMS 屏幕，并努力获得“14 且无不对称”的口号，这是通过考试的标准结果。换句话说，从统计数据来看，具有此分数的人不会在运动中受伤。任何分数的问题都是这样的：想象一个战士通过战斗把面包放在桌子上。我不太愿意说：“抱歉，你不能工作，因为你的小腿肌肉紧绷。”

True, you could use all seven of the FMS screens and strive for the mantra of ‘14 and no asymmetries,’ the standard results for a cleared exam. In other words, statistically, someone with this score won’t get hurt doing a sport. The problem with any score is this: Imagine a fighter who puts bread on the table by fighting. I am not comfortable saying, “Sorry, you can’t work because you have a tight calf muscle.”

好吧，这有点夸张了，但我想你明白了。

Okay, that was a gross overstatement, but I think you get the point.

我使用 ASLR 和 SM 屏幕的原因是我可以立即了解 Mark Cheng 博士所说的四个结。肩膀和臀部需要在紧张、活动性、稳定性、力量和放松之间保持有趣的平衡。就像鞋带上的一个结，太松了，无法固定（不好）；太紧了，解不开（不好）。它必须是“就是这样”。

The reason I use the ASLR and SM screens is that I get an instant insight into what Dr. Mark Cheng calls the four knots. The shoulders and hips need to be in an interesting balance between tension, mobility, stability, strength and looseness. Like a knot in your shoelace, too loose and it doesn’t hold (bad); too tight and you can’t untie it (bad). It has to be ‘just so.’

几分钟之内，我就可以掌握四个结了。当格雷和布雷特向我猛烈抨击时，如果左右之间存在不对称，那就是我们开始工作的地方。在接下来的六个月里，我们可能每天都会进行臀部、肩部和胸部的活动训练，有一个基本的起点会很有帮助。

In minutes, I can have a handle on the four knots. As Gray and Brett pounded into me, if there are asymmetries between right and left, that’s where we begin our work. We’ll be doing hip, shoulder and thoracic mobility work probably every day for the next six months, and having a basic starting point will be helpful.

筛选过程进行了两分钟后，我就基本了解了我们需要在流动工作上花费多少时间。有些人不需要花任何时间在移动上。对于其他人来说，它将成为每次训练课程的开始、中间和结束的一部分。

I am two minutes into the screening process and have a basic sense of how much time we need to spend on mobility work. Some people don’t need to spend any time on mobility. For others, it going to be part of the beginning, middle and end of every training session.

有关筛选和评估的更多信息，请阅读格雷·库克的精彩著作《运动》。他是专家；我从他的盘子里收集面包屑。

For more information on screening and assessing, please read Gray Cook’s marvelous book, Movement. He’s the expert; I collect the crumbs from his plate.

波士顿伟大的力量教练迈克·博伊尔（Mike Boyle）最近提出了一个关于灵活性的观点，值得思考几分钟。

Mike Boyle, the great Boston-based strength coach, recently made a point about mobility that deserves a few minutes of thought.

迈克将移动性描述为“挂门”。我曾经做过一次，挂一扇门，花了我所有的数学技能、我的耐心和太多的时间才最终完成。你看，挂一扇门意味着空间“刚刚好”。如果门完美贴合，只需轻轻一按即可打开和关闭。

Mike describes mobility like hanging a door. I did this once, hanging a door, and it took all my math skills, my patience and far too many hours to finally get it done. You see, hanging a door means the spaces are ‘just enough.’ If the door fits perfectly, it opens and shuts with a mere touch.

迈克指出，关节活动性也应该是一样的：应该足够了。您的关节移动时应该不会卡住或卡住，也不会撞击周围的任何东西。这不具有竞争力；就够了。

Mike notes that joint mobility should be the same: It should be just enough. Your joints should move through without hitches or catches or having to slam anything around. It’s not competitive; it’s enough.

记住这一点——

Put this to memory—

有了灵活性和力量训练，就够了。

With mobility and strength training, enough is enough.

正式评估应该是培训年的常规部分。有些评估不需要运动员消耗任何能量，例如 FMS 或一些各种灵活性动作，每六周重新评估一次并不是一个坏主意。对于其他强度测试，我们可能会每两个月左右重新测试一次。评估的方式和时间在很大程度上取决于教练或培训师的技能，但根据我的经验，最好的评估是通过提出问题和观察动作来完成的。

Formal assessments should be a regular part of a training year. Some of the assessments that don’t take any energy from the athlete, like the FMS or some of the various flexibility moves, re-assessing once every six weeks is not a bad idea. With other tests of strength, we might re-test every two months or so. So much of the how and when of assessing depends on the skill of the coach or trainer, but in my experience, the best assessments are done by asking questions and watching movement.

而且，这就是这一切的意义所在。

And, that is what this is all about.

这是我真正引以为豪的下一部分——运动干预。

It’s the next part I take real pride in—the Movements Intervention.

运动干预

Movements Intervention

当然，这个想法是基于一些成瘾者面对亲人谈论他们的成瘾问题的方式。从某种意义上说，我实际上对运动员也看到了同样的事情。我们变得如此专注于自己的优势，以至于我们需要一群人指出我们的缺陷。

This idea is based, of course, on the way some addicts are confronted by loved ones about their addictions. I actually see the same thing, in a sense, with athletes. We become so singularly focused on our strengths that we need to have a bunch of people point out our flaws.

我笔记中的正式标题是“最佳举重……口试”。我有趣的小副标题是瓦迪亚长凳？出自经典的《周六夜现场》电视节目。

The official title in my notes is Best lifts…oral exam. My fun little subtitle is Waddya Bench? from the classic Saturday Night Live telecast.

在短短几分钟内，我通常可以发现运动员的注意力集中在哪里，也可以看到明显的遗漏。

In just a few minutes, I can usually discover what the focus of the athlete has been, and also see the glaring omissions.

我不听最大的。我正在聆听这份动向清单——



I’m not listening for maxes. I’m listening for this list of movements—



1. 推

1.   Push

2.拉动

2.   Pull

3. 铰链

3.   Hinge

4.深蹲

4.   Squat

5.负重行走/跑步/冲刺（Loaded Carry）

5.   Walk/Run/Sprint under load (Loaded Carries)

6. 最后，我称之为第六运动。这是滚动、跪着、单腿练习等等。为了进行评估，我使用了一件事——土耳其装束。

6.   And finally, what I call the Sixth Movement. This is rolling, kneeling, single-leg work and all the rest. To assess, I use one thing—the Turkish Getup.

最初的干预意味着找到培训中的空白，并从那里构建计划。

The initial intervention means finding where the blanks are in the training, and building the program from there.

我是什么意思？

What do I mean?

通常，几乎普遍地，运动员都是通过推动来完成任务的。我说的是一分钟 90 个俯卧撑或双体重卧推之类的事情。这些数字使运动员名列前茅。对于一些运动员来说，这种压倒性的推力重点也导致了我刚刚在肩部活动屏幕中发现的活动问题。

Usually, and almost universally, an athlete is accomplished with push. I’m talking about things like 90 pushups in a minute or a double-bodyweight bench press. These are numbers that put an athlete at the top of the heap. With some athletes, this overwhelming push emphasis has also lead to mobility issues I would have just discovered in the shoulder mobility screen.

推动的间隙是多少？我不知道，因为我从未在运动员身上看到过这种情况。但这就像无法做 10 个俯卧撑或类似的事情。

What would a gap for pushing? I don’t know, as I’ve never seen this in an athlete. But it would be something like the inability to do 10 pushups or something along those lines.

一般来说，过去几年的战斗机类型在引体向上方面表现得非常出色。也许我们可以感谢洛基或军队，但大多数战士似乎都知道如何做拉动动作。当然，我总是开玩笑说，正是因为他们的鸡腿，他们才能一次又一次地做引体向上。

Generally, fighter types in the past few years show up very good at pullups. Maybe we can thank Rocky, or the military, but most fighters seem to know how to do pulling motions. Of course, I’ve always joked it’s because of their chicken legs that they can do rep after rep on the pullup.

我承认这并没有让我受到他们的喜爱。

I’ll admit that hasn’t endeared me to them.

铰链是我开始看到空白外观的地方。

The hinge is where I start seeing blank looks.

“你知道，”我说，“……铰链运动。”

“You know,” I say, “…hinge movements.”

“嗯？”

“Huh?”

我站起来，双手放在臀部褶皱处，将臀部向后推，然后向前猛冲。

I stand up, put my hands at my hip folds, push my butt back and snap forward.

“秋千。抢夺。清洁。硬拉。跳跃。你知道人类最基本、最有力、最重要的动作吗？”

“Swings. Snatches. Cleans. Deadlifts. Jumps. You know, the most basic and most powerful and most important of human movements?”

没有什么。

Nothing.

精英运动员在整个职业生涯中忽视爆发性快速动作的情况并不罕见。然而，我要说的是，自从壶铃兴起以来，许多人现在都在做危险和疯狂的挥杆变化，正确的指导是第一个补救措施。

It’s not unusual to find an elite athlete has ignored the explosive snap movement throughout an entire career. I will say, however, since the boom of the kettlebell, many people are now doing dangerous and insane swing-like variations and proper instruction is the first remedy.

这将是我能够对运动员的成功产生巨大影响的领域之一。一组正确的挥杆对新陈代谢的影响是令人震惊的，而且在力量和体能训练方面更是如此。如果我所做的只是教正确的挥杆动作并鼓励某种形式的硬拉，我知道我会对这位运动员产生影响。

This is going to be one of the areas where I can have great impact on the success of an athlete. The metabolic hit of a correct set of swings is shocking, and much more on the conditioning side of strength and conditioning. If all I do is teach a proper swing and encourage some form of deadlift, I know I will make an impact on this athlete.

当我提到深蹲时，我通常会得到，“嗯，嗯，”或者，“深蹲对你来说不是有害吗？”

When I mention the squat, I usually get, “Um, well, uh,” or, “Aren’t squats bad for you?”

如果您还没有弄清楚，我的清单从我们在健身房看到的最常见到最不常见的动作，以及，有人可能会说，从最不重要到最重要的动作进行了列出。我非常确信这五个动作都很重要，这里一句“我是全州最好的”，那里一句“嗯，嗯，呃”就很能说明问题了。

If you haven’t figured it out, my list goes from the most common to the least common movements we see in the gym and, one could argue, from the least important to the most important. I’m pretty convinced all five movements are crucial, and having a “I’m the state’s best” here and an “um, well, uh” there is pretty telling.

这是我真正能够快速影响运动员的地方，但也会让人感到非常酸痛。我们真的必须每天坚持做深蹲运动。是的，只要我们需要解决这个问题，我们就会每天进行高脚杯深蹲。

This is where I can really impact an athlete—and quickly—but also make a person very sore. We really must get in and do squat movements every day. Yes, we’re going to be doing goblet squats each and every day as long as we need to address this issue.

列表中的最后一个元素是在负载下行走、跑步或冲刺。我听到的第一反应总是，​​“嗯，是的，我慢跑，我在跑步机上跑步。”

The final element on the list is to walk, run or sprint under load. The first response I hear is always, “Well, yes, I jog and I do the treadmill.”

这与拖着雪橇、推着汽车或带着 75 磅重的管子上山（后面拖着雪橇）不同。当有人问：“这锻炼了什么肌肉？”我喜欢弯下腰，把一个杯子装满汗水，然后扔给他。这是我可以对运动员的体能水平产生直接影响的最大领域。当这个缺失时，我保证添加它将会改变游戏规则。

That’s not the same as dragging a sled, pushing a car or carrying a 75-pound pipe up a hill with a sled dragging behind. After someone asks, “What muscle does this build?” I like to lean over and fill a cup with sweat drops and toss it on him. This is the biggest area where I can have immediate impact in an athlete’s conditioning level. When this is missing, I guarantee adding it will be the game-changer.

然而，满载的携带并不是试图让某人感到疲倦。负荷步行和冲刺似乎比我作为教练或运动员在职业生涯中尝试过的任何事情都更能提高运动素质。它只是改变了我们在所有其他领域处理更多负载的能力。

Loaded carries are not, however, an attempt to get someone tired. Loaded walks and sprints seem to do more to expand athletic qualities than any single thing I’ve attempted in my career, as either a coach or an athlete. It simply changes our ability to handle more load in all the other areas.

最后，我会问这个人是否听说过土耳其装束。直到最近，这几乎引发了普遍的疑问：“嗯？”如果有人从未听说过这种装扮，我很清楚第一次尝试时会发现什么。请注意，我没有包括任何单臂或单腿的工作，也没有包括核心内容。土耳其装束将成为我的评估工具，以确定所有其他“第六”动作的协调性。

Lastly, I will ask if the person has heard of the Turkish getup. Until recently, this triggered an almost universal, “huh?” If someone has never heard of the getup, I have a pretty good idea what I am going to find on the first attempt. Notice I didn’t include any one-arm or one-leg work, nor that core stuff. The Turkish getup will be my assessment tool to determine the coordination of all the other ‘Sixth’ movements.

通常，到了我们关系的这个阶段，我就知道如何提供帮助了。运动员越先进，我就越容易看到理想的方案。简单地说，如果你一直在关注的话，你就会看到这一点，我会发现训练中的遗漏并让运动员去做。我经常说，过去几年我取得了最大的进步，因为我聘请了一位私人教练，一个名叫巴迪·沃克的人。听着，我可以去世界上任何一家健身房，用我的推举给人们留下深刻的印象。但我需要做的最后一件事就是按下。我需要做不对称的工作。我需要锻炼我的上背部。我需要努力打开我的关节。巴迪让我做我需要做的事情，而不是我想做的事情。

Usually, by this point in our relationship I have a handle on how to help. The more advanced the athlete, the easier it is for me to see the ideal program. Simply, and if you have been following along you can see this, I find the omissions in training and make the athlete do them. I often argue that I have made my best progress the last few years because I hired a personal trainer, a guy named Buddy Walker. Listen, I can go to any gym in the world and impress people with my pressing. But the last thing I need to do is press. I need to do asymmetrical work. I need to work on my upper back. I need to work on opening my joints. Buddy makes me do the things I need to do rather than the things I want to do.

这就是优质教练的定义和干预的秘诀。

That’s the definition of quality coaching and the secret to Intervention.

第13章

Chapter 13

第七个问题：

Seventh Question:

你的差距是什么？

What are your gaps?

评估二：灵活性和力量标准

Assessment Number Two: Mobility and Strength Standards

在确定你正在做什么和没有做什么动作之后，我需要了解你对这些动作的能力水平。随着时间的推移，我确定了一些基本的力量标准，我相信它们能告诉我一些事情。迈克·博伊尔有他的特点，就像任何优秀的力量教练一样。这就是我们如何找到 A 点，也许还有一点关于 B 点的位置。

After determining what movements you are and aren’t doing, I need to find out your level of competence at those movements. Over time, I’ve determined some basic strength standards I trust to tell me something. Mike Boyle has his, as does any good strength coach. It’s how we find Point A, and maybe a little about where Point B will be.

一些标准可以帮助您决定自己所处的位置——

Some standards to help you decide where you are—

男士

MEN

预期推力

= 自重卧推

游戏规则改变者 = 自重卧推 15 次

预期拉力

= 8–10 次引体向上

游戏规则改变者 = 15 次引体向上

预期深蹲

= 自重深蹲

游戏规则改变者 = 自重深蹲 15 次

铰链

预期 = 体重 150%自重硬拉

游戏规则改变者 = 双体重硬拉

负重

预期 = 农民以总体重步行（每只手一半）

游戏规则改变者 = 每只手的体重

起立

左右各一个，用半杯水完成

Push

Expected = Bodyweight bench press

Game-changer = Bodyweight bench press for 15 reps

Pull

Expected = 8–10 pullups

Game-changer = 15 pullups

Squat

Expected = Bodyweight squat

Game-changer = Bodyweight squat for 15 reps

Hinge

Expected = Bodyweight to 150% bodyweight deadlift

Game-changer = Double-bodyweight deadlift

Loaded Carry

Expected = Farmer walk with total bodyweight (half per hand)

Game-changer =Bodyweight per hand

Getup

One left and right, done with a half-filled cup of water

着装标准很奇怪，但对于男性来说，在整个范围内不使用任何手指作弊的情况下，用拳头平衡半满的纸杯水的挑战更能说明问题。我有很多小型的装扮练习，可以解决我们在小装扮测试中发现的大多数失败问题。

The getup standard is odd, but with men the challenge of balancing the half-filled paper cup of water on a fist without cheating by using any fingers through the whole range illuminates issues better. I have a lot of small getup drills that work with most of the failures we find in our little getup test.

上述标准中的“预期”是什么意思？这是耸肩点头，“是的，当然，我能做到。”

What do I mean by ‘expected’ in the standards above? It’s this shoulder-shrugging nod of, “Yes, of course, I can do that.”

未经训练的人通常可以在第一次训练中达到这些标准，而那些没有受过训练的人（他花了几年时间积累一些腹部脂肪）可能无论如何都能做到其中的大部分。

An untrained man can often do these standards on the first training session, and someone detrained (he took a few years off to build up some belly fat) might be able to do most of these anyway.

如果你能以改变游戏规则的水平完成所有六个动作，那么你的担忧就不再是举重房了。如果您正在解决身体脂肪问题，那就是饮食。如果你在运动中失败，那是技术或战术方面的问题，但这不是举重房的问题。显然，你足够强大、足够平衡，几乎可以做任何事情。

If you can do all six movements at a game-changer level, your concerns are not in the weightroom. If you’re dealing with a body fat problem, it’s diet. If you’re failing in sport, it’s technical or tactical, but it isn’t a weightroom issue. You are clearly strong enough and balanced enough to do practically anything.

当我们拥有一支具有改变比赛水平的团队并发现挑战时，我认为我们可以将失败归咎于力量教练之外的其他因素。当然，这些都是一般标准，但我们的想法是，如果你在一项测试中达到了最高水平，而在其他测试中却惨败，这表明了你的弱点和你最好的方向。

When we have a team of people at the game-changer level and find challenges, well, I think we can blame something besides the strength coach for the failure. These are general standards, of course, but the idea is, if you max out one test and fail miserably on the others, it indicates your weakness and your best direction.

哦，农夫走多远？

Oh, and how far on the farmer walks?

当然，这要看情况，但至少 20 米，也许 40 米，尽管走得更远也可以。很少有运动比农夫行走更划算，所以无论你得分如何，都要不断挑战自己，走得更远。

It depends, of course, but at least 20 meters and perhaps 40, although it would be fine to go farther. Few movements provide more bang for the buck than farmer walks, so no matter how you score, keep challenging yourself to go farther.

女性

WOMEN

推力

改变者 = 自重卧

推

拉力改变者 = 三个引体向上

铰链

改变者 = 275 磅硬拉

深蹲

改变者 = 135 次后深蹲

负重携带

改变者 = 每手 85 磅

Push

Game-changer = Bodyweight bench press

Pull

Game-changer = Three pullups

Hinge

Game-changer = 275-pound deadlift

Squat

Game-changer = 135 for five in the back squat

Loaded Carries

Game-changer = 85 pounds per hand

无论出于何种原因，一旦任何体重的女性成功达到这些标准，惊人的事情就会发生。我经常向女性和值得信赖的教练询问有关女性的标准，并希望将来能得到更明确的信息。

For whatever reason, once women at any bodyweight succeed with these standards, amazing things happen. I regularly ask women and trusted coaches standards about women’s and am hoping to have more clarity in the future.

可能只是这样——根据我的观察，当一名女运动员硬拉超过 275 磅时，赛场上就会发生非凡的事情。我一直认为，尽管女性举重已经有一段时间了，但我们仍然没有足够的可靠数据或信息来明确女性的标准。

It might simply be this—from my observations, when a female athlete deadlifts over 275 pounds, remarkable things happen in the field of play. It has been my thought that even though women have been lifting for a while, we still don’t have enough reliable data or information to have clarity about standards for women.

我记得看过东德对投掷运动员的研究，数据到处都是。当然，变得更强是一件好事，但可靠的原始数据很难获得。我希望我们将来能有更完整的系列。

I remember seeing East German studies on throwers, and the numbers were just all over the place. Certainly getting stronger is a good thing, but reliable raw numbers are hard to come by. I’m hopeful we’ll have a more complete set in the future.

此时，您的答案可能与“我从未听说过这件事”和“我处于改变游戏规则的水平”相距甚远。稍后，我们将讨论如何对您的工作进行评分，但是，如果您实在等不及了，请记住这一点：您没有做的事情正是您需要做的。

At this point your answers might be as far apart as “I have never even heard of this thing” to I am at “game-changer level here.” Later, we’ll discuss how we grade your work, but, if you simply just can’t wait, remember this: What you are not doing is what you need to do.

你忽略的动作

正是你需要做的事情！

The movements you are ignoring

are the things you need to do!

在详细了解这些走势之后，我们将回顾这些数字和其他一些可能有用的示例。

After we look at the movements in detail, we’ll review these numbers and some other examples that may be helpful.

第14章

Chapter 14

第八个问题：

Eighth Question:

你愿意回到基础吗？

Are you willing to go back to basics?

当然，如果你 从未做过某个动作或者你完全忽略它，那么你需要做那个动作。但怎么知道你走在正确的道路上呢？你怎么知道A点正在接近B点？当然，这是评估、重新评估和重新解决，但有时我们需要回到基本的基础。

CERTAINLY, IF YOU’VE never done a movement or you ignore it entirely, you need to do that move. But how do know you’re on the right path? How do you know that Point A is getting closer to Point B? Certainly, it is assess, reassess and readdress, but sometimes we need to go back to the basic basics.

我认为伟大通常体现在掌握基础知识的勇气上。伟大的音乐家练习音阶，而新手则太努力地拼凑出下一首伟大的曲子。我在每次研讨会、聚会和课堂上都会解释如何掌握生活的基本知识。

I think greatness is usually seen in the courage to master the fundamentals. The great musicians practice scales, while the novice is trying too hard to jam together the next great tune. Mastery of the basics of life is something I explain in every workshop, gathering and class.

对于参与干预过程的运动员来说，这个简单的问题是：“你愿意回到基础吗？”是关键。它实际上是独立的。包含 10 个问题的工具箱中的大部分都要求我们诚实地了解我们现在的处境以及我们想要去往的地方，但这个问题提出了最难的一个问题——

For my athletes in the Intervention process, this simple question, “Are you willing go back to basics?” is the key. It practically stands alone. Much of the 10-question toolbox demands that we look honestly about where we are and where we want to go, but this question asks the toughest of all—

你愿意再次回到最初吗？

你愿意重新开始，从头开始

，还是芬尼根，重新开始？

Are you willing to go back to the beginning again?

Are you willing to start over, start from

scratch, or Finnegan, Begin Again?
