作为一名力量教练，我认为正确训练的支柱既是坚持掌握基础知识，又是在必要时有勇气回到起点，以确保完美的动作。

As a strength coach, I think the pillars of proper training are both adherence to mastering the basics and the courage to go back to the beginning whenever necessary to insure perfect movement.

我对力量训练的愿景涉及所有基本人体动作的能力。由于年龄、疾病或受伤，运动员可能不得不与所有新孩子一起在游泳池的浅水区游泳很多次，但这正是长期职业生涯和卫冕冠军诞生的地方。

My vision of strength training involves competence in all the fundamental human movements. Due to age, illness or injury, an athlete may have to swim many times in the shallow end of pool with all the new kids, but this is where prolonged careers and repeat champions are born.

在下一节中，我们将研究对每个动作的持续评估以及如何进行这些动作。

In this next section, we will look at ongoing assessment for each movement and how you can progress them.

     

     

第15章

Chapter 15

人体基本运动

The Fundamental Human Movements

推

Push

拉

Pull

合页

Hinge

蹲

Squat

满载携带

Loaded Carry

推

Push

我通过电话进行了很多咨询。这仍然是我所知道的了解某人在做什么，也许更重要的是，了解他们认为自己在做什么的最佳方式。写电子邮件、信件和文章让我得出了这个不可避免的结论：大多数学员只能理解他们所读内容的 10% 左右。这也许可以解释为什么我的一个朋友在练腿日做卧推和弯举。

I do a lot of consultations on the telephone. It’s still the best way I know to get a sense of what someone is doing and maybe more importantly, what they think they’re doing. Writing email, letters and articles has led me to this inescapable conclusion: Most trainees understand only about 10 percent of what they read. This might explain why a friend of mine did benches and curls on his leg day.

当我第一次与客户交谈时，我会询问培训背景。除极少数例外，以下是第一个声明——

When I first talk to a client, I ask about training background. With rare exception, the following is the first statement—

“我最好的板凳是（插入数量）。”

“My best bench is (insert amount).”

在听到几十个人用卧推数字总结他们的训练后，我意识到在所有基本的人类动作中——推、拉、铰链、深蹲和负重搬运——我最不应该担心的是推。

After hearing literally dozens of people sum up their training with a bench press number, I realized that of all the basic human movements—push, pull, hinge, squat and loaded carry—the last thing I should worry about is the push.

但后来我的客户变得更加“特别”。

But then my clientele got more “special.”

不久前，我开始和一个我们称之为鲍勃的人一起工作，他身高 6 英尺 8 英寸，体重 310 磅。他只有在休赛期才会有这样的体重，并且会在 NFL 边锋的工作中得到很好的锻炼。他通过阻止人们击打四分卫赚了很多钱，而且他做得很好，戴上了三枚超级碗戒指。当然，他有一些问题……比如，他无法伸直左臂，右肩也很乱。

A while back, I began working with a guy we’ll call Bob, who is 6’ 8” and weighs 310 pounds. He is only this light in the off-season, and will bulk up nicely for his job as an NFL lineman. He makes a fair amount of money stopping people from hitting quarterbacks, and he’s done the job well enough to wear three Super Bowl rings. He has a few issues, of course…like, he can’t straighten his left arm and his right shoulder is a mess.

他不是唯一一个。在过去的几年里，我一直在与一些精英运动员一起工作，他们根本无法像普通人那样推动。因为这些人利用自己的身体过着相当不错的生活，所以我开发了一个很好的小系统，将推动力带回游戏中。

He’s not the only one. I’ve been working with elite athletes the past few years who simply can’t push as well as a normal person. Because of these people, who make a fairly good living using their bodies, I developed a nice little system for bringing the push back into the game.

在一份精彩的 DVD 和手册（他们称之为Dynami）中， Gray Cook 和 Brett Jones 提供了我已将其改编（又名经许可盗用）为这种格式的教学进展——

In a wonderful DVD and manual they call Dynami, Gray Cook and Brett Jones offered a teaching progression I’ve adapted (aka stolen with permission) into this format—

图案化

Patterning

磨削

Grinding

对称

Symmetry

弹道或爆炸

Ballistic or explosive

我经常无法与客户达到弹道水平，因为过去的伤病和其他问题往往使我们无法达到这个水平。正如格雷库克曾经告诉我的那样，“不要加速功能障碍。”这也是对生活的好建议。

I often don’t get to the ballistics level with clients, because injuries and other issues from the past tend to keep us from this level. As Gray Cook once told me, “Don’t add speed to dysfunction.” It’s good advice for life, too.

我们总是从图案开始。在推举的世界里，木板是基础。哦，我也知道这一点：我认识的人中没有人认为他们需要平板支撑。我从加拿大伟大的背部专家 Stu McGill 那里偷来了一个小测试：如果你不能坚持平板支撑两分钟，要么你肥胖，要么你的腹部训练是错误的。

We always start with patterning. In the world of pushes, a plank is the base. Oh, and I also know this: Nobody I know thinks they need to plank. I have a little test I stole from Stu McGill, the great back expert from Canada: If you can’t hold a plank for two minutes, either you’re obese or your abdominal training is wrong.

请注意，没有缺陷……错了！

Not flawed, mind you…wrong!

我的大部分工作都使用俯卧撑平板支撑 (PUPP)。一个疲惫不堪的运动员几乎总是可以保持PUPP，并且很容易将其与其他动作结合起来。这是一项很好的休息练习，让简单的锻炼变得更加困难。我喜欢将秋千和高脚杯深蹲与 PUPP 结合起来。

I use the pushup-position plank (PUPP) for most of my work. A beat-up athlete can almost always still PUPP, and it’s fairly easy to blend that with other movements. It’s a great rest exercise that makes an easy workout harder. I like to mix swings and goblet squats with PUPPs.

关键是：让心率穿过屋顶的是离开地面的上下运动，而不是真正的木板。

Here’s the key: It’s getting up and down off the ground that will drive the heart rate through the roof, not the actual plank.

我使用了所有可以想象到的平板支撑，我的所有运动员也很快开始练习靠墙倒立。一旦我们完成了这一点，我们就转向木板之王，侧手翻。

I use every plank imaginable, and all my athletes quickly work toward wall-assisted handstands, too. Once we accomplish this, we move to the King of Planks, the cartwheel.

是的，我知道……没有人会侧手翻。但当我第一次看到弗兰克·三叶草的训练计划并看到他对侧手翻的使用时，我印象深刻，所以我尝试了它们。奇怪的是，这是我一生中最困难的体能训练之一。我的肩膀受到了让我震惊的锻炼。

Yes, I know…no one does cartwheels. But when I first saw Frank Shamrock’s training program and saw his use of cartwheels, I was impressed, so I tried them. It was oddly one of the most difficult conditioning workouts of my life. And my shoulders took a workout that shocked me.

很少有人在训练中不会从更多的平板支撑中获益。将平板支撑与大动作混合起来，作为集中休息的时间，或者在室外环境中添加侧手翻。对于受伤的运动员，可以在恢复初期添加平板支撑。

It’s a rare person who won’t gain from more planks in their training. Use planks as a focused rest period by mixing them with a big move, or add cartwheels into your outdoor conditioning. For the injured athlete, planks can be added early in the recovery.

我经常处理的问题是：人们相信平板支撑或任何模式练习都是初学者的东西，不值得成为精英。

The issue I always deal with is this: There’s a belief that the plank, or any patterning exercise, is beginner stuff and not worthy of an elite.

听听这个：在运动质量方面我们都是初学者。

Hear this: We’re all beginners when it comes to the quality of movement.

在推举世界中，磨练练习非常明显：俯卧撑、卧推、军事推举，从字面上看，这个列表似乎无穷无尽。对于我训练的运动员来说，我非常相信军事推举和卧推变式。

The grind family of exercises is pretty obvious in the push world: pushups, bench press, military press and literally, the list seems endless. I am a big believer in both military presses and a bench press variation for the athletes I train.

对于大多数人来说，磨练的军事压力机就足够了。我希望我能说得更多，但有比我更好的人来谈论媒体。我是 Jim Wendler 的 5-3-1 训练的忠实粉丝，他提倡每周进行两次推举，所以我一定有很好的陪伴。

For most people, the grinding military presses are about all that will be needed. I wish I could say more, but there are far better people to speak about the press than me. I am a big fan of Jim Wendler’s 5-3-1 training, and he advocates both presses each week, so I must be in good company.

这是大多数人会跳过的下一步，但任何想要高速击球或投掷的人都应该考虑对称推举训练。我第一次接触到单臂卧推是由已故的莱恩·坎农（Lane Cannon）完成的。我们在他的地下室做了这些，在那里我发现我的身体是一体的。

It’s the next step that most people skip, but anyone who wants to hit or throw at high speeds should consider symmetry press workouts. I was first exposed to the one-arm bench press by the late Lane Cannon. We did them in his basement, and there I discovered that my body is one piece.

当我推荐这些产品时，我总是提醒人们保持空闲的、没有负重的手。不要抓住任何东西，让手保持自由。这将要求你的身体锁定并变得坚固。

When I recommend these, I always remind people to keep the free, non-weighted hand free. Don’t grab onto anything, just let the hand stay free. This will demand that your body lock up and become solid.

单臂卧推将是您一生中最伟大的腹部锻炼之一。

And the one-arm bench press will be one of the greatest ab workouts of your life.

维克森林大学的伊森·里维斯用他的单臂紧逼标准填补了方程式的下一部分。他认为举重 125 磅、重复 5 次是运动员的黄金标准。我将高中男生的重量降低到 70 磅，重复 5 次，女生则降低到 30 磅，重复 10 次。哦，在跳起来尝试这个挑战之前做好准备吧。对于 100 磅左右的物体，重量确实会将您的“偏侧”拉到板凳上并拉下。你必须通过积极挤压从脚到上的所有部位来应对重量。这是一个全身举重的动作。

Wake Forest’s Ethan Reeves fills in the next part of the equation with his one-armed pressing standards. He believes hoisting 125 pounds for five reps is the gold standard for his athletes. I lowered this to 70 pounds for five reps for our high school boys and 30 pounds for 10 reps for the girls. Oh, prepare yourself before you jump up and try this challenge. With anything around 100 pounds, the weight will really pull your ‘off’ side around and down the bench. You have to counter it by aggressively squeezing everything from your feet up to deal with the weight. It’s a full body lift with heavy weights.

请记住：保持空闲的手臂自由！

Remember: Keep the free arm free!

事情是这样的。如果你的右手能完成 125 次，而左手只能完成 70 次，那么你就有问题了。现在，我不知道它们是什么，但最好使用单臂工作来发现这些问题，而不是像经常发生的那样——增加不对称问题的爆炸性！以系统的方法处理这个问题，包括加强弱侧、解决流动性和灵活性问题，甚至可能进行一些积极的康复工作。

Here’s the deal. If you can do 125 with the right and only 70 with the left, you have issues. Now, I don’t know what they are, but it’s better to find these issues using one-arm work than doing what often happens—adding explosiveness to an asymmetrical issue! Deal with this problem in a systematic approach that includes strengthening the weak side, addressing mobility and flexibility issues, and perhaps even doing some aggressive rehab work.

十五年前，很少见到有人单臂过头推举。在帕维尔壶铃的影响下，举重运动卷土重来。我是这种举重动作的忠实粉丝，我的许多个人锻炼都是以单臂推举为主。这里很容易看到不对称现象。我建议大多数男性努力进行半体重的单臂过头推举，并且从逻辑上讲，能够用双手完成该动作。

Fifteen years ago, it was rare to see anyone one-arm overhead press. With Pavel’s kettlebell influence, the lift has returned with a vengeance. I am a big fan of this lift and many of my personal workouts are anchored by one-arm presses. It’s easy to see asymmetries here. I suggest most men strive for a half-bodyweight one-arm overhead press and, logically enough, to be able to do it with both hands.

高中时，我们有一个环球体育馆。我不在乎你喜欢还是讨厌机器，但即使现在当我回顾它时，很多人都在通用上进行了非常努力的训练，并取得了相当不错的进步。

In high school, we had a Universal Gym. I don’t care if you love or hate machines, but even now when I look back at it, a lot of people trained really hard on the Universal and made pretty fair progress.

我们经常做的一件事是单臂按压军事新闻站。我们以一种真正经得起时间考验的方式做到了这一点。我站在机器前，我的伙伴拿着钥匙站在附近。

One thing we did a lot of was one-arm presses on the military press station. We did them in a way that honestly stands the test of time. I stood in front of the machine and my partner stood nearby with the key.

关键是，这是我几十年来没有使用过的图像。这是弯曲的选择键，使我们能够使用超过 40 磅的重量。教练把钥匙放在办公室里，这样除非教练在场，否则任何人都不能使用它们。当然，弗朗西斯科露台的每个孩子都知道弯曲的指甲也有同样的效果，所以我有自己的私人健身房，只要我可以偷偷溜进去。

Now that’s an image I haven’t used in decades, the key. This was the bent selector key that allowed us to use more than 40 pounds. The coaches kept the keys in the office so no one could use them unless a coach was around. Of course, every kid from Francisco Terrace knew that a bent nail worked just as well, so I had my own personal gym any time I could sneak in.

所以，我会用右臂做五次。我的朋友会把重量调到 50 磅。还有五次代表。我们一直继续这个过程，直到我不能做五次为止。然后有趣的事情开始了。我们会重新堆叠起来，每次 10 磅，直到起始重量 40 磅。我们称这些为倦怠套装，肩泵令人难以置信。

So, I would do five reps with the right arm. My buddy would move the weight to 50 pounds. Five more reps. We continued this process all the way down the stack until I couldn’t do five reps. Then the fun started. We’d go back up to stack, 10 pounds at a time, to the starting weight of 40 pounds. We called these burnout sets, and the shoulder pump was unbelievable.

当然，现在您不需要合作伙伴，您只需将左手放在配重架上，然后一路向下和向上改变重量即可。当时效果很好，而且我想人体并没有发生太大变化，所以今天可能值得一试。您当然可以在哑铃架上上下移动，或者像我们在我的训练组中所做的那样，在地上放一排壶铃进行相同的基本锻炼。

Of course, now you don’t need a partner for that—you just put your left hand on the weight stack and changed the weights all the way down and back up. It worked well then, and I imagine the human body hasn’t changed that much, so it might well be worth a try today. You certainly can go up and down the dumbbell rack, or do like we do at my training group with a row of kettlebells on the ground doing the same basic workout.

我学校的代表队投掷运动员想出了一个很好的方法来帮助铅球比赛。他们只做单打，但每一次都以一种疯狂、混乱的方式改变了次数。对于投掷运动员来说，这个想法很有价值，但我在职业生涯的大部分时间里都忽略了这一点——速度的变化对于投掷运动员或拳击手来说是一个极好的补充。唉，我忘了使用它，但也许下一代精英投掷运动员会记得。

The varsity throwers at my school came up with a nice twist on this to help the shot put. They only did singles, but changed the reps in a wild, chaotic way each and every rep. There’s gold in this idea for throwers, which I ignored most of my career—the variation of speed is an excellent supplement for a thrower or fighter. Alas, I forgot to use it, but perhaps the next generation of elite throwers will remember.

在进行这些单臂训练时，我们都注意到的一件事是我们的腰部会多么酸痛。

One of the things we all noticed from doing these one-armed workouts is how sore we’d get around the waist.

在成长过程中，我们将肋骨和臀部之间的区域称为“腰部”。现在，我们把它称为核心，并收取很多钱来帮助你训练它。

Growing up, we called the area between our ribs and hips the ‘waist.’ Now, we call it the core and charge a lot of money to help you train it.

这就是进行单臂过头训练的目的之一：它对你从脚趾到头顶的挑战。现在，我并不是要求我们开始像老泰姆强人那样穿着豹纹和俏皮的小胡子，但力量运动有一个伟大的传统，那就是单手将重物举过头顶。就像每一个伟大的举重理念一样，它的受欢迎程度也经历过起落。

And this is part of the point of doing single-arm overhead work: It challenges you from your toes to the top of your head. Now, I’m not calling for us to start dressing like Ye Olde Tyme Strongman with leopard prints and a saucy mustache, but there’s a great tradition in strength sports to put weights overhead one-handed. Like every great lifting idea, it has ebbed and flowed through its popularity.

我认为单臂推举有五个优点。

I see five advantages to one-arm pressing.

第一的

First

整个身体支撑着一侧肢体所做的工作。这使我们能够用一只手承受比两只手更大的重量。

The whole body is supporting the work done by one limb. This allows us to use more weight with one hand than we can handle with two.

让我们说得更清楚一点。

Let’s make that a little more clear.

如果我能单手按压110磅，我就有两条腿和一个躯干支撑它。

If I can one-hand press 110 pounds, I have two legs and one torso supporting it.

如果我每只 手各放 110 磅的重量，我仍然有两条腿和一个躯干支撑它。现在，我知道我可以用一只手按 110，但是双 110（总共 220 个）将是一个巨大的挑战。我的三角肌、三头肌和支撑单臂举重的整块肌肉都受到了真正的考验。

If I put 110 pounds in each hand, I still have two legs and one torso supporting it. Now, I know I can press 110 with one hand, but double-110s—220 total—would be a great challenge. My deltoids, triceps and the whole gang of muscles supporting this one-arm lift are really tested.

是的，如果你做单肢动作的重量足够大，你实际上会让手臂超负荷。诚然，两只手臂的总量更高，但一只手臂的局部负荷更重。对于肥大来说，这几乎感觉像是作弊。

Yes, you actually overload the arm, if you go heavy enough, by doing one-limb movements. True, the total amount is higher with two arms, but the local load is heavier with one. For hypertrophy, it almost feels like cheating.

第二

Second

这应该不足为奇，单臂举重是不对称的。底线是——不对称的工作更加困难。

This should be no surprise, one-arm lifting is asymmetrical. The bottom line is this—Asymmetrical work is harder.

我强烈建议在单臂举起时使用合作伙伴或镜子。我寻找下巴、胸骨和拉链线，即我的 CSZ 线，在按压时基本上保持垂直。在大负载下会出现一些扭曲和转动，但请尽可能限制垂直方向的扭曲。

I strongly recommend either using a partner or a mirror when one-arm lifting. I look for the Chin, Sternum and Zipper line, my CSZ Line, to basically remain in vertical while pressing. There will be some twisting and turning under great loads, but limit the twists from vertical as best you can.

最近有人问我：“当我开始扭转时我该怎么办？”

I was recently asked, “What do I do when I start twisting?”

“停止。”

“Stop.”

我以为我很聪明。

I thought I was brilliant.

第三

Third

单臂举升机的设备需求较少。

Equipment needs for one-arm lifts are fewer.

在我以前的健身房里，我有 113 个壶铃，但其中一组太轻，无法进行按压。让 40 名运动员都按双壶铃，我们必须分享，这当然很好。但通过使用单人，整个团队可以同时举起。看到许多人全神贯注地上下举重，感觉很神奇。

At my old gym, I had 113 kettlebells, but a group of them were far too light for pressing. To have 40 athletes all pressing double kettlebells, we had to share and that, of course, was fine. But by using singles, the whole group could lift at once. There’s something magical about watching that many people intensely focused on pressing weights up and down.

第四

Fourth

轻负荷且仅使用一侧肢体时，会有一种积极休息的感觉。

With a light load and using only one limb, there’s a sense of active rest.

帕维尔有一个关于军队的有趣故事——

Pavel has this funny story about the military—

一群二等兵正在铲土。几个小时后，其中一个人问道：“先生，我们什么时候休息？”

A bunch of privates are shoveling dirt. After a few hours, one of them asks, “Sir, when do we rest?”

军官回答：“啊。如果将泥土扔得更远，泥土在空气中停留的时间就会更长。当空气中充满灰尘时，你就可以休息了。”

The officer answers, “Ah. If you throw the dirt farther, the dirt will be in the air longer. You can rest when the dirt is in the air.”

我对单臂举重时休息的看法似乎与那个笑话中的差不多。当另一条肢体工作时，您会休息。有趣的是，身体似乎能够通过换手来支持一次又一次的重复。当然，当你前进时，代表们会面临挑战，但这将我们带到下一个也是最后一点。

My vision of rest during one-arm lifts seems about the same as in that joke. You rest while the other limb is working. The funny thing is, the body seems more than able to support rep after rep by switching hands. Of course, the reps are challenging as you move along, but that brings us to the next and final point.

第五

Fifth

单臂推举自然会导致更长的组数。如果紧张或负荷下的时间是健美或肥大的关键，那么交替双手并继续运动肯定会增加时间。打电话给爱因斯坦了解增加时间的具体细节，但那些曾经用石膏固定过肢体的人都知道，对健康的手臂或腿进行锻炼似乎可以将受伤一侧的萎缩降至最低。身体是一个宏伟的整体，只有一个血液系统，这些较长的组可能会导致肥大。

One-arm pressing naturally leads to longer sets. If time under tension or load is the key to bodybuilding or hypertrophy, alternating hands and continuing to move will certainly increase time. Call Einstein for the specifics on increasing time, but those who have ever had a limb in a cast know that working on the healthy arm or leg seems to keep the atrophy of the injured side to a minimum. The body is one magnificent piece with only a single blood system, and hypertrophy could come with these longer sets.

根据我的经验以及那些愿意尝试的人的经验，我们认为它是有效的。

In my experience, and in those willing to try it, we think it works.

我相信站立做单臂推举。我已经坐着完成这些动作，例如在手术后，但是将整个身体楔入壶铃下方进行这些动作是有价值的。

I believe in doing one-arm presses standing. I’ve done them seated, for example after a surgery, but there’s a value to doing them with the whole body wedged underneath the kettlebell.

如果您以前从未做过这些，请保持较低的次数，也许是两到五次，然后习惯这个动作。我强烈建议保持肘部垂直于手腕下方，就像卧推一样。同样，镜子在这里可以提供帮助。

If you’ve never done these before, keep the reps low, maybe two to five reps, and get used to the movement. I strongly suggest keeping the elbow vertical under the wrist as in the bench press. Again, a mirror can help here.

我在教学中使用了一些姿势的变化——有一些有趣的名字，比如自下而上的推举和侍者推举——但大多数时候，只是努力保持肘部与手腕在一条直线上。

There are some variations in position that I use in teaching this—with interesting names like the bottom-up press and the waiter press—but most of the time, just strive to keep the elbow in line with the wrist.

对于年龄较大的学员来说，单臂推举可以锻炼弗拉基米尔·詹达（Vladimir Janda）教给我们的所有肌肉，这些肌肉会随着年龄的增长而减弱。换句话说，如果一个 50 多岁的男人问我“那个问题”——如果你只能做一次举重，那会是什么？——我会回答，“单臂推举。”

For the older trainee, the one-arm press works all the muscles Vladimir Janda taught us will weaken with age. In other words, if a 50-plus man asked me ‘that question’—If you could only do one lift, what would it be?— I’d answer, “One-arm presses.”

是的，它甚至可以锻炼臀部，因为当你用一只手臂将一半体重压过头顶时，你的臀部不会下垂。

Yes, it even works the glute, as you can’t have a saggy butt when pressing half-bodyweight overhead with one arm.

尝试增加单臂按压量。单臂推举没有竞赛，也没有金牌，但奖励是丰厚的。

Experiment with increasing your one-arm pressing volume. There’s no contest or gold medal for one-arm pressing, but the rewards are great.

如果你有对称性，你可以升级到推举或其他爆炸性动作。然而，我强烈建议不要进行弹道运动，直到与其他基本人体运动（尤其是拉力和铰链）对称为止。

If you have symmetry, you may move up to the push-press or other explosive moves. However, I strongly suggest holding off on ballistic movements until you have symmetry with the other basic human movements, especially the pull and the hinge.

那么，就这样吧。按压是大多数人最喜欢的动作，但仍然需要从图案、打磨和对称的角度来看待按压。没有什么比在头顶上举重或在卧推上完成大量动作更有价值的了。除了无数组卧推之外，还可以通过平板支撑和单臂推举来获得长期的进步。

So, there you go. The press is most people’s favorite move, but there’s still a need to look at the push from the lens of patterning, grinding and symmetry. There are few things more rewarding than holding a big lift overhead or nailing a big number in the bench press. Long-term improvement can come from including some work with planks and one-arm presses in addition to the countless sets of bench presses.

你的肩膀也会感谢我的。

Your shoulders will thank me, too.

健康与肥胖之间的差距似乎每天都在扩大。肥胖人数似乎每年都在以一种令人震惊的方式增长，从而影响了未来的医疗保健。在这场游戏中，饮食、食品和减肥行业的每个人都与钱袋子息息相关，我们很少听到营养建议不立即遭到另一位专家的反驳。

The gap between fitness and fatness seems to widen each day. It seems each year obesity numbers grow in ways that stagger future medical care. With everyone in the diet, food and fat-loss industries tied to the money-bag in this game, rarely do we hear nutritional advice that isn’t immediately countered by another expert.

拉

Pull

我最近读到，我们每个人吃的卷心菜数量约为以前的三十分之一，萝卜和甜菜等食物正在从餐桌上消失。 （拜托，我并不是在提倡卷心菜、萝卜和甜菜饮食，尽管它比我们看到的一些饮食计划要好。）相反，我们吃玉米糖和廉价碳水化合物，它们使我们变成了气球——人们看看我们看到的购物中心。

I recently read that we each eat about one-30th the amount of cabbage we used to eat, and foods like turnips and beets are vanishing from the table. (Please, I am not advocating a cabbage, turnip and beet diet, although it’s better than some of the food plans we see.) Instead, we eat corn sugar and cheap carbohydrates that turn us into the balloon-people look we see at the mall.

然而在健身行业，那些健康的人越来越多地与身体问题作斗争，这些问题很容易解决，但很少能解决。在这种情况下，我谈论的是撇号、凹陷的箱子或爷爷的行走。换句话说，大多数人进行大量的水平推举动作，而对水平划船的无知，导致我们的运动员肩膀向前滚动，脖子向前伸长，胸部变浅。

Yet in the fitness industry, those who are fit struggle more and more with physical issues that could just easily be addressed but rarely are. In this case, I’m talking about the apostrophe, the sunken chest or the grandpa walk. In other words, the massive number of horizontal pressing movements most people do and an ignorance of horizontal rowing has led us to athletes with shoulders rolled forward, necks craned ahead and shallow chests.

它不仅看起来老旧、病态，而且确实影响运动成功。

Not only does it look old and morbid, it really impacts athletic success.

令人惊奇的是，没有什么比这更容易修复的了。现在，我总是听到这样的争论：“嘿，我划船！”可悲的是，大多数人划船的方式都充满活力，相比之下，奥林匹克举重似乎很慢。二头肌和下背部接近受伤的危险，并且关键的拉动肌肉继续打盹。

The amazing thing is there isn’t anything easier to fix. Now, I hear the argument all the time, “Hey, I do rows!” Sadly, most people row in a way that’s so dynamic, Olympic lifts seems slow in comparison. The biceps and lower back get dangerously close to injured and the key pulling muscle continues to nap.

我对解剖学的了解几乎为零（尽管我知道我喜欢什么；我会等你笑到胃痉挛），但你的背部有一块有趣的小肌肉，叫做菱形肌。菱形就像指定的司机：你真的应该感激它，但是，好吧，你忘了。

I know almost zero about anatomy (although I know what I like; I will wait as you chuckle yourself to a stomach cramp), but there’s a funny little muscle in your back called the rhomboid. The rhomboid is like the designated driver: You really should appreciate it, but, well, you forgot.

菱形肌的作用是收缩肩胛骨，但它似乎很高兴让动力来完成这项工作。我在几页前提到过，捷克斯洛伐克的神经学家和运动生理学家弗拉基米尔·扬达博士将其分类为快肌，他称之为相位肌，这种肌会随着年龄的增长或忽视而减弱。

The rhomboid is there to retract the shoulder blades, but it seems glad to let momentum do the work. It was classified by Dr. Vladimir Janda, the Czechoslovakian neurologist and exercise physiologist I mentioned a few pages ago, as a fast twitch muscle, what he called a phasic muscle—one that weakens with age or neglect.

忽视菱形会让你变老。

And ignoring the rhomboid will age you.

如果你想在10天内看起来立即年轻，就爱上菱形吧。通过一些简单的动作，您可以重新调整事物的模式，增强自己，检查左右问题，增加您的训练时间并减少您的姿势。

If you want to look instantly younger in 10 days, fall in love with the rhomboid. With a few simple moves, you can re-pattern things, build yourself up, check for side-to-side issues, add years to your training and take years off your posture.

典型的锻炼会忽略菱形肌。发展中上背部肌肉将平衡您的锻炼并帮助您站得更高。此外，大多数努力获得瘦体重的人似乎也有姿势问题……这会导致软组织问题……从而导致长期问题。

A typical workout ignores the rhomboids. Developing this mid-upper back muscle will balance your workout and help you stand taller. Moreover, most guys struggling to gain lean body mass also seem to have posture issues…that lead to soft-tissue issues…that lead to long-term issues.

现在让我们解决这个问题。

Let’s fix this now.

我们总是从模式开始。在基本的拉动中，我们已经根深蒂固地倾向于利用速度和动力来忽略我们较弱的小区域——或者也许这只是我的情况。这会导致一些真正的问题。我用于拉动的基本动作是我的新备用动作——蝙蝠翼动作。

We always begin with the pattern. In the basic pull, we have ingrained ourselves toward using speed and momentum to ignore our weaker little areas—or maybe that’s just me. And that leads to some real issues. The basic patterning movement I use for pulls is my new standby, the batwing.

蝙蝠翼

Batwings

以下是如何执行这些操作。抓起一对沉重的壶铃或哑铃，面朝下躺在长凳上，将重物放在身下的地板上。将哑铃拉向胸腔，在顶部将肩胛骨挤压一秒钟。如有疑问，请将拇指放在腋下进行此练习。从鸟瞰角度来看，你的躯干应该像蝙蝠翅膀。从侧面看，它看起来像蝙蝠翅膀。在某种程度上，也许吧。

Here’s how to do these. Grab a heavy pair of kettlebells or dumbbells and lie face down on a bench, resting the weights on the floor below you. Pull the weights up toward your ribcage, squeezing your shoulder blades together for a second at the top. When in doubt, stick your thumbs in your armpits on this drill. From a bird’s-eye view, your torso should resemble batwings. It seems to look like batwings from the side. In a way, maybe.

这个动作很轻微，重物仅上下移动约六英寸。拉得越高，挤压肩胛骨的力度就越大。进行四到五组，每组五次重复。重复动作很简单，类似于等长收缩。

This movement is slight, the weights move up and down only about six inches. The higher you pull, the harder you squeeze your shoulder blades. Perform four or five sets of five repetitions. The reps are simple, something akin to an isometric squeeze.

当我第一次写关于蝙蝠翼的文章时，我收到了一封来自一个人的电子邮件，要求提供有关如何制作蝙蝠翼的视频，因为图片不够好。嘿，看，这是一个等轴测图——没有运动。等距视频看起来很像图片。正如我们所说，“我只是说说而已。”

When I wrote about batwings for the first time, I got an email from a guy asking for a video of how to do them because the picture wasn’t good enough. Hey, look, this is an isometric—there’s no movement. A video of an isometric would look a lot like a picture. As we say, “I’m just saying.”

当然，可以增加保持时间和重量，但要注重质量。任何人都可以做更多糟糕的代表，但高质量的代表就像西雅图的阳光灿烂的日子——很少见，但受欢迎。

Certainly, increase the time of the holds and the weights, but err on the side of quality. Anybody can do more bad reps, but quality reps are like sunny days in Seattle—rare, but welcome.

我最近一直在尝试没有重量的蝙蝠翼。确实，这很简单，但很容易忽视这一点：首先，将背靠在墙上。双脚离墙一两英尺就可以了，然后用平板支撑身体。确保你的臀部紧绷。现在将肘部压入墙壁，直到将拇指放在腋下。还有……坚持住。

I’ve recently been experimenting with batwings without weight. It’s true it’s simple, but the point is easily missed: To begin, lean your back against a wall. Having your feet a foot or two away from the wall is fine, and plank your body. Make sure your glutes are tight. Now press your elbows into the wall until you get into the position of having your thumbs in your armpits. And…hold it.

我们发现不要让你的头接触墙壁会有帮助，因为脖子会想要帮忙，但我们不希望这样。这就是“裸蝙蝠翼”的全部内容，但如果您没有感觉到菱形肌痉挛，您可能会错过这个想法。为了增加难度，调整你的脚。对于某些人来说，让伴侣推肘部就足以产生感觉。

We discovered that not having your head touch the wall helps, as the neck will want to help and we don’t want that. That’s all the “naked batwing” is, but if you don’t feel your rhomboids cramping, you might be missing the idea. To make it harder, adjust your feet. For some people, having a partner push against the elbows is enough resistance to get a feel for things.

一个有趣的旁注：当我训练许多领域的精英时，我经常在第一组蝙蝠翼之后做一些伏都教，压在上中背部。听到像机关枪一样的声音，运动员经常说：“哇，这就是我需要的。”我不建议让任何人背部受伤，但这个练习确实可以减轻上背部的紧张程度。

An interesting side note: When I train elites in many fields, I often do a bit of voodoo after the first set of batwings, pressing down on the upper middle back. There’s a sound like a machine gun and the athlete often states, “Wow, that’s what I needed.” I’m not recommending popping anyone’s back, but this exercise really lights up the amount of tension being held in the upper back.

老实说，我可以停在这里并知道我已经改变了生活。但让我们继续下一步。当且仅当你看到姿势有所改善，或者如果——而且这种情况发生了——人们问你是否减肥“或其他什么”，那就转向较慢、磨人的划船。顺便说一句，人们说你看起来更好了，这也不错。这意味着你的姿势和系统正在回到原来的位置。

Honestly, I could just stop here and know I’ve changed lives. But let’s move to the next step. If, and only if, you see some improvements in posture or if—and this happens—people ask if you lost weight “or something,” move to the slower, grinding rows. It’s not bad for people to say you look better, by the way. It’s means your posture and system are moving back into a place.

水平行

Horizontal Rows

我们中的许多人需要重新集中注意力并将注意力转移到水平行上。现在有很多选择，而当我年轻的时候，我们有Reg Park杠铃划船和一些单臂划船。如今有数十种机器，从简单到复杂，再到类似 Tron 的机器。

Many of us need to refocus and redirect our attention on horizontal rows. There are plenty of options now, whereas when I was young we had the Reg Park barbell row and some one-arm variations. There are dozens of machines today that range from simple to complex to Tron-like.

不过，关键是：放慢速度并挤压到顶部。事实上，我喜欢在杠铃举到胸部的位置上稍微停顿一下，至少数一数。如果你做不到这一点，要么减轻重量，要么结束这组动作。

Here’s the key, though: Slow down and squeeze at the top. In fact, I like a slight pause, at least a one-count, in the position where you have the bar up at the chest. If you can’t do this, either go lighter or end the set.

最近我发现了一件有趣的事情。许多人的行的问题是对称性。我有一个有趣而简单的测试方法，我称之为人体平板支撑划船。

I discovered an interesting thing lately. The issue with many people’s rows is symmetry. I have a fun and simple way of testing this that I call human plank rows.

拉起

Pullup

我测试拉力的磨练标准一直是引体向上。这不是一个完美的解决方案——我和一些运动员一起工作，他们可以做很多引体向上，但也因为这种糟糕的姿势而看起来要向前摔倒。但是，引体向上是有价值的。乔什·希利斯 (Josh Hillis) 指出，能够完成 3 次引体向上和 3 次臂屈伸的女性几乎总能解决体脂问题。正如乔什所说，这项运动的力量似乎与女性的“摇滚明星身材”有着奇怪的相关性。

The grinding standard for me in testing the pull has always been the pullup. This isn’t a perfect solution—I work with athletes who can do lots of pullups, but also look like they’re about to tumble forward because of such awful posture. But, there’s a value to pullups. Josh Hillis notes that a woman who can do three pullups and three dips almost always has her bodyfat issues locked down. Strength in this movement seems to have an odd correlation with a woman being “rockstar fit,” as Josh says.

如果一个人不能做引体向上，那就有明显的问题了。 Wil Hefernan 指出，如果您能做 15 次引体向上，您就可能能够做大多数运动要求的任何事情。正是这种摩擦，这种没有人和太多人之间的紧张关系，导致了支持运动员的最大混乱。

If a man can’t do a pullup, there are obvious issues. Wil Hefernan notes that if you can do 15 pullups, you’re probably able to do anything most sports require. It’s this rub, this tension between none and too many, that causes the most confusion in supporting athletes.

所发生的情况是，我们有一些极端的人，他们要么不能做引体向上，要么可以做几十个引体向上。至少，他们是这么告诉我的。

What happens is we have these extremes of people who can do either no pullups or can crank through dozens. At least, that’s what they tell me.

很少有人不能进行更多的拉动作，而这个基本的拉动作仍然是一个很好的测试。当然，有些人做得太过分了，但同样，这种情况很少见。

It’s a rare person who can’t use more pulling work, and this basic pulling move remains a fine test. Certainly, there are some who overdo it, but, again, that’s rare.

最近帕维尔提醒我腹轮的巨大价值，但你可能错过了重点：腹轮是做引体向上的正确方法。整个前链的张力应该被锁定，使整个身体成为运动的一部分。话虽如此，我们现在可以插入所有关于腹轮的笑话。

I was recently reminded by Pavel of the great value of the ab wheel, but you might miss the point: The ab wheel is the right way to do a pullup. The tension on the whole anterior chain should be so locked down that the whole body becomes part of the movement. Having said that, we can now insert all the jokes about ab wheels.

中年男性每次引体向上应该做五个腹轮。为什么？我正在筹集资金来治疗 MAPS。这也被称为中年引体向上综合症。在某个生日之后，重复做这个动作就会开始让肘部发出声音。我从帕维尔那里得到了关于这一点的暗示，并将我的重复次数保持在两到三次，并做很多组。这不会伤害我的肘部，而且可以让我继续比赛。如果做高次数引体向上时肘部疼痛，就不要做。重复次数越多，情况也不会好转。

Middle-aged men should do five ab wheels for every pullup. Why? I am raising money to cure MAPS. This is also known as Middle-Aged Pullup Syndrome. After a certain birthday, doing reps in this move starts to make the elbows bark. I took a hint from Pavel on this and keep my reps at two or three, and do lots of sets. This doesn’t hurt my elbows and it keeps me in the game. Don’t do high-rep pullups if your elbows ache when you do them. This will not get better with more reps.

通过进行腹轮训练，我们可以获得引体向上的好处，而不会出现肘部问题。如果你的肘部被咬伤，你需要一段时间才能真正再次做引体向上。在此宁可谨慎，少做而不是多做。

By doing the ab wheel work, we’re getting the benefit of the pullup without the elbow issues. If you get the elbow bite, it’s going to be a while before you can really do pullups again. Err on the side of caution here and do less rather than more.

单臂平板支撑划船

One-Arm Plank Rows

这件事做起来比解释起来容易。用一只手抓住好朋友的手或坚固的柱子。现在，使用完全没有滚动或摇摆的完美平板支撑，远离你的伴侣，直到你拥有完全笔直但紧凑的手臂。现在划船回到垂直位置。如果一侧无法固定住木板或在任何时候向外滚动，那么，就出现了对称问题。

This one is easier to do than to explain. Grab the hand of a good friend or a sturdy post with one hand. Now, with a perfect plank with absolutely no rolling or sway, lean away from your partner until you have a perfectly straight but packed arm. Now row yourself back to vertical. If one side can’t hold the plank or rolls out at any point, well, there you go—you have symmetry issues.

我用基本的方法解决对称问题——在那一侧做更多的重复。这是一个价值百万美元的秘密：不要做一组 20 次的动作。要解决对称问题，请做 20 组，每组一组。这是一种精神上的改变，可以很快解决这个问题。不要猛烈地完成一组动作，而是停下来，重新集中注意力，完成每一次动作。

I fix the symmetry issues in the basic way—do more reps on that side. Here’s the million-dollar secret: Don’t do a set of 20 reps. To fix symmetry issues, do 20 sets of one. It’s a mental change that leads to a very quick fix of this problem. Rather than bashing through a set, stop and refocus each and every rep.

它有效。

And it works.

如果你身体不对称，那么一组又一组的杠铃划船会导致你抬头看着我抱怨，“这正在伤害我的下背部。”不要那样做！

If you have asymmetries, crashing and bashing through set after set of barbell rows is going to lead to you looking up at me and whining, “This is killing my lower back.” Don’t do that!

一旦你重新唤醒你的菱形肌，暂停你的磨练并实现对称，你可能会发现很多困扰你的非手术损伤都会减轻。实际上，您可能会发现很难找到那么多泡沫轴的热点，并且您的脊椎按摩师就诊次数可能会大大减少。令人惊奇的是，这种方法可以在短短几周内产生奇迹。

Once you reawaken your rhomboids, pause in your grinds and achieve symmetry, you might find a lot of your nagging nonsurgical injuries will ease. You might actually find it harder to discover as many hot spots to foam roll, and your chiropractor visits may be cut way down. What’s amazing is that this approach can work wonders in just a few weeks.

髋关节铰链

The Hip Hinge

我将告诉你你能做的最强大的事情，但遗憾的是，大多数人不知道如何去做。

I am going to tell you about the single most powerful thing you can do and yet sadly, most people have no concept of how to do it.

这是铰链。

It’s the hinge.

这是臀部折断、臀部猛击以及教练用来教年轻的九年级新生如何像 NFL 线卫那样铲球的各种不恰当术语。只要学习正确的动作就可以增强腿筋的灵活性。带着巨大的负荷慢慢地做可以给你几代的朋友留下深刻的印象。学会在运动中保持对称可以让您开启无伤的职业生涯。

It’s the hip snap, the hip slam and all of the various inappropriate terms coaches have used to teach young virgin ninth graders to tackle like NFL linebackers. Just learning the move right can open up hamstring flexibility. Doing it slowly with a massive load can impress your friends for generations. Learning to have symmetry in the movement can jumpstart you to an injury-free career.

而且，要做得快吗？这是减脂、增强力量和提高运动能力的一站式服务。秋千是铰链运动食物链的顶端，是生活、运动和健身房中最不受重视的动作。

And, to do it fast? It’s the one-stop shop to fat loss, power and improved athletic ability. Swings, the top of the food chain in hinge movements, are the most under-appreciated move in life, in sport and in the gym.

一组高质量的挥杆对新陈代谢的影响是令人震惊的，而且更多地体现在力量和体能训练方面。如果我能做的就是教正确的挥杆动作并鼓励某种形式的硬拉，我知道我会对运动员产生影响。

The metabolic hit of a quality set of swings is shocking, and is much more on the conditioning side of strength and conditioning. If all I can do is teach a proper swing and encourage some form of deadlift, I know I will be making an impact on an athlete.

布伦·霍尔（Breon Hole）在壶铃挥杆方面遇到了困难，乔什·维尔特（Josh Vert）请我帮忙，因为她的下背部在重复几次后发出尖叫声。不到两下，我就阻止了她，“秋千不会伤你的背；秋千不会伤你的背；”无论你做什么都会伤到你的背。”

Breon Hole was struggling with her kettlebell swing and Josh Vert asked me to help out because her lower back screamed after a few repetitions. Within two reps, I stopped her with, “Swings don’t hurt your back; whatever you’re doing hurts your back.”

布伦问道：“好吧，我做错了什么？”

Breon asked, “Well, what am I doing wrong?”

我发现的是：我可以看到问题，但我没有能力解决它。我知道练习，我们可以推、拉、刺激她，让她做出更好的动作，但我很难向她解释这个问题。

What I discovered was this: I could see the problem, but I had no ability to fix it. I knew drills and we could have pushed, pulled and prodded her to better movement, but I was struggling to explain the problem to her.

布伦的膝盖弯曲得太多，导致壶铃放得太低，所有的力量都被抛向了她的下背部。有时也称为蹲式秋千。

Breon was bending her knees too much, which let the kettlebell go too low, which tossed all the forces toward her lower back. It’s sometimes called the squatting swing.

当我大声说出这句话时，我的举重小世界变得绝对清晰。

When I said that out loud, my little world of lifting had absolute clarity.

你看-

You see—

秋千不是深蹲。

深蹲不是秋千。

The swing is not a squat.

The squat is not a swing.

这是我教学生涯中最伟大的见解。我们走到白板前，开始讨论这个概念。它很快被称为髋关节位移连续体。

It was the greatest insight of my teaching career. We went to a white board and began talking about this notion. It soon became known as the hip displacement continuum.

髋关节位移连续体

The Hip Displacement Continuum

几分钟之内，我在davedraper.com的论坛上发布了这个想法的第一个有趣的内容。

Within a few minutes, I posted a first tickler of the idea at my forum at davedraper.com.

Breon 和 Josh Vert 问了一个很好的问题，我们解决了这个问题，然后我打电话给 Mark Twight 讨论这个连续体概念。布伦曾被教导如何从深蹲开始挥杆，并被告知：“如果你不深蹲，你就是在作弊。”

Breon and Josh Vert asked a good question, we worked it through, and then I called Mark Twight to talk about this continuum concept. Breon had been taught to do swings from a deep squat and was told, “You’re cheating if you don’t deep squat.”

嗯，不……

Well, no…

将其放在彩虹曲线或连续体上。

Put this on a rainbow curve or continuum.

最左边：秋千

On the far left: Swings

最右边：高脚杯深蹲

On the far right: Goblet squats

人体可以实现的最有力的运动来自于这种摆动位置，或者最近被称为铰链运动。

The most powerful movements the human body can achieve are from this swing position or, as it has been called more recently, the hinge movement.

帕维尔对这个概念做了很多补充。铰链运动，就像秋千一样，具有深度的臀部运动和最小的膝盖弯曲。深蹲动作对臀部和膝盖都有深度运动。

Pavel has added much to this concept. Hinge movements, like the swing, have deep hip movement and minimal knee bend. Squat movements have deep movements in both the hip and the knee.

所以，要记住——

So, to memorize—

铰接臀部（摆动、跳跃）意味着臀部运动最大，膝盖运动最小

Hinge the hips (swings, jumps) means maximal hip movement, minimal knee movement

深蹲意味着最大髋关节运动、最大膝关节运动

Squats mean maximal hip movement, maximal knee movement

如果你正在走路，一条响尾蛇穿过你的道路，那么跳跃将更多地发生在连续体的铰链侧。如果你首先想亲吻响尾蛇，那么这个动作就是蹲下。你决定，但我毫不怀疑我会做什么。

If you’re walking and a rattlesnake crosses your path, that leap away will be more on the hinge side of the continuum. If you first wish to kiss the rattler, that movement would be a squat. You decide, but I have no question about which I would do.

糟糕的跳投者一开始就会有大量的膝盖弯曲，并会削弱臀部的弹力。不好的深蹲者会过度弯曲膝盖，而忽略臀部的运动。这个连续体永远为我澄清了这个想法。这是脑力劳动可以提高身体表现的少数几次之一。

Bad jumpers start with a lot of knee bend and diminish the pop of the hinging hips. Bad squatters bend their knees a lot and ignore the hip movement. The continuum clarified this thinking for me forever. It’s one of the few times when mental effort can improve physical performance.

作为测试，我们增加了一系列立定跳远测试。首先，我们鼓励运动员大量弯曲膝盖并“真正使用双腿”，并测试了三跳。然后，我们要求膝盖几乎不弯曲，但臀部动作敏捷。大多数运动员在这种风格下的成绩与最佳成绩相差不到三英寸，而且许多运动员实际上做得更好。

As a test, we added a series of standing long jump tests. First, we encouraged the athlete to use a lot of knee bend and “really use your legs” and tested three jumps. Then, we asked for nearly no knee bend, but a snappy hip movement. Most athletes are within three inches of their best with this style and many athletes actually do better.

最后，允许额外的膝盖弯曲，但强调臀部的爆发力，运动员需要进行更多尝试。在这里获取个人记录比不获取个人记录更常见。

Finally, allowing some additional knee bend but emphasizing the explosive hip, the athlete takes a few more attempts. It’s more common than not to reach personal records here.

帕维尔将这种僵腿秋千称为“翻倒鸟”，就像那些古老的酒吧标准一样，塑料鸟在饮料中来回摆动。当您穿过连续体时，您可能会注意到膝盖弯曲得越来越多，但从来都不是没有。在任何运动过程中，膝盖总是需要轻微弯曲。深蹲初学者犯的最大错误之一就是在动作开始或最高点时锁住膝盖。

Pavel calls the stiff-legged swing ‘the tipping bird,’ like those old bar standards where the plastic bird swings back and forth into a drink. As you move across the continuum, you might note that the knee bends more and more, but it’s never none. There always needs to be a slight bend in the knees during any movement. One of the great errors of beginning squatters is to lock the knees at the start or top of the movement.

终生无需抬高膝盖：保持轻微弯曲。

No need to jack up your knees for life: Keep a slight bend.

想想 70 年代和 80 年代腿部伸展机和腿弯举机的流行是很有趣的。这些运动不使用臀部或深度弯曲膝盖，但有一些研究表明这些运动对膝盖来说很糟糕。大自然似乎最了解训练。

It’s interesting to think about the popularity of leg extension and leg curl machines in the ‘70s and ‘80s. These use no hip or deep knee bending, but there has been some research indicating these movements are terrible for the knees. Mother Nature seems to know best when it comes to training.

当人们抱怨秋千伤害腰部时，通常是因为他们把这个动作变成了下蹲秋千。始终攻击拉链、铰接臀部、使臀部折叠……或任何对你有帮助的线索。

When people complain that swings hurt the low back, it’s often because they have turned the movement into a squatting swing. Always attack the zipper, hinge the hips, make the hips fold…or whatever clue helps you.

当人们抱怨深蹲伤害膝盖时，花点时间提示一下臀部。铰链是通过将枪托向后推来实现的。刚开始学习时，大多数人都会过度弯曲膝盖。您确实需要最小程度的膝盖弯曲。

When people complain that squats hurt their knees, take a moment to cue the hips. The hinge is achieved by pushing the butt back. When first learning, most people will excessively bend the knees. You truly need minimal knee bend.

再次是这个公式。



Here’s the formula, again.



深蹲：最大膝盖弯曲和最大髋部弯曲

铰链：最小膝盖弯曲和最大髋部弯曲

Squat: Maximal Knee Bend and Maximal Hip Bend

Hinge: Minimal Knee Bend and Maximal Hip Bend

髋关节铰链图案化

Patterning the Hip Hinge

铰链比深蹲更有力。关键是立定跳远、立定跳远、抓举、高翻和摆动。这是曲棍球的铲球和检定。在你的脑海中想象这样的画面，不是一个缓慢的下蹲动作，而是一个动态的、臀部回到臀部的动作。获取该图像。

The hinge is more powerful than the squat. The hinge is the vertical jump, the standing long jump, the snatch, the clean and the swing. It’s the tackle and the check in hockey. Get that image in your head, not a slow squatty move, but rather a dynamic, butt back into hip snap. Get that image.

图案非常重要，我几乎每天都会使用以下练习。

The patterning is so important that I use the following drill nearly daily.

站在墙边，背对着墙。铰接臀部，使臀部接触墙壁。距离墙壁约六英寸，重复触碰屁股的动作。再移动一两英寸并重复。继续这样做——触碰墙壁并向外移动一点。

Stand next to a wall, facing away. Hinge at your hips so your butt touches the wall. Step about six inches from the wall and repeat the butt touch. Move an inch or two more and repeat. Keep doing this—touch the wall and scoot a little out a little more.

当你真正感觉到你的腿筋燃烧和颤抖时，你就做对了。就像弓箭一样，这些弦可以提供令人难以置信的力量。

When you really feel your hamstrings burning and shaking, you have it right. Like a bow and arrow, those strings can deliver an unbelievable amount of power.

铰链上的图案可能听起来很奇怪，因为它就像大小便一样自然。但当我们增加负重时，很多人都欺骗自己，没有将屁股向后推，而是将股四头肌作为焦点。

It might sound odd to pattern the hinge, as it’s as natural as relieving yourself. But when we add load, many people cheat themselves by not pushing the butt back and instead use the quads as the focus.

对于顽固的客户（通常这是女性的问题），我使用 HAT（铰链评估测试）。解释起来很残酷，但演示起来很简单，我们在YouTube上有一个视频示例——

For stubborn clients, and usually this is a woman’s issue, I use the HAT, the Hinge Assessment Test. It is brutal to explain, but simple to demonstrate and we have a video example on YouTube—

http://youtu.be/34saz57cxjs

http://youtu.be/34saz57cxjs

虽然一张图片胜过一千个文字，但这段视频也胜过这一点。

Whereas a picture is worth a thousand words, this video trumps that too.

磨削髋关节铰链

Grinding the Hip Hinge

下一个动作将教导和训练你。打好图案后，我们开始打磨。在我们的世界中，磨练意味着缓慢的力量动作，这不仅可以为模式创造奇迹，而且还可以提供大量的新陈代谢工作，显然可以提高力量。

The next movement will both teach and train you. After patterning, let’s work on grinding. Grinding in our world means slow strength moves that do wonders for patterning, but also deliver a lot of metabolic work and, obviously, improve strength.

要磨削髋关节铰链，请使用重沙袋、壶铃或盘子，将重量抱在胸前，将重量基本保持在胸骨和上腹肌上。现在，重复髋部铰链，仍然将重量保持在胸部。我通常会进行一组五次研磨，然后重复墙钻。

To grind the hip hinges, use a heavy sandbag, a kettlebell or a plate, hug the weight to your chest, keeping the weight basically at your sternum and upper abs. Now, repeat the hip hinge, still holding the weight to your chest. I usually do a set of five of the grinds, then repeat the wall drill.

我把这个动作称为保加利亚山羊袋摆动，它是减缓铰链运动并教会琴键进行更动态工作的绝佳方法。在这里，我们寻找的是加压呼吸、铰接髋部的正确感觉以及确保稳定性的腹部紧绷感。要想快速锻炼几乎保证让你的腘绳肌得到锻炼，可以做这些髋部铰链磨削动作，重复次数为 5-10-15-15-10-5。

This movement, which I get a kick out of calling the Bulgarian goat-bag swing, is an excellent way to slow down the hinge movement and teach the keys to more dynamic work. Here we’re looking for pressurized breathing, the correct feeling of the hinged hip, and the abdominal tightness that insures stability. For a swift workout nearly guaranteed to steam up your hamstrings, do these hip hinge grinds for reps, 5-10-15-15-10-5.

另外，硬拉也是一个很好的磨削选择。多年来，我一直坚持将双体重硬拉作为经验法则，以表明某人已经超出了初学者阶段。它可以很好地衡量整体身体力量、握力和适当的训练。女性似乎在 150% 体重的运动中表现出色，但我注意到，几乎无一例外，当女性硬拉 275 及以上时，运动中就会发生好事。

Alternatively, the deadlift is an excellent grinding option. For years I’ve insisted upon a double-bodyweight deadlift as the rule of thumb to indicate someone is beyond the beginner stage. It’s a good measure of overall body strength, grip strength and appropriate training. Women seem to do well in sport with 150% of bodyweight, but I’ve noticed, almost without exception, when a woman deadlifts 275 and above, good things happen in sport.

在我们继续讨论百万美元的走势之前，让我们花几分钟检查一下对称性。你需要一面镜子和一个壶铃。一只手握住壶铃，练习铰链模式。再说一次，如果你必须用墙钻和一些保加利亚山羊袋秋千重新设计铰链，那也没关系。

Before we move on to the million-dollar move, let’s take a few minutes to check symmetry. You’ll need a mirror and a single kettlebell. Hold the kettlebell in one hand and practice the hinge pattern. Again, if you have to re-pattern the hinge with the wall drill and some Bulgarian goat-bag swings, that’s fine.

注意 CSZ 线——“下巴、胸骨和拉链”线——它应该全部保持在一条垂直线上。像拿着手提箱一样拿着壶铃，做几个铰链。正如大多数读者所知，我是单臂动作的忠实粉丝，但这确实有助于束缚对方。如果您发现自己脱线，请重新设计前两次练习。

Watch for the CSZ line—the “chin, sternum and zipper” line—which should all remain in a single vertical line. With the kettlebell in hand like you’d hold a suitcase, do several hinges. As most readers know, I am a big fan of single-arm moves, but this one really helps tie down the opposite side. If you see yourself pulling offline, re-pattern the first two drills.

秋千

The Swing

最后，我们到了秋千上。如果非要我选一个能燃烧脂肪、放松臀部和腿部、将臀部抬高到令人赏心悦目的高度的动作，那就是秋千。请记住，如果您还没有进行图案化、打磨和对称性方面的工作，请先花时间去做。

Finally, we get to the swing. If I had to pick one move that will burn fat, loosen the hips and legs, and raise the buttocks to an eye-pleasing height, it would be the swing. Remember, if you haven’t worked on your patterning, grinding and symmetry, take the time to do it first.

如果您正确地挥杆，那么它就是您一般训练的一站式商店。如果做得正确，秋千是减脂、缓解臀肌和腘绳肌疼痛的门票。但是，“正确完成”是这里的关键。挥杆的教学方式可能会很可怕。一位电视专家——你知道的——推出了一张有关壶铃的 DVD，其中的挥杆技术实际上是不道德的。

If you do swings correctly, it is your one-stop shop for general training. Done correctly, swings are the ticket to fat loss, as well as sore glutes and hammies. But, “done correctly” is the key here. The swing can be taught horrifically. A TV expert—you know the one—came out with a DVD on kettlebells, and the swing technique in it is literally immoral.

挥杆是一个从侧面看很简单的动作，但是学起来有点困难。确保一些有能力的指导值得花费时间、精力和金钱。

The swing is a simple move to look at from the side, but a little difficult to learn. Securing some competent instruction is worth the time, energy and money.

美国运动研究委员会的一项新研究表明，“我们知道壶铃摆动实际上是最好的减肥运动。”

There is a new study from the American Council on Exercise Research, “We know the kettlebell swing actually is the best fat loss movement there is.”

和，

And,

“壶铃锻炼每分钟燃烧 20.2 卡路里。这是双倍动感单车（每分钟 9.8 卡路里）和传统训练营锻炼（每分钟 9.9 卡路里）的两倍。”

“Kettlebell workouts burn 20.2 calories per minute. That’s double Spinning (9.8 calories per minute) and that’s double traditional boot camp workouts (9.9 calories per minute).”

您的标准应该是能够进行 75-250 次挥杆锻炼，并且第二天不会感到酸痛。 75-250 的范围足够大，因此那些挥舞大壶铃以增强力量或轻壶铃以减脂的人都包括在内。

Your standard should be being able to do a workout of 75–250 swings and not be sore the next day. The range of 75–250 is a large enough spread so those who swing big kettlebells for strength or light kettlebells for fat loss are all included.

这个范围是一个奇怪的标准方式，但正如我告诉人们的那样，如果你的腰部在挥杆后受伤，那是你的错。挥杆后下背部酸痛通常表明铰链结构不良。我们不能这样。

That range is an odd way to have a standard, but as I tell people, if your low back hurts after swings, it’s your fault. Soreness in the lower back after swinging often indicates poor hinge mechanics. And we can’t have that.

我认为每周三天 75 次挥杆就可以了。我设定了一个月每天 250 次挥杆的目标，每个人都问我的饮食情况。这太糟糕了，我吃得太多、喝得太多，但从那个 250 秒的小项目开始，我开始看起来很不错。

I think you can get away with as little as 75 swings, three days a week. I made a goal of 250 swings a day one month and everybody asked me about my diet. It was awful and I ate and drank too much, but I started looking pretty good from that little project of 250s.

秋千效果很好。

Swings work that well.

一种方法是想出一个数字，75 对于初学者来说非常适合，然后将其分成小组或 20 或 25 次挥杆。

One route is to come up with a number, 75 is excellent for beginners, and break it into bite-size sets or 20 or 25 swings.

我最喜欢的锻炼是“我去/你去”的重复计划——

My favorite workout is “I go/You go” with this rep scheme—

5-10-15-15-10-5

5-10-15-15-10-5

这就是 60 次，休息时间只有几秒钟。如果我们确实需要教会我们的心攀爬然后快速恢复，那么这就是我的贡献。尽管您最多可以进行五轮，但请先尝试一下，然后再制定晚餐和跳舞的计划。或许。

That’s 60 reps and the rest period is only a few seconds. If it’s true that we need to teach our hearts to climb and then recover quickly, well, here’s my contribution. Although you can do this up to five rounds, try it first, and then make plans for dinner and dancing. Maybe.

30/30 也很有效。三十秒的摆动，然后休息 30 秒，这是在短时间内完成大量工作的绝佳方法。如果您只有 10 分钟，请尝试 30/30。再加上一些农夫散步，你就可以搞定事情了。

30/30 also works well. Thirty seconds of swings, followed by 30 seconds of rest is a marvelous way to get a lot of work into a short period of time. If all you have is 10 minutes, try the 30/30. Toss in a set of farmer walks and you’ve taken care of business.

髋关节铰链在性能方面对人体来说是最好的。花时间了解基础知识，因为我几乎为自己和到处与我一起工作的人进行每一次锻炼。

The hip hinge is as good as it gets for the human body in terms of performance. Take the time to walk through the basics, as I do nearly every workout for both myself and the good people I work with here and there.

挑战很简单：这样做！

The challenge is simple: Do this!

深蹲

The Squat

我对力量和体能训练的最大影响始于一个故事。

The greatest impact I’ve had on strength and conditioning starts with a story.

几年前，面对 400 名无法正确深蹲的运动员，我试图教深蹲，一个又一个动作，一个又一个举起。

Years ago, faced with 400 athletes who couldn’t squat correctly, I attempted to teach the squat, move after move, lift after lift.

我每次都失败了。

I failed each and every time.

我从教一个孩子 Zercher 深蹲（将重量保持在肘部的弯曲处......享受！）中看到了一线希望，当我们用球将壶铃举离地面时，一些人学会了这种模式，称为土豆袋深蹲，因为它们看起来就像从地上捡起一袋土豆。但没有任何效果。

I saw glimmers of hope from teaching one kid the Zercher squat (weight held in the crooks of the elbows…enjoy!), and a few picked up the pattern when we lifted kettlebells off the ground by the ball, called potato sack squats since they look like picking up a sack of potatoes off the ground. But nothing was working.

答案是介于 Zercher 深蹲和土豆深蹲之间。

Somewhere between a Zercher and a potato squat was the answer.

当我在挥杆之间休息时，我想到了这一点，重量举在我面前，就像我拿着圣杯一样。我从那里蹲下来，用肘部把膝盖推出来，瞧，高脚杯蹲了！

It came to me when I was resting between swings with the weight held in front of me like I was holding the Holy Grail. I squatted down from there, pushed my knees out with my elbows and, behold, the goblet squat!

是的，深蹲就是这么简单。这是人类的基本动作，您只需要被提醒如何去做即可。

Yes, the squat is that easy. It’s a basic human movement and you just have to be reminded how to do it.

深蹲对总质量和身体力量的影响可能比所有其他举重动作的总和还要多。做错这些动作可能会比所有其他动作造成更大的伤害。

Squats can do more for total mass and body strength than probably all the other lifts combined. Doing them wrong can do more damage than probably all the other moves, too.

让我们从简单开始吧。找一个没人看的地方蹲下来。在底部，即你能到达的最深处，用肘部将膝盖推出。放松……然后再深入一点。你的脚应该平放在地板上。对于大多数人来说，这个小动作——用肘部推动膝盖——将永远简化深蹲的过程。

Let’s start simple. Find a place where no one is watching and squat down. At the bottom, the deepest you can go, push your knees out with your elbows. Relax…and go a bit deeper. Your feet should be flat on the floor. For the bulk of the population, this small movement—driving your knees out with your elbows—will simplify squatting forever.

接下来，尝试这个小练习。与门把手保持一臂距离。双手抓住手柄，挺胸。向上？想象一下，在加利福尼亚的海滩上，一位泳装模特走过。当我让运动员这样做时，他会立即挺起胸部，从而收紧下背部并锁定整个上半身。背阔肌自然地伸展一点，肩膀向后一点。

Next, try this little drill. Stand arms-length from a door knob. Grab the handle with both hands and get your chest up. Up? Imagine being on a California beach when a swimsuit model walks by. When I have an athlete do this, immediately he puffs up his chest, which tightens the lower back and locks the whole upper body. The lats naturally spread a bit and the shoulders come back a little.

现在，放低自己。

Now, lower yourself down.

人们此刻发现的是一个基本的生理事实。双腿不会像高跷一样卡在躯干下面。相反，躯干悬挂在两腿之间。当你向下倾斜并伸直手臂时，你会发现举重的真正关键之一——

What people discover at this instant is a basic physiological fact. The legs are not stuck like stilts under the torso. Rather, the torso is slung between the legs. As you go down, leaning back with straight arms, you’ll discover one of the true keys of lifting—

你蹲在两腿之间。

You squat between your legs.

你不像手风琴那样折叠和展开——你会沉入双腿之间。

You do not fold and unfold like an accordion—you sink between your legs.

不要只是坐下来读这篇文章：去做吧！

Don’t just sit and read this: Do it!

高脚杯深蹲

The Goblet Squat

现在你已经准备好学习有史以来最好的举重动作——高脚杯深蹲。抓住哑铃或壶铃并将其靠在胸前。使用壶铃时，握住壶角，或者使用哑铃时，只需将其一端保持垂直，就像将高脚杯靠在胸前一样。

Now you’re ready to learn the single best lifting movement of all time—the goblet squat. Grab a dumbbell or kettlebell and hold it against your chest. With a kettlebell, hold at the horns or with a dumbbell, just hold it at one end, vertical, like you’re holding a goblet against your chest.

你看——高脚杯深蹲。

You see—goblet squats.

将重心放在胸前，蹲下，让肘部滑过膝盖内侧。你的肘部朝下，可以将肘部压在膝盖上，在下降时将膝盖向外推出。

With the weight cradled against your chest, squat down with the goal of having your elbows slide past the inside of your knees. Your elbows are pointed down, and it’s okay to have them push against your knees, pushing your knees out as you descend.

在健身房学习动作有一个重要的关键——让身体告诉身体该做什么。听听这个：尽量远离它！对一个动作进行思考常常会导致问题；让肘部向下滑动，接触膝盖内侧，好事就会发生。

There is the big-money key to learning movements in the gym—let the body teach the body what to do. Listen to this: Try to stay out of it! Thinking through a movement often leads to problems; let the elbows glide down by touching the inner knees and good things will happen.

运动员思考得越多，我们就越能找到把事情搞砸的方法。不相信我？加入篮球队并陷入危急境地。在比赛还剩三秒时进行一对一，落后两分，如果您认为思考是个好主意，请稍后再联系我。

The more an athlete thinks, the more we can find ways to screw things up. Don’t believe me? Join a basketball team and get into a crucial situation. Shoot a one-and-one with three seconds to go, down by two points, and get back to me later if you decided thinking was a good idea.

我不确定我是否应该告诉你这一点，但事实是：我认为高脚杯深蹲是大多数人需要的深蹲。如果杠铃在后蹲时受伤（我不会评论），你的手腕在前蹲时受伤（在这里吞掉我的舌头），并且健美操教练禁止你使用踏板箱进行单腿深蹲变化，请尝试高脚杯蹲。说真的，一旦你拿起一个超过 100 磅的壶铃，做几组 10 次的高脚杯深蹲，你可能会想知道第二天早上厕所的水位怎么这么低。

I’m not sure I should tell you this, but here it is: I think goblet squats are all the squatting most people need. If the bar hurts in back squats (I won’t comment), your wrists hurt in front squats (swallowing my tongue here) and the aerobics instructor has banned you from using the step boxes for your one-leg squat variations, try the goblet squat. Seriously, once you grab a kettlebell over 100 pounds and do a few sets of 10 in the goblet squat, you might wonder how the toilet got so low the next morning.

作为脚放置的简单指南，连续进行三个垂直跳跃，然后向下看。这大致就是你每次深蹲时双脚放置的位置。你知道脚趾应该稍微向外伸出，大多数人低下头都会神奇地看到脚趾向外伸出。你不想在这里向东或向西走，但你想要一些脚趾向外。

As a simple guide for foot placement, do three consecutive vertical jumps, then look down. This is roughly where to place your feet every time you squat. You know the toes should be out a little, and most people look down and see the toes magically out. You don’t want to go east and west here, but you want some toe-out.

有一个重要的指导要点需要指出。高脚杯深蹲和我所描述的所有练习都可以教授模式。除非你有这种模式，否则你不应该从事更繁重的工作。我什至会推迟前蹲和后蹲，直到一个人能够证明深蹲的稳定性、灵活性，以及​​最重要的是，深蹲的模式。

There is an important coaching point to be made. The goblet squat and all the drills I’ve described teach patterning. Unless you have the pattern, you shouldn’t move into heavier work. I am to the point where I even hold off front and back squats until a person can prove the stability, flexibility and, most importantly, the patterning of the squat.

双壶铃前蹲

Double-Kettlebell Front Squats

高脚杯深蹲之后，我们现在开始进行深蹲动作（缓慢的力量动作），例如双壶铃前深蹲 (DKFS)。负载保持在前面，这要求整个核心是刚性的。此外，使用两个壶铃时，你仍然可以将肘部向下将膝盖推出。

After the goblet squat, we’re now moving to the grind squats movements—the slow strength moves—like the double-kettlebell front squat (DKFS). The load remains in front, which insists that the whole core be rigid. Moreover, with two kettlebells, you can still have your elbows down to push the knees out.

DKFS 以一种奇怪的方式让人筋疲力尽：就像与蟒蛇摔跤一样，你似乎正在慢慢地将自己窒息而死。当你继续上下润滑时，压力也会教会你保持紧张。此外，DKFS 似乎确实以压缩的方式作用于上背部。这是一种被遗忘的肌肉和力量增强方法，其中不断挤压肌肉系统就是运动，因为没有更好的术语。

DKFS are exhausting in an odd way: Like wrestling an anaconda, you seem to be slowly choking yourself to death. The pressure is also teaching you to stay tight as you continue to grease up and down. Also, the DKFS seems to really work the upper back in the style of compression. This is a forgotten method of muscle and strength building where the constant squeezing of a muscle system is the movement, for lack of a better term.

作为磨练标准，我们当然可以期望在模式建立并且运动员进入磨练后的短时间内进行自重深蹲。再次强调，正如我在标准中指出的那样，如果您能在背上自重的情况下完成 15 次，那么您可能就足够强壮，可以进行几乎任何运动。

As a grinding standard, we can certainly expect a bodyweight squat within a short amount of time after the pattern is established and the athlete moves into grinds. Again, as I noted in the standards, if you can do 15 reps with your bodyweight on your back, you’re probably strong enough to do just about any sport.

单侧深蹲

Single-Side Squats

单侧深蹲提供了一种独特的方式，通过将重量集中在一侧来加强整个身体。这是一个简单的动作：抓住一个壶铃并清洁它。将壶铃紧贴身体——我建议拇指接触上胸肌，前臂紧贴身体——蹲下。

Single-side squats provide a unique way of strengthening the whole body with weight just on one side. It is a simple movement: Grab a single kettlebell and clean it. With the kettlebell tight to the body—I recommend the thumb touching the upper pec and the forearm tight against the body—squat down.

还记得髋关节铰链中的 CSZ 想法吗？我们在这里使用相同的工具。由于负载仅在一侧，身体会发生一些扭曲和枢转。下巴-胸骨-拉链线应始终垂直向上和向下。

Remember the CSZ idea from the hip hinge? We use the same tool here. With the load just on one side, there is some twisting and pivoting by the body. The Chin-Sternum-Zipper line should be vertical all the way up and down.

如果不是，为什么不是呢？

If not, why isn’t it?

几年前，当我的腿真的受伤时，我以为它已经完美康复了。但我无法让自己的身体不扭动（左髋受伤，单侧深蹲最低点时身体向右转）。我花了昂贵的医疗干预来解决这个问题，今天我在单侧深蹲的底部有一个完美的 CSZ。值得庆幸的是，一开始我没有在这种功能障碍中添加弹道，因为我身体的某些部分可能已经脱落！

When I really injured my leg years ago, I thought rehabbed it perfectly. Yet I couldn’t get my body not to twist away (left hip injury, my body turned to the right in the bottom position of the single-side squat). It took an expensive medical intervention to deal with the problem, and today I have a perfect CSZ at the bottom of my single-side squat. Thankfully, early on I didn’t add ballistics to this dysfunction because parts of my body might have come off!

满载携带

Loaded Carries

我发现有件事比我职业生涯中尝试过的任何其他事情都更能提高运动素质。毫无疑问，采用正确的动作可以从根本上改变运动员。众所周知，当迪克·诺特梅尔（Dick Notmeyer）慷慨地坚持让我经常深蹲时，我的体重在四个月内从 162 磅增加到了 202 磅。尽管我在卧推方面比大多数人都更强，但由于缺乏深蹲，我的体重处于更适合滑雪运动员而不是铁饼运动员的范围内。

There’s something I’ve discovered that does more to expand athletic qualities than any other thing I’ve attempted in my career. There is no question that tapping into the right movement can radically change an athlete. Famously, I went from a bodyweight of 162 pounds to 202 in four months when Dick Notmeyer graciously insisted that I squat deep and often. Even though I was stronger in the bench press than most mortals, my lack of squatting kept my bodyweight in a range more appropriate for a skier than a discus thrower.

几年前，我和一个名叫泰德的人一起工作（不是真的，但你明白了）。特德的问题很有趣：他是一名相当扎实的举重运动员（卧推、深蹲和硬拉），并且非常擅长两项奥运会举重项目——抓举和挺举。换句话说，他不是一个追随者，不是一个初学者，不是一个新手，也不是一个网络战士。特德是货真价实的。

A few years ago, I worked with a guy named Ted (not really, but you get the idea). Ted’s issue was interesting: He was a fairly solid powerlifter (bench press, squat and deadlift), and very good at the two Olympic lifts—the snatch and the clean & jerk. In other words, he was not a wannabe, a beginner, a neophyte, nor a internet warrior. Ted is the real deal.

当他来找我寻求建议时，我在举重房里帮不了什么忙。这里有一点，那里有一个想法，我就差不多完成了。所以，完成后，我们走到外面做一些人过去所说的终结者。

When he came to visit with me for advice, there wasn’t a ton I could help with in the weightroom. A point here and an idea there, and I was pretty much finished. So, being finished, we went outside to do what some people used to call a finisher.

“你愿意背负重物、步行还是拉雪橇？”我问。

“Would you rather do carries, walks or sleds?” I asked.

“我从来没有做过这样的事情。”

“I’ve never done any of that kind of thing.”

很好，我想。我可以搭把手。

Good, I thought. I can help.

在他第一次尝试使用每根重 105 磅的农夫金条后几秒钟内，他就醉得踉踉跄跄了。当然，经过几杯酒和大量讨论后的几​​个小时，我们都会变成那样。

Within seconds of his first attempt with the farmer bars weighing 105 pounds each, he was a stumbling drunk. Of course, in a few hours after several drinks and lots of discussion, we both would be that way.

他可以从地板上拉起数百磅的物体，但缺乏稳定性（交叉力量）来用杠铃支撑超过几英尺的距离。我们尝试了重物搬运，他气喘吁吁，就像因为必须挤压 150 磅重的袋子才能移动而窒息一样。从字面上看，他的人体内胎几乎没有超过五秒的射程。

He could pull hundreds of pounds off the floor, but didn’t have the stability—the cross-strength—to handle more than a few feet with the bars. We tried a heavy carry, and he was gasping for breath like being choked by having to squeeze the 150-pound bag to move. Literally, his human inner tube had almost no range past five seconds.

是的，我可以帮忙。

Yeah, I can help.

几周后，我接听了一个我以前听过的电话，“丹，你是个天才（谦卑的教练脸红了，但会意地点点头）。我的硬拉有所提高（从低 500 秒到高 500 秒），而且我全身都变厚了。”

A few weeks later, I answer the phone to a call I have heard before, “Dan, you’re a genius (humbled coach blushes, but nods knowingly). My deadlift has gone up (low 500s to high 500s) and I am just thicker all over.”

我不惊讶。再说一次，在我的教练和举重生涯中，我的工具箱里没有什么比负载运载更能改变游戏规则的了。

I’m not surprised. Again, in my career of coaching and lifting, nothing in my toolbox has been a game-changer like loaded carries.

满载携带

Loaded Carries

我将进位分为三类。事实上，是四个，但你会明白这一点的。

I break the carries into three categories. Actually, it’s four, but you’ll see the point.

手中的重量

Weights in Hand

这些是最简单且最受认可的方法——拿起一两个哑铃或壶铃然后走开。

These are the simplest and most recognized—grab one or two dumbbells or kettlebells and walk away.

单手携带

One-Handed Carries

服务员行走——手臂伸直举过头顶，就像咖啡馆里的欧洲服务员一样。这通常是最轻的一种背法，对肩膀来说有奇效。

Waiter Walk—The weight is held with an arm straight overhead like a European waiter in a café. This is usually the lightest of the carries and does wonders for shoulders.

手提箱步行——这就像穿过机场一样，像手提箱一样抓住重量然后步行。重量另一侧的斜肌第二天会想和你讨论。

Suitcase Walk—This is like moving through the airport, grab the weight in one hand like a suitcase and walk. The obliques on the other side of the weight will want to have a discussion with you the next day.

架上步行——这些通常是用壶铃完成的，将壶铃保持在架上的位置，这是你胸部的重量，就像处于“干净”的位置一样。这是一个相当补救的动作，但它可以教会人们如何锻炼腹肌。

Rack Walk—These are usually done with a kettlebell, holding the kettlebell in the racked position, which is the weight on your chest as if in a ‘clean’ position. This is a fairly remedial move, but it can teach a person how the abs work.

双手携带

Two-Handed Carries

媒体步行——这是一种双壶铃侍者步行，但壶铃会随着您的移动而活跃起来。不要这样做导致失败——这看起来很危险，因为事实确实如此。

The Press Walk—This is a double-kettlebell waiter walk, but the kettlebells come alive as you move. Do not do this to failure—it looks dangerous because, well, it is.

农夫步道——搬运之王。双手握住壶铃，尽可能重，就像拎着双手提箱一样。这可以做到非常重或很远的距离。我最喜欢的变化是在很远的距离上真的很重。

Farmer Walk—The King of Carries. Go as heavy as you can with kettlebells in both hands like a double-suitcase carry. This can be done really heavy or for great distance. My favorite variation is really heavy for a great distance.

双架步行——再次强调，这是一项学习练习，但它是学习在压力下呼吸的好方法。

Double-Rack Walk—Again, this is a learning exercise, but it’s a great way to learn to breathe under stress.

人行横道——在这里，我们一只手做服务员行走，另一只手做农民行走。这是学习在运动过程中锁定腹部的一种非常有趣的方法。

Cross Walk—Here we do a waiter walk in one hand while doing the farmer walk in the other. It’s a very interesting way to learn to lock down the midsection during movement.

包

Bags

这组携带物包括背包、沙袋或加重背心。就我个人而言，我仍然更喜欢旧的行李袋或野战包。去任何杂货店购买软水剂盐或除冰盐。不到 10 美元，你就可以买到 150 磅的盐。沙子在很多情况下效果更好，但冬天我总是在车道上使用除冰器，这起到了训练和安全的双重作用。

This group of carries includes backpacks, sandbags or weighted vests. Personally, I still prefer an old duffle bag or field pack. Go to any grocery store and buy either water softener salt or salt for de-icing. For under $10, you can get 150 pounds of salt. Sand works better in many situations, but I always used the de-icer on the driveway during the winter, which served the dual purpose of training and safety.

基本款包包的携带方式很简单。事实上，归根结底，要么是背包旅行，要么是把重物扛在肩上，要么是熊抱重物。背包或背心设置是理想的选择，因为它可以解放您的双手。

The basic bag carries are simple. Really, it comes down to either backpacking or holding the weight over the shoulders or bear-hugging the weight. The backpack or vest set-up is ideal, as it leaves your hands free.

熊抱负重是一种很好的训练工具。内部压力增大，呼吸被胸部的重量所窒息，你必须不断用力挤压才能使其远离地板。总而言之，这只是有趣而已。

Bear-hugging a weight is a great training tool. The internal pressure builds, the breath is choked off by the weight on the chest, and you have to keep squeezing it harder just to keep it off the floor. All in all, it’s just nothing but fun.

雪橇

Sleds

方法很简单：用安全带或配重带挂住雪橇并将其拖走。除了雪橇之外，这个概念还包括推车、上山（向前和向后）以及当今更好的健身房中可用的所有各种新型推车设备。

The method is simple: Hook up a sled either with a harness or weight belt and tow it away. Along with sleds, this concept also includes pushing cars, going up hills (forward and backward), and all the various new pushing devices available in today’s better gyms.

这些中的每一个都可以单独工作。将它们结合起来使它们值得注意。农夫每只手拎着 105 磅的重物，背着 150 磅的背包，拖着雪橇行走，是我做过的最困难的事情之一。显然，某些组合的效果不如其他组合——任何类型的人行横道和高架走道在与其他组合结合时通常都会遭遇巨大的失败。

Each of these work well alone. Combining them makes them worthy of note. Farmer walks with 105 pounds in each hand, with a 150-pound backpack and dragging a sled is one of the most difficult things I’ve ever done. Obviously, some combinations don’t work as well as others—crosswalks and overhead walks of any kind are usually epic failures when combined with something else.

这是你不知道该问的问题的答案——

Here’s the answer to the question you didn’t know to ask—

学习这一切的顺序是什么？

What’s the order of learning all this?

第16章

Chapter 16

学习顺序是什么？

What’s the Order of Learning?

让我们回顾一下学习的顺序——

LET’S REVIEW the order of learning—

图案

磨削

对称

动态

Patterning

Grinding

Symmetry

Dynamic

过快地推动某人完成这一进程会带来很多问题。我从农夫行走开始，因为它可以快速教会图案。

Driving someone too quickly through this progression is fraught with issues. I begin with the farmer walk because it quickly teaches patterning.

我过去常常纠正学生们回头看并互相交谈的行为，但我意识到酒吧在更深层次上教会了这一点。头顶的头发应该达到最高点，眼睛应该正好位于颧骨上方。

I used to correct students for looking over their shoulders and talking to each other, but I realized the bars teach that at a far deeper level. The hair on the top of your head should reach to zenith and your eyes should look just over the cheekbones.

理想情况下，我发现像约翰尼·卡什那样走在队伍中，对于教一个人保持上半身安静的姿势具有真正的价值。老实说，光是走这条路就可以拥有一个漫长而快乐的职业生涯。

Ideally, I find walking the line, like Johnny Cash did, has a real value in teaching a person posture with a quiet upper body. Honestly, a long and happy career can be had from just doing this walk.

我发现排队是展示不平衡的一种美妙而简单的方式。现在，造成这些问题的原因肯定是一个问题，但我发现一个努力保持在线状态的人很快就会获得顿悟（“哦，我明白了！”）。同样，从这里继续前进可能永远不需要出现问题，因为这些不对称的行动将为大多数人创造奇迹。

I find walking the line to be a wonderful and easy way to show imbalances. Now, what causes them is certainly an issue, but I find there’s a moment of insight (“Oh, I see!”) provided quickly by a person struggling to stay on-line. Again, there may never need to be an issue about moving on from here, as these asymmetrical moves will do wonders for the bulk of the population.

背着沉重的袋子进行熊抱式散步也可以在初级阶段进行。这比农夫行走先进了一步，但这种携带方式似乎比我所知道的任何一种方式都更能教会加压呼吸。

Bear-hug walks with heavy bags can be done at the basic level, too. It’s a step more advanced than the farmer walk, but this kind of carry really seems to teach pressurized breathing better than any single thing I know.

一旦建立了农夫步道，我们就加载推力。推汽车并不是一个坏的开始，尽管今天我们有很多不需要司机和安全的地方来推的健身玩具。

Once the farmer walk is established, we load up a push. Pushing a car is not a bad start, although today we have plenty of gym toys that don’t require a driver and a safe place to push.

然后，对于我们的对称工作，服务员的行走和手提箱的搬运很快暴露出技术或解剖学问题。

Then, for our symmetry work, the waiter walk and suitcase carry quickly expose technical or anatomical issues.

这些高速运动，例如雪橇冲刺或冲刺上山，对于任何运动员来说都是令人难以置信的。我发现，作为一名高中田径教练，通过每周两次集中的山地冲刺训练，我们的投掷能力得到了提高。数量很少，通常只有两个冲刺，但结转是显而易见的。如果山足够陡的话，你可以将这些视为爆发性单腿深蹲。

These movements at high speeds, like sprinting with sleds or sprinting up hills, can be incredible for any athlete. I discovered as a high school track coach, we were getting better throwing by having two weekly focused hill-sprint workouts. The volume was low, often only two sprints, but the carryover was obvious. You can think of these as explosive one-legged squats if the hill is steep enough.

我经常告诉人们，如果你能做的只是农夫散步和山地冲刺，那么你就做得很好了。

I often tell people, if all you can do is farmer walks and hill sprints, you’re doing pretty well.

许多人在第一次负重锻炼时可以用自重行走，每只手各负一半体重。对于负重运举并没有完美的标准，因为变化和选择似乎无穷无尽，但双倍体重负重运举（每只手的体重）无疑是高强度水平的重要指标。

Many people can farmer walk bodyweight, half-bodyweight in each hand, during their first carry workout. There are no perfect standards for loaded carries, as the variations and options seem about endless, but certainly a double bodyweight carry—bodyweight in each hand—is worthy indicator of high levels of strength.

现在，下一期——

Now, the next issue—

多少以及多久一次？

How much and how often?

我曾让高中二年级的学生每只手使用 85 磅的重量进行农夫漫步，而我的后院小组则每只手使用 155 磅的重量。我在与农夫酒吧的竞争中做了更多的事情，不建议你这样做。无论你手头有什么，都是一个好的开始。

I’ve had high school sophomores use 85 pounds per hand in the farmer walk, and my backyard group has worked with up to 155 pounds per hand. I’ve done more in competition with the farmer bars and wouldn’t suggest you do it. Whatever you have at hand is a good start.

一袋重 50 磅的盐或沙子携带起来令人大开眼界。去仓库家庭供应地点拿一个独轮车外壳（就是装东西的绿色部分），将一根绳子穿过独轮车上的孔，然后将绳子连接到配重带上，你就拥有了第一个雪橇。

A bag of salt or sand weighing 50 pounds is an amazing eye-opener in carries. Go to a warehouse home supply place and get a wheelbarrow shell (just that green part that holds stuff), string a rope through the hole in the wheelbarrow and connect the rope to a weight belt and you have your first sled.

对于雪橇重量，我从扔掉的水泥和一堆石头开始。

For sled weights, I started out with cement that had been thrown out, and a bunch of rocks.

因此，只要有两个哑铃或壶铃、一个手推车外壳、一条举重带、一个背包、一些沙子和一些石头，你就可以在食物链的顶端进行训练。

So, with two dumbbells or kettlebells, a wheelbarrow shell, a weight belt, a backpack, some sand and some rocks, you can train at the top end of the food chain.

多远？多少？多久？

How far? How many? How long?

这得看情况。我通常告诉人们首先尝试农夫漫步。然后，将袋子拉到胸前，然后走动。不要走得太远，也不要做太多事情，只是感受一下事物的感觉。

Well, it depends. I usually tell people to first try the farmer walk. Then, pull a bag to your chest and walk around. Don’t go far and don’t do much, just get a sense of things.

我们很少在每次移动时做更多的“向下和向后”的动作，因为我们努力在每组中不断添加元素。一个掌握了图案、研磨、对称性和弹道学的人可以通过“背部和背部”进行很好的锻炼——

Rarely do we do more than ‘down and back’ with each move, as we strive to keep adding elements each set. A person who has mastered patterning, grinding, symmetry and ballistics could have a great workout with just ‘down and backs’ of—

手提箱步行

农夫步行

手提箱步行 佩戴加重背包

农夫步行 佩戴加重背包

雪橇拉力

带袋子的雪橇拉力（熊抱）

雪橇拉力 佩戴加重背包

雪橇拉力 带背包 和 农夫步行

Suitcase Walk

Farmer Walk

Suitcase Walk Wearing a Weighted Back Pack

Farmer Walk Wearing a Weighted Back Pack

Sled Pull

Sled Pull with Bag (Bear Hug)

Sled Pull Wearing a Weighted Back Pack

Sled Pull with Back Pack and Farmer Walk

这是“向下和向后”的八个动作，需要最少的设备和大量的工作。

That’s eight movements ‘down and back,’ with minimal equipment and a lot of work.

对于距离有多远的问题，通常的回答是“不太好”。你就会知道为什么。

The how far question is usually answered “not very.” You’ll find out why.

每周进行三次负重训练，但只有其中一天应该是“全部”。当你攻击这些动作时，你需要表现得具有攻击性和强烈性。农夫行走和熊抱式搬运是我个人最喜欢的动作，对于大多数人来说往往是最划算的动作。

Do some kind of loaded carry three times a week, but only one of the days should be ‘everything.’ You want to be aggressive and intense when you attack these movements. The farmer walk and bear-hug carries are my personal favorite moves and for most people tend to be some of the best bang for their bucks.

做完这些三周后回复我。显然，你的握力更好。你的腿更有力了。你发现举重室不再那么艰难了。你看起来更瘦了，但也更大了。

Get back to me after doing these for three weeks. Obviously, your grip is better. Your legs are stronger. You discover the weightroom isn’t that tough any more. You look leaner but bigger.

哦，不客气。

Oh, and you’re welcome.

第17章

Chapter 17

第六乐章

The Sixth Movement

我的干预研讨会上提出了一个很好的问题。

THERE IS AN EXCELLENT QUESTION that comes up in my Intervention workshops.

“丹，其他的事情呢？”

“Dan, what about all the other stuff?”

哦，这个问题我明白了。在对称之前你不会看到单臂运动，你不会真正看到单腿工作，那么填空呢？

Oh, I understand this question. You don’t see one-arm movements until symmetry, you don’t really see one-legged work and what about fill-in-the-blank?

其他都是第六乐章。或者，也许更准确地说，其他一切都是五个动作加一。半跪推举、地雷、单臂俯冲俯卧撑、劈砍、划船、划船跨平面单腿硬拉（我称之为“帽翼”），或者任何时候你扔健身球时，你都在做“第六乐章”或“加一乐章”。

Everything else is the sixth movement. Or, probably more accurately, everything else is the five movements plus one. Half-kneeling presses, landmines, one-armed dive-bomber pushups, chops, rows, cross-plane single-leg deadlift with a row (I call these HATwings), or any time you throw a medicine ball, you’re doing the ‘sixth movement’ or the ‘plus one.’

不要将此作为判断陈述。我并不是说第六乐章比前五乐章少一些；只是说第六乐章比前五乐章少一些。我是说所有其他东西都是有价值的并且需要训练，但不能以训练铰链或负载携带为代价。

Don’t make this a judgment statement. I’m not saying the sixth movement is somehow less than the first five; I’m saying all that other stuff is valuable and needs to trained, but not at the expense of training the hinge or loaded carry.

我们知道，成年人需要很多现代训练中经常遗漏的东西。人们正在尝试解决这个问题——你可以看到人们在当地的健身房里到处练习，我们看到许多设施都采取了基本的纠正措施。

And we know that the adult population needs a lot of things that are often left out of modern training. There are attempts to address this—you can see people at local gyms lunging a bit here and there, and we see basic correctives done in many facilities.

但我们很少看到有人在地板上。我想我从来没有见过在公共设施里打滚，而且很少有人真正仰卧起坐，做除了仰卧起坐或仰卧起坐之外的任何事情。

But rarely do we see people on the floor. I don’t think I have ever seen rolling in a public facility, and few people actually get on their backs and do anything save crunches or situps.

如果我对数字的理解正确的话，每年有 28,000 名美国人死于跌倒受伤。如果你系好安全带并且不吸烟，坠落就是潜伏在拐角处等待击倒你的恶魔。除了几根栏杆和一块防滑垫之外，大多数人会做些什么来预防或应对跌倒呢？

If I understand the numbers correctly, 28,000 Americans die each year in fall-related injuries. If you wear your seatbelt and don’t smoke, falling is the demon lurking around the corner waiting to take you down. Besides a few railings and a skid-proof mat, what do most people do to prevent or deal with falling?

没有什么。

Nothing.

我使用土耳其着装和训练作为我的“加分项”。装束从地板上开始，通常装有壶铃，通过它我们滚动、铰链、跪下、弓步、站立，然后在控制下回来。

I use the Turkish getup and drills as my ‘plus one.’ The getup begins on the floor, often loaded with a kettlebell, and through it we roll, hinge, kneel, lunge, stand and then come back down under control.

蒂姆·安德森

Tim Anderson

我向《按下重置》一书的作者蒂姆·安德森询问了一些关于让我们回归基础的见解。蒂姆认为我们需要回到我们第一次睁开眼睛时！

I asked Tim Anderson, the author of Pressing Reset, for some insights about getting us back to basics. Tim believes we need to take things back to when we first popped our eyes open!

这是蒂姆——

Here’s Tim—

大多数培训计划似乎都缺少一件事，那就是基础工作。大多数人没有花足够的时间在地面上，或者没有足够的时间学习如何站起来。

ONE THING THAT SEEMS to be missing from the majority of the training programs is ground work. Most people don’t spend enough time on the ground, or enough time learning to get up off the ground.

例如，让我们看看儿童。他们通过学习如何操纵和从地面上站起来，建立了令人惊讶的强壮身体。他们会翻滚、爬行、爬行、蹲下、跪下，最终学会站立。通过这样做，孩子们可以在需要的地方发展活动能力、稳定性和力量。

Let’s look at children, for instance. They build amazingly strong bodies by learning how to maneuver and get up off the ground. They roll, creep, crawl, squat, kneel and eventually learn to stand. In doing so, children develop mobility, stability and strength where they need it.

大多数成年人的做法恰恰相反。我们大部分时间都在努力远离地面。老实说，我们大部分时间都在寻找便利，这样我们就不必经常走动。反过来，我们在需要的地方失去了机动性、稳定性和力量。我们正在倒退地做这一切。

Most adults do the opposite. We spend most of our time trying to stay off the ground. To be honest, we spend most of our time trying to find conveniences so we don’t have to move around very much. In turn, we lose mobility, stability and strength where we need it. We are doing this all backwards.

或许所有的幼稚行为都不该被抛弃。如果我们花更多的时间在地面上，我们真的可以建立一个强壮和健康的身体。这就是土耳其装束如此出色的原因。它让您回到地面，并允许您完成几种儿童般的运动模式。通过这样做，您实际上可以开始恢复应有的活动能力、稳定性和力量。

Perhaps all childish ways were not meant to be put away. If we spent more time on the ground, we could really build a strong and healthy body. This is the reason the Turkish getup is such a great exercise. It gets you back on the ground and allows you to move through several child-like movement patterns. In doing so, you can actually start regaining the mobility, stability and strength you’re supposed to have.

让我们从孩子的角度来看看这个装扮。它从躺着的位置开始，然后滚动到坐的位置。然后，我们从坐姿抬起到三点姿势——除了一只肢体外，所有肢体都与地面接触，所以它不太适合用手和膝盖着地。从三点姿势过渡到半跪姿势，然后从半跪姿势开始站立。

Let’s take a look at the getup through a child’s eyes. It starts from a lying position and involves a roll to a seated position. We then lift from a sitting position to a three-point stance—all but one limb is in contact with the ground, so it is just shy of being on your hands and knees. From the three-point stance, there’s a transition to the half-kneeling position, and from the half-kneeling position, we stand.

基本上，这种起立模仿了孩子从躺着到站起来的方式。将壶铃举过头顶甚至会产生与儿童沉重且不成比例的头部类似的阻力。着装是一种很好的方式，可以有意识地做孩子们学得很好的事情：从头开始。

Basically, the get-up mimics the way a child might go from lying to standing. Holding a kettlebell overhead could even offer similar resistance as a child’s heavy, out-of-proportion head. The getup is a great way to intentionally do what children learn to do so well: move from the ground up.

我有没有提到孩子们会发展出惊人的强壮身体？

Did I mention children develop amazingly strong bodies?

我们成年人需要花更多的时间在实地。事实上，只要趴在地板上并进行一些重置就可以对建立强壮、健康的身体大有帮助。我特别喜欢的一个动作是双手和膝盖着地，用高大的胸骨来回摇晃，这意味着胸部很大，我称之为摇晃。我知道这个名字很棘手。

We adults need to spend more time on the ground. In fact, just getting down on the floor and performing a few resets can go a long way toward building a strong, healthy body. One move I love in particular is done by getting down on hands and knees and rocking back and forth with a tall sternum, meaning a big chest, which I call rocking. Tricky name, I know.

摇摆是重置身体和清理动作的好方法。它刺激前庭系统——你的平衡系统；它可以打开你的臀部。这是快速提高深蹲或挥杆动作的好方法；它反射性地刺激手臂和核心肌肉；它将你的臀部连接到你的肩膀。再加上几次颈部点头，只需四肢着地时上下抬起头，你就会像圣诞树一样点亮你的核心肌肉！

Rocking is a great way to reset your body and clean up your movements. It stimulates the vestibular system—your balance system; it opens up your hips. It’s a great way to quickly improve a squat or a swing; it stimulates the muscles in your arms and core reflexively; and it connects your hips to your shoulders. Throw in a couple of neck nods, simply raising your head up and down while on all fours, and you’ll light up your core muscles like a Christmas tree!

换句话说，摇摆有助于将你的核心联系在一起。它真正让您的身体做好运动的准备。

In other words, rocking helps tie your core together. It truly prepares your body to move.

我喜欢的另一个重置是滚动。滚动有助于通过增强旋转强度和稳定性将身体结合在一起，从而准备并使身体能够有效地将力从一侧传递到另一侧。简单地在地板上打滚就可以让你变得强壮。滚动还能刺激前庭系统，并向大脑提供大量本体感觉信息——它可以改善你的运动图。你滚动得越好，你移动得就越好。

Another reset I like is rolling. Rolling helps to tie the body together by building rotational strength and stability, thus preparing and enabling the body to transfer force effectively from one side to the other. Simply rolling around on the floor can enable you to become strong. Rolling also stimulates the vestibular system and offers a huge proprioceptive flood of information to the brain—it improves your movement map. The better you roll, the better you will move.

滚动和摇摆是很好的重置。它们实际上可以帮助您恢复运动基础，并为任何训练计划提供重要补充。他们确实是重置。

Rolling and rocking are great resets. They can actually help you regain your movement foundation, and make an essential addition to any training program. They really are resets.

它们是土耳其装束的完美补充，土耳其装束结合了摇摆和滚动的各个方面。

And they make a great complement to Turkish getups, which combines aspects of both rocking and rolling.

最重要的是，任何在地面上度过的训练时间都是值得的。婴儿和儿童以正确的方式增强力量，我们可以通过效仿他们而受益。如果您想变得更强壮或者只是想保持健康，请学习如何站起来、趴下、打滚、翻滚、爬行和爬行。像孩子一样对待运动——就像你曾经几乎可以做任何事情一样。

The bottom line is, any training time spent on the ground is time well spent. Babies and children build strength the right way, and we’d benefit by emulating them. If you want to get stronger or you just want to be healthy, learn how to get up, get down and roll around, to tumble, creep and crawl. Approach movement like a child—like you once did when you could do almost anything.

~蒂姆·安德森 (Tim Anderson)， 《Becoming Bulletproof》合著者、 《Pressing Reset》和《Fitness Habits Made Easy》一书的作者

~Tim Anderson, co-author of Becoming Bulletproof, author of Pressing Reset and Fitness Habits Made Easy

蒂姆是我在研讨会上的合作伙伴，他真的明白这一点。请注意，他的建议和培训任何人群的整体方法中缺乏男子气概。老实说，我们有时会陷入举重成为人类和杠铃之间的战争，但我们大多数人也需要时间重新处理和解决事故、伤害和愚蠢带来的问题。

Tim was my partner at a workshop and he honestly gets it. Note the lack of macho posturing in his suggestions and his holistic approach to training any population. To be honest, we sometimes get stuck on weightlifting becoming a war between human and barbell, but most of us also need time to rework and readdress the issues brought on by accidents, injuries and idiocy.

顺便说一句，当我想知道谁的身体受到了事故、伤害和愚蠢的影响时，我首先举起了手。

My hand went up first, by the way, when it came to wondering who’s had accidents, injuries and idiocy impact their bodies.

土耳其装束

The Turkish Getup

蒂姆和我都提到土耳其着装是一种从根本上简单的方法，可以将所有这些融入到你的锻炼中。我建议负责任的辅导来帮助您正确学习这一点。我花了很多年的时间来学习这套服装，并且花了一些额外的工作来学会正确地教授它。

Both Tim and I referenced the Turkish getup as a fundamentally simple way to get all of this into your workout. I recommend responsible coaching to help you learn this correctly. It has taken me years to learn the getup, and it took some extra work to learn to teach it correctly.

老实说，并不是每个人都需要掌握穿搭步骤。让我向您介绍一下我与成年人相处的方法。
