Honestly, not everyone needs to master the steps of the getup. Let me walk you through my approach with adults.

我开始教授六点位置的动作。这就是你的手和膝盖着地的地方——两只手，两个膝盖，两只脚；你明白了……六分。

I begin my teaching of the movement in the six-point position. This is where you’re on your hands and knees on the ground—two hands, two knees, two feet; you get it…six points.

首先做出大幅度点头动作，上下移动颈部，然后尝试越过肩膀向后看，先看一侧，再看另一侧。然后，做蒂姆所说的“摇摆”，并将臀部向后推，使下半身做出轻柔的下蹲动作。

Begin by making big nodding movements, shifting the neck up and down, then try to look backward over your shoulders, one side then the other. Then, do what Tim calls rocking, and push your hips back into a gentle squatting motion of the lower body.

这很有趣，因为大多数人告诉我他们不能深蹲，但我可以让他们在第一次尝试时摇摆起来。

It’s funny, as most people tell me they can’t squat but I can get them rocking on the first attempt.

对于我的许多成年客户来说，这将是他们有史以来花在地面训练上的时间最长的一次。

For many of my adult clients, this will be the most time they’ve spent on the ground training since forever.

接下来，仰卧。关于背部训练，我有一个简单的规则：每次重复后一定要让头休息。

Next, lie on your back. I have one simple rule about the drills on you back: Always rest your head after each rep.

为什么？

Why?

很多时候，成年学员会用他们的头作为启动器，让身体离开地面。您可以通过大多数人做仰卧起坐的方式来看待它：它看起来就像一系列碰撞测试假人一遍又一遍地撞击墙壁。我不喜欢核心这个词，但更糟糕的是，很多人自学认为核心是脖子的前部和下背部。我们的工作就是在这里重新构建系统。

All too often, adult trainees will use their heads as a jumpstart to get the body off the ground. You can see it in the way most people do situps: It looks like a series of crash-test dummies hitting the wall over and over. I don’t like the word core, but worse yet, many people have taught themselves that the core is the front of the neck and the lower back. Our job is to literally re-knit the system here.

在史蒂夫·伊尔格（Steve Ilg）的精彩著作《全身转型》中，他指出“适合”一词来自古挪威语“编织”。我想不出更好的方法来解释健身在一个人的生活和社区中的综合作用，以及如何思考其核心。从肩膀到臀部，郑医生的四个结，应该像铁丝网一样。

In Steve Ilg’s wonderful book, Total Body Transformation, he notes that the word “fit” comes from the old Norse term “to knit.” I can think of no better way to explain not only the integrated role of fitness in one’s life and community, but also how to think of the core. From your shoulders to your hips, Doc Cheng’s four knots, should be like a chain-link fence.

我曾经遇到过一场车祸。汽车撞毁了支撑柱，但仍然被灵活而坚固的铁丝网围住。这就是你的核心应该如何反应，强大而灵活。

I once came upon a car crash. The car wiped out the supporting posts, but was still held in the flexible but strong knitting of a chain-link fence. This is how your core should react, strong and flexible.

从仰卧，我们转向简单的滚动。肘部呈 45 度角（垂直于身体呈 90 度，沿着两侧垂直向下呈 0 度），慢慢地用肘部向上爬，轻轻滚动。

From supine lying, we move to simple rolling. With the elbows at 45 degrees—straight out from the body is 90, straight down along the sides would be zero—slowly climb up on your elbows in a gentle roll.

记住，每次代表都要低头！这应该就像躺在地板上，然后在电视上听到令人兴奋的新闻一样：卷起来，直到肘部成为上半身唯一仍在地面上的部分。然后，再向下滚动。我将这些称为 Rolling 45。

Remember, head down on each rep! This should be like lying on the floor, then hearing exciting news on the TV: roll up until your elbow is the only part of your upper body still on the ground. Then, roll back down. I call these Rolling 45s.

从这里开始，滚动到肚子上。这是蒂姆·安德森（Tim Anderson）的另一个技巧：当你努力用一只脚掌推动翻滚和向后滚动时，假设向右，笔直向上，让它引导你向左移动。让腿成为角色的发动机。只需用你的腿，前后滚动，从腹部到背部，从右到左，直到你开始感觉到你的整个身体都参与其中。

From here, roll onto your stomach. Here’s another trick from Tim Anderson: As you strive to roll over and back by driving the sole of one foot, let’s say the right, straight up and let it lead you over to your left. Let the leg be the engine of the role. Just using your legs, roll back and forth, stomach to back, right to left, until you begin to feel your whole body engage.

不要用你的上半身来帮忙！

Don’t use your upper body to help!

我们在早期序列中所做的就是教导和提醒身体如何在地面上移动。六点动作、45 度滚动和俯身滚动都是唤醒我们在婴儿时期学到的早期原始模式的好方法。

What we are doing with the early sequence is teaching and reminding the body how to move on the ground. The six-point moves, the rolling 45s and the tummy rolls are great ways to awaken those early primal patterns we all learned as babies.

在土耳其装束中，我们通常会发现问题。我们在 Crosspointe 壶铃俱乐部或 Coyote Point 壶铃俱乐部的聚会中确实做了几十个部分动作。

In the Turkish getup, we discover usually issues. We do literally dozens of partial movements in our gatherings at the Crosspointe Kettlebell Club or the Coyote Point Kettlebell Club.

正如布雷特·琼斯提醒我们的那样，“这是一次演习，而不是技能。”在我看来，成年人需要比我们平时做更多的练习。因此，我们用多种方式来分解装束，但这些方式往往似乎永远不会真正带来任何结果。

As Brett Jones reminds us, “This is a drill, not the skill.” In my vision, adults need to do many more drills than we often do. So we break down the getup in many ways that often never seem to actually lead anywhere.

好吧，除非参与者在整个动作中完美地、几乎是无意识地移动，否则它不会产生任何结果。

Well, it doesn’t lead anywhere until the participant moves flawlessly, nearly mindlessly, through the whole movement.

这就是事情变得令人兴奋的时候。第六个动作——五加一——可以扩展到远远超出仅仅在地板上滚动的范围。

And this is when things get exciting. The sixth move—the five plus one—can be expanded to go far beyond just rolling on the floor.

斯蒂沃教练

Coach Stevo

史蒂夫教练向我们提供了这个——

Coach Stevo offers us this—

你知道那句老话吗：“我尽我所能地信任那个人”？我认为丹·约翰会非常信任那个人，因为他可以把重物扔得很远很远。但我有一个坦白。我可能可以前蹲、高翻、卧推和抱那个人，但我不能扔太多东西来挽救我的生命。这是一个问题，因为与下蹲、铰链、推、拉和搬运一样，投掷（旋转力的弹道应用）是人类的第六种运动。

You know that old expression, “I trust that person about as far as I can throw him”? I think Dan John would trust that person a lot because he can throw heavy things very, very far. But I have a confession to make. I can probably front squat, power clean, bench and carry that person, but I can’t throw much of anything to save my life. This is a problem, because like the squat, hinge, push, pull and carry, throwing—the ballistic application of rotational force—is a sixth human movement.

投掷是弹道旋转。离开你手的所有东西都会沿着弹道轨迹离开。力从地面开始，通过身体传递，并通过围绕质心的协调肌肉的旋转力引导到您想要摆脱的任何物体。这包括挥拳。勾拳、上勾拳、甚至刺拳都涉及旋转。

Throwing is ballistic rotation. Everything that leaves your hand leaves on a ballistic trajectory. Force starts at the ground, transmits through the body, and is directed into whatever you want to get rid of through the rotational force of your coordinated muscles around your center of mass. And that includes throwing a punch. Hooks, uppercuts, even jabs involve rotation.

但旋转力隐藏在许多其他运动中。当您以下时，您会产生并抵抗旋转力：

But rotational force is hidden in a lot of other athletic movement. You generate and resist rotational forces when you—

跑步

Run

跳

Jump

改变方向

Change direction

摇摆任何东西

Swing anything

服务

Serve

截击

Volley

踢

Kick

处理

Tackle

大满贯

Slam

躲闪

Dodge

转动

Turn

打别人的脸

Pound someone’s face

做爱

Have sex

或者用一只手或一条腿做任何事情

Or do anything with one hand or on one leg

正如您所看到的，几乎所有体育运动都涉及旋转力的应用或阻力。那么，一个人，尤其是像我这样小时候从未参加过球类运动的人，如何训练这种人体运动呢？

As you can see, pretty much every athletic movement involves the application or resistance of rotational forces. So how does one, especially someone like me who never played ball sports as a kid, train this human movement?

对于投掷，进展如下：

For throwing, the progression is as follows—

卷

Roll

一切都从地面开始。施加旋转力的运动模式从基本滚动开始。没错，我们刚出生时就通过在地上打滚来学习投掷。地面提供了更多的稳定性，并允许孩子们将动作分解成我们可以学习的小部分。我们用手臂打滚，用腿打滚，所有这些都没有摔倒和受伤的风险。

Everything starts on the ground. The movement pattern for applying rotational force begins as basic rolling. That’s right, we learn to throw by rolling around on the ground as a newborn. The ground provides more stability and allows kids to break down the movement into little parts that we can learn. We roll around using our arms, roll around using our legs, all without the risk of falling over and getting hurt.

地面还允许我们对抗重力而不是穿过重力，这要复杂得多。作为成年人，有很多好方法可以模仿这种进展，同时也可以安全地增加脊柱的稳定性和运动范围。以下是 Coyote Point Kettlebell Club 的一些例子——

The ground also allows us to work against gravity instead of across it, which is a lot more complicated. As adults there are lots of great ways to mimic this progression that also safely increase stability and range of motion along the spine. Here are a few examples from the Coyote Point Kettlebell Club—

仰卧，仅用双腿翻滚至俯卧

Lie on your back and roll onto your stomach using only your legs

仰卧，仅用手臂翻滚至俯卧

Lie on your back and roll onto your stomach using only your arms

平板支撑

Getup Planks

加载拥抱

Loaded Cuddles

滚动 45 秒

Rolling 45s

滚动 45 秒至 T

Rolling 45s to the T

半身装

Half-Getups

土耳其式起立——终极滚动练习

Turkish Getups—the ultimate rolling exercise

捻

Twist

一旦我们站起来，我们就开始在空间中扭转。对于成年人来说，这看起来很像只是四处走动，而我们几乎没有想到这一点。我们稍微向一侧或另一侧捡起东西。我们背上背包。我们将装备从房间的一侧移动到另一侧。这些是旋转力的磨削应用。

Once we’re on our feet, we start twisting in space. To adults, this looks a lot like just moving around, and we barely think about it. We pick up stuff slightly to one side or the other. We put on backpacks. We move gear from one side of a room to another. These are grinding applications of rotational force.

当我们在汽车或自行车上保持直立时，当我们承受不均匀的负载时，或者做任何单方面的事情（例如将自己保持在俯卧撑位置）时，我们也会抵抗旋转力，人们这样做的频率比他们注意到的要多得多。

We also resist rotational forces when we work to remain upright in a car or on a bike, when we hold an uneven load, or do anything unilateral like hold ourselves up in a pushup position, which people do a lot more often than they notice.

其中一些动作是非常常见的受伤原因，因此许多针对它们的训练练习都来自康复领域。这是一个简短的清单——

Some of these motions are very common causes of injury, so a lot of the exercises to train for them come out of the rehab world. Here is a short list—

任何较重的滚动动作

Any of the rolling movements with heavier weight

半跪式推举

Half-Kneeling Presses

半跪排骨

Half-Kneeling Chops

半跪式举重

Half-Kneeling Lifts

旋转行

Rotational Rows

单臂卧推

One-Arm Bench Press

单臂俯卧撑

One-Arm Pushups

单臂划船

One-Arm Rows

单臂推举

One-Arm Presses

单臂前蹲

One-Arm Front Squat

长按

Long Presses

作为孩子，一旦我们足够强壮、足够稳定，我们就会开始扔东西，比如房间里的麦片碗或把钥匙扔进厕所。作为成年人，一旦我们通过翻滚和扭转训练变得足够强壮和稳定，就该再次开始扔东西了。健身球是此类训练的常用工具，但您可以扔任何不会发出太大声音的东西。

As kids, soon as we are strong enough and stable enough, we start throwing things, like bowls of cereal across the room or keys into the toilet. As adults, once we’re strong and stable enough from training rolls and twists, it’s time to start chucking things around again. Medicine balls are a popular tool for this type of training, but you can throw anything that won’t complain too loudly.

弹道训练的目标是总力量，它是质量和加速度的乘积。如果你很强壮并且楼下的邻居不在家，那么扔壶铃就可以了，但是扔一些较小的东西，比如健身球，甚至六罐可乐，可能对训练弹道更有帮助。

The goal of ballistic training is total force, which is the product of mass and acceleration. It’s fine to throw a kettlebell, if you’re strong and your downstairs neighbor isn’t home, but throwing something smaller like a medicine ball or even a six-pack of coke will probably be more beneficial for training ballistics.

这里有一些弹道投掷练习，其中一些甚至不涉及放开物体——

Here are a few ballistic throwing exercises, some of which don’t even involve letting go of the object—

上手投掷

Overhand throws

低手投掷

Underhand throws

一步投掷

Throws with a step

站立侧扭转

Standing Side Twists

格斗者

The Grappler

哑铃抓举

Dumbbell Snatches

单臂壶铃摆动

One-Arm Kettlebell Swings

单臂壶铃抓举

One-Arm Kettlebell Snatches

正如您所看到的，训练投掷模式的方法有很多。从地面开始，然后滚动。说真的，这种感觉太棒了，你会着迷的——这是一件好事，因为像其他五种人类动作一样，投掷，意思是滚动和扭转，是你应该练习的每一个动作。该死。天。

As you can see, there are a lot of ways to train the throwing pattern. Start on the ground and just roll around. Seriously, it feels so good you’ll get hooked—which is a good thing because like the other five human movements, throwing, meaning rolling and twisting, is something you should practice Every. Damn. Day.

〜史蒂夫·莱德贝特

~Stevo Ledbetter

从头开始

From the Ground Up

一旦你沿着第六招的道路走下去，你真的可以分支出很多方向。这就是为什么玩游戏对健身如此有益——你可以以一种非结构化、动态的方式进行所有人类动作，并从中获得无穷乐趣。老实说，如果大多数成年人每天下班后都开始玩，我就会失业！

Once you go down the road of the sixth move, you can really branch out a lot of directions. This is why playing games is so good for fitness—you do all human movements in an unstructured, dynamic way and have a boatload of fun doing it. Honestly, if most adults started playing every day after work, I’d be out of a job!

但是，他们没有。

But, they don’t.

这让我的职业生涯充满活力！

This keeps my career alive!

顺便说一句，基本的人类动作是通过土耳其服装编织而成的。这就是帕维尔和其他人坚持认为仅包含摆动和起立的计划可以是最佳锻炼的原因之一。

By the way, the fundamental human movements are knitted through Turkish getup work. This is one of the reasons Pavel and others insist that a program of just swings and getups can be an optimal workout.

推

Push

这套服装基本上是一块移动的单手木板。两只手臂，一只放在地上，一只负重，在整个运动过程中都在负重下旋转，但始终处于负重状态。

The getup is basically a moving one-handed plank. Both arms, the one on the ground and the one loaded, spin under load throughout the movement, but are constantly under load.

拉

Pull

也许有点难看出，肩膀的旋转木板需要适当的拉动动力。

Perhaps a bit harder to see, the pivoting plank of the shoulder needs proper pulling dynamics.

合页

Hinge

当您从单手支撑位置转换为一只手离开地面时，最好进行铰接。其实单独练习也是一个很好的动作。

When you transfer through the positions from one-handed support to the hand off the ground, it’s best to hinge. In fact, it is a good movement to practice by itself.

蹲

Squat

翻滚到手部后，剩下的动作就是下蹲动作。

After rolling to the hand, the rest of the getup is a squat movement.

满载携带

Loaded Carries

TGU 的难度与任何用于全身调节的负重训练一样困难。

The TGU can be as difficult as any of the loaded carries for total body conditioning.

蒂姆、斯蒂沃和我都同意事情要从头开始。从那里开始，我们可以一层一层地进行动作，直到我们跳跃、冲刺和互相扔球。所以，是的，第六乐章的整个家族都是重要且关键的。而且，最重要的是，它们很有趣。

Tim, Stevo and I all agree that things begin from the ground up. From there, we can layer movement upon movement until we are leaping around, sprinting and throwing balls to one another. So, yes, the whole family of the sixth movements are important and crucial. And, most important, they’re fun.

第18章

Chapter 18

第九个问题：

Ninth Question:

你愿意改正你的问题吗？

Are you willing to correct your problems?

我要感谢帕维尔的伟大见解之一是他对运动员生命中时间的理解。虽然对于大多数运动员来说，力量训练和技术确实是阴阳关系，但每周花在这两种品质上的时间并不是 50/50。

ONE OF THE GREAT INSIGHTS I owe to Pavel is his understanding of time in an athlete’s life. While it is absolutely true for most athletes that strength training and technique are in a yin and yang relationship, the amount of time given to these two qualities each week isn’t 50/50.

我一遍又一遍地错过这个见解，直到它最终粘在墙上。我这里也需要注意一下。



I missed this insight over and over, until it finally stuck to the wall. I, too, need to pay attention here.



   提高力量应该对运动员有所帮助。

   Improving strength should help an athlete.

   提高技术应该对运动员有所帮助。

   Improving technique should help an athlete.

   提高力量和技术对运动员确实有帮助！

   Improving both strength and technique should really help an athlete!

因此，运动员在一项运动中的训练时间不应该分成50/50（一半时间举重，一半时间做技术）；相反，应该是这样的关系——



So, the time spent in training for an athlete in a sport should not be divided 50/50 (half the time lifting and half the time working technique); rather it should be in a relationship perhaps like this—



   80%的时间都花在了运动上

   80% of the time allotted on the sport

   10%的时间用于力量训练

   10% of the time allotted on strength training

   10% 的时间用于纠正

   10% of the time allotted on correctives

如果您打算每周训练 10 小时，则每周将有 2 小时用于基本人体动作以及灵活性和动作矫正，另外 8 小时将用于您的运动。

If you are going to train 10 hours a week, two hours a week will be doing the fundamental human movements and the mobility and movement correctives, and eight hours will be spent on your sport.

这个想法对于减肥也很有效。追求减肥的大部分时间应该花在购物、准备和做饭上。你的精力应该集中在积极主动地应对生日蛋糕、舒适食品和“少量”美味佳肴的冲击上。您的力量训练将增强一些瘦体重，而您的纠正工作将使您感觉更好......因此您运动得更好......因此您会运动得更多。

This idea works well with fat loss, too. The bulk of your time in a fat-loss pursuit should be in shopping, preparing and cooking your meals. Your energy should be addressing proactive strikes against the onslaughts of birthday cake, comfort food and “just a handful” of yummy, crummy treats. Your strength training will build some lean body mass, and your corrective work will make you feel better…so you move better…so you’ll move more.

作为一名运动员，去做你的运动，让你的训练支持它。其他人都应该四处走动，煮好饭菜，过上美好的生活。然后，每周来一次健身房，我们将启动您的机器并重新调整轮子。

As an athlete, go do your sport and let your training support it. Everybody else should move around, cook good meals and live a good life. Then, come to the gym a bit each week and we’ll kick-start your machine and realign the wheels.

我们来谈谈这个概念的应用。

Let’s talk about applying this concept.

精英运动员每周可以在举重房训练最多 10 个小时，但这意味着实际的运动训练每周可能会超过 40 个小时，包括电影、比赛和所有其他时间，而且，所有其他时间可能会占用大量时间。职业运动员。想象一下，一名大联盟棒球运动员每年必须为 162 场比赛（不包括表演赛）收拾行李、穿衣、洗澡和吃饭。

Elite athletes can train in the weightroom up to 10 hours a week, but that means the actual athletic training could be upwards of 40 hours a week including films, games and all the rest—and, all the rest can be a lot of time for a professional athlete. Imagine packing, dressing, showering and eating for the 162 games (not including exhibitions) that a major league baseball player has to do each year.

我保持运动员积极性的一种方法是，既训练他们的个人弱点，又解决纠正工作，每次训练的前半部分都致力于五个基本人体动作的感知优势。这次致力于发挥他们的优势，我添加了他们的机动性和灵活性纠正措施。这是我逐渐认识到的人性的一个方面：如果我用你做得好的事情来奖励你，你就会做一些小事，比如纠正。

One way I address keeping my athletes motivated for both training their personal weaknesses and addressing corrective work is this: The first half of every training session is devoted to the perceived strengths in the five fundamental human movements. To this time devoted to their strengths, I add their mobility and flexibility correctives. It’s an aspect of human nature I’ve come to acknowledge: If I reward you with what you do well, you’ll do the little things like correctives.

一般来说，这意味着我的运动员将把一半的时间花在举重房里做他们最擅长的事情。通常，这意味着推和拉运动。但是，例如，在卧推组之间，我会进行泡沫轴滚动，练习滚动动作或练习高脚杯深蹲。所以你可能会看到一组五人一组的大重量卧推，然后运动员用泡沫滚动臀部并做一些高脚杯深蹲。五分钟的休息时间充满了轻微的纠正动作。我们将在替补席上进行下一组的五人组以及另一轮的纠正工作。

Generally, this means my athletes will spend half their time working in the weightroom on what they do best. Usually, this means push and pull movements. But between sets of bench presses, for example, I have them foam roll, work on rolling movements or practice goblet squats. So you might see a set of a heavy set of five in the bench press, followed by the athlete foam rolling the hips and doing a few goblet squats. The five-minute rest period is filled with light corrective movements. We follow this up with the next set of five in the bench and another round of corrective work.

另一半的培训时间专门针对弱点或遗漏。由于你可能正在学习一些新的技能和动作，所以所有的精力都必须投入到掌握新的任务上。我清楚地记得和迪克·诺特迈尔一起学习深蹲，当时每组和每一次都会在身体、精神和情感上带来压力。简直太痛了！

The other half of the training time is dedicated to weaknesses or omissions. Since you may be learning some new skills and movements, all energy has to be devoted to mastering the new tasks. I remember well learning to squat deep with Dick Notmeyer, when every set and rep was stressful physically, mentally and emotionally. It flat out hurt!

有些动作，例如高脚杯深蹲、摇摆和起立等热身动作，对许多人来说也可以作为矫正动作。如果您正在学习深蹲，在一组军事推举之间进行一组高脚杯深蹲非常有启发性。当然，它会发展模式，但它也提供了一些额外的时间来掌握动作。如果你诚实地尝试一下，你会惊讶于这个改变游戏规则的调整的简单性。

Some movements, like the warmup movements of goblet squat, swing and getup, also serve as correctives for many people. If you’re learning the squat, a set of goblet squats between a set of military presses is quite instructive. It develops the pattern, certainly, but it also provides some extra time to master the movement. If you give this an honest try, you’ll be amazed at the simplicity of this game-changing tweak.

纠正措施可以是那些标记为热身的壶铃动作，但也包括任何专门的移动动作，就像我们在功能运动系统的动作库中找到的那样。这些也可以包括泡沫轴滚动和一般的灵活性训练。你不是在组间休息，而是积极地解决你的问题。

Correctives can be those kettlebell moves labeled as warmups, but also include any specialized mobility work like we those find in the Functional Movement System’s library of movements. These can include foam rolling and general flexibility work, too. Instead of resting between sets, you’re actively battling your issues.

时间并不总是完美的，因为高级运动员在举重房中通常没有什么弱点。但几乎普遍来说，他们都会忽视负重运球，并且在深蹲深度上遇到困难。通过深蹲、农夫行走或推雪橇来完成锻炼会让人筋疲力尽，因此无需在推车组之间添加任何内容。

The time doesn’t always work perfectly, as advanced athletes often have few weaknesses in the weightroom. But almost universally, they ignore loaded carries and struggle with squat depth. Finishing a workout with squats and a farmer walk or sled pushes is exhausting and there is no need to add anything between sets of car pushes.

了解自己的优势和劣势的最好方法就是对它们进行评分，就像在学校一样。当你仔细思考这一点时，你就会明白，我坚持要求 GPA 很差。



The best way to look at your strengths and weaknesses is to grade them, like in school. As you’ll understand when you think through this, I insist on a lousy GPA.



A——发挥你真正的力量，你最好的动作。是的，通常是推动。

A—Give this to your real strength, your best movement. Yes, usually it’s the push.

B——显然，这将是你第二好的运动，但每三周需要花一些时间重新思考。负重的携带通常永远不会完成，并且会立即得到改善。

B—Obviously, this would be your second-best movement, but take some time to re-think about every three weeks. The loaded carry is often never done, and improves immediately.

C——现在，我们已经到了事情变得有点模糊的地步了。有些人三项动作成绩很差，但诚实在这里很好。

C—Now, we’re getting to the point where things become a little fuzzy. Some people have poor grades on three movements, but honesty is good here.

D——通常我会告诉人们圈出“蹲下”并继续前进，但也有例外（这些被称为优秀运动员）。

D—Usually I tell people to circle ‘squat’ and move on, but there are exceptions (these are called good athletes).

F——唉，我们需要在家长教师会议上见到你们的家人。如果你不采取对人类表现至关重要的举措，那么你就失败了。

F—Alas, we’ll need to see your folks at the parent-teacher conference. If you don’t do a move that’s key to human performance, well, you fail.

每当你处理不及格的成绩时，你就会变得更好。因此，你进行的任何训练都会提高你的水平，而任何时候你做额外的低水平训练——例如，高脚杯深蹲作为深蹲的矫正——你都会变得更好。纠正措施不仅仅是泡沫轴滚动和在墙上做一些奇怪的动作，当然，尽管我也看到了这些的重要性。

Any time you work your failing grade, you get better. So, any training you do on it will improve you, and any time you do additional low-level work—for example, the goblet squats as correctives for squats—you’ll get better. Correctives are more than foam rolling and little odd moves on a wall, although I see the importance of those, too, of course.

训练的前半部分你将锻炼自己的强项。正如马克·赖夫金德（Mark Reifkind）指出的那样——

The first half of the workout you’ll work on your strong points. As Mark Reifkind, pointed out—

克服你的弱点，

但用你的优势竞争。

Work on your weaknesses,

but compete with your strengths.

我对训练过程中出现不平衡的运动员没有任何意见，但我的工作是迫使人们尝试提出他们的弱点，无论在每种情况下可能意味着什么。但是，你必须用你的优势去竞争。

I have no issues with an athlete having imbalances in the training profile, but it’s my job to force people to attempt to bring up their weak points, whatever up might mean in each circumstance. But, you must compete with your strengths.

让我们看一个最常见的例子：你有很大的推力和拉力，这并不罕见。因此，前半小时的训练将是卧推和绳索划船，这是一种缓慢的超级组。

Let us look at the most common example: You have a great push and pull, which isn’t unusual. So, the first half-hour of training will be bench presses and cable rows in a kind of slow superset.

哦，你爱我！

Oh, you love me!

我要求卧推进行五组，每组 5 次，并与绳索划船进行五组，每组 10 次。我经常让人们以 1:2 的比例进行推拉训练，因为很多人长期以来都忽略了拉拉。此外，大多数成年人都存在姿势和肩膀问题。这有帮助。

I ask for five sets of five in the bench press, and match that with five sets of 10 in the cable row. I often have people train with a 1:2 ratio in volume for push and pull because so many people have ignored pulling for so long. Moreover, most of adults have issues with posture and shoulders. This helps.

我还要求组间有完整的五分钟休息时间！

I also ask for full five-minute rest periods between the sets!

但是，这并不是真正的休息——而是纠正的时间。

But, it isn’t actually rest—this is the time for correctives.

在每次休息期间，我们努力进行所需的所有泡沫轴滚动，特别是在我们在计划开始时所做的移动屏幕突出显示的区域。我们还进行各种脚趾接触、臀部和腿部的灵活性运动、肩部的一些墙壁运动以及各种几乎总是痛苦的胸部活动运动。

During each rest set, we strive to do all the foam rolling we need, especially on the areas highlighted by the mobility screen we did at the beginning of the program. We also do varieties of toe touches, flexibility moves for the hips and legs, some wall work for the shoulders and various, almost always painful, thoracic mobility work.

根据我的经验，纠正措施比实际训练会导致更多的出汗和疲劳。这种方法有什么好处呢？你就可以开始工作了！我怎么强调都不为过。

From my experience, the correctives cause more sweating and exhaustion than the actual training. What is the upside of this method? You get the work in! I can’t emphasize that enough.

纠正措施还可以是进行几次高脚杯深蹲、一些滚动、起立练习或任何您需要解决的问题。用大量时间奖励自己的优势，但继续努力解决需要解决的领域。

Correctives can also be a few reps of the goblet squat, some rolling, getup drills or anything you need to address. Reward yourself with a lot of time on your strengths, but continue to hammer away at the areas that need to be addressed.

剩下的训练时间主要集中在弱动作上。让我发自内心地告诉你：花半小时或更长时间来早期掌握秋千和高脚杯深蹲是地狱般的，而以基本的农夫散步结束则令人筋疲力尽。在这种培训的几天内，我作为一个创造奇迹的人而受到称赞——客户看起来更好，感觉更好，动作也更好。

The rest of the training period is focused work on the weak movements. Let me tell you from the heart: A half-hour or more dedicated to early mastery of the swing and goblet squat is hellish, and ending with a basic farmer walk is exhausting. Within days of this kind of training, I get patted on the back as a miracle-worker—the client looks better, feels better and moves better.

我们正在做的就是在整个训练过程中针对问题并解决它们。与大多数每次训练都会围绕“做这个”的训练计划不同，我们实际上把整个时间都花在解决问题上。与此同时，我们仍然保留让您变得伟大的举重和动作的根源……无论您的水平如何。

What we’re doing is targeting the issues and attacking them throughout the entire workout. Unlike most training programs that circle a ‘do this’ period each workout, we literally spend the whole time attacking issues. At the same time, we still keep the roots of lifts and movements that made you great…or whatever your level.

很快，您将在几组强力动作之间进行几次土耳其式的动作。如您所知，着装既是一种评估，也是一种纠正。此外，这本身就是一项令人筋疲力尽的小练习。但这可能要等几周，直到我们掌握了基本的装束和动作模式。

Soon, you’ll be performing a few reps of the Turkish getup between sets of the strong movements. As you know, the getup is both an assessment and a corrective. In addition, it’s an exhausting little exercise in its own right. But this can wait a few weeks until we have the basics of the getup and the movement patterns mastered.

奇怪的是：装载的装备不仅能快速扩展你的能力，而且还能快速掌握它们。不久之后我们就需要再次进行评估。

Here’s the strange thing: The loaded carries will not only expand your abilities quickly, but they’re also mastered quickly. It isn’t too long before we need to go through our assessments again.

在我的一生中，我在短短几个月内就从“从不蹲”变成了一名擅长蹲的人。后来，当我发现我在负载携带上的成绩为“F”时，我迅速解决了这个问题。毫不奇怪，当我提高深蹲和抱举动作时，我作为一名运动员取得的最大进步就发生了。

In my life, I went from ‘never squatted’ to becoming a good squatter in just a few months. Later, when I discovered my ‘F’ grade on loaded carries, I addressed it swiftly. My greatest progress as an athlete happened, not surprisingly, when I brought up my squats and carries.

要点——

The take-away points—

评估。无论如何，在某个地方，请弄清楚你在哪里！

Assess. Somehow, somewhere, please figure out where you are!

永远不要忽视你的优势，而是将你的时间与锻炼你的优势的时间（这通常是你最喜欢的东西）结合起来，与灵活性、灵活性或组织质量的锻炼（泡沫轴滚动等等）结合起来。

Never ignore your strengths, but combine your time working on your strong points, which is usually your favorite stuff anyway, with the mobility, flexibility or tissue quality work—the foam rolling and all of that.

当你锻炼你的弱点时，将你所有的精力都集中在那里。即使在最低的入门级别，或者尤其是在最低的入门级别，解决薄弱环节也是令人筋疲力尽的。

When you work your weak points, keep all your energy focused there. Even at, or maybe especially at, the lowest introductory level, working a weak point is exhausting.

在为未深蹲的群众进行负重运载或深蹲之后，真正的体能训练的理念将会发生根本性的改变。做你从未做过的事情是很累的。

The idea of true conditioning work will radically change after doing loaded carries or squats for the unsquatted masses. Doing stuff you never do is exhausting.

享受。

Enjoy.

第19章

Chapter 19

第十个问题：

Tenth Question:

如果一切从开始到结束都是无缝的，你介意吗？

Would you mind if everything was seamless from start to finish?

“无缝”的理念是我教学、指导和尝试生活方式的一个重要概念。在我的葬礼上，我希望每个人都在谈论同一个人——在生活中，我们称之为正直，即在每种情况下成为一个人、同一个人的能力。

THE IDEA OF ‘SEAMLESS’ is an important concept in the way I teach, coach and attempt to live my life. At my funeral, I hope everyone is talking about the same person—in life, we call this integrity, the ability to be one person, the same person, in every situation.

作为学员，我们在每一项努力中的努力都应该是无缝的，从一种情况或挑战到下一种情况或挑战。

As trainees, our efforts in every endeavor should be seamless, flowing from one situation or challenge to the next.

我的无缝训练方法分为几个层次。首先，我相信精神上对身体如何移动的关注很容易被贴上“优雅”的标签。这与健美操有着相同的传统，健美操一词的字面意思是“美丽的力量”。

My method for making training seamless comes in several layers. First, I believe the mental focus for how the body should move can easily be labeled ‘grace.’ This is from the same tradition as calisthenics, a word that means, literally, ‘beautiful strength.’

其次，对我们来说，与大自然合作非常重要，因为她决定让我们变胖、变弱、让我们陷入困境。一点点知识在这里可以创造奇迹，而最快的途径就是与身体本身一起工作。

Second, it’s really important for us to work with nature as she decides to fatten us up, weaken us and ties us into knots. A little knowledge can work wonders here, and the fastest route is to work with the body itself.

根据你如何看待生活，你可能会说，我们一生都在不断地与重力作斗争，最终不可避免地会被压扁。或者，就像我建议的那样，我们可以考虑一种更美观、更简单的方法。如果你真的对终身健身感兴趣，请重新调整你的思维，让自己变得美丽而简单。

Depending on how you look at life, you could argue that we fight the constant fight against gravity our entire lives and it’s inevitable we’ll end up crushed and flattened. Or, like I advise, we can look at a more beautiful and simple approach. If you’re truly interested in lifelong fitness, readjust your thinking to the beautiful and simple.

当我们想到自己变老的方式，或者观察我们中有多少人搬家时，您可能会感觉到缺少了一些东西。

When we think of the way we age, or watch how many of us move, you might get the sense that something is missing.

我想当你观看 NBA 比赛，然后观看你的邻居打一场接球比赛时，你就会明白我在说什么。观看大厨切胡萝卜，当你用刀挥舞时，你也会看到同样的情况。请把手指放在汤上。

I think you’ll know what I am talking about when you watch an NBA game and then watch your neighbors play a pick-up game. Watch a master chef cut carrots and you’ll see the same thing when you flail away with a knife. Keep your fingers out the soup, please.

嗯，那是什么？

Well, what is it?

这是恩典。这是优雅。这是美丽。

It’s grace. It’s elegance. It’s beauty.

这可能听起来很奇怪，但如果我被迫只为那些对健身感兴趣的人谈论一个问题，那就是恩典。

It might sound odd, but if I were forced to talk about only one issue for those interested in fitness, it would simply be grace.

在解决身体问题之前，只需决定努力变得更加优雅即可。尝试更平稳地坐下、站立和移动，减少抽搐、砰砰声和摇晃。

Before addressing the physical, simply decide to make the effort to be more elegant. Try to sit, stand and move smoother, with less jerks, pops and waddles.

如有疑问，请尝试保持头部平静，并将头顶向上拉，就像被绳子拉着一样。是的，这就是你在芭蕾舞第一天学到的东西，它也适用于你的一生。

When in doubt, try to keep your head calm and the top of your head pulled upward like it’s being pulled by a rope. Yes, it’s what you learned the first day of ballet, and it works for life, too.

观看大多数健身电视节目或互联网视频的最糟糕的部分是寻求精疲力尽。身体崩溃，关节承受压力，我们只感到出汗和疲惫。老实说，从长远来看，最好是努力追求优雅和美丽，让身体适应，嗯……美丽。

The worst part of watching most fitness TV shows or internet videos is the quest for exhaustion. Form falls apart, the joints are stressed and we just get a sense of sweat and exhaustion. Honestly, it’s better long term to strive for elegance and beauty and let the body adapt, well…beautifully.

我们每天都需要这样做。掌握真实的动作应该是每个人的关键，而持续的练习是实现这一想法的关键。我有一个概念，我称之为“热身就是锻炼”，可以满足这种需求，

We need to do this every day. Mastery in authentic movement should be the key for everyone, and consistent practice is the key to this idea. I have a concept I call ‘the warmup is the workout’ that addresses this need,

关键是：如果某件事在锻炼中很重要，那么就应该每天都做。我的热身过程反映了这一点。尽管这里有很多工作，但可以通过改变负荷或缩短距离、时间或重复次数来增加或减少强度。请不要担心这些术语，因为除了上下文之外，名称通常没有什么意义。路德维希·维特根斯坦，我欠你一个！

Here is the key: If something is important in exercise, it should be done every day. My warmup progressions reflect this insight. Although there’s a lot of work here, one can add or subtract the intensity by changing the load or shortening the distance, time or repetitions. Please don’t worry about the terms, as often names have little meaning save in context. Ludwig Wittgenstein, I owe you that one!

不久前，有人告诉我战术青蛙也叫狮子式，但后来有人说“这”是狮子式，然后做了一些奇怪的面部动作。尝试记住这一点：不要担心名称，专注于概念。

Not long ago, I was told the Tactical Frog is also called the Lion Pose, but then someone else said that ‘this’ is the Lion Pose, and then did a number of odd facial movements. Try to remember this: Don’t worry about the name, focus on the concept.

在过去的几年里，我每周都会在当地的公园进行一次免费锻炼，主要是为了保持我的教练技巧。我们在露天进行热身，每人只用一个壶铃——

For the past few years, I offered a weekly free workout at a local park, mostly to keep my coaching skills sharp. We do this warmup out there in the open air with just one kettlebell each—

服务员用非惯用手走路，然后转身返回

Waiter walk with the non-dominant hand, then turn and return with it

用惯用手重复行走

Repeat the walk with dominant hand

自下而上的压力机走得尽可能远——使用 24K，我哪儿也去不了！再次，换手并返回。

Bottoms-up press walk as far as you can—with the 24K, I go nowhere! Again, switch hands and return.

高脚杯深蹲，进入底部位置，然后添加一些弯举

Goblet squat, get into the bottom position and then add a few curls

髋部屈肌拉伸，然后是跨身体下背部拉伸，然后是风车变式，将心脏推向天空

Hip flexor stretch followed by a cross-body lower back stretch, then a variation of the windmill, pushing the heart to the sky

高脚杯深蹲

Goblet squat

髋部屈肌拉伸，然后是跨身体下背部拉伸，然后是风车变式，将心脏推向天空

Hip flexor stretch followed by a cross-body lower back stretch, then a variation of the windmill, pushing the heart to the sky

各种手腕活动

Various wrist mobility moves

开罐器拉伸，针对梨状肌和腰方肌

Can-opener stretch, for the piriformis and QLs

战术青蛙伸展

Tactical frog stretch

肩胛俯卧撑，我们过去所说的水平耸肩

Scap pushups, what we used to call horizontal shrugs

下犬式，然后移动

Downward dog pose, and move through it

海豚姿势，并穿过它

Dolphin pose, and move through it

为了增加每个部分的难度，如果您愿意，可以在每个动作后进行一组 10 次摆动。如果你想更努力，那就20吧！

To make every part harder, if you wish, do a set of 10 swings after each movement. If you want to go even harder, make it 20!

这次热身的目的是完成所有基本的人体动作，通过力量练习、活动性和灵活性运动来润滑关节，并对心血管系统进行一些挑战。这种方法可以解决瘦体重中的“瘦”部分，并提供一种简单的方法来锻炼关节活动度。

The idea of this warmup is to move through all the basic human movements, to lube the joints with strength exercises, mobility and flexibility movements, and to challenge the cardiovascular system a little. It’s a method that addresses the ‘lean’ part of lean body mass, and provides an easy way to work joint mobility.

我的朋友，这就是力量教练最重要的焦点，无缝地支持你的目标。

And that, my friend, is the overriding focus of the strength coach, to seamlessly support your goals.

尽管我将很快讨论程序和编程，但要知道每周进行五天这样的热身是可能的。从那里，您可以选择一个动作并更加集中地训练它。

Although I will address programs and programming shortly, know that it’s possible to do this kind of warmup five days a week. From there, you can pick a movement and train it with more focus.

举个例子-

As an example—

周一

热身

推

周二

热身

拉

周三

热身

铰链

周五

热身

深蹲

周六

热身

负重携带

Monday

Warmup

Push

Tuesday

Warmup

Pull

Wednesday

Warmup

Hinge

Friday

Warmup

Squat

Saturday

Warmup

Loaded Carry

您需要尽可能多地进行基本动作，但加载次数可以减少到每周一次。或者更少，真的。

You need to do the fundamental movements as often as you can, but loading them can be done as seldom as once a week. Or less, really.

重要的是不要将这些视为练习。它们是运动。你没有步行日和“我想我今天会起床”的一天。不！你每天起床，四处走动，活动！

It is important not to think about these as exercises. They’re movements. You don’t have a walking day and an ‘I-think-I’ll-get-out-of-bed-today’ day. No! You get out of bed, you walk around, you move every day!

快速但关键的一点：听起来我似乎在告诉每个人每天都要努力训练。老实说，我认为人类的基本动作应该或可以是日常的，但生活总有办法超越这种思维。根据您的目标，这种方法（整个干预计划）可以短至每周两天，也可以每天两次或两次以上。对于我们大多数人来说，我建议每周进行三次训练和几次简单的运动。嘿，如果你必须这么做的话，就去带狗去散步吧。

A quick but crucial point: It might sound like I’m telling everyone to train hard every day. Honestly, I think the fundamental human movements should or could be daily, but life has a way of getting in front of this kind of thinking. Depending on your goals, this approach—the whole Intervention program—can be as little as two days a week to two or more sessions a day. For most of us, I suggest three training sessions a week and several simple movement sessions. Hey, just go take the dog for a walk, if that’s what you have to do.

力量教练应该寻求将人体运动的基础知识无缝地融入到实现客户目标的训练中。负载可能会改变。音量可能会改变。然而，运动胜过一切。

A strength coach should seek to seamlessly integrate the basics of human movement into training towards their clients’ goals. The load may change. The volume may change. Movement, however, trumps everything else.

第20章

Chapter 20

三合会和奥林匹克举重训练

Training with the Triads and the Olympic Lifts

在干预中， “高级”的概念略有不同。这并不意味着 NFL 或奥运会选手。这意味着你已经掌握了动作的模式、磨练和对称性。此外，您希望通过在锻炼中添加一些流行元素来加速实现目标。

In Intervention, the concept of ‘advanced’ is just a little different. It doesn’t mean NFL or Olympian. It means you have mastered the patterns, the grinds and symmetry of the movements. In addition, you’re looking to accelerate your goals by adding a little pop to your workouts.

请记住这一点：与我在第二象限合作的许多运动员（如您所知，碰撞运动和职业）基本上只是进行模式工作和磨练。为了进行体能训练，我们会使用第 227 页上的“Eagle”训练，以及第 228 页上的 ButtBurner 4000 的变体。通常，由于所有碰撞造成的伤害，第二象限运动员由于对称性而无法在训练中进行弹道训练问题。

Keep this in mind: Many of the athletes I work with in Quadrant Two—as you remember, the collision sports and occupations—basically just do pattern work and grinds. For conditioning, we do things like The Eagle, seen on page 227, and variations of the ButtBurner 4000 from page 228. Often, due to injuries caused by all the collisions, Quadrant Two athletes can’t do ballistic work in training because of symmetry issues.

那么，如果专业人士不做这些高级工作，你为什么要去做呢？这些动作是多种人体动作的无缝集成。我挑战你做一个李维诺夫抓举或自重抓举，并告诉我五个人体动作中的哪一个——实际上是五加一！——它是。这些动作对掌握各个领域的能力具有挑战性，同时也要求力量、灵活性和全力以赴的协调性。另外，它们很有趣，可以有效燃烧脂肪，并在弹道下挑战我们。

So, why should you do the advanced work if the pros aren’t doing it? These movements are seamless integrations of multiple human movements. I challenge you to perform a Litvinov or bodyweight snatch and tell me which of the five human movements—actually, five plus one!—it is. These movements are challenging in their demand for mastery across the spectrum, as well as in grace in coordination of strength, mobility and all-out effort. Plus, they’re fun, efficient for fat burning and challenge us under ballistics.

其中一些动作改变了我的生活。

Some of these movements changed my life.

三合会——推举、摇摆和李维诺夫

The Triads—Push Press, Swings and Litvinovs

如果您掌握了推、拉和铰链的模式，并且可以在慢速力量运动中具备一定的能力，并且没有任何对称性问题，那么让我们谈谈如何更快地举起杠铃。

If you have the patterns for push, pull and hinge and you can do them with some competence in slow strength movements and you don’t have any symmetry issues, let’s talk about getting the bar up a little faster.

如果你右手单臂推110磅，左手推不了35磅，我是否必须告诉你你还没有准备好？如果你无法坚持平板支撑 10 秒，请不要认为冲力能帮助你。

If you one-arm press 110 pounds with your right hand and can’t press 35 with your left, do I have to tell you you’re not ready? If you can’t hold a plank for 10 seconds, please don’t think momentum is going to help you.

有人曾经问我，为什么借力推举和借力挺（爆炸性过头动作）似乎在短短几天内就增加了肩部重量。我的回答缺乏科学性，但我再次重复一遍作为提醒，“因为你使用了更重的重量。”

Someone once asked me why push presses and push jerks—explosive overhead movements—seemed to add shoulder mass in just a few days. My answer lacked science, but I repeat it again as a reminder, “Because you use heavier weights.”

这些动作的好处是你会让杠铃飞起来。不足之处？如果你还没有准备好，你就会把大重量抛过头顶。我没疯：在把重物举过头顶之前，请确保所有事情都已确定。如果你不接受我的简单建议，你的棺材可能就钉牢了。安息吧不是我的恢复工具箱的一部分。

The upside of these movements is you’re going to be flying the bar up. The downside? If you’re not ready, you’re going to be tossing big weights overhead. I’m not crazy: Be sure you have things all nailed down before you toss weights overhead. You could end up with your coffin nailed down if you don’t take my simple advice. Rest in peace is not part of my recovery toolbox.

现代体重世界中已经失去了一个简单的原则：你用眼睛按压，但你用耳朵猛拉。很简单，当施压时，包括板凳、军事和其他你能想到的施压时，你会用眼睛看着杠铃上升。将代表向上挤压并全程观察。不管出于什么原因，这都是有效的。

A quick principle lost in our modern weight world: You press with your eyes, but you jerk with your ears. Very simply, when pressing, and that includes bench, military and everything else you can think pressing, you watch the bar go up with your eyes. Squeeze the rep up and watch it all the way. For whatever reason, this works.

但是，用布莱恩·奥德菲尔德的话来说，“你无法通过弹道运动来思考。”

But, to quote Brian Oldfield, “You can’t think through a ballistic movement.”

当猛拉重物时，听 脚的声音。事实上，我教过头挺举时先做一个受控的下蹲，然后用脚发出声音。有趣的是，每个人每次都同意这是对工具包的惊人补充。这个技巧可以摆脱猴脑的束缚，让你以平稳、有效的方式移动你的身体，而不会因为过度思考而破坏它。

When jerking weights, listen for the feet. In fact, I teach the overhead jerks as a controlled dip followed by making noise with the feet. The funny thing is, everybody, every time agrees this is an amazing addition to the toolkit. This trick gets monkey-brain out of the way and allows you to move your body in a smooth, efficient manner without ruining it by over-thinking.

当然，对于每一个动作都是如此，包括所有的投掷和大多数团队运动。思考可能会危害您的成功！下次当你在 1000 万观众面前筋疲力尽、比赛时间已所剩无几、必须罚两球才能扳平比分并将比赛拖入加时赛时……继续想一想。祝你好运。

This is true, of course, for every movement, including all of the throws and most team sports. Thinking can be hazardous to your success! The next time you’re exhausted in front of 10-million viewers with no game time left on the clock and have to make two free throws to tie things up and send the game into overtime…go ahead and think about it. Good luck.

推压

Push Press

推压很简单。站直，将重量放在胸部（过头推举的正常起始位置），将双腿置于受控的弯曲位置。然后，用全身用力将杠铃推向完成的推举位置。这相对容易做到，但要花点时间添加板。当你向上推杆时，你的下巴会挡住杠铃，需要一些练习才能学会将下巴拉开。我经历了一番艰难才学会了这一点。

The push press is simple. Standing tall, with the weight on your chest—the normal start position for overhead pressing—dip your legs in a controlled bend. Then, vigorously drive the bar using your whole body toward the finished press position. It’s relatively easy to do, but take your time adding plates. There’s an issue with your chin being in the way of the bar as you drive it up, and it takes a bit of practice to learn to pull your chin out of the way. I learned that one the hard way.

秋千

Swings

虽然我在铰链部分讨论了摆动，但让我提醒您，在添加动态运动之前，您需要锁定拉动、铰链和下蹲模式，而不会出现对称问题。女性如此迅速地掌握秋千的部分原因是，她们的大部分训练经验往往是拉、铰和蹲，并且许多人避免了似乎吸引男性的过度推动作。

Although I discussed swings in the hinge section, let me remind you, you need to have the pull, hinge and squat patterns locked down without symmetry issues before adding the dynamic movement on top of things. Part of the reason women pick up the swing so quickly is that much of their training experience tends to be pull, hinge and squat, and many avoid the excessive pushing movements that seem to draw men.

或许。无论如何，男性比女性更快地挥杆的情况很少见。

Maybe. No matter what, it’s a rare situation where men pick up the snappy, hinging swing faster than women.

李维诺夫锻炼

The Litvinov Workout

在我写过的所有文章中，关于谢尔盖·李维诺夫的那一篇受到的批评比我所做的任何文章都多。故事简介：前铁饼世界纪录保持者约翰·鲍威尔告诉我，1983 年他看到 196 磅重的利特维诺夫进行训练。

Of all the articles I have ever written, the one about Sergei Litvinov has received more criticism than anything I have done. The story in brief: former discus world-record-holder John Powell told me that in 1983 he saw the 196-pound Litvinov do a workout.

这很简单——以 180 公斤（396 磅）的重量进行前蹲八次，然后绕 400 米跑道跑 75 秒。约翰报告说，李维诺夫这样做了三次。

It was simple—eight reps in the front squat with 180 kilos (396 pounds) followed by a 75-second run around the 400-meter track. John reported that Litvinov did this three times.

让我们回顾一下这里的基础知识。第一，如果你能做三组 400 米的前蹲，每组八个，那么你可能不需要我提供太多建议。第二，你们中那些不认为李维诺夫真的做到了这一点的人，好吧，但是问约翰，而不是我！

Let’s review the basics here. One, if you can front squat 400 for three sets of eight, you probably don’t need a ton more advice from me. Two, those of you who don’t think Litvinov actually did this, fine, but question John about it, not me!

早期文章的批评者还忽略了这一点：我开发了以下李维诺夫程序供精锐军队使用。当战斗中发生某些事情时，就会出现腿筋撕裂的问题。健美和慢跑并不能让人类满足在负重战斗中冲刺的需要。因此，以下编程来自我与这些力量一起工作的经验。

What the earlier article critics also missed was this: I developed the following Litvinov program for use by elite military forces. There was an issue with torn hamstrings when certain things happened in combat. Bodybuilding and jogging doesn’t prep a human for the needs of sprinting in combat under load. So, the following programming comes from my experience working with these forces.

我还要说的是：这些训练改变了我和我的运动员作为投掷运动员的身份，我必须感谢约翰·鲍威尔和谢尔盖·利特维诺夫进行了这次伟大的变革性训练！

I will also say this: These workouts transformed me and my athletes as throwers and I have to thank John Powell and Sergei Litvinov for this great transformational workout!

进行任何大的举重动作，然后（轻轻地）放下杠铃并跑步。我和我的负责人使用过以下电梯。

Perform any big lift, then drop the bar (gently) and run. My charges and I have used the following lifts.

清洁

Cleans

清洁并按压

Clean & Press

挺举

Clean & Jerk

硬拉

Deadlift

前蹲

Front Squat

过头深蹲

Overhead Squat

抢夺

Snatch

我们还使用壶铃和哑铃进行抓举和摆动的各种变体。

We’ve also used any and all variations of snatches and swings with kettlebells and dumbbells.

随着时间的推移，我们发现 400 米的距离对于我们的需求来说太长了。但如果你真的想要快速减脂，一定要跑 400 米！

Over time, we discovered 400 meters was far too long a run for our needs. But if you really desire a fat-loss blast, by all means run 400 meters!

这项训练的关键在于细节。后蹲不起作用，因为承受重量和逃跑需要太多的关心和计划。我们还发现，即使是最轻的行李架，也很难装入皮卡车的货厢中，拖到可以将提升和运行结合起来的地方。

The devil is in the details with this workout. Back squats don’t work because racking the weight and running away involves way too much care and planning. We also discovered that even our lightest racks were a hassle to pack into the bed of a pickup to haul to a place where we could combine the lifting and running.

另外，我讨厌在恶劣的天气里把杠铃、举重和架子放在外面，收集雨水和泥土。我厌倦了在夏日阳光下用滚烫的重物灼伤双手。

Also, I hated having my bar, weights and rack outside in lousy weather, collecting rainwater and mud. And I got tired of burning my hands on the hot weights in the summer sun.

有些举重动作也不太有效——我们尝试了其他举重动作，比如军事推举和卧推，但这似乎很愚蠢——大量的工作和设置，但时间和精力却没有多少回报。挺举似乎也从来没有发挥过作用。举升机必须简单且易于快速推动，只需很少的脑力劳动。

Some lifts don’t work very well either—we tried other lifts, like military presses and one attempt with the bench press, but it seemed foolish—lots of work and set-up for not much of a return on the time and effort. The clean & jerk never seemed to work right either. The lift has to be simple and easy to push quickly with little mental effort.

最好的电梯是——



The best lifts are—



   前蹲

   Front Squat

   过头深蹲，如果你擅长的话

   Overhead Squat, if you’re good at them

   抢夺

   Snatch

   用壶铃或哑铃摆动——但要真正增加次数；尝试做超过30个

   Swings with kettlebells or dumbbells—but really rack up the reps; try doing more than 30

利特维短跑

The LitviSprint

很快，Litvinov 被重新构想为 LitviSprint。当我们玩举重和距离时，有一天我们发现自己有了一个壶铃和一座小山。我们很快发现跑步的速度和强度对锻炼的影响比举重本身更大。

Soon, the Litvinov became re-imagined as the LitviSprint. As we played with lifts and distance, one day we found ourselves with a kettlebell and a hill. We soon discovered that the speed and intensity of the run had a bigger impact on the workout than did the lift itself.

锻炼后，我们会先挥动壶铃，然后进行 30 码左右的山坡冲刺，这似乎会让我们在几个小时内燃烧氧气。此外，大量的肉类和止痛液（啤酒）对我们的苏醒作用不大。

Kettlebell swings followed by a hill sprint of 30 yards or so seemed to leave us burning oxygen for hours after the workout. Moreover, massive amounts of meat and analgesic liquids (beer) did little to revive us.

我的教练生涯中最明显的教训再次得到强化：训练越激烈越好。是的，你知道。我也是。那我们为什么不遵守规则呢？

Once again, the most obvious lesson of my coaching life has been reinforced: The more intense your training, the better. Yep, you knew that. So did I. Why, then, don’t we follow the rule?

LitviSprints 开始出现一个不错的小附带利益。当学习举重时（通常是过头深蹲），举重后进行冲刺似乎可以加快学习过程。

A nice little spin-off benefit began to emerge from LitviSprints. When learning a lift—very often the overhead squat—doing the sprint after the lift seems to speed up the learning process.

为什么？我有两个想法。



Why? I have two ideas.



1. 当大多数人尝试学习一项新技能时，他们想得太多。就像已故的乔·米尔斯常说的那样：“别想！你装备不好啊！

1.   When most people try to learn a new skill, they think too much. Like the late Joe Mills used to say: “Don’t think! You’re ill-equipped!

我会尝试在诊所教抓举或挺举，但问题却不断出现。

I’ll try to teach the snatch or clean at a clinic and the questions just keep coming.

“我的大拇指应该放在哪里？”

“Where do I put my thumbs?”

（嗯，靠近你的手指。）

(Um, near your fingers.)

“我的手肘应该放在哪里？”

“Where do I put my elbows?”

（上臂和下臂之间。）

(Between the upper and lower arm.)

通过增加冲刺来使新的举重变得更加复杂，问题就停止了，我们开始追寻动作。通过魔法，看起来还不错。



In making the new lift even more complex by adding sprints, the questions stop, and we get after the movement. By magic, it looks okay.



2. 人们在第一次尝试一项新技能时就试图使其完美。我可能已经深蹲了近 100,000 次，每次与戴夫·特纳或比尔·威特一起工作时，我仍然可以学到新东西。这不会在第一盘发生！短跑的挑战似乎让我们忘记完美而专注于完成。

2.   People attempt perfection with a new skill the first time they try it. I’ve probably squatted near 100,000 reps and I still learn new things each time I work with Dave Turner or Bill Witt. This isn’t going to happen on the first set! The challenge of sprinting seems to get us to forget perfection and focus on completion.

利特维雪橇

LitviSleds

我不满足于独自一人，开始尝试 LitviSleds。我们这里确实存在一些设备问题。除了杠铃、壶铃或哑铃以及需要跑步的区域之外，您还需要雪橇和安全带。

Not content with leaving well enough alone, I began experimenting with LitviSleds. We do have some equipment issues here. Beyond the bar or kettlebell or dumbbell and the need for an area to run, you’ll also need a sled and a harness.

在雪橇拖动之前选择您要执行的举升动作。我把我们的清单精简为这些简单的动作——

Choose the lift you’ll be performing before the sled drag. I cut our list down to these simple moves—

前蹲

Front Squats

过头深蹲

Overhead Squats

用壶铃摇摆

Swings with a kettlebell

您必须简化的原因是您在抬起之前将自己挂在安全带上。在举升过程中，您会被挂在雪橇上，这样您就可以放下杆并冲刺或拖走。

The reason you have to simplify is that you hook yourself into the harness before you lift. You’re hooked to the sled during the lift so you can drop the bar and sprint or drag away.

警告：抬起到雪橇路径的一侧。很明显，是的，但不少人开始冲刺或阻力，抓住重物并被猛力拉到地上。看起来很有趣，但也可能真的很伤人。我还是会笑，但你会受伤。

A caveat: Lift to the side of the path of the sled. Obvious, yes, but more than a few people have started the sprint or drag, snagged the weights and got yanked to the ground. It’s funny to watch, but it may also really hurt. I’ll still laugh, but you’ll be hurt.

我不知道雪橇上应该装载多少东西。我发现挂一个 70 磅重的壶铃，让它拖曳对于大多数人来说是合适的。阻力很好，但不要像许多人那样过度，他们认为你需要拉动建筑物。重要的不是像猪一样在污水中打滚，而是像运动员一样飞走。

I have no idea how much you should load on the sled. I’ve found hooking a 70-pound kettlebell so it drags is about right for most people. The drag is nice, but don’t overdo it like many, who think you need to pull a building. What’s important isn’t wallowing around like a pig in slop, but flying away like an athlete.

因此，减少沉迷，加快速度。

So, less wallow, more speed.

我还鼓励你走大约五秒钟，不要担心距离。否则，你几乎会立即失去努力的质量。

I also encourage you to go for about five seconds and not worry about distance. Otherwise, you lose the quality of effort almost immediately.

Litvinovs、LitviSprints 和 LitviSleds 基于一个非常简单的想法。努力的质量远比数量重要——一开始你可能会忽略这个概念。

Litvinovs, LitviSprints and LitviSleds are based on a very simple idea. The quality of effort is far more important than the quantity—a concept you’ll probably miss at first.

您可能会发现这是您做过的最快的锻炼。如果锻炼看起来太轻松或太轻松，请不要感到惊讶。判断最后一组的训练结果，而不是第一组。



You may find this the fastest workout you’ve ever done. Don’t be surprised if the workout seems too light or too easy. Judge the workout on the last set, not the first.



1. 选择您熟悉的电梯。用它完成八次良好的重复，然后冲刺五秒钟。休息并重复此操作两次。

1.   Pick a lift you know. Hit eight good reps with it, then sprint away for five seconds. Rest and repeat this two more times.

2. 下次尝试锻炼时，尝试另一次举重，也许冲刺时间更长一点。

2.   The next time you try the workout, try another lift and maybe go a bit longer on the sprint.

3. 每周进行两次这种简单的练习。如果您选择将其作为整个腿部的锻炼，那么您的选择是明智的。如果您正在准备体育比赛，请尝试看看这种锻炼是否适用于您的比赛领域。

3.   Do this easy progression about twice a week. If you choose to make this your whole leg workout, you’ve chosen wisely. If you’re preparing for an athletic competition, try to see if this workout carries over to your field of play.

4. 不要在前几次锻炼中测量休息时间。让自己完全康复。当举重中的重量增加并且冲刺时间达到大约 10 到 20 秒时，尝试将 3 到 5 分钟的恢复时间归零。你会需要它。

4.   Don’t measure rest periods the first few workouts. Let yourself recover fully. As the weights go up in the lift and the sprint gets to around 10 to 20 seconds, try to zero in on three- to five-minute recoveries. You’ll need it.

哦，最后一点。在 1987 年罗马世界锦标赛上，约翰·鲍威尔 (John Powell) 在看到第一批 Litivinovs 四年后，明显变得更瘦、更快、肌肉更发达，他在铁饼比赛中获得了第二名。他已经40岁了，这对于田径来说是古老的事，这一成就至今仍被认为是田径历史上最惊人的壮举之一。

Oh, one final note. At the 1987 World Championships in Rome, noticeably leaner, faster and more muscular four years after he saw the first Litivinovs, John Powell took second place in the discus. He was 40 years old, which is ancient in track and field, and this accomplishment is still considered one of the most amazing feats in track and field history.

奥林匹克升降机

The Olympic Lifts

如果，这是一个很大的如果，你有模式、研磨、对称、弹道，并且可以展示推举或挺举、挥杆和李维诺夫，我将欢迎你来到奥林匹克举重的架子上。现在，我可以教一屋子九年级学生举重的基础知识，但对于其他人群，我会等待这两个动作。如果推、拉、铰、蹲都拨通了，那么深蹲抓举及其亲属就合适了。如果负重携带很扎实，我还会将深蹲和挺举以及家庭的其他部分添加到训练负荷中。

If, and is this a big if, you have the pattern, the grind, the symmetry, the ballistics and can demonstrate a push press or jerk and a swing and a Litvinov, I will welcome you to the racks of Olympic lifting. Now, I can teach a roomful of ninth-graders the basics of weightlifting, but with any other population, I wait on these two moves. If the push, pull, hinge and squat are all dialed in, the squat snatch and its relatives are appropriate. If loaded carries are solid, I also add the squat clean and jerk, and the rest of the family, to the training load.

如需了解更多信息，我在www.danjohn.net/pdfs/bp.pdf上提供了一本免费的 97 页电子书，并在davedraper.com上提供了几张有关该主题的 DVD 。

For more information, I offer a free 97-page ebook at www.danjohn.net/pdfs/bp.pdf, and have several DVDs on the topic at davedraper.com.

打印奥运举重指令是一件困难的事情。用足球教练的术语来说，这些需要刻意学习。

It is a difficult thing to type out Olympic lifting instructions. These need to be, in the jargon of football coaching, learned deliberately.

走它

说它

粉笔它

Walk it

Talk it

Chalk it

如果您需要的话，花时间和精力来掌握 O 举是非常值得的。

It is well worth the time and effort to master the O lifts…if you need to do them.

第21章

Chapter 21

工具包的秘密

The Secrets of the Toolkit

当我向我的教练同事介绍干预的基础知识时，当他们收回要点并在自己和运动员身上进行尝试时，出现了一些反复出现的主题。我将这些称为秘密，就像“低买高卖”是一个秘密一样。

As I HAVE GIVEN the basics of Intervention to my fellow coaches, a few reoccurring themes have emerged as they take back the key points to try them on themselves and their athletes. I refer to these as the secrets, in the same way ‘buy low, sell high’ is a secret.

这份清单代表了一年左右的见解、后续讨论和突破。



This list represents a year or so of insights, follow up discussions and breakthroughs.



   增强基本的人体动作。

   Get stronger in the fundamental human movements.

   这就是举重的阿特金斯饮食法——通过在训练中故意保持一段时间的不平衡，你可以平衡真正的不平衡。

   This is the Atkins Diet of lifting—by deliberately being imbalanced for a while in training, you balance the real imbalances.

   遵循模式不会受到惩罚——学习并回归模式永远不会错。

   There is no punishment in doing patterns—learning and coming back to patterns is never wrong.

   因模式和磨砺动作而感到气喘吁吁是没关系的。

   It’s okay to get gassed from patterns and grind movements.

   对称训练因其代谢影响而被低估。

   Symmetry workouts are undervalued for their metabolic hit.

   如果您需要爆发力动作，请检查模式、研磨和对称性。看看三合会。

   If you need explosive movements, check patterns, grinds and symmetry. Look at the triads.

   80/10/10 规则是一个很有价值的工具。把大部分时间花在你的目标上——扔东西、做饭和吃饭。

   The 80/10/10 rule is a valuable tool. Spend the bulk of your time on what your goal is all about—throwing, cooking and eating.

   当你走这条路时，确保它能拓展你的视野——想想螺旋式的发展。

   As you go on this path, make sure it expands you out—think about the spiral.

   目标就是保持目标，目标！专注于它，不要陷入其他事情中。

   The goal is to keep the goal, the goal! Focus on it, don’t get caught up in a bunch of other things.

记住工具包并记住以下内容：

Remember the toolkit and put the following to memory—

大多数人都会处于第三象限，所以仅仅因为你可以做所有事情，并不意味着你应该这样做。如果您是培训师或教练，请学会将人们推向第三象限。您可能会花一生的时间让人们相信他们不是精英特种部队或 NFL 球员。

Most people will be in Quadrant Three, so just because you can do everything, doesn’t mean you should. If you’re a trainer or coach, learn to push people to Quadrant Three. You may spend your life convincing people they’re not elite Special Forces or NFL players.

增强基本的人体动作。

Get stronger in the fundamental human movements.

这是如此明显，您可能会错过这一重要点，因此请注意：几乎普遍而言，变得更强将帮助您实现目标。说到力量就够了，但大多数人甚至从未接近过力量训练这个唾手可得的成果。

This is so obvious you might miss this important point, so pay attention: Almost universally, getting stronger is going to help you with your goals. Enough is enough when it comes to strength, but most people never even get close to the low-hanging fruit of strength training.

我和一些人一起工作，他们对我的卧推体重 15 磅的建议感到惊讶，因为他们从未见过如此强壮的人。相信我，这个星球上有很多强者。对于减脂来说，变得更强壮就像把自己变成一台减脂机器的一站式服务。

I work with men who gasp at my suggestion to bench bodyweight for 15 since they’ve never seen anyone that strong. Trust me, there are plenty of strong people on the planet. For fat loss, getting stronger is like the one-stop shop for turning yourself into a fat-loss machine.

进入举重室，努力增加杠铃片或将销钉向下移动或滑到更重的哑铃上。这是我能教你的最简单的事情。

Get in the weightroom and strive to add plates or move the pin down or slide over to a heavier dumbbell. It is the simplest thing I can teach you.

这就是举重的阿特金斯饮食法——通过在训练中故意保持一段时间的不平衡，你可以平衡真正的不平衡。

This is the Atkins Diet of lifting—by deliberately being imbalanced for a while in training, you balance the real imbalances.

最初的阿特金斯饮食最有意义的事情之一是为期两周的诱导计划，以完全消除饮食中的所有碳水化合物。我的想法是这样的：如果我的碳水化合物摄入量不平衡，那么我们就完全转向相反的摄入脂肪和蛋白质，以达到这种平衡。这对他的饮食和锻炼都有效。

One of the things that made the most sense about the original Atkins Diet was the two-week induction program to completely remove every carbohydrate from the diet. The thinking was this: If I’ve been imbalanced with carbs, let’s swing all the way to the opposite towards fat and protein to achieve that balance. It worked for many in his diet and it works in exercise.

有可能在几周的时间里，你会做大量的高脚杯深蹲、农夫行走和在地上打滚。您可能会从平常做事的正常方式中忽略一些事情。但这种向一个方向的不平衡将会使事情达到平衡。它也发生得很快。

There’s a chance that for a few weeks, you will do lots of goblet squats, farmer walking and rolling on the ground. You may ignore some things from the normal way you usually do things. But this imbalance in one direction is going to balance things out. It also happens very quickly.

例如，如果你没有真正的深蹲模式，并且忽视了你的菱形肌，那么它就会在运动和衰老过程中迎头赶上。我的整形外科医生告诉我，没有什么比基于能够大小便而决定进行髋关节置换术更让他难过的了。由于不使用或疾病而失去深蹲模式可以由训练师和外科医生解决，具体取决于严重程度。

If you don’t have an authentic squat pattern and you ignore your rhomboids, for example, it’s going to catch up in sports and in the process of aging. My orthopedic surgeon told me that nothing makes him sadder than when the decision to perform hip replacement is based on being able to relieve oneself. Losing the squat pattern through disuse or disease can be addressed by either the trainer and the surgeon, depending on the severity.

让我们在几周内保持一点不平衡，以使明显的弱点达到某种标准。

Let’s be a bit imbalanced for a few weeks to bring the glaring weaknesses up to some standard.

遵循模式不会受到惩罚——学习并回归模式永远不会错。

There is no punishment in doing patterns—learning and coming back to patterns is never wrong.

许多人认为平板支撑、蝙蝠翼、帽子、高脚杯深蹲、农夫行走和基本滚动等动作都是初学者动作。诚然，我们应该尽早并经常教授这些知识，但高级培训师通常从简单的东西中受益比我能想象的任何花哨的东西更多。

Many people consider the patterns—planks, batwings, HATs, goblet squats, farmer walks and basic rolling—to be beginner moves. True, we should teach these early and often, but advanced trainers often benefit more from the simple stuff than anything fancy I can dream up.

图案工作可以燃烧脂肪。模式工作可以进行纠正。模式工作可以让你变得更坚强。不要认为模式工作是有罪的、惩罚性的、倒退的或令人尴尬的。这些举措可能是您的问题的答案。

Pattern work can be fat burning. Pattern work can be correctives. Pattern work can make you stronger. Don’t consider pattern work to be sinful, punishment, regressive or embarrassing. These moves might be the answer to your issues and questions.

因模式和研磨动作而感到气喘吁吁是正常的。

It’s okay to get gassed from pattern and grind movements.

我永远不知道如何与那些只想感觉“锻炼身体”的人打交道。我喜欢培训人们变得更好、做得更好。如果你的运动，或者你的自尊，需要一些让你蜷缩起来、呕吐到花盆里的锻炼，你可以通过模式和磨练来达到目标​​。无论您今天的需求是什么，前蹲然后用卡车推一英里都会满足您所需的一切。

I’m never sure how to handle people who just want to feel ‘worked out.’ I like to train people to be and do better. If your sport, or your ego, demands some workouts that curl you over, vomiting into a flower pot, you can get there with patterns and grinds. Front squats followed by a truck push for a mile will get you all you need no matter what your needs are today.

图案和磨砂是你想要点亮事物的地方，而不是在奥林匹克举升机上。

Patterns and grinds are where you want to light things up, not on the Olympic lifts.

对称训练因其代谢 影响而被低估。

Symmetry workouts are undervalued for their metabolic hit.

当我旅行时，我经常使用酒店的健身房进行单臂训练。我发现令人惊讶的是，对称训练，就像基本的矫正一样，似乎和艰苦的锻炼一样让我疲惫不堪。关于为什么会发生这种情况，目前正在进行一场精彩的讨论，但许多健身专家发现，与跑步机或骑自行车等更常见的运动相比，他们的减脂客户通过矫正运动和对称运动变得更瘦。值得未来持续关注。

When I travel, I often use the hotel gym to one-arm work. What I find amazing is that symmetry work, like basic correctives, seems to wear me out as much as a tough workout. There is a great conversation going on right now about why this happens, but many fitness experts have been finding their fat-loss clients get leaner doing corrective work and symmetry movements as opposed to more common movements like treadmills or cycles. It’s worth keeping an eye on in the future.

此外，正如我从多次手腕手术中了解到的那样，训练健康的肢体似乎可以促进打石膏的肢体的康复。这很奇怪，但却是事实。据我的医生说，我恢复正常的时间是正常患者的一半，他认为我坚持继续围绕伤势和吊带进行训练是一个主要因素。身体是一个整体，一个奇妙的整体，也许对称训练提醒我们，你可能有两个肢体，但一颗心和一个大脑。理想情况下。

Moreover, as I learned from my multiple wrist surgeries, training a healthy limb seems to spark the rehab in the limb that is in a cast. It is bizarre, but true. My return to normal was half the time of a normal patient according to my doctor and he thinks that my insistence on continuing to train around the injury and sling was a major factor. The body is one piece, one marvelous piece, and perhaps symmetry training reminds us that you may have two limbs, but one heart and one brain. Ideally.

如果运动员需要爆发力动作，请检查模式、研磨和对称性。看看三合会。

If an athlete needs explosive movements, check patterns, grinds and symmetry. Look at the triads.

如果。

If.

不要忽视那个“如果”。投掷运动员、碰撞运动员和跳远运动员可能需要抓举和挺举。奶奶大概不会。在参加奥运会举重比赛之前，要花时间真正寻找并处理差距、不对称和不良的运动模式。在快速举重过程中，受伤来得又快又严重。

Don’t ignore that ‘if.’ Throwers, collision athletes and jumpers might need to snatch and clean & jerk. Grandma probably doesn’t. Take the time to really search and deal with gaps, asymmetries and poor movement patterns before tossing bodyweight overhead at an Olympic lifting meet. The injuries come fast and hard in the quick lifts.

花大量时间掌握推举、挥杆和李维诺夫家族。对于我们许多人来说，这三者足以突破任何物理障碍或限制。 O 举重改变了我的职业生涯，但我在身体、精神和情感上都做好了迎接挑战的准备。在参加我的主要运动之前，我还有几个月的时间来掌握这些动作。

Spend quality time mastering the push press, the swing and the Litvinov family. For many of us, these three will be enough to break through any physical barriers or limitations. The O lifts changed my career, but I was physically, mentally and emotionally ready for the challenge. I also had months to master the movements before I had to compete in my main sport, too.

您可能没有时间在举重室中完成爆发性动作。

You may not have the years it takes to walk up the path to explosive movements in the weightroom.

如果你愿意，那就出发吧。

If you do, get going.

80/10/10 规则是一个很有价值的工具。把大部分时间花在你的目标上——扔东西、做饭和吃饭

The 80/10/10 rule is a valuable tool. Spend the bulk of your time on what your goal is all about—throwing, cooking and eating

时间是关键。如果您每周有 40 个小时用于实现目标，我们会让您在举重房进行 4 小时的举重训练和 4 小时的矫正训练。我的数学很模糊，但看起来大约是八个小时。剩下的时间应该致力于你的目标。

Time is the key here. If you have 40 hours a week to spend on your goal, we get to have you in the weightroom for four hours of lifting and four hours of corrective work. My math is fuzzy, but that looks like about eight hours. The rest of the time should be working on your goal.

为了减肥，你每周要花 32 个小时购物、烹饪、测量、称重，并积极处理饮食和食物。如果您是投掷者……投掷！如果你是跨栏运动员，那就跨栏吧！如果你是短跑运动员，那就冲刺吧！如果你是一名跳高运动员，那就跳吧！

For fat loss, you would spend 32 hours a week shopping, cooking, measuring, weighing, and proactively dealing with eating and food. If you are a thrower…throw! If you are a hurdler, hurdle! If you are a sprinter, sprint! If you are a jumper, jump!

现在我也泄露了我作为田径教练的所有秘密。

Now I have given away all my secrets as a track coach too.

当你走上这条道路时，请确保它会扩展你——螺旋。

As you go on this path, make sure it expands you out—the spiral.

有许多作者对此说得更好，但就是这样：要小心，不要在实现目标后发现它不值得。正确的目标设定应该包括在每个象限中扩展你的生活。请记住，“适合”一词源自古挪威语“针织”。你的生活就是你的挂毯，它应该有精美的图画、丰富的色彩和紧密的编织。

There are dozens of authors who have said this better, but here it is: Be wary of getting your goal and discovering it wasn’t worth it. Proper goal-setting should include expanding your life in every quadrant. Remember, the word ‘fit’ comes from the Old Norse word ‘to knit.’ Your life is your tapestry and it should have a great pictures, rich colors and a tight weave.

正如我曾经告诉我的学生，“你的生活就是你的信息！”

As I used to tell my students, “Your life is your message!”

目标就是保持目标，目标！专注于它，不要陷入其他事情中。

The goal is to keep the goal, the goal! Focus on it, don’t get caught up in a bunch of other things.

虽然这一点似乎与前一点相矛盾，但请记住这一点：正如克里斯·朗一直向我指出的那样，“当你在鳄鱼身上拼尽全力时，再问为什么要排干沼泽就为时已晚了。”

Although this point seems to contradict the previous point, remember this: As Chris Long points out to me all the time, “When you’re up to your butt in alligators, it’s too late to ask why you drained the swamp.”

私人教练、生活教练或好朋友能为你做的最好的事情就是不断提醒你你的目标。

The best thing a personal trainer, life coach or good friend can do for you is to keep reminding you about your goal.

史蒂夫教练的案例三

Coach Stevo’s Case Three

这个故事中的客户是一位年长的客户，他非常了解A点，但随着年龄的增长，B点对他来说已经发生了变化。他一边努力前行，一边寻找目标。更重要的是，尽管他具备回答所有 10 个问题的知识，但他脱离了干预工具包的五个原则，并且没有能力处理这些答案。他的干预可能就像重新认识自己身体的完整性一样简单。

The client in this story is an older client who is very aware of Point A, but Point B has changed on him with age. He is seeking a place to aim for, even as he continues diligently marching forward. More importantly, even though he has the knowledge to answer all of the 10 questions, he’s lost touch with the five principles of the Intervention toolkit and is ill-equipped to deal with the answers. His intervention might be as simple as reacquainting himself with the integrity of his own body.

四年前，当他为Greater-Midvale先生训练的时候，他真的已经把事情拨通了。有时他会回去阅读那些日子的训练日记，只是为了寻找线索。

Four years ago, when he was training for Mr. Greater-Midvale, he really had things dialed in. Sometimes he goes back and to read his training journals from those days just to look for clues.

泡沫轴、拉伸、动态热身

Foam Roll, Stretch, Dynamic Warmup

后蹲，5×5

Back Squat, 5×5

超级组——

          腿部伸展、10×3

          腿部弯举、10×3

              每组 1 组至力竭

Superset—

          Leg Extension, 10×3

          Leg Curl, 10×3

              1 set each to failure

超级组

          ——坐式小腿抬高、10×3

          站立小腿抬高、10×3

              每组 1 组至力竭

Superset—

          Seated Calf Raise, 10×3

          Standing Calf Raise, 10×3

              1 set each to failure

那是一次很好的锻炼。不过，他现在永远无法进行这项锻炼了——对膝盖来说太难了。他主要坚持使用滑动臀部雪橇来进行腿部训练。有时他会做弓箭步。但跑步机是他真正能投入时间保持苗条身材的唯一方法。

That was a good workout. He could never do that workout now, though—too hard on the knees. He mostly sticks to the sliding hip sled for his leg work. Sometimes he does lunges. But the treadmill is the only way he can really put in the time he needs to stay lean.

40岁以后肯定更难，但什么不是呢？他知道如果他想保持健康就需要继续投入时间。或者，他经常对朋友开玩笑，他可以放开自己，做一只熊。经过 20 年的举重训练，他只是没有动力去真正完成一系列的倦怠。强度是年轻人的游戏。

It’s definitely harder after age 40, but what isn’t? He knows he needs to keep putting the time in if he’s going to stay fit. Or, he often jokes to his friends, he could let himself go and just be a bear. After 20 years of lifting iron, he just doesn’t have that drive to really finish a set of burnouts. Intensity is a young man’s game.

也许他在锻炼后开始写训练日志后迷失了方向。有一次，他锻炼了整整一个小时，却记不起自己做了什么。他猜是卷发；那是星期二，星期二通常是二头肌日。也许他需要一个程序什么的。他已经完成了他能想到的所有程序，但他总是必须修改它们。后来他在跑步机上读了几本健身杂志。当然，他可以做一些新的事情——一些能够推动进步、让他再次前进的事情。

Maybe he got lost after he started writing his training logs after he worked out. Once he worked out for a whole hour and couldn’t remember what he’d done. He guessed curls; it was Tuesday and Tuesday was usually biceps day. Maybe he needed a program or something. He’d done every program he could think of though, and he always had to modify them. He’d read a couple of fitness magazines later on the treadmill. Surely there was something new he could do—something to jumpstart some progress, get him going again.

但他总是知道他会在那里找到什么。

But he always knew what he would find in there.

“六周后手臂就会变粗！”我的手臂已经很大了。

“Six weeks to bigger arms!” My arms are already big.

“三个练习保证提高你的生活质量！”我的什么？

“Three exercises guaranteed to blast your QLs!” My what?

“419 个你没有得到结果的原因！”哦不，有419个理由！

“419 reasons you’re not getting results!” Oh no, there’s 419 reasons!

这些都没有帮助。他熟悉举重房的情况。他曾经身材魁梧，身材魁梧。他知道他以前是如何到达那里的，他不想再这样了。现在他想要别的东西。他只是想让事情变得更容易。但事情正变得越来越困难。他做错了什么？

None of these helped. He knows his way around the weightroom. He used to be really big and cut. He knows how he got there before, and he doesn’t want that again. Now he wants something else. He just wants things to be easier. But things are just getting harder. What’s he doing wrong?

第22章

Chapter 22

五项原则

The Five Principles

当小比利问我如何组建校队时，我将通过一些基本原则来回答这个问题，这些原则是让他变得更大、更快和更强的最佳方法。在本书的前一部分中，我问了你很多问题，但你只问了我一个——

WHEN LITTLE BILLY asks me how to make the varsity team, I’m going to answer that question by calling on some fundamental principles about the best way to get him bigger, faster and stronger. Over the previous bulk of this book, I have asked you a lot of questions, but you have only asked me one—

我如何从这里到那里？

How do I get from here to there?

这个问题的答案将取决于我的五项原则。



The answer to that question will rely on my five principles.



1. 瘦体重和关节活动能力的力量训练比其他一切都重要。

1.   Strength training for lean body mass and joint mobility work trumps everything else.

2. 人体的基本运动是根本。

2.   Fundamental human movements are fundamental.

3. 必须不断评估标准和差距。

3.   Standards and gaps must be constantly assessed.

4. 公园长椅和公交车长椅锻炼的概念必须在整个训练生涯中一起应用。

4.   The notion of park bench and bus bench workouts must be applied together throughout the training lifetime.

5. 不断追求精通和优雅。

5.   Constantly strive for mastery and grace.

我将深入讨论其中的每一个，在接下来的章节中，您将了解为什么我会这样回答。

I’ll talk about each of these in depth, and in the following chapters you’ll see why I answer the way I answer.

原则 1

针对瘦体重和关节灵活性的力量训练胜过其他一切。

Principle 1

Strength training for lean body mass and joint mobility work trumps everything else.

您应该花多少时间在肥大和关节活动度上？答案很简单：只要你有空闲的时间！如果目标是尽可能长久地生活得足够好，那么就不要忽视其中任何一个。

How much time should you spend on hypertrophy and joint mobility? The answer is simple: all the time you can spare! If the goal is to live well enough as long as you can, don’t overlook either one.

每当我在电脑上工作时，我都会注意到，当我坐累了时，就会有一种想要站起来的冲动，向后伸展双臂，打个哈欠，这让我看起来就像YMCA歌曲中的 Y。我需要伸展我的臀部和腰肌、我的胸肌、我的二头肌——事实上，我需要伸展我弯腰身体的整个核心。

Whenever I work on a computer, I notice as I tire from sitting, there’s an urge to get up, stretch my arms backwards in this magnificent yawn that makes me look like the Y in the song, YMCA. I need to stretch my hips and psoas, my pecs, my biceps—in fact, I need to stretch the whole core of my bent-over body.

几年前，Vladmir Janda 博士开始讨论姿势所需的肌肉。为了简化，这始终是一个滑坡，他将肌肉分为两组：强直性肌肉，在疲劳（或年老！）时往往会缩短；以及阶段性肌肉，在压力（或年龄，我敢说）下往往会减弱。

Years ago, Dr. Vladmir Janda began discussing the muscles necessary for posture. To simplify, and that’s always a slippery slope, he separated muscles into two groups: tonic, which tend to shorten when tired (or old!) and phasic, which tend to weaken under stress (or age, I dare say).

一个简单的图表——

A simple chart—

肌肉变得更紧实—— 肌肉变弱——
补品 阶段性
上斜方肌 菱形
胸大肌 中后部
二头肌 三头肌
胸小肌 臀大肌
腰肌 深腹肌
梨状肌 腹外斜肌
腿筋 三角肌
小腿肌肉  

我通常这样解释——

I usually explain it this way—

如果一只老虎把你追到树上，你用来长时间抓住树枝的肌肉就是强直肌。如果你决定追赶一头鹿并向它扔石头，你就会使用你的相位肌。

If a tiger chased you up a tree, the muscles you use to hang on to the branch for a long time are tonic muscles. If you decided to chase a deer to throw rocks at it, you’d use your phasic muscles.

可悲的是，大多数培训师都是这样做的。他们倾向于强调像胸肌和二头肌这样的镜像肌肉——比如卧推和弯举——而忽视了真正年轻时的肌肉。

Sadly, most trainers work this backwards. They tend to emphasize the mirror muscles like the pecs and biceps—with, say, bench press and curls—and ignore the muscles that are really the muscles of youth.

利用我们的基本人体动作

Using our fundamental human movements

推力： 三角肌和三头肌

Push: Deltoids and Triceps

拉动： 菱形

Pull: Rhomboids

铰链： 对接

Hinge: Butt

深蹲： 臀部

Squat: Butt

负载： 屁股

Loaded Carries: Butt

各位，屁股是年轻人的肌肉。在那儿坐一会儿。

Folks, the butt is the muscle of youth. Sit on that for a while.

当我第一次接触万维网时，我与 100 磅俱乐部的一些女性进行了一次精彩的对话。只需减掉 100 磅即可成为会员。他们中的大多数人都认为举重中最划算的动作是站立推举和深蹲。看看上面的列表和两个动作，你可以看到他们直观地理解了加强相位肌的必要性。

When I first came to the world wide web, I had this wonderful conversation with some women in the 100-Pound Club. To be a member, one needed only to lose 100 pounds. Most of them had figured out the biggest bang for the buck in terms of weightlifting were the standing press and the squat. Looking at this list above and the two movements, you can see they intuitively understood the need for strengthening the phasic muscles.

举重可以是获得更多瘦体重并提供额外关节活动能力的一种方法。在训练运动员或任何人之前，我会做出一个基本假设，它分为两部分。

Lifting weights can be a way to gain more lean body mass and provide some additional joint mobility. There’s a basic assumption I make before training an athlete, or really anyone, and it comes in two parts.

首先，运动往往胜过肌肉。我不相信手臂日或腿部日。我认为是“人类基本运动”日。当然，我们可以将这项工作分解为垂直、水平和单肢，可能还有更多选择，但通常我们每天都需要处理这些工作，当然还有每次训练课程。

First, movements tend to trump muscles. I do not believe in an arm day nor a leg day. I think ‘basic human movement’ day. Sure, we can break this work into vertical and horizontal and single-limb and probably many more options, but generally we need to deal with these each day, and certainly each training session.

记住：动作第一。

Remember: movements first.

原则 2

人类的基本运动是根本性的。

Principle 2

Fundamental human movements are fundamental.

我知道这是显而易见的一点。相信我，当我第一次开始训练时，我首先被告知了基础知识。五年后，基本面的概念第一次像闪电一样击中了我：我们首先需要基本面！

I know this is an obvious point. Trust me, when I first started to train, I was told fundamentals first. Five decades later, the concept of fundamentals first hit me like a lightning bolt: We need fundamentals first!

几年前，我遇到了这位婚姻治疗师先生。他说了一句话让我思考了几个月：“你知道，通奸对婚姻来说是地狱。”

Years ago, I met this gentleman who was a marriage therapist. He said something that made me think for a few months, “You know, adultery is hell on a marriage.”

然后他恍然大悟，说道：“当然，以前也说过这样的话。”

Then, he sort of caught himself and said, “Of course, something like this has been said before.”

对于没有理解他的观点的读者，请参阅第六诫或任何宗教传统的各种著作。但是，这里的要点很重要：经过 15 年左右的工作，与大约 300 名客户（也许更多）以及似乎经过重大反思后，他得出了一个结论。

For the readers who missed his point, see the Sixth Commandment or the various writings of any religious tradition. But, the point here is important: after 15 or so years of work, with perhaps 300 clients—maybe more—and after, it seems, significant reflection, he came to a conclusion.

您还会注意到，我们的婚姻治疗师没有使用统计数据或数字来证明他的观点。 Covert Bailey 在他的著作《Fit or Fat?》中提出了一个奇妙的问题：“如果一家超市打折‘10 英镑换 1 美元’，你会买吗？不，你不会先问“10 磅什么？”

You will notice, too, that our marriage therapist didn’t use statistics or numbers to prove his point. Covert Bailey, in his work Fit or Fat?, has that wonderful question, “If a supermarket had a sale of ‘10 pounds for a dollar,’ would you buy it? No, wouldn’t you first ask, ‘10 pounds of what?’

总是问，‘10 磅什么？’”

Always ask, ‘10 pounds of what?’”

我们的婚姻治疗师提供的见解是长期反思的概念。请花点时间：我希望你思考第二点——

The insight our marriage therapist provides is the concept of prolonged reflection. Take a moment here: I want you to think about point number two—

人类的基本运动是基础。

Fundamental human movements are fundamental.

我指导和与人们合作的时间越长，我就越相信基本动作胜过其他一切。人们想要奇特的机器、华丽的编程和 Whizzbang 船长的高科技监控设备，但说实话，基本的动作——基本的推、拉、铰链、下蹲和搬运——将成为基础。您可以通过使用壶铃、杠铃、石块或负重袋来获得收益。

The longer I coach and work with people, the more convinced I am that doing the basic movements trumps everything else. People want fancy machines, ornate programming and Captain Whizzbang’s high tech monitoring equipment, but, honestly, the fundamental movements—the basic pushes, pulls, hinges, squats and carries—are going to be the foundation. You can make gains by using kettlebells, bars, rocks or weighted bags.

当我第一次见到迪克·诺特梅尔时，他的训练项目是奥林匹克举重和前深蹲。当我第一次见到拉尔夫·莫恩（Ralph Maughan）时，他的贡献是全转身投掷，一些举重，并且在整个职业生涯中始终如一地表现出来。在每一种需求时尚和时尚中，这些给定都被一次又一次地证明是正确的。

When I first met Dick Notmeyer, his givens were the Olympic lifts and the front squat. When I first met Ralph Maughan, his givens were full-turn throws, some lifting, and showing up consistently for one’s whole career. Throughout every need fad and fashion, these givens have been proven correct over and over again.

但是，这就是关键：就像我的婚姻治疗师朋友的见解一样，如果你真诚地努力探索你的艺术，你就会发现真正的宝石是你第一天可能学到的东西。

But, that’s the key: Like the insight from my marriage therapist friend, if you make an honest effort to explore your art, you’re going to discover that the true gems are the things you probably learned the first day.

这很简单，但你可能需要 30 年的时间才能简化事情。

It’s pretty simple, but it might take you 30 years to simplify things.

原则 3

必须不断评估标准和差距。

Principle 3

Standards and gaps must be constantly assessed.

当人们问我有关标准的问题时，我经常感到困惑。我得到了一个令人惊讶的问题：我无法达到这个标准。我应该怎么办？我可以轻松地做这个或那个，但做不到这个。

I’m often confused when people ask me about standards. I get this surprising question: I can’t do this standard. What should I do? I can easily do this or that one, but not this.

你知道答案：缺乏注意力、缺乏行动力或者只是缺乏动力。如果我能回到过去，我会坐下来审视几十年前的自己，解释这个事实——

You know the answer: lack of focus, lack of doing the moving or just lack of motivation. If I could go back in time, I would sit down with myself circa a few decades ago and explain this truth—

只有警惕、积极地找出自己的弱点和差距，并将其提高到一定标准，你才能向前迈进。诚然，要发挥自己的优势，但要取得进步，就必须克服自己的差距。

You only move forward by vigilantly and aggressively sorting out your weaknesses and your gaps and bringing them up to some standard. True, compete with your strengths, but your ability to move ahead is all about dealing with your gaps.

作为一名年轻运动员，我做了一件有趣的事情。每年年底，我都会给未来的自己写一份清单（我的思维过程中有很多时间旅行），告诉他明年成功的线索。当我最近回顾其中的一些内容时，很明显，我试图告诉自己做更多的增肌训练（健美），在一般训练中使用更多的多样性，特别是运动，并警告自己不要试图做得太多太快。

I did an interesting thing as a young athlete. At the end of each year, I wrote down a list of things to my future self (there is a lot of time travel in my thought processes), to tell him the clues to success for the next year. As I recently reviewed some of these, it was obvious I was trying to tell myself to do more hypertrophy work (bodybuilding), use more variety in general training especially movement, and giving warnings about trying to do too much too soon.

本书谨献给我在整个职业生涯中未能留意的警告！

This book is dedicated to the warnings I failed to heed my whole career!

这是一次紧绳行走。将一个人推向精英水平的优势、兴趣和技能不容忽视。对我来说，这是从奥林匹克举重中获得的速度和爆发力，以及每天花四个小时投掷的毅力。

It’s a tight rope walk. The strengths and interests and skills that propel one to elite levels cannot be ignored. For me, it was the speed and explosion gained from the Olympic lifts, and the tenacity to spend up to four hours a day throwing.

然后，我的差距就显现出来了。我没有做负重carry；我的深蹲动作有问题；我需要更智能的恢复方法来支持训练负荷。我还需要在一个更有利于大型铁饼比赛的地方。

Then, my gaps showed up. I didn’t do loaded carries; my squat movement had issues; and I needed smarter recovery methods to support the training load. I also needed to be in a locale more conducive to big discus throws.

我的解决办法是继续O举重，蹲下时过度前倾，然后越来越用力地投掷。我需要的是填补空白，而不是更多地发挥我的优势。

My solution was to keep on O lifting, squatting with too much of a forward lean, and throwing harder and harder. What I needed was to fill in the gaps, not more work on my strengths.

这就是为什么聪明的教练会聘请自己的私人教练。正如笑话所说，任何代表自己的律师都有一个白痴的客户。对于健身专业人士来说也是如此：如果你自己训练，你的客户就会遇到问题。这就是为什么我每周至少聘请一名私人教练与我一起工作一次。

This is why a smart trainer hires his own personal trainer. As the joke goes, any attorney who represents himself has an idiot for a client. The same goes for fitness professionals: If you coach yourself, your client has issues. That’s why I hire a personal trainer to work with me at least once a week.

我的教练巴迪·沃克让我做我知道应该做的事情，但又找理由不做这些重要的事情。良好的培训计划不断地回到这样一个观念：从长远来看，差距会导致问题。

Buddy Walker, my trainer, makes me do the things I know I should do, but find reasons not to do these important things. Good training programs constantly come back to the notion that it’s the gaps that will cause the problems over the long term.

迈克·博伊尔 (Mike Boyle) 关于移动性的见解（门和门框的图像以及间隙如何必须恰到好处）为我们提供了关于终身健身的见解。灵活性训练必须集中于保持间隙“恰到好处”。过上正常的生活，甚至通常参加精英运动，并不需要太大的机动性或灵活性。当然，如果你想在马戏团里呆在鞋盒里，你需要的比我能提供的更多。但是，对于我们其他人来说，再一次，够了。

Mike Boyle’s insight about mobility—the image of the door and door frame and how the gaps must fit just right—gives us an insight about lifelong fitness. Mobility training has to be focused on keeping the gaps ‘just right.’ There’s no great need for outrageous mobility or flexibility to live a normal life and even, usually, to be in elite sport. Sure, if you want to be in the circus and fit in a shoebox, you need more than I can offer. But, for the rest of us, once again, enough is enough.

原则 4

公园长椅和公交车长椅锻炼的概念必须贯穿整个训练周期。

Principle 4

The notion of park bench and bus bench workouts must be applied throughout the training lifetime.

有数千本关于“如何”健身的书籍。我有一些书承诺每周 30 分钟健身，每天几分钟，囚犯的体能训练，奥运会选手的健身，以及斯巴达人的身体。我相信大多数人都知道健身的“方法”。

There are thousands of books on the ‘how’ of fitness. I have books that promise fitness in 30 minutes a week, a few minutes a day, the conditioning of a convict, the fitness of an Olympian, and the body of a Spartan. I’m convinced most people know the ‘how’ of fitness.

如果您一生中的任何时候都有一位称职的体育教练，那么您可能已经具备了基础知识。慢跑两圈，做一些伸展运动和健美操，然后玩一个小时的游戏。报告所有受伤情况，并务必淋浴并清洁双脚，因为脚气的祸害仍然令人担忧。

If you had a competent physical education coach at any time in your life, you probably have the basics. Go jog two laps, knock off a few stretches and calisthenics and then go play a game for an hour. Report all injuries and be sure to shower and clean your feet because the scourge of athlete’s foot is still a worry.

曾经有人告诉我，家用跑步机的平均使用次数是7.2次。它在你家里的其余生活将是用来存放衣服并提醒你过去健身的尝试。

I was once told that the average amount of use of a home treadmill is 7.2 times. The rest of its life in your house will be to hold clothes and remind you of past attempts to achieve fitness.

我们健身方法的问题似乎在于“我为什么要这样做？”与如何。而且，我知道你为什么想训练——

The problem in our approach to fitness seems to lie in ‘why am I doing this?’ versus how. And, I know why you want to train—

塑造体形

减掉一些体重——最好是脂肪

为了看起来更好、感觉更好、运动得更好

To get into shape

To lose some weight—ideally fat

To look better, feel better and move better

你知道如何做以及为什么要这样做，但跑步机就放在角落里，上面覆盖着衬衫、裤子和毛巾。

You know how to do it and why to do it, but there sits that treadmill in the corner, covered in shirts, pants and towels.
