我认为问题在于：健身行业只推销全速、死亡行军、全心全意的训练理念。坦率地说，我们大多数人根本无法日复一日地这样做。

I think the problem is this: The fitness industry only sells full-throttle, death-march, total-commitment training concepts. And, frankly, most of us simply can’t do that day in and day out.

也许我们可以从宗教界人士身上学到一些教训。

Perhaps we can learn a little lesson from those in the business of religion.

在《两条长凳的故事》中，我的前老板乔治·尼德劳尔大主教描述了坐在公共汽车长凳上的情景。当我们等公共汽车时，我们充满期待。 G巴士应该在8点11分到站。如果我抬头看8点11分却没有看到，我就会开始恐慌。 8点13分，我的一天就毁了。我想离开这个长凳，去别的地方！公共汽车现在应该到了。等等……现在！

In the Tale of Two Benches, Archbishop George Niederauer, my former boss, describes sitting on a bus bench. When we wait for a bus, we’re filled with expectations. The G bus should be here at 8:11. If I look up at 8:11 and don’t see it, I begin to panic. At 8:13, my day is ruined. I want to get off this bench and get going somewhere else! The bus should be here now. Wait…now!

然而，公园的长椅上却是一个坐下来聆听和观看的时间。我们什么也不等待。昨天出现的当地松鼠今天可能会也可能不会。而且，没关系。如果我们希望城市松鼠警察出现而他们却没有出现，我们就不会打电话给他们。

The park bench, however, is a time to sit and listen and watch. We wait for nothing. The local squirrels that showed up yesterday may or may not be here today. And, that’s okay. We don’t call the city squirrel police if they don’t show up when we want them to show up.

大多数运动员在比赛中采用的方法是公共汽车凳的想法。 26号星期六，我将击败所有出现的人，打破我所有的个人记录，在我所做的一切中找到完美，并遇见我的梦想之人。

The approach most athletes take to competition is the bus-bench idea. On Saturday the 26th, I will defeat all who show up, break all my personal records, find perfection in all I do, and meet the person of my dreams.

我的朋友们，这就是运动准备和生活的 G 巴士。这是一个很难遵循的模式。回顾近50年来参加有组织的比赛，我只能想起几次（三次？）G巴士如期出现。

This, my friends, is the G bus of sports preparation and life. It’s a tough model to follow. As I look over my nearly 50 years in organized competition, I can only think of a few times (three?) when the G bus showed up on schedule.

对于大多数运动员来说，以及对于我们大多数人来说，公园长椅模型更合适。当您比赛或训练时，花点时间欣赏风景，呼吸空气，不用担心松鼠！比赛或训练期间发生的任何事情都应该以惊奇和感谢的眼光来看待。

For most athletes most of the time, and for most of us for most of our lives, the park bench model is much more appropriate. When you compete or train, take time to enjoy the view, breathe the air, and don’t worry about the squirrels! Whatever comes along during your competition or training should be viewed through the lens of wonder and thanks.

我参加高地运动会的巨大乐趣与结交的友谊、丰富多彩的活动和聚会气氛有很大关系。高地运动会的运动员不会因抱怨表现不佳而自取其辱。这些事件愚弄了我们！

My great joy in competing in Highland Games has a lot to do with the friendships made, the variety of events and the party atmosphere. Highland Games athletes don’t make fools of themselves complaining about a bad performance. The events make a fool of us!

为了获得公园长椅心态，我们必须认识到，充其量，很少有比赛是完美的。另外，当明星安排你进行那些完美的比赛时，你最好不要试图用大量额外的精力来搞砸它，你只能让它过去。

To get a park-bench mentality, we have to realize that at best, very few competitions will be perfect. In addition, when the stars arrange for you to have those perfect competitions, you had better not try to mess it up with a lot of extra energy—you just have to let it go.

公园长椅上的态度也有助于应对 20% 的比赛中出现问题的情况。如果你能保持头脑清醒，喂一两只松鼠，你就能挽救比赛！

The park bench attitude also helps with the 20% of competitions where things all go wrong. If you can keep your wits and feed a squirrel or two, you may just salvage the competition!

顺便说一句，没有什么比你脸上平静的微笑更让你的竞争对手感到恐惧的了。他们认为你在搞事。

By the way, nothing frightens your competition more than a serene smile on your face. They think you’re up to something.

我完全相信人生就是一场竞争。我身上有足够的达尔文气质，还有历史学硕士学位，让我相信我们的生活充其量也是脆弱的，而生存，没有任何讽刺意味，反映了我们的健康状况。

I fully believe life is a competition. There’s just enough Darwin in me, as well as a Master’s degree in History, to believe that our lives are tenuous at best, and survival, without any hint of irony, reflects on our fitness.

如果你的生存取决于你的健康，那你为什么要把头撞到墙上去呢？

If your survival depends on your fitness, so why are you slamming your head against a wall to get it?

刻苦训练，但享受竞争。努力竞争，但享受训练。必须牢记最后一个关键点：永远不要仅在一天内判断一项锻炼或训练计划的好坏。

Train hard, but enjoy competition. Compete hard, but enjoy your training. One key final point must be kept in mind: Never judge a workout or training program as good or bad solely on a single day.

我经常对新投掷者说：“抱歉，你还不够好，所以不能让你失望。”根据一天的成绩来判断一个运动员的价值是愚蠢的，并且会导致长期的失败。罗马斯多葛派哲学家爱比克泰德告诉我们——

I often tell new throwers, “Sorry, you are just not good enough to be disappointed.” Judging one’s worth as an athlete over the results of single day is just idiocy, and will lead to long-term failure. Epictetus, the Roman Stoic philosopher tells us—

我们必须牢记，除了意志之外，没有什么好坏之分，我们不能试图预测或指导事件，而只是用智慧接受它们。

We must ever bear in mind that apart from the will, there’s nothing good or bad, and that we must not try to anticipate or to direct events, but merely to accept them with intelligence.

作为一名运动员，我牢记了宗教研究中的一些见解。首先，让事情发生，不要评判它们是好是坏。享受训练和比赛的机会。

As an athlete, I took to heart a few pieces of insight from my study of religion. First, let things happen and don’t judge them as good or bad. Enjoy the opportunity to train and compete.

其次，找到一个由支持你的目标的人组成的社区，并确保你也支持你的目标。当你努力实现目标时，不要忽视螺旋。

Second, find yourself a community of people who support your goals, and be sure you support your goals, too. Don’t lose sight of the spiral as you strive to achieve your goals.

巴士长凳锻炼

The Bus Bench Workout

巴士长凳锻炼的例子是什么？老实说，这是大多数人想要的事情。你可以称其为程序、千篇一律的方法或培训手册，但大多数人想要掌握的却是一页又一页的“做这个”和“做那个”。

What would be an example of a bus bench workout? To be honest, it’s the kind of thing most people want. Call it a program, a cookie-cutter approach or a training manual, but it’s that long page after page after page of ‘do this’ and ‘do that’ most people want to have in their hands.

当一位有抱负的大学橄榄球新生在从大学力量教练那里得到第一个训练计划的第二天走进举重房时，他喜欢冲过去给我展示这个秘密训练。通常，它只是从这个地方和那篇文章拼凑在一起，并且有很多很多的事情要做。而且，它可以发挥作用。

When an aspiring freshman college football player comes into the weightroom the day after he gets his first program from his college strength coach, he loves to rush over and show me this secret workout. Usually, it’s just slapped together from this place and that article, and has lots and lots of things to do. And, it can work.

嘿，另一件事：我喜欢速度饮食。我不是向你推荐它，但我喜欢它。这是节食和锻炼的终极公交车凳方法。给你，供审查——

Hey, another thing: I loved the Velocity Diet. I am not recommending it to you, but I loved it. It’s the ultimate bus-bench approach to dieting and exercise. Here you go, for review—

在 28 天内，您将吃六杯低碳水化合物蛋白质奶昔。

For 28 days, you’ll eat six very low-carb protein shakes.

哦，每周有一天，你可以吃一顿固体食物。当天一定要减少震动！

Oh, and one day a week, you get to eat a single solid-food meal. Be sure to cut back on the shakes that day!

没错，一个月吃四顿固体饭。

That’s right, four solid meals in a month.

朋友们，如果你在 V 饮食法中没有减掉体脂，那么从所有权利和考虑来看，你都有权随心所欲地尖叫和挥舞拳头。如果您诚实地遵循该计划 28 天并且没有减掉体脂，那么您遇到的问题我不确定我能否解决。抱怨走开！

Friends, if you don’t lose bodyfat on the V Diet, you have by all rights and all considerations the authority to scream and shake your fist as wildly and as angrily as you wish. If you honestly followed the program for 28 days and didn’t lose bodyfat, you have issues I’m not sure I can address. Complain away!

我做过公交车长凳项目，其名称如下：

I have done bus bench programs that have names like—

两周内变大的二头肌

两周内变大的二头肌到

六周内变硬的范妮·苏维埃深蹲计划

Bigger Biceps in Two Weeks

Two Weeks to a Firmer Fanny

Soviet Squat in Six Weeks Program

这样的例子不胜枚举。

And the list goes on and on.

一般来说，巴士长凳计划有固定的持续时间，例如两周或 12 周，如果您遵循指示，您应该在这段时间内进行更改。如果不是，则程序失败。

Generally, bus bench programs have built-in durations like two weeks or 12 weeks and, if you follow the directions, you should be changed in that time. If not, the program failed.

再次，抱怨消失。

Again, complain away.

每个人每年都应该有大约两次公交车长凳计划。克拉伦斯·巴斯 (Clarence Bass) 是一位健美运动员，以苗条的体格闻名，被称为“撕破先生”(Mr. Ripped)，他继续安排每年一次的照片拍摄，以便让他每年都能专注于上公共汽车。 70岁以后，这对他来说仍然很有效。许多人利用一月和比基尼季节前的几周来重新集中注意力。我对这一努力表示赞赏。

Everyone should have about two bus bench programs a year. Clarence Bass, a bodybuilder noted for his lean physique and who’s known as Mr. Ripped, continues to schedule an annual photo shoot to give him a focus each year to, well, get on the bus. After age 70, it’s still working well for him. Many people use January and the weeks leading up to bikini season times to refocus. I applaud the effort.

我遇到的问题是，大多数人把一年中的 52 周都变成了公交车长凳心态。互联网论坛热议最新最好的就是正确的答案。体育界有句老话：最好的事情就是你没有做的事情。

The issue I have is that most people turn all 52 weeks of the year into the bus bench mentality. The internet forums rage about how whatever is latest and greatest is the right answer. The cliché in sports is this: The best thing is the thing you’re not doing.

打开你的一个又深又黑的橱柜，看看神奇的药丸、粘液和贴片，它们被吹捧为解决你所有问题的答案。我经历了高碳水化合物、低碳水化合物、高脂肪、低脂肪、高蛋白和低蛋白饮食，却发现大多数饮食只是公交车长凳心态在起作用。请听好，这很重要：任何饮食两周都会对人们产生奇迹。

Open one of your deep, dark cupboards and look at the miracle pills, goos and patches that were touted as the answer to all your problems. I have survived high carb, low carb, high fat, low fat, high protein and low protein diets, only to learn that most diets are simply the bus bench mentality at play. And please listen, this is important: Two weeks on any diet works miracles for people.

“效果非常好，我不再这样做了。”

“It worked so well, I stopped doing it.”

这是要记住的事情。如果您确实尝试将自己的摄入量限制在 500 卡路里并连续几周每天注射牛血浆，但未能实现目标，请归咎于该计划！如果成功了，请重新集中注意力一段时间，重新调整你的优先事项，但不要用两打甜甜圈来庆祝。一打就够了！

Here’s the thing to remember. If you honestly tried limiting yourself to 500 calories and an injection of beef plasma every day for a few weeks and failed to achieve your goals, blame the program! If it was a success, refocus for a while, readjust your priorities, but don’t celebrate with two-dozen doughnuts. One dozen is plenty!

我怎么强调都不为过。公交车凳上的训练和饮食方法是正确的。一年两次左右是绝对正确的。就像关于坏钟的老笑话一样，坏钟一天有两次是对的；对目标进行集中、有纪律的进攻是一件很棒的事情。

I can’t emphasize this enough. The bus bench approach to training and diet is right. It’s absolutely right about twice a year. Like the old joke about a broken clock, a broken clock is right twice a day; a focused, disciplined attack on a goal is a great thing to do.

只是不是一直这样！

Just not all the time!

更进一步来说，公交车长凳心态正在可悲地摧毁美国的教育。许多家长相信，这之间存在着直接的因果关系，例如，加入俱乐部运动会获得一级体育奖学金，或者在大学先修生物学课程中获得 A 会进入医学院。

To continue just a step farther, the bus bench mentality is sadly destroying education in America. Many parents are convinced there’s a straight line, a cause-and-effect relationship between, for example, membership in a club sport leading to a Division One athletic scholarship, or an A in Advanced Placement Biology leading to medical school.

公共汽车长椅和公园长椅心态的健康结合可以服务于教育和健身。我坚信我们的大部分时间应该花在公园长椅上的工作上。孩子们应该为了快乐而读书，享受好书。当然，他们应该接受有关某些书籍的严格问题的挑战，并且通过对他们阅读和喜欢的书籍进行更深入的理解，他们的生活将会变得更加丰富。

Education and fitness are both served by a healthy mix of bus-bench and park-bench mentality. I’m convinced the bulk of our time should be spent doing park bench work. Children should read for pleasure and enjoy good books. Certainly they should be challenged with rigorous questions concerning some books, and their lives will be enriched by a deeper understanding of the books they read and enjoy.

别忘了享受。

Don’t forget to enjoy.

原则 5

不断努力追求精通和优雅。

Principle 5

Constantly strive for mastery and grace.

我所知道的关于精通的一切都可以在乔治伦纳德的作品中找到。 20 世纪 80 年代，当他在Esquire杂志上发表题为“终极健身”的文章时，他强调了这样一个观点：我们在体育和商业中学到的一切也应该引导我们对生活产生同样的见解。在过去的几十年里，我只是点头同意伦纳德在那篇文章和后来在他的书《精通》中指出的一切。

Everything I know about mastery can be found in the work of George Leonard. When his Esquire magazine article called “Ultimate Fitness” came out in the 1980s, he highlighted the idea that everything we learn in sports and business should also lead us to the same insights about life. I have spent the past few decades merely nodding in agreement to everything Leonard noted in that article and later in his book, Mastery.

在拳击场或赛场上为胜利做准备、达到巅峰和制定计划的经验教训都是人生的教训。有时你可以走捷径，但通常你不能。但是，就像爱情和生活一样，我经常注意到，最好的表演有一种难以解释的丝般轻松。对我来说，真正的掌握是如此优雅和充满恩典，以至于那些不知道什么是最佳的人仍然会欣赏这一刻。

The lessons learned about preparing, peaking and programming for victory in the ring or on the field are lessons of life. Sometimes you can get away with cutting corners, but usually you can’t. But, like love and life, I have often noted that the best performances have a silken easiness to them that defies explanation. For me, true mastery is so graceful and grace-filled that someone who is unaware of what is optimal will still appreciate the moment.

我在无缝部分（从第 171 页开始的第 10 个问题）中提出了一些关于优雅的观点，但请务必记住这一点：在训练时始终努力保持安静的头脑、高效的动作和平静的感觉。

I made some points about grace in the Seamless section, the 10th question beginning on page 171, but be sure to remember this: Always strive for a quiet head, efficient movements and sense of calm while training.

确实，眼睛被汗水灼伤时很难显得优雅，但请尝试一下。

True, it is difficult to look elegant with sweat burning your eyes, but try.

我认为正确的健身训练可以从正确训练的人的体型中看出。当我们保持体形时，我们不仅可以优雅地、熟练地移动，而且体态上也会有一种美感。

I think proper fitness training will be seen in the body shape of the person training correctly. Not only will we move gracefully—masterfully—when in shape, but there will be a beauty in the form, too.

当我第一次登录互联网时，Art DeVany 引起了我的注意。他指出，男性的 X 型外观是健康的标志。他指出，男人应该宽肩、细腰、臀部和大腿有力，不应该担心手臂暴露。另一方面，女性则以沙漏形身材、细腰、圆润的上身和下身来展现生育力。

Art DeVany brought this to my attention when I first logged onto the internet. He noted that the X look for men is a sign of health. Men, he noted, should have broad shoulders, a thin waist, powerful buttocks and thighs, and should not worry about showy arms. Women, on the other hand, show fertility with an hour-glass figure, a narrow waist bordered by a rounder top and bottom.

拉蔻儿·薇芝 (Raquel Welch) 在《不列颠哥伦比亚省一百万》(One Million, BC)中的形象可以立即引起大多数男人的反应。它仍然对我有用。

Images of Raquel Welch in One Million, BC can fire an immediate response in most men. It still works for me.

X造型和沙漏型身材还有一个微妙的方面，很多人都忽略了。多年来我过度训练自己的力量，导致我遭受了很多身体创伤。为了消除那些年的伤害，这并不夸张，因为我们谈论的是几十年来糟糕的运动选择和不良姿势，我学会了改善体质、提高表现和快乐、无痛关节的两个关键。

The X look and the hour-glass figure also have a subtle aspect many people miss. My years of overtraining my strength led me to lots of physical trauma. To undo those years of damage, and this is not hyperbole as we’re talking about literally decades of poor exercise choices and poor posture, I learned the two keys to a better physique, better performance and happy, pain-free joints.

而且，您可能会问，这两个键是什么？优雅和压缩。

And, you may well ask, what are the two keys? Grace and compression.

现在，恩典对大多数人来说可能是显而易见的，并且因此令人遗憾地被忽视，但压缩完全是另一个问题。

Now, grace might be apparent to most people, and because of that sadly ignored, but compression is another issue altogether.

不久前，我经历了一个让生活变得清晰的时刻。我参加了深夜的热瑜伽课程，发现我越努力让自己处于一个姿势，我的身体在休息期间的扩张反应就越强烈。从字面上看，我们压缩的东西就会扩展。

Not long ago, I had one of those moments that provided clarity for life. I attended a late night hot yoga session and discovered the harder I pulled myself into a position, the more my body responded by expanding in the rest period. Literally, what we compress, expands.

身体的某些部位在压缩后似乎效果最好。过去几年，健身行业出现了一些新的公理——某些关节和区域需要灵活性，而另一些则需要灵活性。压缩似乎也确实有助于某些领域实现灵活性和移动性。

Certain areas of the body seem to work best after compression. There have been some new axioms in the fitness industry in the past few years—certain joints and areas needing flexibility and others needing mobility. It does seem, too, that compression helps some areas open up to flexibility and mobility.

加压伸展以打开脚和手腕的武术传统就是一个例子，人们在训练中进行的头顶俯卧撑也是一个例子。这些基本上是俯卧撑，手臂永远不会弯曲，但上半身放松并通过肩膀下降。上背部那条令人耳目一新的裂缝通常表明你做对了。高脚杯深蹲的底部位置，以及底部位置的弯举等各种动作，实际上是通过推动（压缩）身体来打开身体。

The martial arts traditions of pressurized stretches to open the feet and wrists are an example, as are the scap pushups people do in training. These are basically pushups where the arms never bend, but the upper body relaxes and drops through the shoulder. That refreshing crack in the upper back usually indicates you got it right. The bottom position of the goblet squat, and various moves like curls in the bottom position actually open up the body by pushing—compressing—it apart.

这很有趣，但在训练中，在我们进行一系列按压之后，我经常注意到人们站起来的姿势是我所说的尤尔·布伦纳或彼得潘的姿势。对于心理形象，想想《国王与我》中的尤尔，或者彼得在与胡克船长打交道时傲慢的双手叉腰的姿势。您可能会发现自己正在这样做！

It’s funny, but often in training after we do a series of compressions, I notice people standing up with what I call either the Yul Brenner or the Peter Pan stance. For the mental image, think of Yul in the King and I or the cocky hands-on-hips stance of Peter when he deals with Captain Hook. You might find yourself doing it!

在您的健身目标中，优雅和压缩应该处于阴阳关系中。当长时间站立、步行和冲刺时，以及训练的动作时，努力将优雅作为你努力的关键品质。

Grace and compression should live in a yin and yang relationship in your fitness goals. When standing for long periods, walking and sprinting, and for the movements of your training, strive for grace as the key quality in your efforts.

在恢复性工作和活动性工作中，让自己在压缩和扩张的感觉中跳舞，并确保不要让任何一方主导。

In restorative work and mobility work, let yourself dance through the compression and expansion feeling, and be sure not to let either partner lead.

恩典是一件了不起的事。我本来想说太棒了，但是，好吧……

Grace is a remarkable thing. I was going to say amazing, but, well…

如果你有意识地决定坐得更优雅，那么你起身时往往会更优雅。奇怪的是，如果你决定更优雅地投掷铁饼，用平静的拉长头和安静的动作，铁饼会飞得更远来感谢你。高级运动和艺术动作中蕴含着一种优雅，即使是完全不熟悉表演的人通常也能知道谁是最好的，而无需求助于分数。

If you make the conscious decision to sit more gracefully, you tend to rise more gracefully. On an odd note, if you decide to throw the discus more gracefully, with a calm elongated head and quiet movements, the discus will thank you by flying farther. There’s an elegance in superior sport and artistic movements that even someone completely unfamiliar with the performance will usually know who’s the best without having to resort to the box scores.

美丽的动作不仅让人赏心悦目，而且往往不会感到痛苦。正如比尔·威特 (Bill Witt) 关于投掷的评论：好的技术不应该造成伤害。如果你每年做某件事 10,000 次，就像 Witt 鼓励的那样，那不可能是 10,000 次痛苦的重复。

Beautiful movement is not only a joy to watch, but it tends to be pain-free. As Bill Witt notes about throwing: Good technique shouldn’t hurt. If you do something 10,000 times a year, like Witt encourages, it can’t be 10,000 painful reps.

为了获得压缩的好处，您可以参加瑜伽课程、加入运动小组或深入研究灵活性。传统的伸展运动对于理解压缩的作用非常重要。从字面上看，我们将自己挤压到适当的位置，然后放松并扩展。

To get the benefits of compression, you can take a yoga class, join a mobility group, or take a deep study into flexibility. Traditional stretching movements are very important in understanding the role of compression. Literally, we squeeze ourselves into positions, then relax and expand.

帕维尔有一本很棒的书，《放松伸展》，他在书中概述了诸如等待伸展、本体感觉神经肌肉促进 (PNF)、等长伸展、对比呼吸、强制放松等技巧，以及我最喜欢的扣刀技巧。不知何故，将拉伸与使用弹簧刀进行比较激发了我学习更高水平拉伸的兴趣。

Pavel has a wonderful book, Relax into Stretch, where he outlines techniques such as waiting out the stretch, proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (PNF), isometric stretching, contrast breathing, forced relaxation and, my favorite, the Clasped Knife Technique. Somehow, comparing stretching to the use of a switchblade awakens something in my interest in learning to stretch at a higher level.

你应该在这些努力上花费多少时间和精力？随着年龄的增长，除了不要发生严重的创伤性事故外，还有两件事需要关注——增加去脂体重和保持关节活动能力。

How much time and effort should you spend in these efforts? As you age, besides not getting into a serious traumatic accident, there are two things to focus on—increasing lean body mass and maintaining joint mobility.

这不是我第一次这么说。

It’s not the first time I’ve said this.

第23章

Chapter 23

实施干预计划

Implementing the Intervention Program

编程前了解重复

Understanding Repetitions before Programming

我一生都在努力理解举重。在我看来，有三个重要的关键。

I have spent my life trying to understand weightlifting. It seems to me there are three important keys.

基本人体运动

次数和设定

负荷

Fundamental Human Movements

Reps and Sets

Load

这是我们进行举重时应该采取的正确顺序。我们需要建立正确的姿势和模式，然后在训练中解决合理的动作数量，最后我们应该讨论负荷。

This is the correct order we should approach weightlifting. We need to establish the correct postures and patterns, then work around reasonable numbers of movements in a training session and, finally, we should discuss the load.

可悲的是，举重人群——我也对此感到内疚——已经改变了顺序，把 500 磅硬拉作为提高比赛水平或减少脂肪的答案。这话有一定道理，但我们都同意，运动质量对个人来说无论是短期还是长期都更安全。

Sadly, the lifting population—and I am guilty of this too—has switched the order and made a 500-pound deadlift the answer to improving one’s game or cutting some fat. There is some truth in this, but we can all agree that quality of movement is both safer short- and long-term to the individual.

请注意，我在上一段中说的是“培训课程”。如果你接受训练基本人体动作、强调姿势、模式和优雅的概念，你就必须意识到训练课程不仅仅是呼吸困难、出汗或呕吐。

And note well, I said “training session” in the paragraph above. If you buy into the concept of training the fundamental human movements, stressing posture, patterns and grace, you have to realize that training sessions are about more than just breathing hard, sweating or vomiting.

哦，我可以帮你解决。每次我吹口哨就来回跑几个小时。但是，请不要认为这会提高您的技能或长期从事从运动到优雅衰老等任何事情的能力。

Oh, I can work you out. Just run back and forth for a couple of hours every time I blow a whistle. But, please don’t think that’s going to improve your skill set or your long-term ability to do anything from sport to aging gracefully.

我喜欢用这三种基本的壶铃动作来教授人类运动的关键模式：摇摆、高脚杯深蹲和起立。髋部位移连续体揭示了髋部运动有两端的秘密，即摆动和高脚杯深蹲。摆动需要最大的髋关节铰链和最小的膝关节弯曲，而高脚杯深蹲需要最大的髋关节铰链和最大的膝关节弯曲。该服装是一个一站式课程，涵盖从滚动和铰链到弓步和锁定的每个人体动作的基础知识。

I like to teach those key patterns of human movement with these three basic kettlebell moves: the swing, the goblet squat and the getup. The hip displacement continuum unlocks the secret that hip movement has two ends, the swing and the goblet squat. The swing demands maximal hip hinge and minimal knee bend while the goblet squat demands maximal hip hinge along with maximal knee bend. The getup is a one-stop course in the basics of every human movement from rolling and hinging to lunging and locking out.

以这三个动作为基础，再加上俯卧撑，说实话，你可能就完成了。让我这样说：以最少的教学、学习和失败次数，将基本模式和动作纳入计划中。在解决去脂体重和关节活动度问题时，“少即是多”比流行语更重要。

With these three moves as a base, add the pushup and honestly, you might be done. Let me say this: Get the basic patterns and movements into a program with the least amount of teaching, learning and failure you can maintain. ‘Less is more’ is bigger than a buzzword when it comes to addressing the issues of lean body mass and joint mobility.

我相信关于培训课程的三个简单的事情——



I believe three simple things about training sessions—



1. 培训课程需要可重复。

1.   Training sessions need to be repeatable.

2. 培训课程应该让您走上实现目标的道路。我仍然不敢相信我必须告诉人们这一点。

2.   Training sessions should put you on the path of progress towards your goals. I still can’t believe I have to tell people this.

3、培训要注重质量。

3.   Training sessions should focus on quality.

记住这个清单！

Memorize this list!

现在，为了将这些要点应用到力量训练中，我发现在任何给定的训练中密切关注正确的重复次数是确保高质量动作与适当负荷平衡的最简单方法。

Now, to apply these points to strength training workouts, I have found that keeping an eye on the correct number of repetitions in any given workout is the easiest way to insure that quality movements are balanced with appropriate loads.

全身运动和10法则

Whole Body Movements and the Rule of 10

10 规则：高质量重复的总数为 10 次或更少。这里少即是多。

Rule of 10: The total number of quality reps is 10 or fewer. Less is more here.

土耳其装束

The Turkish Getup

抢夺

Snatch

挺举

Clean and Jerk

硬拉

Deadlift

对于精英运动员，使用杠铃进行深蹲变式

For elite athletes, squat variations with a barbell

和许多人一样，我发现对于经验丰富的举重运动员来说，一次锻炼中大约重复 10 次是全身举重的正确次数。这个 10 规则意味着你在一次大举训练中可能有 10 次真实的重复，比如硬拉、抓举和挺举。

I discovered, as many have, that around 10 reps in a workout is the right number for whole body lifts for an experienced lifter. This rule of 10 means you have probably 10 real reps in a workout with a big lift like the deadlift, the snatch and the clean and jerk.

在教授起立姿势时，或者使用这个美妙的举重动作作为发现身体的工具时，请将重复次数保持在 10 次左右。您可以将其视为总共 10 次，其中右侧 5 次，左侧 5 次，或者您也可以尝试 10 次右10，左10。但是……真的吗？

In teaching the getup, or using this wonderful lift as a tool to discover your body, keep the reps around 10. You can think about this as a total of 10 with five on the right and five on the left, or you can try 10 right and 10 left. But…really?

如果我将起身作为热身的一部分，同时进行一些这样或那样的起身练习（我用于纠正的高科技名称），那么我会出汗并进行大约 10 次的锻炼。

If I do getups as part of my warmup along with some getup drills for this or that (the highly technical name I use for correctives), I am sweating and pushing into a workout around 10 total reps.

当然，有时你可以做得更多。最近，我们遇到了一个很棒的挑战，即在每个月的第一天做一次重复，并在 31 日之前每天增加一次重复。在挑战结束时，一个人告诉我他正在左右做这个！那是 62 次起床！

Certainly, at times you can do more. Recently, we had a wonderful challenge of doing one rep on the first of the month and adding a rep a day up until the 31st. At the end of the challenge, one guy told me he was doing this right and left! That’s 62 getups!

这是一个很好的挑战，但也许不是一个培训计划。

That’s a good challenge, but perhaps not a training program.

一周又一周，每节训练课大约重复 10 次。

Week in and week out, think around 10 reps per training session for the getup.

这也适用于大举重——翻举、抓举和硬拉。此外，我发现即使是来自推拉家族树的动作在这个重复范围内也能发挥很好的作用。

This also works well with the big lifts—the clean, snatch and deadlift. Moreover, I have discovered that even movements from the family tree of pushes and pulls work well in this rep-range.

大多数有经验的举重运动员都会认识到这些类型的锻炼——

Most experienced lifters would recognize these kinds of workouts—

三组三张

Three sets of three

五组两个

Five sets of two

两组五个

Two sets of five

五三二

Five-three-two

六到十个单打

Six to 10 singles

人类的基本动作可以很好地运用“10 法则”。除非您是银背大猩猩，否则我不建议您在日常锻炼中按照 10 法则进行全部 5 个（加 1 个）大重量动作。

The fundamental human movements can be used well with the Rule of 10. I don’t suggest, unless you are a Silverback Gorilla, for you to do all five (plus one) movements heavy and hard with the rule of 10 for a daily workout.

对10法则和基本动作的一些建议——



Some suggestions for the Rule of 10 and the basic movements—



   推举： 卧推、上斜推举和杠铃军事推举

   Push: Bench Press, Incline Press and Military Press with a barbell

   拉动： 用杠铃划船

   Pull: Rows with a barbell

   铰链： 硬拉、硬拉变化、高翻、杠铃抓举

   Hinge: Deadlift, Deadlift Variations, Cleans, Snatches with a barbells

   深蹲： 杠铃前蹲或后蹲

   Squats: Front Squats or Back Squats with a barbells

   满载搬运： 农夫行走、徘徊者、汽车推——重载且持续时间短

   Loaded Carries: Farmer Walks, Prowlers, Car Pushes—heavy loads and short durations

选择 10 规则的举升机并在基础上进行大量训练是很有可能的，但您需要在一些轻松的日子里进行构建并循环负载。简单力量是做到这一点的尝试，我将在第 25 章（从第 233 页开始）中对此进行扩展。

Picking a rule-of-10 lift and going heavy on the basics is very possible, but you need to build in some easy days and cycle the load. Simple strength is an attempt to do this and I will be expanding on this in Chapter 25, beginning on page 233.

如果尝试仅使用 10 法则进行锻炼，请确保其中一些动作相对较轻且容易。我通常将其称为补品，提神醒脑的东西。考虑将蝙蝠翼、高脚杯深蹲或其他纠正动作作为该计划的一部分。

If attempting to do a workout with nothing but the rule of 10, be sure a few of the movements are relatively light and easy. I usually refer to this as tonic, something that refreshes. Consider the batwing, goblet squat or other corrective movements as part of this program.

顺便说一句，有人向我报告说，“10 法则”、每周多次锻炼和壶铃取得了巨大成功。重点是——

By the way, I’ve had people report great success with the rule of 10, multiple workouts a week and kettlebells. The focus is on—

重型单顶压力机（左、右）

Heavy Single-Overhead Presses (Left and Right)

负重引体向上（壶铃挂在腰部的引体向上）

Loaded Pullups (Pullups with kettlebell dangling from the waist)

上膛手枪（左右腿握住壶铃）

Loaded Pistols (Hold a kettlebell, both left and right legs)

厚重的装束

Heavy Getups

虽然这超出了本书的范围——如果你能用半体重或更多的壶铃完成这些动作，那么你暂时不需要干预——这是一个有趣的人体实验。主要的抱怨是锻炼时间太短，而且“什么也没做”的感觉很难克服。

Although this is beyond the scope of this book—if you can do these movements with a half-bodyweight kettlebell or more, you don’t need Intervention, for now—it’s an interesting experiment with the human body. The chief complaint is the workouts take so little time and the feeling of ‘not doing anything’ is hard to overcome.

最后一点：我注意到这些是全身提升。这些动作需要以一种异常费力的方式协调身体。人们经常问我卧推是否真的是一项全身运动，我提醒他们我的核心信念：身体是一个整体。在重卧推下，比如 500 磅，你会发现如果我用叉子插在你的小腿上，你的表现就会下降。事实上，这可能是你死亡的直接原因。

One final point: I note that these are whole-body lifts. These movements require an orchestration of the body in a way that’s unusually taxing. Often people ask me if the bench press is truly a whole-body exercise and I remind them of my core belief: The body is one piece. Under a heavy bench press, say 500 pounds, you will discover that if I stick a fork in your calf, it will distress your performance. In fact, it might be the direct cause of your death.

此外，这些在大负荷下完成的动作会很快耗尽你的储备。保持大动作的重复次数。

Moreover, these movements, done under large loads, will quickly exhaust your reserves. Keep the reps down on the big movements.

健美动作（半身动作）

The Bodybuilding Movements (Half-Body Moves)

该动作总共 15–25 次

15–25 Total Reps for the Movement

15 到 25 次之间是进行磨削动作的正确次数范围。根据我最近的经验，基本动作，包括几乎所有的推举，最好在这个范围内完成。再次强调，如果你卧推 600 磅，军用推举 300 磅或 400 磅，请参考 10 规则。

Somewhere between 15 and 25 reps is the right rep-range for working the grinding movements. From my recent experiences, the basic moves, including nearly all the presses, are best done in this range. Again, if you are benching 600 and military pressing 300 or 400 pounds, refer to the rule of 10.

一方面，这是一项合理的锻炼。例如，三组五组最终成为大多数人在 5x5 训练和变式中实际进行的做法。如果你不计算热身的话，这是很多严重的前蹲动作。

For one thing, it’s a reasonable workout. Three sets of five, for example, ends up being what most people actually do on the 5x5 workouts and variations. That’s a lot of serious front squats if you aren’t counting warmups.

体积的整个问题始终需要解决。当然，我们曾经做过这样的比赛，你要以 100 磅的重量卧推 100 次，只是为了比一位朋友更胜一筹，但这并不是真正的训练计划；而是训练计划。这很有趣。

The whole issue of volume always needs to be addressed. Certainly, we’ve done those contests where you bench 100 pounds 100 times just to one-up a friend, but that isn’t really a training program; that’s just fun.

继续享受乐趣，但也要偶尔计划一些事情。

Keep having fun, but plan things occasionally, too.

每次锻炼 15-25 次左右的高脚杯深蹲似乎是完美的。我为您提供人性化的波比跳作为尝试这个概念的一种方式——

The goblet squat seems be perfect around 15–25 reps per workout. I offer you the humane burpee as a way to try this concept—

10 次秋千

10 Swings

5 个高脚杯深蹲——将壶铃放在双脚之间，并受到控制

5 Goblet Squats—put the kettlebell down between your feet, under control

尺蠖式俯卧撑姿势——用手行走

Inchworm out to the pushup position—walk on your hands

5 次俯卧撑

5 Pushups

尺蠖回到起点

Inchworm back to the start

10 次秋千

10 Swings

4 个高脚杯深蹲——将壶铃放在双脚之间，并受到控制

4 Goblet Squats—put the kettlebell down between your feet, under control

尺蠖式俯卧撑姿势——用手行走

Inchworm out to the pushup position—walk on your hands

4 次俯卧撑

4 Pushups

尺蠖回到起点

Inchworm back to the start

10 次秋千

10 Swings

3 个高脚杯深蹲——将壶铃放在双脚之间，并受到控制

3 Goblet Squats—put the kettlebell down between your feet, under control

尺蠖式俯卧撑姿势——用手行走

Inchworm out to the pushup position—walk on your hands

3 次俯卧撑

3 Pushups

尺蠖回到起点

Inchworm back to the start

10 次秋千

10 Swings

2 个高脚杯深蹲——将壶铃放在双脚之间，并受到控制

2 Goblet Squats—put the kettlebell down between your feet, under control

尺蠖式俯卧撑姿势——用手行走

Inchworm out to the pushup position—walk on your hands

2 次俯卧撑

2 Pushups

尺蠖回到起点

Inchworm back to the start

10 次秋千

10 Swings

1 高脚杯深蹲——将壶铃放在双脚之间，并受到控制

1 Goblet Squat—put the kettlebell down between your feet, under control

尺蠖式俯卧撑姿势——用手行走

Inchworm out to the pushup position—walk on your hands

1 次俯卧撑

1 Pushup

尺蠖回到起点

Inchworm back to the start

完成的！

Finished!

即 50 次挥杆、15 次高脚杯深蹲和 15 次俯卧撑。如果您需要的话，八、五和二计数将为您提供相同的结果，但摆动次数更少（只需 30 次！）。

That’s 50 swings, 15 goblet squats and 15 pushups. Eight, five and two counts will give you the same results with fewer swings if you need that (only 30!).

我们大多数人都认为这个范围是健美锻炼。雷格·帕克（Reg Park）有一篇著名的文章，其中提到了 5x5 锻炼几乎适用于身体的每个部位，并且负荷相当重。他声称这既提高了尺寸，又提高了功率，并且他已经取得了成果。

Most of us recognize this range as the bodybuilding workout. Reg Park famously wrote of the 5x5 workout for nearly every bodypart with rather heavy loads. He claimed this built both size and power, and he had the results to show for it.

15-25 次重复的关键是找到适合动作的合适负荷。这里有一个简单的公式：

The key to 15–25 reps is finding the right load for the movement. There’s a simple formula here:

如果做不到15个（三组五，五组三），则负荷过重。

If you can’t do 15 (three sets of five, five sets of three), the load is too heavy.

如果 25 次轻而易举（五组，每组五次），则说明负荷太轻。

If 25 reps are a breeze (five sets of five), the load is too light.

是的，人们付钱给我来向他们解释这一点。

And, yes, people pay me money to explain this to them.

这个范围内的基本人体运动更多地反映了传统的健美力量训练方法。

Fundamental human movements in this range reflect more of a traditional bodybuilding approach to strength training.

推

Push

大多数健身房都有各种推举器械，包括标准品种的卧推器械、上斜器械、下斜器械、军用器械等。当然，杠铃变式在这里效果很好。

Most gyms have a variety of machines for pushing, including the standard varieties of bench, inclines, declines, militaries and the like. Of course, the barbell variations work well here.

拉

Pull

同样，有数十种拉力机可供选择，当然杠铃在这里也能很好地发挥作用。

Again, there are dozens of pulling machines available, and certainly the barbell will work well here, also.

铰链

Hinges

在一些健身房里，这些可能有点棘手，因为快速举重、硬拉等动作经常被禁止。这让人想知道为什么它们被称为健身房！陷阱杆已经成为许多人流行的变体，尽管它往往会让一些人蹲下。

These can be a bit tricky in some gyms as often the quick lifts, deadlifts and the like are banned. Which makes one wonder why they are called gyms! The trap bar has become a popular variation for many, although it tends to make some people squat-hinge.

深蹲

Squats

请不要将腿部伸展、腿弯举、内外器械以及腿部推举作为深蹲训练。对于典型的举重运动员来说，五乘五的深蹲变化是一项很好的锻炼。

Please don’t include leg extensions, leg curls, innie and outie machines and leg presses as squat workouts. For the typical lifter, squat variations of five by five is a great workout.

满载携带

Loaded Carries

许多负载载体支持批量和功率训练方法。奇怪的是，背着包似乎在构建人体内胎方面发挥了很大作用，而人体内胎对于建立坚实的基础至关重要。

Many of the loaded carries support a bulk-and-power approach to training. Oddly, bag carries seem to do a lot to build that human inner tube so necessary for building a solid foundation.

模式和爆炸性壶铃举重

Patterns and The Explosive Kettlebell Lifts

总次数可以相当高，75-250 次，但要坚持动作质量。

The total number of reps can be quite high, 75–250, but insist on quality of movement.

几年前，我萌生了用一个壶铃摆动 20 次，用两个壶铃摆动 10 次的想法。在每天进行数百次挥杆之后，我注意到我的技术在 10 和 20 范围内保持良好。这就是体育的基本教诲：不要让数量影响质量。

A few years ago, I picked up this idea of doing 20 swings with one kettlebell and 10 swings with two. After doing literally hundreds of swings a day, I noticed my technique held up fine in that 10- and 20-range. This is the basic teaching of sports: Don’t let quantity influence quality.

换句话说，10次好的重复比几十次糟糕的重复要好得多。如果你想要更多的训练量，就多做几组。

In other words, 10 good reps is far better than dozens of crappy ones. If you want more volume, do more sets.

当然，有时候你应该做超过20件。有时候你想做各种各样的事情。不过，有些时候（大多数时候）你只是继续前进。我通常将这些称为“打卡”训练，我认为这是留在比赛中的关键。

Absolutely, there are times when you should do more than 20. There are times when you want to do all kinds of things. There are times, though (known as most of the time), where you just keep moving ahead. I usually call these ‘punch the clock’ workouts and I think it’s the key to staying in the game.

那么，你可能会问，这样就够了吗？

So, you may ask, is this enough?

随着时间的推移……是的！

Over time…yes!

是的，你可以做得更多，但你希望能够日复一日地完成——实际上是年复一年。

Yes, you can do more, but you want to be able to do it day in, day out—literally year in and year out.

是的，更高代表的工作具有很大的价值，但要保持高工作质量。基本的人体动作和更高次数的训练需要一些努力。

Higher-rep work has great value, yes, but keep the quality of work high. The fundamental human movements and the higher-rep work need a bit of work.

推

Push

平板支撑是理想的长推动作。 Stu McGill 对 120 秒平板支撑的见解也为我们提供了重复次数应如何适应此范围的目标。

The plank is an ideal long push. Stu McGill’s insight of 120 seconds of planking also gives us a target of how the reps should fit into this range.

拉

Pull

蝙蝠翼动作是进入更高次数的有趣方式。与平板支撑一样，这也是一个时间问题，但许多人发现，在经过适当的磨合期后，蝙蝠翼式的等距训练最好采用较长的保持时间。

Batwings are an interesting way to move into higher reps. Again, like the plank, this is a time issue, but many have discovered that the isometric work of the batwing is best served with longer holds after an appropriate break-in period.

铰链

Hinges

当然，壶铃摆动和抓举是铰接中高次数训练的金字塔顶端。如果你的技术很扎实，那么显然，提高次数是有一定价值的。

Of course, the kettlebell swing and snatch are the top of the pyramid for high-rep work in hinging. If your technique is solid, there’s some value in moving to higher reps, obviously.

深蹲

Squats

除非你掌握了动作，否则高次数深蹲并不总是一个好主意。如果您有勇气进行高次数杯状深蹲（最多 50 次），请尝试一下。第二天保持开放。

High-rep squats are not always a good idea unless you have the movement mastered. If you have the courage to do high-rep goblet squats, up to 50, give it a try. Keep the next day a bit open.

满载携带

Loaded Carries

基本上，当你把所有这些加起来时，总共 120 秒的加载时间将是漫长的一天。

Basically, when you add it all up, a total of 120 seconds of loaded carries would be a long day.

在尝试探索更高的次数之前，请务必锁定动作。

Be sure to have movements locked down before trying to explore higher reps.

对于大多数人来说，负载通常是一个问题。为了完全刻板地看待地球上的整个人口，男性往往体重过重，女性往往体重过轻。基本人体动作的标准是适当的目标，但有时训练课程应该是关于动作的。老实说，负载是最困难的。

Load is often the problem for most people. To completely stereotype the entire population of the planet, men tend to go too heavy and women tend to go too light. The standards of the fundamental human movements are appropriate targets, but sometimes training sessions should be about the movements. Load is the tough one, to be honest.

我认为：如果你有一个美丽、优雅、流畅的动作，并且你处于正确的重复和设定方案中，你可以通过注意以下几点来确定你正在使用正确的负载：



I argue this: If you have a beautiful, graceful, smooth movement and you are in the right rep- and set-scheme, you can determine you’re using the right load by noting—



   如果你的负荷正确，你就能按计划完成次数和组数。

   If you had the load right, you got the reps and sets as planned.

   如果你没有完成次数和组数，那就太重了。调整。

   If you didn’t get the reps and sets, it was too heavy. Adjust.

   如果你发现次数和组数太简单，那就太轻了。调整。

   If you found the reps and sets too easy, it was too light. Adjust.

您可能需要经常调整负载。我发现过度训练的第一个迹象是当我开始与杠铃上合理的重量作斗争时。就这么简单，大多数人都错过了。

You may need to adjust the load often. I find that one of the first signs of overtraining is when I start to struggle with what had been a reasonable weight on the bar. It’s so simple, most people miss it.

第24章

Chapter 24

使用模式和研磨进​​行编程：

Programming with Patterns and Grinds:

四个步骤

The Four Steps

如前所述，就受欢迎程度而言，五种基本的人类动作按以下顺序排列：



AS NOTED BEFORE, in terms of popularity the five basic human movements from are in this order—



   推

   Push

   拉

   Pull

   合页

   Hinge

   蹲

   Squat

   满载携带

   Loaded Carry

然而，就影响力而言——成为游戏规则改变者的能力——我们需要颠倒顺序——



However, in terms of impact—the ability to be a game-changer—we need to reverse the order—



   满载携带

   Loaded Carry

   蹲

   Squat

   合页

   Hinge

   拉

   Pull

   推

   Push

当我们进入代谢调节领域时，这五个动作之间存在着有趣的关系。我第一次听到“代谢调节”这个词是在 20 世纪 70 年代末或 80 年代初，通过艾灵顿·达顿 (Ellington Darden) 的著作。

The five movements have an interesting relationship when we move into the area of metabolic conditioning. I first heard the term ‘metabolic conditioning’ in the late 1970s or early ‘80s through the work of Ellington Darden.

从本质上讲，代谢调节是指从一种运动（例如深蹲）转向另一种运动（例如引体向上）时的奇怪感觉。尽管心率在合理范围内（可以说是心血管调节），并且即将使用的肌肉是新鲜的，因此力量耐力不是问题，但运动员无法做好足够的“一切”准备来完成这项工作。

Essentially, metabolic conditioning is that odd feeling when moving from one movement, say squats, to another movement like a pullup. Even though the heart rate is within reason—cardiovascular conditioning, so to speak—and the muscles about to be used are fresh, so strength endurance isn’t an issue, the athlete can’t gear up enough ‘whatever’ to do the job.

不要疯狂地进行代谢调节。是的，它有其价值。是的，它是终结者或毒气者，但它也可能导致各种问题，例如关节问题，从蹩脚的代表到似乎席卷某些设施的严重医疗状况。

Don’t go crazy with metabolic conditioning. Yes, it has a value. Yes, it’s a finisher or a gasser, but it can also lead to a variety of issues like joint problems from crappy reps to the serious medical conditions that seem to be sweeping some facilities.

重要的是训练代谢调节时的混合。图案化运动在这里效果很好，因为运动误差量很小。图案化工作通常是等距的，并且很难搞乱静止不动的动作。

The important thing is the mix when training metabolic conditioning. Patterning movements work well here because the amount of movement error is minimal. Patterning work is often isometric—and it’s difficult to mess up a movement that isn’t moving.

图案化运动与研磨效果很好。然而，它们并不能很好地协同工作！哦，当然，你可以将任何东西组合在一起，但以下四种组合对于大多数人来说都是理想的选择。

Patterning movements work well with grinds. However, they don’t all work well together! Oh, sure, you can slap together anything, but the following four combinations are ideal for most people.

组合一：

负重运球的模式动作，与深蹲的磨砺相结合

Combo One

The Pattern Movement of Loaded Carries, Mixed with the Grind of the Squat

几年前，我发现了我称之为“鹰”的组合。我当时任教的学校吉祥物是翱翔的雄鹰，所以这个名字就很自然了。它将最简单的负重动作——农夫行走的模式动作——与基本的深蹲——双壶铃前蹲结合在一起。

A few years ago, I discovered the combination I call The Eagle. The school mascot where I was teaching at the time was the Soaring Eagle, so the name was a natural. It combined the simplest of the loaded carries—the patterning movement of the farmer walk—with the basic grinding squat, the double-kettlebell front squat.

我想说的是“简单”，但工作量是令人难以置信的。简单来说，运动员做八次双壶铃前蹲，然后将重物放到身体两侧，农夫走 20 米，然后再做八次深蹲，如此重复，直到完成八个循环。

I am going to say ‘simply’ here, but the workload is incredible. Simply, the athletes do eight double-kettlebell front squats, then drop the weight to their sides and farmer walk for 20 meters, then do another eight squats and repeat until completing eight circuits.

这个目标常常没有实现。

That goal was often not met.

这个组合有一些隐藏的好处。运动员需要两个壶铃并且永远不会放下它们。握力、壶铃摔跤和大量负重都会加速新陈代谢。正是这只鹰让我思考了理想的组合。

There are some hidden benefits to this combo. The athlete needs two kettlebells and never puts them down. The metabolic hit is accelerated by the grip work, the wrestling with the kettlebells and the sheer volume of carrying the load. It was this Eagle that made me think about the ideal combos.

练习的选择并没有什么神奇之处；它是负重运载的模式化运动与深蹲的磨削运动的混合。无论出于何种原因，这两个壶铃也是来自天堂的信号，表明这将是一项艰苦的锻炼。

There is nothing magical in the choice of exercises; it is the patterning movement of loaded carries mixed with the grinding movement of squats. For whatever reason, those two kettlebells are also a sign from heaven that this is going to be a hard workout.

组合二

深蹲的模式运动，与铰链的研磨相结合

Combo Two

The Pattern Movement of the Squat, Mixed with the Grind of the Hinge

向上移动图表，请注意深蹲的模式运动（高脚杯深蹲）与铰链的磨削运动（保加利亚山羊袋秋千）配合得非常好。这种单壶铃锻炼确实可以激发你的热情。它的数字或结构不必很复杂，只要尝试一下即可。

Moving up the chart, note that the patterning movement for the squat—the goblet squat—works extraordinarily well with the grinding movement of the hinge—those Bulgarian goat-bag swings. This single-kettlebell workout can really stoke your fire. It doesn’t have to be complex in numbers or structure, just try it.

事实上，高脚杯深蹲和保加利亚羊袋秋千适合我所知道的最好的锻炼方式，即 ButtBurner 4000。

And in fact, the goblet squat and the Bulgarian goat-bag swings lend themselves to the best workout I know, the ButtBurner 4000.

烟蒂燃烧器 4000

The ButtBurner 4000

拿一个 25 到 60 磅范围内的壶铃或哑铃。比您预期可能需要的更轻。现在，给我一个高脚杯深蹲。然后做一个山羊袋秋千。现在，每个做两个，然后做三个。

Grab a kettlebell or dumbbell in the 25- to 60-pound range. Go lighter than you expect you might need. Now, give me a goblet squat. Then do a goat-bag swing. Now, do two of each, then three.

这是完整的练习——

Here’s the full workout—

一个高脚杯深蹲和一个保加利亚羊袋秋千

两个深蹲和两个保加利亚羊袋秋千

三、三、

四、四……如果可以的话，一直到 10。

One goblet squat and one Bulgarian goat-bag swing

Two squats and two Bulgarian goat-bag swings

Three and three

Four and four…all the way up to 10 if you can.

如果你只进行五次练习，则每次练习重复 15 次。 10 分每人 55 分，而且会让人喘不过气来。不言而喻，你需要在此基础上慢慢积累。这个组合将使整个下半身焕发活力，并教您真正掌握铰链和深蹲这两种模式。

If you just go to fives, that’s 15 reps of each exercise. Tens gets you 55 each and a lot of lost breath. It should go without saying, you need to build up on this one slowly. This combo will revitalize the entire lower body and teach you to really own both patterns, the hinge and squat.

大多数学员犯的错误是太快地转向复杂的动作（有趣的动作），但伟大之处在于那些有勇气首先掌握模式，然后增加复杂性的人。

The mistake most trainees make is to move too quickly to complex movements (the fun ones), but greatness resides in those who have the courage to master the patterns first, and then add complexity.

简单的模式也可以进行最令人震惊的疲惫锻炼。找个时间试试 ButtBurner 4000，看看简单、努力工作的价值。

The simple patterns can also make for the most shockingly exhausting workouts. Try the ButtBurner 4000 sometime and see the value of simple, hard work.

组合三

铰链的模式运动，与拉力的磨削混合

Combo Three

The Pattern Movement of the Hinge, Mixed with the Grind of the Pull

下一个动作实际上改变了我教授铰链和划船动作的方式。靠墙罗马尼亚硬拉（RDL）之后进行划船似乎确实可以保护下背部（这对于包括我在内的许多划船举重运动员来说都是一个问题）并且照亮了整个背部，从膝盖以下一英寸一直到颈部。那是很多肌肉。

The next movement has actually changed the way I teach both the hinge and the rowing motions for pulls. The wall-based Romanian deadlift (RDL) followed by a row seems to really protect the lower back—an issue for many lifters who row, including me—and lights up the whole back, from an inch below the knee up through the neck. That’s a lot of muscles.

一定要感觉到腘绳肌在整个过程中都在伸展，并在重量到达“顶部”时专注于有质量的暂停（挤压！）。这意味着：使用杠铃时，当它触及胸部时暂停；使用壶铃或哑铃时，当重量到达腋窝时保持该位置。

Be sure to feel the hamstrings stretching the entire time and focus on a quality pause (squeeze!) when the weight comes to the “top.” That would mean this: With a barbell, pause when it touches your chest and with a kettlebell or dumbbell hold the position when the weight reaches your armpit.

组合四

拉的模式运动与推的研磨混合

Combo Four

The Pattern Movement of the Pull, Mixed with the Grind of the Push

当我们沿着梯子爬上举重机时，第四个也是最后一个组合是将拉动（蝙蝠翼）的模式运动与磨削推力（卧推或俯卧撑）结合起来。这类似于经典的健美超级组，但我们深度保护肩膀。许多练习者倾向于做太多的水平推举，而完全忽视了相反的拉力。这也是很多练习生出现肩部问题的原因。

The fourth and final combo as we walk the ladder up the lifts is to combine the patterning movement of the pull (batwings) with the grinding push (bench press or pushups). This is similar to the classic bodybuilding superset, but we’re deeply protecting the shoulders. Many trainees tend to do far too many horizontal presses and totally neglect the opposite pull. That’s also why many trainees have shoulder issues.

关于组合的想法

Thoughts on the Combos

聪明的人看到这四个组合包后会问：“为什么不把平板支撑和推车混合起来呢？”现在，这很有趣，至少在某种程度上是这样，但是，看，在推汽车或徘徊者时，你最好完全被踩住。

The clever ones who look at these four combo packages have asked, “Why don’t you mix planks with car pushing?” Now, that’s funny, at least at one level, but, look, you’d better be fully planked when pushing a car or a prowler.

最近，我向车间里的某人提出了将推车与木板混合使用的建议，但一定要上坡。一开始他也没有明白这个笑话，但在平板支撑时汽车会从你身上滚下来。这是一件坏事。

Recently, I gave the advice to someone at a workshop to mix car pushing with planks, but be sure to be going uphill. He didn’t get the joke at first either, but the car will roll down over you while planking. And that’s a bad thing.

这四个组合——

These four combos—

农夫散步和双壶铃前蹲

高脚杯深蹲和保加利亚羊袋秋千

RDL 和划船

蝙蝠翼和俯卧撑或其他推举

Farmer Walks and Double-Kettlebell Front Squats

Goblet Squats and Bulgarian Goat-Bag Swings

RDL and Row

Batwings and Pushup or Another Push

——本身就可以成为一个培训计划。

—can be a training program in themselves.

前两种显然是我用过的最好的锻炼组合。后两个是更传统的健美运动，但即使是最新的学员也能很好地发挥作用。

The first two are clearly the best workout combinations I’ve ever used. The second two are more traditional bodybuilding movements, but work well with even the newest of trainees.

现在，对称运动本身对新陈代谢产生了有趣的影响。保持对称、平衡和结构似乎可以让神经系统顺风顺水。

Now, the symmetry movements have an interesting metabolic hit in themselves. Maintaining symmetry, balance and structure seems to take the nervous system for a ride.

以下可能是一项繁重的锻炼——

The following can be a taxing workout—

手提箱步行

Suitcase Walk

服务员步行

Waiter Walk

单侧深蹲

Single-Side Squat

手提箱铰链（手提箱硬拉）

Suitcase Hinge (Suitcase Deadlift)

使用 TRX 的单臂划船

One-Arm-Row Plank using a TRX

单臂卧推

One-Arm Bench Press

单臂军事压力机

One-Arm Military Press

我强烈建议不要将对称运动搞得筋疲力尽或与其他运动结合起来。虽然存在一些安全问题，但实际上，这只会适得其反。疲倦并不总是答案。

I strongly recommend not doing symmetry movements to exhaustion or in combination with other movements. There are some issues with safety, but, really, it’s just counterproductive. Getting tired is not always the answer.

俯卧撑和秋千的奇迹

The Miracle of Pushups and Swings

将弹道运动与模式、磨削和对称运动混合在一起是先进的东西，除了一种组合：磨削推举（俯卧撑）与秋千的弹道运动。

Mixing ballistic movements with patterning, grinding and symmetry movements is advanced stuff, save for one combination: grinding pushes (pushups) with the ballistic movement of swings.

乔什·希利斯 (Josh Hillis) 在为女性客户混合俯卧撑和秋千方面取得了巨大成功。一项令人筋疲力尽的基本锻炼如下——

Josh Hillis has had marvelous success with mixing pushups and swings for his female clientele. An exhaustingly basic workout is the following—

摇摆：10 次

Swings: 10 Reps

俯卧撑：5 次

Pushups: 5 Reps

摇摆：10 次

Swings: 10 Reps

俯卧撑：4 次

Pushups: 4 Reps

摇摆：10 次

Swings: 10 Reps

俯卧撑：3 次

Pushups: 3 Reps

摇摆：10 次

Swings: 10 Reps

俯卧撑：2 次

Pushups: 2 Reps

摇摆：10 次

Swings: 10 Reps

俯卧撑：1 次

Pushup: 1 Rep

两个周期可以成为训练过程中极好的滋补品。请务必从danjohn.net获取免费的Coyote Point Kettlebell Club电子书，了解大量其他俯卧撑和摆动组合。

Two cycles of this can be an excellent tonic in the middle of training. Be sure to grab that free Coyote Point Kettlebell Club ebook from danjohn.net for plenty of other pushup and swing combinations.

老实说，尝试将弹道与其他动作混合需要在每个动作的图案、打磨、对称和弹道方面具有高水平的能力。你可能会走得太远，在没有适当基础的情况下尝试进行弹道训练，尤其是在对称性方面。当你把一根负载的杠铃举过头顶时，如果你有很多对称性问题，那么，这就是一个坏主意。

Honestly, trying to mix ballistics with the other movements demands a high level of competence in patterning, grinding, symmetry and ballistic among each of the movements involved. You can get too far ahead of yourself and try to train ballistically without the proper foundation, especially in symmetry. When you drive a loaded bar over your head when you have a lot of symmetry issues, well, this is called a bad idea.

这与医学上的剂量是一样的。过量的维生素 A 可能会杀死您，但您需要维生素 A。在干预计划中，我会问您可以做多少来实现目标，而不是做多少。

It’s the same idea as dosage in medicine. Excessive amounts of Vitamin A can kill you, but you need Vitamin A. In the Intervention program, I ask how little can you do to achieve your goals, not how much.

第25章

Chapter 25

简单强度：

Simple Strength:

在公园长椅上呆了几个月

A Few Months on the Park Bench

几年前，当我第一次见到帕维尔时，他向我提出了一项为期 40 天的锻炼的挑战。我按照他的指示来到了T。

YEARS AGO, when I first met Pavel, he challenged me to do a 40-day workout. I followed his instructions to a T.

“在接下来的 40 次训练中，选择 5 次举重。每次锻炼都做这些。永远不要错过任何一次代表，事实上，永远不要接近挣扎。根据需要尽可能轻地进行，并且在一次锻炼中任何动作的重复次数都不要超过 10 次。这看起来很容易。当感觉重量很轻时，增加更多的重量。”

“For the next 40 workouts, pick five lifts. Do them every workout. Never miss a rep, in fact, never even get close to struggling. Go as light as you need to go and don’t go over 10 reps in a workout for any of the movements. It’s going to seem easy. When the weights feel light, add more weight.”

我也完全按照他说的做了。第 22 次训练时，我独自在车库健身房里打破了我一生最好的上斜卧推记录，即单次 300 次。在没有观察员的情况下，在冰冻的车库里，我以 315 的倾斜板凳获得了双打。所有其他电梯都穿过屋顶，我现在和当时一样感到惊讶。

And I did exactly as he said. On the 22nd workout, alone in my garage gym, I broke my lifetime best incline bench press record, which was 300 for a single. Without a spotter, in a frozen garage, I incline-benched 315 for a double. All the other lifts went through the roof, and I’m as amazed now as I was then.

这太容易了。事实上，它是如此简单，我不得不将其分解为几十页的文章，以使其尽可能简单！而且，老实说，我越尝试简化程序，一些人就越迷失。

It’s too easy. In fact, it’s so easy, I have had to break it down into literally dozens of pages of articles to make it as simple as possible! And, the more I try to simplify the program, honestly, the more lost some people become.

我并不完全相信我是一个天才，但必须有人向我解释为什么我如此轻松地遵循这些指示，而如果没有我拥有无与伦比的智力的明显答案，一大群培训师似乎无法遵循这个概念。

I’m not entirely convinced I’m a genius, but somebody has to explain to me why I followed those instructions so easily and hoards of trainers can’t seem to follow the concept without the obvious answer of me having an unrivaled intelligence.

或者，也许我可以遵守规则。

Or, perhaps, I can just follow the rules.

所以……我决定我必须创造简单的力量。我不想这样做，但我已经筋疲力尽地向人们解释“三组三，每次增加重量”意味着做三组三，每次增加重量。我认为，我的挫败感让我变得更加清晰。

So…I decided I had to create Simple Strength. I didn’t want to, but I was exhausted explaining to people that ‘three sets of three, adding weight each time’ meant to do three sets of three, adding weight each time. My frustrations, I think, led to even more clarity.

适合经验丰富的举重运动员的简单力量

Simple Strength for an Experienced Lifter

让我们从一位从未做过任何负重训练的经验丰富的高级教练开始。三周后，我将被证明是正确的，因为农民的独自行走将改变一切。

Let’s start with an advanced experienced trainer who has never done any loaded carries. In three weeks I’ll be proven correct, as the farmer walk alone will change everything.

在我们开始之前有一些规则。

There are a few rules before we begin.

绝不错过任何代表！

Never miss a rep!

遵循 10 法则（参见第 215-218 页），了解适合高级举重运动员的举重动作。如果需要进行图案化，请根据需要经常进行，并使用 15-25 的规则进行适当的半身提升（参见第 218-220 页）。

Follow the Rule of 10 (see pages 215-218) for the appropriate lifts for an advanced lifter. If patterning needs to be done, do it as often and as much as necessary, and use the rules of 15-25 for the appropriate half-body lifts (see pages 218-220).

高级热身

Advanced warmups

5–25 高脚杯深蹲

5–25 Goblet Squats

75 次秋千——每组 10-25 次；真正润滑铰链运动

75 Swings—sets of 10–25; really grease that hinge movement

1-5 次起立——半起立就可以了，或者只是一些滚动。

1–5 Getups—half-getups are fine, or just some rolling around.

第一周

Week One

日期、锻炼次数、组数和次数 - 锻炼详情如下所述

Day, workout number, sets and reps—workout details are explained below

第二周

Week Two

上述训练的举重——

Lifts for the workouts above—

新闻运动

Press Movement

每两周更换一次电梯——使它们相同但不同。每两周一次后，平板卧推、上斜卧推和军事卧推可以互换。

Change the lifts every two weeks—make them the same, but different. Flat bench press, incline bench press and military press can be exchanged for each other after every two-week block.

拉动

Pull Movement

要么将蝙蝠翼与推举结合起来，每次锻炼时保持两到三个等距保持约 10 秒。有些人可以跳过这个动作，从其他动作中获得锻炼，比如秋千或奥林匹克举重变式。

Either do batwings in combination with the press, two to three isometric holds for about 10 seconds every workout. Some people can skip this and get the work in from the other movements, like the swings or Olympic lift variations.

铰链运动

Hinge Movement

这里有两种选择，根据需要而定——要么选择一种硬拉变化并每两周轮换一次——例如，粗杠硬拉、抓举硬拉、干净握力硬拉、正统硬拉、杰斐逊举或哈克深蹲——或者在 75-100 次范围内摆动壶铃。

There are two options here, depending on need—either pick a deadlift variation and rotate it every two weeks—for example, thick-bar deadlifts, snatch-grip deadlifts, clean-grip deadlifts, orthodox deadlifts, Jefferson lifts or hack squats—or do kettlebell swings in the 75–100-rep range.

这些选项通常也满足拉动的需要。

These options often cover the need for pulling, too.

深蹲运动

Squat Movement

再次强调，理想情况下，每两周更换一次动作：前深蹲、后深蹲、过头深蹲、Zercher 深蹲或安全深蹲都可以。

Again, ideally you’d alternate movements after every two weeks: Front squats, back squats, overhead squats, Zercher squats or safety squats are all fine.

满载携带

Loaded Carry

如果可以的话，每次改变距离，也可能改变负载。

Vary the distance every time, and probably the load, too, if you can.

重要的提示

Important Note

这可能不一定是锻炼的顺序（从推举到负重携带）。一些高级教练还需要做纠正工作，仍然需要观察一些动作滞后的问题，需要更加关注。

This might not necessarily be the order of the workout (from push to loaded carry). Some advanced trainers still need to do corrective work and still need to observe the issue that some movements are lagging behind and need more focus.

请参阅第 18 章第 163 页开始的问题九：问题——您愿意纠正您的问题吗？

See Question Nine, Chapter 18, beginning on page 163: The issues—Are you willing to correct your problems?

锻炼细节

The Workout Details

两组五个

Two sets of five

它应该很简单，就像典型锻炼中的第二次或第三次热身举重一样。这个想法（秘密）是让这项锻炼感觉越来越轻松。

It should be easy and be like your second or third warmup lift in a typical workout. The idea—the secret—is to get this workout to feel easier and easier.

五三二

Five-three-two

用 2x5 重量重复 5 次；添加三个重量；然后做一个扎实的双打。做双！

Do five reps with your 2x5 weight; add weight for three; then do a solid double. Make the double!

六单打

Six singles

我不在乎你怎么做，但每组增加重量。没有错过！

I don’t care how you do this, but add weight each set. No misses!

一套10个

One set of 10

六次单打后的第二天，做 10 次简单的补品，非常轻的负荷。

The day after six singles, do very light load for10 easy tonic reps.

经验丰富的举重运动员的锻炼示例

Example workout for an experienced lifter

第一周

Week One

星期一，第一天——



Monday, day one—



上斜卧推：5 次 165 次，5 次 165 次（最多单次 300 次）

Incline Bench Press: 165 for five reps, 165 for 5 reps (300 max single)

粗杠硬拉：5 次 185 次，5 次 185 次（单次最多 265 次）

Thick-Bar Deadlifts: 185 for five reps, 185 for 5 reps (265 max single)

这些是高级举重运动员的拉力和铰链动作。



These are the pull and hinge movements for an advanced lifter.



前蹲： 5 次 185，5 次 185（最大单次 405）

Front Squats: 185 for five reps, 185 for 5 reps (405 max single)

农夫漫步：每只手105，来回100米（三站）

Farmer Walks: 105 with each hand, 100 meters out and back (three stops)

第二天可以根据心情和感觉更重或更轻。重要的是要出现并开始做动作。如果某一天太难，第二天就妥协了，只要减轻负荷并继续做重复次数而不影响速度就可以了。

Day two can be heavier or lighter depending on mood and feel. The important thing is to show up and get the movements in. If one day is too hard and compromises the next day, that’s fine as long as you lighten the load and continue getting the reps without compromising speed.

第三天应该从通常的 2 x 5 锻炼中的重复 5 次开始，然后为 3 次增加一些重量，最后为 2 次增加一些重量。一定要拿到双份。

Day three should begin with the rep five number from the usual 2 x 5 workout, then add some weight for three, and finally add some weight for two. Be sure to get the double.

大多数参加简单力量计划的人发现这项锻炼是对事情进展情况的测试。双杠上的重量开始飞升，这很好，但到此为止。请记住，这是一个让自己变得坚强的长期方法——不要不断地测试自己。把巨大的努力留到，好吧……永远不会。

Most people on the simple strength program find this workout is the test for how things are progressing. The weights begin to fly up on the double, and that’s good, but stop there. Remember, this is a long-term approach to getting strong—don’t keep testing yourself. Save the big effort for, well…never.

第四天和第五天是最混乱的日子。同样，杠上的负载取决于您的感觉。如果感觉轻松轻松，就稍微增加负荷。

Day four and day five are the most confusing days. Again the load on the bar depends on how you feel. If the efforts feel easy and light, nudge the load up.

秘密（再次）是这样的：这个计划的目标是在轻松的日子里轻轻地增加你的努力（负荷），让杠铃感觉很轻。如果你一开始以一种努力水平举起一个重量，比如 205 磅，几周后你以相同的感知努力和速度举起 245 磅，那么你就变得更强了。

Here’s the secret (again): The goal of this program is to gently raise your efforts—the load—on the easy days, so the bar feels light. If you start out lifting a weight, say 205, at one effort level and in a few weeks you’re lifting 245 at the same perceived effort and speed, you’re stronger.

经过一天的休息后，第六天会感觉很轻松，而且应该如此。让代表进来。

After a day of rest, day six is going to feel easy, and it should. Get the reps in.

第二周

Week Two

第七天有一个简单的规则：做六次单杠，每次增加重量。它可以是 5 磅或 50 磅，具体取决于每个人的感受。这不是最后一组的最大努力，这是第六单曲。如果感觉负载很重，只需增加五磅即可。如果酒吧在飞，请添加更多。

Day seven has a simple rule: Do six singles adding weight each rep. It can be five pounds or 50, depending on how each single feels. It’s not a max effort on the last set, it’s the sixth single. If the loads feel heavy, just add five pounds. If the bar is flying, add more.

如果你的背景是坚持每次锻炼都是世界末日，那么第七天将会令人困惑。目标是根据重量感觉来确定负载。如果它突然弹出并且感觉很轻，则将其扔到盘子上。如果没有，请尊重今天，并意识到您将来将有很多机会变得更强大。

If you come from a background that insists every workout be Armageddon, day seven will be confusing. The goal is to determine the load based on how the weight feels. If it pops right up and feels light, toss on the plates. If it doesn’t, respect today and realize you’re going to have plenty of opportunities to get stronger in the future.

第八天是“补品”日，这是我们过去使用这个词的方式。动作要轻，只需享受 10 次重复即可。它可以轻至最大重量的 40%，或者如果您愿意的话可以更轻，并在昨天的剧烈尝试后使用该运动来放松。

Day eight is a ‘tonic’ day, the way we used to use the term. Go really light and just enjoy 10 repetitions. It can be as light as 40% of max, or lighter if you want, and use the movement to unwind after yesterday’s heavy attempts.

第九天通常是人们了解该计划背后的推理的日子。这一天，举重似乎太容易了。这是该计划取得进展的标志。我记得实际上我以为我把杠装错了，不得不仔细检查我的数学，因为杠似乎太轻了，不正确。

Day nine is often the day when people see the reasoning behind the program. This is the day when the weights often seem far too easy. That’s the sign of progress in this program. I remember actually thinking I misloaded the bar and had to double-check my math as the bar seemed far too light to be right.

第十天有时是人们稍微测试自己的一天，只要你愿意追求它就可以。再次强调，不要错过。

Day ten is sometimes the day when people test themselves a little, and this can be fine as long as you feel like going after it. Again, don’t miss.

这是令人困惑的部分——

Here’s the confusing part—

你不需要

每两周、每次锻炼，或者，真的……永远都进行一次。

You don’t need to go up

every two weeks, every workout, or, really…ever.

只要继续参与并相信这个过程即可。

Just keep coming in and trust in the process.

第三周

Week Three

选项一

Option One

帕维尔设计的原始程序要求重复第一周和第二周，另外重复三次。哦，效果很好。到了第五周，我就成了举重机器，打破了一生的个人记录，两次（而不是一次）打破了我的上斜卧推记录 15 磅，并打破了我以前的粗杠硬拉记录，从 265 次增加到 315 次这是惊人的进步。

The original program Pavel designed demanded a repeat of weeks one and two, three additional times. Oh, and it works well. By week five, I was a machine on the lifts and broke lifetime personal records, smashing my incline bench press record by 15 pounds for two reps, not just a single, and crushing my old thick-bar deadlift record, going from 265 to 315. This is staggering improvement.

选择一是仅仅遵循帕维尔的计划并继续坚持下去。

Option one is to merely follow Pavel’s plan and keep on keeping on.

选项二

Option Two

对于大多数运动员来说，我更喜欢这一点。你对动作进行一些小的改变，从卧推到上斜卧推，从粗杠硬拉到抓举硬拉，从前蹲到后蹲。这是帕维尔的“相同但不同”的方法。这些微小的变化似乎让人们在整个八周内都保持着高涨的热情。

I like this one more for most athletes. You make small changes to the movements, from bench press to incline bench press, thick-bar deadlift to snatch-grip deadlift and front squat to back squat. This is Pavel’s ‘same, but different’ approach. Those small changes seem to keep enthusiasm high for the entire eight weeks.

选项三

Option Three

我有一些运动员这样做，我相信（好吧，也许“希望”是一个更好的词）这对于速度和力量运动员来说是更好的选择。这一周又是充满新陈代谢挑战的减负荷周。

I have a few athletes doing this and I believe (well, maybe ‘hope’ is a better word) this is the better option for speed and power athletes. It’s both a deload week and week filled with more metabolic challenges.

第一天

Day One

推力或推力挺

Push Press or Push Jerk

10 法则——五组，每组两人，每组增加重量，是一项很好的锻炼。

Rule of 10—five sets of two, adding weight each set, is a great workout.

李特维诺夫

Litvinovs

完成铰链或下蹲动作后，可以冲刺、雪橇或在完成后立即使用徘徊者。在健身房里，这可能很困难，但我在户外只用壶铃和山丘就成功地做到了这一点。

After doing a hinge or a squat movement, either sprint, sled or work the prowler immediately after finishing. In a gym setting, this can be difficult, but I’ve done this outside with great success with just a kettlebell and a hill.

第二天

Day Two

仅左臂！

Left arm only!

服务员步行

Waiter Walk

手提箱步行

Suitcase Walk

单侧深蹲——壶铃是最好的

Single-Side Squats—kettlebells are best

手提箱铰链—硬拉

Suitcase Hinge—deadlift

使用 TRX 或类似设备的单臂划船

One-Arm Row using a TRX or similar device

单臂卧推

One-Arm Bench Press

单臂军事压力机

One-Arm Military Press

次数、组数、负荷、时间和所有其他因素……这取决于情况！

Reps, sets, load, time and every other factor… it depends!

这个想法是推动肌肉和运动的稳定性和对称性。这些动作会对新陈代谢产生奇怪的影响，因为你的出汗量会比预期多得多。

The idea is to push the stability and symmetry muscles and movements. There’s an odd metabolic hit to these moves as you’ll sweat a lot more than expected.

例如，这可以在公园里用一个壶铃来完成——顺便说一句，这很棒——你可以挑战训练的各个方面，得到良好的锻炼，同时练习掌握身体位置和动态。

For example, this can be done with a single kettlebell in a park—which is wonderful by the way—and you can challenge various aspects of training and get a good workout while also practicing mastery of body position and dynamics.

只做一侧也会让你的思想稍微放松一些。几天后你要做什么是非常明显的，所以你可以做一些实验，在训练时在紧张和放松的边缘进行游戏。

Doing just one side also frees up your mind a little. It’s pretty obvious what you’ll be doing in a few days, so you can experiment a bit and play at the edges of tension and relaxation as you train.

第三天

Day Three

推力或推力挺

Push Press or Push Jerk

10 法则——五组，每组两人，每组增加重量，是一项很好的锻炼。

Rule of 10—five sets of two, adding weight each set, is a great workout.

李特维诺夫

Litvinovs

与第一天一样，在完成铰链或下蹲动作后，完成第一个动作后立即冲刺、雪橇或使用徘徊者。在健身房或室外，当然，室外是最好的。

As on day one, after doing a hinge or a squat movement, either sprint, sled or work the prowler immediately after finishing the first movement. In a gym setting or outside, and, of course, outside is best.

第四天

Day Four

仅限右臂！

Right arm only!

服务员步行

Waiter Walk

手提箱步行

Suitcase Walk

单侧深蹲——壶铃是最好的

Single-Side Squats—kettlebells are best

手提箱铰链—硬拉

Suitcase Hinge—deadlift

使用 TRX 或类似设备的单臂划船

One-Arm Row using a TRX or similar device

单臂卧推

One-Arm Bench Press

单臂军事压力机

One-Arm Military Press

第四周

Week Four

在第四周开始时，您将混合基本动作的变化——推、拉、铰链、深蹲、负重携带——并使用与第一周和第二周相同的代表和设定模板进行进展。

At the beginning of week four, you’ll mix up the variations in the basic movements—push, pull, hinge, squat, loaded carry—and progress along using the same rep and set template as weeks one and two.

第一周和第二周总共重复四次。第三种选择是为期 12 周的计划。

Weeks one and two are repeated four times total. Option three would be a 12-week program.

完成计划后，根据您的目标全面评估您的活动能力、基本力量水平和计划。如果成本和可用性不是问题的话，我建议也可以进行 FMS 筛查和血液检查。

After finishing the program, fully assess your mobility, basic strength levels and the program vis-à-vis your goals. I’d suggest maybe an FMS screen and blood tests, too, if costs and availability aren’t an issue.

全力以赴：在巴士长凳上呆上几周

Going All Out: A Few Weeks on the Bus Bench

现在，让我们来解决这个计划中的另一个巨大的困惑：是的，你可以在一年中的大部分时间里通过一遍又一遍地重复五个动作以及三个选项的微妙变化来进行训练。我建议每年最多这样做 10 个月！

Now, let’s deal with the other great confusion in this plan: Yes, you can train much of the year with just five movements repeated over and over with the subtle variations of three options. I suggest doing this up to as many as 10 months a year!

让我先举一个例子：一年 10 个月的简单力量训练和一年两个月的巴士凳训练。

Let me stick to this one example first: 10 months a year of simple strength and two months a year of bus-bench training.

这实际上是我认为第三象限中的任何人都应该做的事情，从试图减肥的奶奶到精英投掷运动员。是的，这意味着你，高地运动会投掷者先生，他给我发电子邮件询问秘密训练信息，但如果你仍然不确定，请参阅第 8 章，从第 63 页开始，回顾一下象限。

This is actually what I think just about anybody in Quadrant Three should do, from Grandma trying to lose fat to an elite thrower. Yes, that means you, Mr. Highland Games thrower who emails me for secret training information, but if you’re still not sure, see Chapter 8, beginning on page 63, for a refresher on the quadrants.

另外两个月是你应该点燃它的时候。现在是比基尼海滩锻炼、激烈、完整的计划和艰苦举重的时候。瘦瘦的投掷者，做Mass Made Simple（如果你是瘦瘦的足球运动员，也可以看看这本书）。其他投掷者可能会在 Big 21 比赛中参加两场改变人生的三周比赛——有关详细信息，请参阅《Never Let Go》或我在danjohn.net上的文章。

Those other two months are when you should light it up. These are the times for the bikini beach workouts, the intense, full programs and the hard lifting. Skinny throwers, do Mass Made Simple (also see the book if you’re a skinny football player). The other throwers might do two life-altering three-week rounds of the Big 21—see Never Let Go or my articles at danjohn.net for details.

我们大多数人的问题是我们有这样的想法，即我们必须随时随地用脚踩油门进行训练。我在训练营中训练过很多运动员，实际上有数千名，我们每天训练四次。我们还准备好饭菜——所有我们能吃的东西——而且我们大多数人都会在冰箱里储存额外的食物和饮料。几乎每次我这样做的时候，都会有人问——全年都这样训练不是很好吗？

The problem with most of us is we have this idea that we have to train always and everywhere with our foot pushing hard on the gas pedal. I’ve trained many athletes, literally in the thousands, in a camp experience where we train four times a day. We also have our meals prepared—all we can eat—and most of us stock our fridges with extra food and drink. Nearly every time I do this, someone asks—Wouldn’t it be great to train like this year-round?

不。

No.

可悲的是，我曾经也是这么想的！

Sadly, I used to think so!

这些紧张的训练营经历对于提高强度、磨练技术和拓展我们的能力具有巨大的价值。但是，然后我们需要回家并像平常一样利用这些新见解进行训练。我曾经告诉营员们，要在家里进行露营体验，但我对此感到遗憾。现在，我告诉他们休息一下，用日记作为挖掘营地经验的工具。

These intense camp experiences have a great value in raising intensity, polishing technique and expanding us. But, then we need to go home and train as we normally do using these new insights. I used to tell the campers, and I regret this, to make a camp experience at home. Now, I tell them to take a little time off and use their journals as a tool to mine the camp experience.

然后，适应并成长。

Then, adapt and grow.

拿一个日历，最好是 12 个月的一览表，诚实地划掉那些生活不允许你进行人类最高水平训练的月份。对于会计师来说，将三月和四月视为划掉的月份。对于父母来说，从感恩节到新年，所有的箱子都装满了。对于运动员来说，季节的高峰期并不是加快速度的时候——干草在谷仓里，或者任何你喜欢使用的陈词滥调在这里都适用。

Take a calendar, ideally a 12-month view-at-a-glance variety, and honestly cross out those months where life is not going to allow you to train at the highest human levels. For accountants, look at March and April as crossed-out months. For parents, all the boxes from about Thanksgiving to New Year’s are full. For athletes, the height of your season is not the time to ratchet things up—the hay is in the barn, or whatever cliché you like to use is appropriate here.

我们有这样的职业道德，不知怎的，我们感觉自己在犯罪，除非我们在每次锻炼时都尽最大努力进行训练。身体根本不是这样运作的。我们有时需要加大力度，是的，毫无疑问！然而，始终踩下油门踏板会直接导致倦怠。找到合适的几周和几个月来真正完成你需要做的事情，但不要害怕在需要时放松下来。

We have this work ethic that somehow we feel we’re sinning unless we train at maximal effort each and every workout. That’s simply not how the body works. We need to ramp it up at times, yes, no question about that! However, keeping the gas pedal down at all times leads directly to burnout. Find appropriate weeks and months to really attack what you need to do, but don’t be afraid to ease off when you need to.

或者，我认为更好的是，为什么不直接计划一下呢？成功的计划是在一周的卸载时间内构建的。简单的力量计划可以通过进行有趣的“选项三”锻炼或只是进入举重室放松来进行减重。

Or, better I think, why not just plan this? Successful programs build in a deload week. The simple strength program accommodates deloading either by having those fun ‘option three’ workouts or just going in to the weightroom and taking it easy.

有些人，像我一样，在举重房度过轻松的日子。我真的需要远离健身房的乐趣和友情，以及它奇怪的能力，让我训练困难和愚蠢，无论我的计划锻炼应该多么聪明。提前计划好几个月、几周和几天。用你的大脑找出那些明显你不能或不应该训练到极限的时刻。您仍然需要训练并注意食物和饮料的摄入量，但要利用这些训练窗口作为保持大部分品质的时间。

Some people, like me, struggle with easy days in the weightroom. I really need to be away from the fun and camaraderie of the gym and its strange ability to make me train hard and stupid no matter how smart my programmed workout was supposed to be. Plan those months, weeks and days far ahead. Use your brain to find those times when it’s obvious you either can’t or shouldn’t train to the edge. You still need to train and watch your food and drink intake, but use these training windows as time to maintain most of your qualities.

其他人告诉我，他们实际上可以每年进行四个月的公交车凳、以目标为中心的强化训练。我对此表示赞赏，但尝试一下这种方法——



Others have told me they can actually do four months a year of bus bench, goal-focused intense training. I applaud that, but try this approach—



   两个月的简单力量或变化

   Two months of simple strength or variations of it

   一个月的“这样做！”巴士长凳计划

   One month of a ‘Do This!’ bus bench program

这实际上对很多人来说都很有效。请记住，当您结束一个简单的训练周期时，您将期待一些艰苦的工作，或者您认为艰苦的工作。当你进入一项每周进行一百多次大重量深蹲的计划的最后一周时，你会非常期待它的结束。

This actually works well for many people. Remember, as you come to the end of an easy training cycle, you will be looking ahead to some hard work, or what you perceive as hard work. When you come to the last week of a program that has you squatting heavy for a hundred-plus reps a week, you will be brightly looking forward to the end of it.

第26章

Chapter 26

饮食和营养的干预方法

The Intervention Approach to Diet and Nutrition

在这项工作的大部分内容中，我忽略了饮食和营养，而这是与人合作的干预方法的真正支柱。是的，我知道您，温柔的读者，确切地知道在这方面应该做什么，但让我们谈谈我们知道应该吃什么和我们实际如何吃之间的巨大鸿沟。

FOR MUCH OF THIS WORK, I have ignored diet and nutrition, a real pillar of the Intervention approach to working with people. Yes, I know that you, gentle reader, know exactly what to do in this area, but let’s talk about the great chasm between what we know we should eat and how we actually do eat.

我在大学里就开始了英雄研究。我第一个硕士学位的部分工作就是研究《贝奥武夫》。现在我知道很多读者都考虑过这种惩罚，但直到今天，这部作品给了我一种洞察力，这种洞察力仍然激励着我。

I took up the study of heroes in college. Part of my work in my first masters degree was studying Beowulf. Now I know many readers consider this punishment, but to this day, the work gave me an insight that still propels me.

在贝奥武夫故事中的演讲中，战士们在纯粹的当下说话。他们会顺便提及过去，很少会关注下一场战斗。如果一个丰满的女人在七山之战之前展现出她的魅力，我们的英雄不会阻止她评论说他需要吃完他的肌酸和五盎司鸡肉和那三个杏仁。

In the speeches in the story of Beowulf, warriors speak in the pure present. They mention the past…in passing, and rarely look beyond the next fight. If a buxom woman offers her charms before the Battle of the Seven Mountains, our hero doesn’t stop her to comment that he needs to finish his creatine and five ounces of chicken and those three almonds.

然而，国王说话的方式是我们希望有远见的人会考虑的。是的，本书的大部分内容就是这些乏味的演讲，其中包括对我们来到这里的历史的简短回顾、对现状的快速总结以及对未来的充满希望的展望。为了完美地看到它，请拿出一份葛底斯堡演说的副本，并注意亚伯·林肯完美地遵循了这个模型。

Kings, however, speak in a way we would hope visionaries would consider. Yes, these are the dull speeches that make up much of the book with a short review of the history that brought us here, a quick summary of the present situation and a hopeful look ahead. To see it perfectly, whip out a copy of the Gettysburg Address and note that Abe Lincoln followed the model perfectly.

“四分零七年前”、“现在我们正在进行一场伟大的内战”和“世界将很少注意到，也不会长久记住我们在这里所说的话”，这些不仅是一些最好的英语诗歌，但为任何场合的良好祝酒提供了一个模型。

“Four score and seven years ago,” “Now we’re engaged in a great civil war,” and “The world will little note, nor long remember what we say here,” are not only some of the finest poetry in English, but provide a model for great toasting on any occasion.

战士们生活在纯粹的当下。国王生活在这样的境地：他们需要回顾过去，也需要向前看以评估下一步该做什么。

Warriors live in the pure present. Kings live in a situation where they need to look backward, as well as forward to assess what to do next.

而且，这对我来说是个问题：我是一名教练。

And, this is the issue for me: I’m a coach.

我从我开采了四十多年的丰富金矿中深深挖掘，当你准备好时，我会给你一些宝石。我也知道，迟早你会很高兴我把它们分发出去。正如那句陈词滥调所说：“当学生准备好时，大师就会出现。”

I dig deeply from those rich veins of gold I’ve mined for over four decades to give you a few gems when you’re ready. I know, too, sooner than later you’ll be glad I hand them out sparingly. Like the clichéd quote goes, “When the student is ready, the master appears.”

我当然不是说我在很多事情上都是大师，但在酒吧里总有一种积累的智慧。

I’m certainly not saying I am a master at many things, but there’s a touch of wisdom one gathers from all this time under a bar.

在我的旅行中，我注意到许多力量和健身运动员倾向于像战士一样看待食物：这就是，我吃它。我想挑战你与食物建立一种新的关系——就像《贝奥武夫》中的国王一样看待它。

In my travels, I notice many strength and fitness athletes tend to look at food as a warrior would: Here it is, I eat it. I’d like to challenge you into a new relationship with food—look upon it as would a king in Beowulf.

让我们首先重新审视我们与食物的关系。你必须明白，我并不是在评判一种方法的好坏，但它有助于了解你的重点和目标。

Let’s start by reexamining our relationship with food. You have to understand I’m not judging one approach as good or bad, but it helps to know your focus and your goals.

首先，考虑一下战士对待食物的方式。

First, consider the warrior’s approach to food.

Velocity Diet 是 Warrior 101。十四瓶蛋白质、一个摇摇杯和一些补充剂几乎可以满足您接下来几周所需的全部。当有人问：“这对你有好处吗？”你会回答：“你看到我的腹肌了吗？！”

The Velocity Diet is Warrior 101. Fourteen bottles of protein, a shaker and some supplements is pretty much all you need for the next few weeks. When someone asks, “Is it good for you?” you’ll reply, “Have you seen my abs?!”

换句话说，对于减脂——我认为对身体来说第二难的事情——增加瘦体重是赢家——获胜的方法是活在纯粹的当下：成为一名战士。

In other words, for fat loss—what I consider only the second hardest thing to do with the body—gain lean body mass is the winner here—the winning approach is living in the pure present: Be a warrior.

如今，间歇性禁食（也称为 IF）以及其他长时间禁食和剧烈饮食的方法已经变得如此流行，读到每天吃一顿饭可能不会让您感到震惊。

Today, as intermittent fasting, also known as IF, and other methods of long fasts followed by intense eating have become so popular, it might not shock you to read about eating one meal a day.

大约五年前，我有机会在军事研讨会上与一些人一起工作，几乎所有人都在进行间歇性禁食。由于位置偏僻，我们吃晚饭的时候只能找到一家还在营业的地方，一家很受欢迎的快餐店，营业员是一个红金相间的小丑。听五个一整天没吃饭却在餐馆辛辛苦苦工作了12个小时以上的人的声音，值得拍一段视频。我相信在场的每一位父母都会保护孩子的眼睛。汉堡一个接一个地被冲下去，场面十分壮观。

About five years ago, I had the opportunity to work with some people at a military workshop, and almost all of them were doing intermittent fasting. Due to the remote location, we could only find one place open when we broke for dinner, a popular fast food place with a red and gold clown as its salesperson. To listen to five guys who had not eaten all day but had worked hard for over 12 hours order at the eatery was worth a video. I’m sure every mother and father in the place shielded their children’s eyes. It was a sight to behold, as burger after burger was flushed down.

正如一个人向我解释的那样，“我只吃一次；我只吃一次。”我得吃很多东西。”

As one guy explained it to me, “I only eat once; I have to eat a lot.”

根据记录，这些人都伤痕累累，身体状况良好。这可能很可怕，但确实有效。

For the record, these guys were all ripped and in great physical condition. It may have been frightening, but it worked.

这就是战士的心态。

That’s the warrior mentality.

看看你在这里看到的——

Look at what you see here—

在快餐店吃饭或每天喝六杯蛋白质奶昔并没有太多烹饪。现在，说真的，如果你想遵循这样的计划这种禁食，学习如何使用瓦罐或烧烤架。您会注意到的一件事是，快速减肥计划通常不会给味蕾带来什么享受。

There is not a lot of cooking in eating at fast food places or drinking six protein shakes a day. Now, truly, if you wish to follow a plan like this kind of fasting, learn how to use a crock pot or BBQ grill. One thing you will notice is that quick fat-loss plans often leave little for the taste buds to enjoy.

这不是你妈妈教你吃饭的方式。

This isn’t the way your mom taught you to eat.

这是真的。事实并非如此。战士之道可能有很多妈妈不希望你做的事情。但是，让我们明确一点：对于减肥和短期目标，我不相信有什么比以战士的眼光来处理它更有效。真正的瘦身，与味蕾、饱腹感或美食烹饪无关。这是关于食物作为一种工具……以及大量的饥饿。

That’s true. It isn’t. The Warrior Way probably has a number of things Mom doesn’t want you to do. But, let’s make this clear: For fat loss and short-term goals, I’m not convinced anything works better than to deal with it with the vision of a warrior. Getting ripped, truly lean, is not about taste buds, satiety or gourmet cooking. It’s about food as a tool…and a lot of hunger.

而且你可以在一生中短暂地这样做。我的朋友们，这是一种公共汽车长凳上的饮食方式。而且，就像巴士长凳锻炼一样，他们有更好的工作！

And you can do it for short periods throughout your life. This, my friends is a bus-bench approach to eating. And, like bus-bench workouts, they had better work!

对于所有其他目标和任何类型的终身方法，我建议遵循国王的方法。

For all other goals and any kind of lifetime approach, I recommend following the King’s approach.

我有一些建议给你。最近，我的书《Mass Made Simple》中的一句话多次出现在Facebook状态栏上，在博客领域，它终结了许多关于饮食的咆哮。我用简单的一句话来总结我对饮食、营养和补充剂的见解——

I have some advice for you. Recently, a quote from my book Mass Made Simple became a Facebook status line several times, and in the world of blogging was the finisher for quite a few rants about diets. I sum my insight about all things diet, nutrition and supplements with the simple phrase—

像成年人一样吃饭。

Eat like an adult.

老实说，说真的，你不知道如何处理食物？这里有一个想法：像成年人一样饮食。停止吃快餐，停止吃儿童麦片，只要你最喜欢的节目没有在你想要的时候播放，就用所有的糖果和舒适的食物结束它，减少零食的摄入量，并且不要表现得好像你不知道一样这——多吃蔬菜和水果。

Honestly, seriously, you don’t know what to do about food? Here’s an idea: Eat like an adult. Stop eating fast food, stop eating kid’s cereal, knock it off with all the sweets and comfort foods whenever your favorite show is not on when you want it on, ease up on the snacking and—don’t act like you don’t know this—eat more vegetables and fruits.

真的，这有多难？停止抱怨。别再找借口了。像成年人一样行事，不要像电视广告那样吃东西。长大。

Really, how difficult is this? Stop with the whining. Stop with the excuses. Act like an adult and stop eating like a television commercial. Grow up.

我和任何人一样了解我们与食物之间的情感联系。在婚礼上，不要让我数酒，因为我正在努力记住鸡舞的最后一部分。在葬礼上，尤其是在我亲近的人的葬礼上，我可能会吃一些糕点，而且我不会因为自己糟糕的碳水化合物选择而感到难过。

I know as well as anyone the emotional connection we have with food. At a wedding, don’t ask me to count drinks because I am trying to remember the last part of the Chicken Dance. At a funeral, especially of someone close to me, I might indulge in a few pastries and I am not going to feel awful about my lousy carb choices.

事实上，在速度饮食期间，我在第一顿饭结束时就开始哭泣。对于那些已经忘记的人来说：V 饮食是每天六杯蛋白质奶昔。就是这样！没饭吃，每周省一顿饭！

In fact, I started crying at the end of my first meal during the Velocity Diet. For those of you who forgot already: the V Diet is six protein shakes a day. That’s it! No food., save one meal a week!

那个星期六，在我心爱的一餐中，我吃了一块丁骨、一些鸡蛋、一些吐司和一杯甜味苏格兰威士忌。我妻子问我出了什么事，我回答说：“到底怎么了？”意识到我已经七天不能再吃东西了，我流下了眼泪。

On my beloved meal that Saturday, I pushed down a t-bone, some eggs, some toast and a sweet-tasting Scotch. My wife asked what was wrong and I responded, “What the hell?” Realizing I wasn’t going to eat again for seven days brought out a trickle of tears.

我得到它。

I get it.

我明白为什么无论你在小学做了什么，你都应该得到一块糖果，因为你是如此特别。这让我想起他们对顶尖大学的学生说的话：“向右看。现在，看向左边。你周围的每个孩子都是高中的优等生，是班长，也可能是告别演说者。克服它吧。”

I get why no matter what you did in elementary school, you deserved and got a piece of candy because you’re so special. It reminds me of what they tell students at top universities, “Look to your right. Now, look to your left. Every kid around you was a straight-A student in high school, was the class president and probably Valedictorian. Get over it.”

每当你在生活中取得成功时，并不需要为每个人额外喝几轮啤酒、一个有益的甜甜圈和击掌。我一直很钦佩伟大的运动员——我想到了巴里·桑德斯——他们取得达阵、进球或得分，然后继续前进。这是你的工作，所以克服它。

Every time you succeed in life does not call for several extra rounds of beer, a salutary doughnut and high-fives for everyone. I’ve always admired great athletes—Barry Sanders comes to mind—who score a touchdown, goal or point, and just keep moving along. It’s your job, so get over it.

如果你想把对瘦体重产生终生影响作为你的目标，你需要停止情绪化饮食的循环。如果你有情绪化饮食、暴饮暴食或净化问题，你需要的帮助远远超过我所能提供的，但这也是对国王态度的光荣洞察——

If trying to make a lifetime impact on lean body mass as a goal for you, you need to stop the cycle of emotional eating. If you have issues with emotional eating or binging or purging, you need far more help than I can offer, but this is also a glorious insight into the King attitude—

你过去的恶魔

正在改变你今天的样子。

The demons you have in your past

are changing the way you look today.

我一直将更大与更好等同起来。更多负载，更多容量，更多食物。

I’ve always equated bigger with better. More load, more volume, more food.

而且，我的朋友们，这引起了你们的注意。我真的必须把那个瘦小的孩子从我的大脑中解救出来，并将我的饮食和训练调整为中年男人可以做的事情。

And, my friends, that catches up to you. I literally have to unpack that skinny kid out of my brain and redirect my diet and training to something a late-middle-aged man can do.

那么，我能提供什么帮助呢？

So, how can I help?

首先，您的饮食哲学是什么？我是认真的，你购物、烹饪和包装食品的基本方法是什么？

First, what is your philosophy of food? I’m serious here, what is your basic approach to shopping, cooking and packaging food?

伊莱恩·圣詹姆斯 (Elaine St. James) 创造了一个以简单生活为基础的产业。我最喜欢她的书是《简化你的生活》。她关于健康的第一点是简化你的饮食习惯。她和她的丈夫决定简化生活，并发现诚实地努力简化膳食也可以带来更健康的饮食。

Elaine St. James has made an industry out of living simply. My favorite of her books is Simplify Your Life. Her first point on health is to simplify your eating habits. She and her husband decided to simplify life and discovered making an honest effort in simplifying meals also led to a healthier diet.

她确定了两个原则。第一，这并不奇怪：消除垃圾食品。她继续讨论其他选择，比如外出时总是在餐厅吃饭。
