She settled on two principles. One, no surprise here: Eliminate the junk food. She goes on to discuss other options, like to always split a restaurant meal when you go out.

其次，他们还想要更少的卡路里、脂肪和胆固醇。她选择的一件事就是喝水，而不是其他富含廉价卡路里的选择。

Second, they also wanted fewer calories, and less fat and cholesterol. One thing she chose was to drink water rather than all the rest of the options laden with cheap calories.

在追求简单并减少做饭时间的过程中，圣詹姆斯发现她和她的丈夫看起来更好了。

On the path to simplicity and cutting back the time devoted to making meals, St. James discovered that she and her husband simply looked better.

现在，如果我刚刚写的一切都让你感到震惊，与你所相信和思考的一切相反，那么，你可能只是一个战士。但迟早，你必须转变态度并集中长期注意力。

Now, if everything I’ve just written is appalling to you, the antithesis of everything you believe and think about, well, you might just be a warrior. Sooner or later, though, you have to shift gears and gather a long-term focus.

大多数人往往知道该吃什么。圣让的想法都在正常范围之内。没有提及 HCG、异国草药或任何东西的过量测量。

Most people tend to know what to eat. St. Jean’s ideas are all well within the range of normal. There’s no mention of HCG, exotic herbs or excessive measurements of anything.

饮食王道的第一步是要有长远的目标。我们都知道，蔬菜、瘦肉蛋白和淡水可能是您余生中进餐和外出时的最佳选择。如果你的大部分餐食都在这些选择上徘徊，那就没问题了。

Step one to the kingly approach to eating is to have a long-term focus. We all know vegetables, lean protein and fresh water are probably the best choices, meal in and meal out, for the rest of your life. If you hover around those choices for the bulk of your meals, you’ll be fine.

你知道这个。

You know this.

第二步是处理你个人与食物的关系，也许是奇怪的关系。

The second step is to work with your personal and perhaps odd relationship with food.

当谈到食物时，我们对大多数人都有一个杠铃问题。杠铃是想象图表两端有高点、中间有低点的绝佳方式。如果我告诉你余生都吃你想吃的蔬菜汤和沙拉，你会找到很多借口不吃那么多。

We have a barbell issue with most people when it comes to food. The barbell is an excellent way of imagining a graph with highs on both ends and lows in the middle. If I tell you to eat all the vegetable soup and salad you want for the rest of your life, you’ll find a dozen excuses not to eat that much.

另一方面，如果我告诉你放弃一件物品，也许是胡萝卜，那么，当你试图说服我你没有胡萝卜就活不下去时，我们将会发生一场激烈的争斗。即使你过去20年没有吃过胡萝卜，你仍然会想吃胡萝卜。从这里开始，我们将回到中间的食物区域，如薯条、苏打水、面包和谷类食品，并让自己达到一个不错的肥胖水平。

On the other hand, if I tell you to give up a single item, perhaps carrots, well then, we will have a major fight on our hands as you try to convince me you can’t live without carrots. Even if you haven’t had a carrot in the past 20 years, you will still crave carrots. From this, we will drift back into that middle area of foods like chips and sodas and breads and cereals, and graze ourselves up to a nice level of obesity.

第一步是开始对如何对待食物有一个长远的看法。第二步是要明白，对于我们大多数人来说，作为杂食动物，我们将在某种程度上与食物限制作斗争。

Step one is to begin to have a long-term view of how you approach food. Step two is to understand that for most of us, being omnivores, we’re going to struggle somehow with food restrictions.

Kingly方法的第三个问题是烹饪。有趣的是，我遇到了很多，我的意思是很多读过我的作品的人。他们中的许多人从来没有做过饭，因为这并没有什么错，所有的做饭都是他们的妈妈做的。

The third issue with the Kingly approach is cooking. What’s funny is that I’ve met a lot, and I do mean a lot, of people who have read my work. Many of them have never cooked a meal because, and there’s nothing wrong with this, their moms do all the cooking.

然后他们告诉我他们拥抱战士精神。而且，虽然这可能是真的，但当你经常大喊时，“妈妈，肉饼在哪里？”你需要开始审视与食物的不同关系。

Then they tell me they embrace the Warrior Spirit. And, while that might be true, but as often as you yell, “Ma, where’s the meat loaf?” you need to start looking at a different relationship with food.

在力量的世界里，有很多非凡的强者，同时也是高手的厨师。马蒂·加拉格尔 (Marty Gallagher) 曾训练过举重界的两位伟大人物柯克·卡沃斯基 (Kirk Karwoski) 队长和埃德·科恩 (Ed Coan)，他也是烹饪界的知名人物。我不是烧烤专家，但这一点很重要：大量的排骨、鸡肉、牛肉和猪肉准备好并食用，似乎会让你变得又大又强壮。

In the strength world, there are many extraordinary strongmen who are also brilliant cooks. Marty Gallagher, who trained Captain Kirk Karwoski and Ed Coan, two great names in powerlifting, is a famed name in cooking. I’m no expert on BBQ, but the point is important: A lot of ribs, chicken, beef and pork prepared well and eaten seems to make you big and strong.

要像国王一样吃饭，您也需要像国王一样购物。许多减肥专家建议我们每周花两天时间，比如周日和周三，跳过锻炼，利用这段时间除了购物和准备饭菜之外什么都不做。

To eat like a king, you need to shop like a king, too. Many fat loss experts recommend that we take two days a week, say Sunday and Wednesday, to skip the workouts and use the time to do nothing but shop and prepare meals.

这是对待食物的王道。而且它似乎能提供最佳的持续减脂效果。

That’s a kingly approach to food. And it seems to give the best results for fat loss that stays off.

所以，是的，战士对待食物的方法是绝对正确的。有时。就像它的好朋友公交车凳锻炼一样，你需要在你的一年、几十年或一生中平衡它。

So, yes, the warrior approach to food is absolutely correct. Sometimes. Like its good friend the bus-bench workout, you need to balance this into your year, decades or life.

然而，在我们生命的大部分时间里，我建议学习与食物的关系，在这种关系中，你要怀着饱足感、瘦身、饱满和长期成功的愿景来计划、准备和消费。你可能已经知道答案了。

For the bulk of our lives, however, I suggest learning a relationship with food in which you plan, prepare and consume with vision of satiety, leanness, fullness and long-term success. You probably already know the answer.

是的，你知道：像成年人一样饮食。

Yes, you know: Eat like an adult.

第27章

Chapter 27

饮食和运动象限

The Quadrants of Diet and Exercise

我一直对人们在开始改变生活的计划之前所拥有的大量自律和自由意志感到惊讶。当然，这通常会持续一天左右。几年前，我发表了一篇关于我短期饮食的文章，一个人向他博客上的每一位读者发起挑战，要求他们跟随我和他踏上这段伟大的旅程。

I AM CONSTANTLY AMAZED at the great amount of discipline and free will people have just before they start a life-changing program. Of course, this lasts, usually, about a day. Years ago, I published an article about a diet I was doing for a short time and a guy challenged every reader on his blog to follow me—and him—into this great journey.

一天后他就辞职了。这对大多数人来说都是正确的。部分问题在于，人们常常会决定将战士饮食（例如两周的辣椒肝脏净化）与公交车凳锻炼计划结合起来。现在，您可能会很高兴阅读了前面的章节并理解了这句话！

He quit after one day. That’s about right for most people. Part of the problem is that all too often, people will decide to do a Warrior Diet (like a Two-Week Cayenne Pepper Liver Cleanse) mixed with a bus-bench workout program. By now, you might be glad you read the earlier chapters to understand that sentence!

让我们以我第二喜欢的看待选择的方式来看看我们的四个选择——当然，在连续统之后——饮食和锻炼的象限。

Let’s look at our four options in my second favorite way of seeing choices—after continuums, of course—the quadrants of diet and exercise.

我认为通过使用“合理”和“强硬”这两个词，我在这一点上展示了一些我的手，但我还没有想出更好的办法。当我解释的时候，我觉得我需要挥手并说很多“你知道”。但是，你知道，合理是可重复的、可行的和可信的。

I think by using the words reasonable and tough, I show my hand a little bit about this point, but I have yet to come up with better. I feel like I need to wave my hands around and say ‘you know’ a lot when I explain it. But, you know, reasonable is repeatable, doable, and believable.

艰难会让你晚上醒来担心锻炼或饮食。

Tough is going to make you wake up at night worrying about the workout or diet.

我建议您在一年和一生的大部分时间里进行合理的饮食和合理的锻炼，这应该不足为奇。如果我们都是机器人的话，这会非常有效。

It shouldn’t be a shock that I suggest reasonable diets and reasonable workouts for most of your year and life. This would work really well if we were all automatons.

你知道……就像我总是试图提醒你，你吃什么比这个奇妙的想象世界“你要吃什么”更重要。爱丽丝梦游仙境中的红皇后当然不同意这一点。我想大多数人都会爱上她的伟大洞察力，这与我对事物的看法相去甚远——

You know…like I’m always trying to remind you that what you ate is much more an issue than this marvelous imaginary world of ‘what you are going to eat.’ The Red Queen of Alice in Wonderland would disagree with this, of course. I think most people fall in love with her great insight that’s far from my view of things—

“嗯，在我们国家，”爱丽丝仍然有点气喘吁吁地说，“如果你跑得很快，很长一段时间，你通常会到达其他地方，就像我们一直在做的那样。”

“Well, in our country,” said Alice, still panting a little, “you’d generally get to somewhere else—if you run very fast for a long time, as we’ve been doing.”

“一个缓慢的国家！”女王说。 “现在，你看，你需要尽全力奔跑才能保持在同一个地方。如果你想去别的地方，你至少要跑两倍的速度！”

“A slow sort of country!” said the Queen. “Now, here, you see, it takes all the running you can do to keep in the same place. If you want to get somewhere else, you must run at least twice as fast as that!”

健身行业的大多数人都会转向战士式饮食和公交车凳锻炼。老实说，我们中很少有人有内在动力去同时燃烧蜡烛的两端。红皇后希望看到你跑得越来越快，通常无处可去，想一想，这正是跑步机和健身车的作用。我在《永不放手》中对此进行了大量论述——我们中很少有人有自由意志、时间和机会如此自律地同时进行严格的饮食和严格的锻炼计划。

Most people in the fitness industry slide over to the Warrior Style diets and bus-bench workouts. Honestly, few of us have the internal motivation to take on burning both ends of the candle. The Red Queen would love to see you run faster and faster to go, usually, nowhere and, come to think of it, this is exactly what treadmills and exercycles do. I wrote extensively about this in Never Let Go—few of us have the free will, time and opportunity to be so disciplined to do both tough diets and tough workout programs at the same time.

当然，正如人们通常告诉我的那样，现在你是例外。一个喝得酩酊大醉的人曾经对我说：“我最注重的是纪律。”他的双手都装满了食物和饮料。而且，不，我不是在对着镜子说话。那时。

Now, of course, you are the exception, as I am usually told. A very drunk person once said to me, “I’m all about discipline,” both hands filled with food and drink. And, no, I was not talking to a mirror. That time.

我当然可以看到许多人经历过严格节食和合理锻炼的时期。我已经通过从阿特金斯归纳法到 F 计划饮食等各种饮食法来做到这一点。这种方法对于节假日或休假后的收紧工作非常有效。互联网上有无数的三天、十二天和两周的闪电减肥法，而且每天都会出现新的减肥法。这听起来可能与你读到的内容相反，但当有人说“我正在实行三天闪电减肥法”时，我会尽力支持它。

I can certainly see periods of tough diets and reasonable workouts for many people. I’ve done this with various diets from Atkins Induction to the F-Plan Diet. This approach works well for tightening up after a holiday or a vacation. There are a myriad of three-day, twelve-day and two-week blitz diets on the internet, and new ones appear daily. It might sound counter to what you’ve been reading, but when someone says, “I’m doing the Three-Day Blitz Diet,” I support it as best I can.

有时，这些小实验可以让一个人重回正轨。几天之内减掉五到七磅的体重对于少吃一点的牺牲来说无疑是足够的回报。这不是一种生活方式，但你会发现许多宗教传统也将这种公共禁食纳入了每年的循环中。它有效，持续一段时间。

Sometimes these little experiments can get a person back on the path. Losing five to seven pounds in a few days is certainly enough reward for the sacrifice of eating much less for a bit. This is not a lifestyle, but you will find that many religious traditions have this kind of communal fast built into the yearly cycle, too. It works, for a little while.

合理的饮食和艰苦的锻炼是运动员的基本模板。一年中的某个时候，我们需要进行“大推动”。现在是“全力以赴”的时刻，我们需要培养成功所需的品质。进入这个加速过程时保持合理的状态是件好事，但很多人都忽略了这一点。大多数时候，保持良好的身材胜过追求完美。

Reasonable diets and tough workouts are the basic template for athletes. There comes a time of year when we need to do The Big Push. It’s ‘all hands on deck’ time and we need to bring up the qualities necessary to succeed. It’s nice to be in reasonable shape going into this ramping process, and this is a fact missed by many. Being in pretty good shape most of the time trumps being on the razor’s edge of perfection.

正如马克·赖夫金德（Mark Reifkind）提醒我们的那样，“登上顶峰之后的第一步就是悬崖。”当您决定每天只吃 500 卡路里的热量并进行一些史诗般的训练计划时，这些都是很强烈的话语，非常值得考虑。哦，你可以做到，但是你应该这样做吗？有关这方面的更多信息，请阅读侏罗纪公园。仅仅因为你可以做某事，并不意味着你应该做某事。

As Mark Reifkind reminds us, “The first step down after a peak is a cliff.” These are strong words and well worth thinking about when you decide to go on some epic training program while eating only 500 calories a day. Oh, you can do it, but should you? For more on this, read Jurassic Park. Just because you could do something, doesn’t mean you should.

干预工具包中的每个问题都旨在让您以合理、适当的方式思考训练以及随后的饮食。从字面上看，这 10 个问题旨在涵盖基本点：这就是你。

Every question in the Intervention toolkit is designed to get you to think about training—and later, diet—in a reasonable, appropriate way. Literally, the 10 questions are set up to cover the basic point: This is you.

我希望你思考并解决人际关系、社区参与以及未来几十年的生活。

I want you to think about and address relationships, community involvement and living your life well beyond the next few decades.

不久前，我在客厅里捍卫目标螺旋上升的想法，这是工具箱中的第三个问题。

Not long ago, I was in my living room defending the idea of the spiraling of goals, question number three from the toolbox.

“这不会起作用；你是在告诉我，我需要腾出更多时间！”

“It won’t work; you’re telling me I need to make more time!”

接下来的讨论强调了大多数饮食和锻炼方式的问题——这个人每天在健身房呆了三个小时！问题是这样的：在这三个小时中，大部分时间都花在了泡沫轴上，做了几十个矫正动作、动态移动动作和各种各样的东西，然后才上了跑步机进行有氧运动。换句话说，他在健身房里呆了很长时间，做了所有的事情，但是，在很多方面……什么也没做。

The ensuing discussion highlighted the problem with most diet and exercise regimes—the person was in the gym up to three hours a day! The problem was this: Of those three hours, most of it was spent foam rolling, doing dozens of correctives, dynamic mobility moves and assorted stuff before getting on the treadmill for his cardio. In other words, he was in the gym a long time doing everything, but, in so many ways…nothing.

我带他去了戴夫·特纳的大力士杠铃俱乐部。正好在 10:00 点，我们开始了开合跳和戴夫的长而快速的热身循环。然后我们抓起棍子并完成了举重的基本动作。接下来，我们来到杠铃前，在戴夫的指导下做了26组练习。我们把装备收起来，聚集在一起高喊俱乐部的座右铭，然后走出了门。

I took him to Dave Turner’s Hercules Barbell Club. Precisely at 10:00 o’clock, we started jumping jacks and Dave’s long but fast warmup circuit. We then grabbed sticks and went through the basics movements of lifting. Next, we went to the barbells and did 26 sets of exercise under Dave’s eagle eye. We put the equipment away, gathered together to chant the mottos of the Club and walked out the door.

持续了一小时。我的朋友第二天几乎无法行走，他告诉我，他明白在他的新日程中，与家人和社区共度的所有时间将来自哪里。合理并不意味着容易。

It lasted one hour. My friend, who could barely walk the next day, told me he understood where all those hours of spending time with family and community were going to come from in his new schedule. Reasonable doesn’t mean easy.

正如约翰·鲍威尔常说的：“我说这很简单，但并不容易。”

As John Powell always says, “I said it was simple, not easy.”

从纸面上看，合理是合理的。在实践中，这通常是我们能做的最困难的事情。

Reasonable looks so, well, reasonable on paper. In practice, it is often the hardest thing we can do.

如果我让你相信合理的饮食和锻炼计划胜过几天或几周的疯狂，那么你就会走得更远。我已尽力向大家展示谨慎的健康、健身和长寿方法可以带来什么，但剩下的就取决于你了。

If I’ve convinced you that reasonable diets and exercise programs trump a few days or weeks of insanity, you’ll be far further ahead. I’ve done my best to show what a prudent approach to health, fitness and longevity can provide, but the rest is up to you.

杰瑞·宋飞说得最好——

Jerry Seinfeld said it best—

“但现在压力在你身上。这本书充满了有趣的想法，但你必须提供交付。所以当你读它的时候，记住：时机、语调、态度。那是喜剧。我已经尽了我的职责。表现就看你了。” ~杰里·宋飞 (Jerry Seinfeld)，SeinLanguage

“But the pressure is on you now. This book is filled with funny ideas, but you have to provide the delivery. So when you read it, remember: timing, inflection, attitude. That’s comedy. I’ve done my part. The performance is up to you.” ~Jerry Seinfeld, SeinLanguage

现在压力就在你身上了。表现取决于你。

The pressure is on you now. The performance is up to you.

史蒂夫教练案例四

Coach Stevo Case Four

我希望您在干预中停留足够长的时间，亲自看到这一点：干预是如此简单，感觉就像作弊，客户甚至可能也这么认为。您的客户会怀疑该系统是否有效，因为它并不困难。但是，如果作为一名教练，您能够耐心地帮助您的客户找到道路，并有勇气以仁慈和优雅的态度继续走下去，那么您就已经为他们提供了干预工具包中的所有工具，他们会在回顾过去时想知道如何他们一开始就迷路了。

I hope you stay with Intervention long enough to see this for yourself: Intervention is so simple, it feels like cheating, and clients might even feel like it is. Your clients will doubt the system will work because it’s rarely hard. But if as a coach you can find the patience to help your clients find the path and have the courage to keep on it with kindness and grace, you will have given them all the tools of the Intervention toolkit and they will look back and wonder how they ever got lost in the first place.

她让它看起来太容易了。也许她正在服用类固醇什么的。但她并不大或什么的。她只是，我不知道，色调或其他什么。但我从来没有见过她在健身房呆超过 15 分钟。她只是拿起那些壶球，在两腿之间摆动，蹲下几次，然后像举重运动员一样将它们推过头顶。我不明白；她都做错了。我在这个该死的椭圆机上呆了很久，而她却几乎不出一滴汗！我敢打赌这是基因。我敢打赌她从来不胖。

She makes it look too easy. Maybe she’s on steroids or something. But she isn’t huge or anything. She’s just, I don’t know, toned or whatever. But I’ve never seen her in the gym for more than, like, 15 minutes. She just picks up those kettleball things, swings them between her legs, squats them a couple times, then pushes them over her head like some powerlifter. I don’t get it; she’s doing it all wrong. I’m on this damn elliptical for like, ever, and she barely breaks a sweat! I bet it’s genes. I bet she was never fat.

“其实，我本来就胖。”

“Actually, I was fat.”

“那你的秘密是什么？我一直在努力减肥。”

“What’s your secret then? I’ve been trying to lose weight forever.”

“没有什么秘密。我只是做我能做的事；尝试继续前进并变得更坚强。”

“There’s no secret. I just do what I can; try to keep moving and get a little stronger.”

“是那些壶球的东西吗？它们比椭圆机更好吗？我也在参加新兵训练营。”

“Is it those kettleball things? Are they better than the elliptical? I’m doing boot camp, too.”

“嗯，我的意思是，我想这取决于你想做什么。”

“Well, I mean, I guess it depends on what you’re looking to do.”

“我正在努力减肥。我应该尝试一下那些壶球吗？”

“I’m trying to lose weight. Should I try those kettleballs?”

“如果你认为你愿意的话。但实际上我只是选择了一些东西并坚持下去。你知道，我一直在努力做得更好，但我不会让它主宰我的生活。”

“If you think you’d like to. But really I just picked something and stuck to it. You know, I keep trying to better at it, but I don’t let it rule my life.”

“这听起来太容易了。”

“That sounds too easy.”

“这并不容易。坚持一件事真的很难。”

“It’s not easy. It’s really hard to stick to something.”

“它会比椭圆机运行得更快吗？”

“Will it work faster than the elliptical?”

“我不知道;我知道变得更强对我来说效果更好。”

“I don’t know; I know getting stronger worked better for me.”

“刚开始的时候我体重减轻了很多，但现在我认为我减掉的体重不会超过一磅。”

“I lost a bunch of weight when I started, but now I don’t think I’ve lost more than a pound.”

“是的，这对我来说就是这样。事情发生得很慢。当然，一开始不是。但随着我越来越擅长移动并保持合理的状态，我发现继续前进变得容易多了。那么慢也不是那么糟糕。我只需要继续前进并让它发生。”

“Yeah, that’s kind of how it worked for me. It happened slowly. Not at first, of course. But as I got better at moving and kept things reasonable, I found it a lot easier to keep going. Then slow wasn’t so bad. I just had to keep moving forward and let it happen.”

“它花了多少时间？”

“How long did it take?”

“你知道吗，我什至不记得了。有一天我只是说，‘哦，我想我现在就在这里了。’

“You know, I don’t even remember. One day I just said, ‘Oh, I guess I’m here now.”

“在哪里？”

“Where?”

“你知道。这里。我想去的地方。我想，我对自己很满意。”

“You know. Here. Where I want to be. Happy with myself, I guess.”

“你认识一位教练可以帮助我吗？”

“Do you know a coach who could help me with that?”

第28章

Chapter 28

结论性思考

Concluding Thoughts

我不知道为什么人们开始认为他们需要疯狂才能进步，但当人们意识到理性每次都胜过疯狂时，我觉得我心碎了。为了将意外情况降到最低，我以以下剧透开始我的干预研讨会。

I DON’T KNOW WHY people have come to think they need insanity to progress, but I feel like I break hearts when people realize that reasonable trumps insanity every time. To keep the surprises to a minimum, I start my Intervention workshop with the following spoilers.

玫瑰花蕾是他的雪橇。

卢克是达斯·维德的儿子。

哈利杀死了伏地魔。

佛罗多还活着。

理性胜过疯狂。

Rosebud is his sled.

Luke is Darth Vader’s Son.

Harry kills Voldemort.

Frodo lives.

Reasonable trumps insanity.

如果这些内容有任何剧透，我深表歉意。但是，一生进行合理的锻炼，加上一定的强度和掌握，总是会胜过短暂的疯狂锻炼。

If any of these are spoilers for you, I apologize. But reasonable workouts done for a lifetime, peppered with some intensity and mastery, are always going to trump insanity done briefly.

当我第一次提出这五项原则时，它们看起来非常简单。它们是如此简单；有时我觉得有必要用图表和统计数据进行冗长、杂乱的解释来解释这些事实。

The Five Principles seem so simple when I first lay them out. They’re so simple; I sometimes feel the need to go into long, rambling explanations with charts, graphs and stats to explain these truths.

现在，我只是坚持计划——



Now, I just stick to the plan—



   问 10 个问题

   Ask the 10 questions

   听听答案

   Listen to the answers

   应用原则

   Apply the principles

结果不言自明。

The results speak for themselves.

知道你的目标。了解路径。坚持基本原则。让成功发生。

Know your goal. Understand the path. Stick with the basic principles. Let success happen.

关于作者

About the Author

丹·约翰 ( DAN J OHN)一生一只脚涉足举重和投掷领域，另一只脚则涉足学术界。丹是一名全美铁饼运动员，还参加过最高水平的奥运会举重、高地运动会和举重五项全能比赛，他在这项赛事中保持着美国纪录。

DAN JOHN has spent his life with one foot in the world of lifting and throwing, and the other foot in academia. An All-American discus thrower, Dan has also competed at the highest levels of Olympic lifting, Highland Games and the Weight Pentathlon, an event in which he holds the American record.

丹的工作生活是将每周的研讨会和讲座与全职写作结合起来，同时也是密苏里州哥伦比亚学院的在线宗教研究讲师。他之前的著作包括与 Pavel Tsatsouline 合着的《Never Let Go》、《Mass Made Simple》和《Easy Strength》 。

Dan spends his work life blending weekly workshops and lectures with full-time writing, and is also an online religious studies instructor for Columbia College of Missouri. His previous books include Never Let Go, Mass Made Simple and Easy Strength, written with Pavel Tsatsouline.

本书的配套 DVD《干预》拍摄于 2011 年，可通过otpbooks.com获取。

The companion DVD for this book, Intervention, was filmed in 2011 and is available through otpbooks.com.

您可以通过 Dan 的网站danjohn.net与他保持联系。

You can keep up with Dan via his website at danjohn.net.
